z8gqpUpQO9hgAIHkMp2IOQ.text: After a wonderful experience with this chain in San Antonio, my husband and I decided this would be the place to host my in-laws 50th Anniversary family celebration. The ease of making the reservations online lead me to believe that the evening would be a smooth and enjoyable.   Unfortunately that evening my husband was held up at work and we were about an half an hour later than our reservation. The host at the restaurant did a wonderful job seating our party and starting the meal as we had texted the family explaining our situation. Even upon our arrival, the servers were very helpful in getting my husband and me seated. As the meats were circulated to our table my husband and I had to continually catch the servers attention. Being a slightly larger party of eight, I did not think that was a number that would allow members to be overlooked. After about 45 minutes it seems the font of house manager noticed our issue and was very helpful sending servers to us and even asking if we were waiting for something particular.  But due to our later arrival as the rest of our party were enjoying conversation and the market bar, the meat stopped arriving along with all servers. They all seemed to have migrated to a different portion of the restaurant.   The other issue I had with the evening was that all the meat except the steak was very dry and over cooked. As our reservation was at 6pm, I can't imagine this was because the meat had cooked too long during service. It was a Thursday evening with I'm sure slower traffic than a weekend, but I would have thought the kitchen would be aware of how many reservations and on average how much of which dishes move during an evening and would adjust accordingly. Sadly to say that does not seem to be the case as chicken, pork, and even sausage were all dry and over cooked.   The bottom line is that I left an all you can eat restaurant hungry. Next time I am looking for a Brazilian dinning experience I will try a locally owned establishment.

H__akJIk-pEOKbD2p23BIA.text: Excellent service.   Amazing meat selections.   Can't really go wrong with Fogo De Chao. :)   My favorite meat is their house special, Picanya and lamb chops but honestly they are all amazing. Second favorite would be the garlic beef filet mignon. Every time I go here, I am tempted to order a bunch of their cheese breads to go!

QgumyDZJCSWPvxHXF3kq4g.text: We tried Fogo de Chao out on a Friday night for my husband's Birthday. It is a very large restaurant with a nice atmosphere. There is not much to choose from on the food menu; basically, for $54.95 you get everything, which is all the meats and full salad bar. The meats were very good. The salad bar is amazing. Unfortunately, the service was not. After taking our orders and bringing over a few side dishes that accompany the $54.95 per head, our waiter never returned. After sitting for approximately 15 minutes waiting for our bill, we flagged down a bus boy, when we finally received our bill, the total was incorrect. The bus boy took the bill back and when he returned with it a second time, it was still incorrect, the third time, it was finally the correct bill.  Don't know what ever happened to our waiter. Overall, the food was very good, but a bit pricey. Obviously, our experience was lacking in service.

8FfH_nRtmJ6mZDerfqrDnw.text: Food was great and the meat kept coming. All the meats were delicious and perfectly cooked. The salad bar did not make sense to me as it seemed like a bunch of random stuff put out. Items at the salad bar tasted fresh so that was good but I still only made one trip. Nothing was good enough for seconds. All in all the meal was great and features a ton of meat. If you like very well seasoned and perfectly cooked meat this is your place. I don't know how anyone can leave here and not be on the verge of a food coma!

pkpks6EOo25Rd2kOsfRe4g.text: I love coming to fogo to get my meat fix on. Been here a few times and just recently figured out that lunch can be had for 30 vs 50 for dinner for all the exact same foods, but the only problem is that it's difficult to go back to work when you're fighting a food coma! If you've never been the red/green card controls whether the servers come around to give you meat or not.   Fogo has tons of cuts of beef, pork, lamb, and chicken! My favorites are the beef ribs that you usually have to request, the filet mignon/rib eye, and lamb chops. I usually skip the chicken and pork cause they are not always super tender and every time I've had the parmesan pork it's been a little tough.   The salad bar is well stocked as well with various cheeses and and cured meats and smoked salmon as well and provides a nice break from the meat. They also have a few hot items on the side such as the pao de queijo (cheesy bread) that is awesome and I really enjoy the caramelized bananas and polenta as well!

kVpprYFDFkvooRGf9ku4_A.text: Very disappointed with all the hype around it. The best part was the salad bar. They are really cheap about serving any good cut of meat and constantly bring around the sirloin. If you want a good cut of meat you have to ask specifically for it and even then you get one small paper thin slice. And while you are still chewing they are trying to give you your bill.

dM_CAGumYm_lMMsl5G10Iw.text: In town for business from Houston.  My work partner wanted steak and had never been to a Fogo. So of course I had to bring him here.  Was not disappointed and he liked it so much he was  talking about taking his wife to the Houston location for their anniversary because of our great experience here. Overall great experience, service was excellant and well worth the money.

84Dt96wwPMSeboea8OL1iA.text: Amazing service considering a busy Saturday night. Food is delicious. Will recommend the top sirloin and the jam jelly in the salad bar. I won't give 5 stars just because the parking is a nightmare and it's a bit overpriced, but the food and service deserves A+

eDhAMFDOd4YxUOUB7P37YA.text: Well not sure where to start. Was extremely disappointed with the fact there was no dress code. I had to look at a man at the table next to me wearing a tank top with workout shorts. Not exactly what I was expecting when paying over $50 a person. I felt like I was on a cruise ship. Spoke to the manager and he could care less. Interesting that the Fogo in Atlanta has a lot more class. Too bad as the food was good.

CbANnR7miRYqEMhWssU2gA.text: Been here about 3 times. Each time gives me a different experience.  Was there this week for a ladies dinner We love salt There is a lot of salt on the meats; this time wasn't as bad as other visits. You just need to be aware of the salt issue.  Service is good. We had a waiter that walked so close to us with a tray of ribs but we couldn't get him to come over. We asked other waiters to help but that didn't work. He eventually came around but.... Salad bar is fantastic.  Hearts of palm, lox, prosciutto, lovely dried meats and great cheeses.  These little cheese rolls that come gratis to your table are pure bliss.  Dessert was great. Creme brulee Good value for money

i8CkctHL0eYBrRaDJkNt0w.text: Pretty good for a Brazilian place. I was amazed with how many people were about providing various meats. The meats were very high quality, spiced really well and kept my eyes open waiting for more food. We went as a part of Phoenix Restaurant week and they were nice enough to pack our complementary dessert to go, because the meat was just too much.   Service was good, not the most fantastic in the world but I never had to wait for more food.   I only wish the lamb had come out more often. But I wish I had room for the second time their signature prime filet came out. That was the bomb dot com.  The Mango Refresco drink was amazing, but not quite $16 good.   Definitely make a reservation if you're there on a Friday, cause its Scottsdale packed. You will see a lot of rich white old guys taking out these fake-boobs twenty-somethings too. Which is hilarious.

w3vHA73bAXW_lDvc5RCvKg.text: Such a fun place! Make sure you come hungry because it's more food then anyone can handle. Some of the meat was a little dry but the service was incredible!

lO_C6JLQrfmKMiGj9sNxGw.text: Had a fantastic lunch. Fantastic service and great company. It was a wonderful way to end a long week.

Nmj8CRTRPNLRbp3ShZyqfw.text: The food is okay. The salad bar is kind of small. But a restaurant of this type should prioritize service. Half of our party wasn't getting food and we shouldn't have to ask multiple times just to get meat. This turned our lunch into THREE HOURS because the people who were getting food finished way before the others.

dUPVNv_mnf6SNdX0bGme_g.text: It took two days to recover from what I did to myself at this restaurant! The food was amazing and cooked perfectly! I loved the beer selection they offered me. I had a Brazilian light beer which was heaven. My favourite meat by far was the filet mignon cooked perfectly!

fRvCxhQ3F5coxJgOEBnHew.text: Came here for Mother's Day, food here was exceptional. They had some good choices at the salad bar and endless Caramelized bananas/ cheese bread. We had the limeade super delicious and their endless cuts of meat cooked to perfection. We'll definitely be back soon

GBgPfWqZQCqi6lWpZe7O9w.text: Was absolutely fabulous everything from the service , price, quality of meats ......it was the best for you dollar !

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fabulous !

847YW7MCMRmcvUBr342O6w.text: Food was absolutely delicious! The salad/cheese bar was so fresh and there was many options. The meat was so good and they brought it right to your table, there was a few meats that were on the drier side, mostly the chicken but other than that it was excellent. The drinks are strong but yummy. The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because we were here celebrating an anniversary (as many are celebrating something) we could hardly have a conversation, every 4 minutes an employee would ask how everything is, if we need anything. This wasn't the meat carvers doing this, it was just too much. Asking once is good with me and if I need something I will let you know. It kind of just got old after a while, I know they want to make sure everyone is taken care of but if they would give you more privacy while eating I would give this place 5 stars

pi1Y0W_oZW2bL2H0ygLiiQ.text: Went here for AZ restaurant week. My bf and I walked in and were consumed by the absolute noise of this place. We asked to be seated in a more secluded area, which happened to be by a dining room filled with teenagers taking selfies, shouting, and running amok.   From the moment we sat down we felt rushed. "Here's your bread, here's your non-refillable soda, go to the salad bar, here's some meat, are you done? No. Are you done now? No." The servers stopped at our table even when our signs on the table told them not to.   The food itself was mediocre. The potato salad was good, the mashed potatoes were salty, and all the meats were cooked rare and had a hint of butane and lighter fluid to them.   It reminded me of a buffet in Reno when a high school sports tournament is in town. It was so incredibly loud and crowded and definitely not worth the $100+ check. Good grief, never again.

xu6T12matDxm8fO_Kp2jkw.text: I've been here a couple times and had been dying to go back, so what better way to celebrate your birthday then to come to Fogo! My parents hadn't been before, so I explained to them how it all worked once we arrived and they absolutely LOVED it!   The salad bar is wonderful and more upscale than your normal salad bar. They have delicious vegetables, cheeses, Italian meats, and more. They also have beans and rice as well. All the meat they bring around to your table is delicious and it's all you can eat! One of the best things that they bring to the table is the Brazilian cheese bread...it is out of this world.   The service is always stellar and the food is always wonderful. I highly recommend this place!

Kz_VYJ-TPm_GqK0I_ss5pA.text: I really enjoyed going to fogo! It's was the first time I herd of it when we were invited and I didn't have any clue what to expect. I loved it the food was amazing so many different kinds of meat so good! I don't think there was anything I tried that I didn't like! I will definitely be going back and recommend it to anyone wanting to spend a lot!!(:

7G02HvaP8uKRdzJ5TeAnow.text: Love this place!! The Filet Mignon, Bottom Sirloin, and the house sirloin is to die for!! Salad bar is great too! We hit a Fogo anytime there is one where we are vacationing. We've eaten at San Antonio, Addison, Austin, and Scottsdale.  The reason for the 2 Stars is because of the service. Scottsdale's location leaves A LOT to be desired! They have no idea how to refill drinks or even the bread basket. They also do not know the difference between medium, medium well, and well done. We were really disappointed :-(

-xG-vZPl4s74A4_Pqoqc7g.text: This is a great place for any occasion.......First you need to prepare three days before......you will absolutely be rolled out of here from all of the food.....they offer many types of beef.....rare, medium rare and rare.....the staff is constantly coming to your table with filet, sirloin etc.....this is a meat lovers paradise........

udFrnehoWhGyIxBlckINyw.text: For a hefty meat eater, you'll enjoy the experience.  The red/green cards are like a polite way of snapping your fingers.  When you're green side up it's like screaming "Meat!  Bring meat now!"    Servers arrive with skewered meats (rare, medium, well) and you get to choose where they slice, using your tongs to grab hold of it.  I believe they had 16 different meats and/or cuts but take care not to miss one by following the picture pamphlet they give to first timers.  There are plentiful refills on cheese rolls, sauteed bananas, and fried polenta.  If you're not heavily into meat, then you'll want to make use of these free refills.  The salad bar wasn't as widely stocked with veggies as I wanted.  It was lacking in that area.    Given that I went during lunch, we'll assume dinner time salad bar selections are much more plentiful.  But for the price, it would have to be twice as good.  For me to give 5 stars, FdC would need to improve the veggie selections and offer dessert in the price.

vPG4xGHygH2YVQ-STqjKTQ.text: Oh My GOD  The garlic sirloin and filet were to die for.  The other meats were good, but nothing compares to those first two.   The lamb was okay,  bacon wrapped chicken a bit on the dry side.  The candied bacon at the salad bar?!? I would come back for that alone.   It's  $49.95 per person, which includes salad bar, mashed potatoes, plantains, etc. and all of the meat you can eat.  I made one trip up for salad and skipped everything else but meat. It's a great deal if you bring your appetite, but if you're not expecting it, that group check is scary.   Cocktail prices are cleverly omitted from the drink menu,  the single, small mixed drink I had weighed in at $13.  Ouch.  This is a definite must-visit in Scottsdale, and next time I'm in the area I am DEFINITELY returning.

0YWGointiBY6FlBoJGSfzQ.text: Awesome place for my Birthday dinner! The staff is very attentive and the food is excellent.  Definitely recommend.

Em2CiPoOEKaPTZUScMH_7Q.text: Great food and attentive staff! Would definitely visit this place again.

zC1RBfybIApHUEPk1U1JOg.text: I love this restaurant! I am a steak lover! Service is great and the quality of the meat it's amazing!

POOsDwnsc6AP_oPKU3FPPw.text: It was our first time at Fogo de Chao and we really enjoyed it. We arrived hungry and that was a smart choice. The salad bar had a great selection. The service was fast, friendly, and helpful. It was a little confusing not having a designated server for our table. We weren't sure who to order a refill drink from, but we figured it out! All in all, I don't think I will go back to Fogo de Chao on a regular basis, but it is most likely going to be a once in a while treat for us!

jEka55zIFr1tIQxWdAPGAA.text: WOW!!!!!! I have never been to a restaurant where the staff was as attentive as they were here. Lou, the manager, Dan the customer service manager, and Norma our server were all just amazing. So stopping here would be sufficient right? Maybe but I can't stop..because.....the FOOD. I don't know where to start...the salad bar with all kinds of fresh h'oduerves - giant asparagus, fresh mozarella balls, zuchinni, salads etc...or handsome men walking around with pipping hot beautiful cooked meats (16 to be exact) on gigantic metal prongs sliced so thin so that you can savor the flavor either plain or with a cup of delicious salsa or some kind of cilantro dipping..I couldn't choose...so there you go. Last but not least the dessert. It was my mother's birthday so she ordered the tres leche cake. I've had plenty of tres leche cakes in my life but this particular one at Fogo was the most moist, and succulent that I've ever had the pleasure of eating. If someone were to ask me if I'd ever return I would have to look at them like they were missing some brain cells because my answer will ALWAYS be YAAAASS!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A sample of what&#39;s in store for you at the salad bar.

o2jQNOt2NgEIfuhxAYlrFQ.text: Delicious food! I have been here three different times now. I booked my reservations online for my anniversary and was given a complimentary cake. Their lunch pricing is the best time to go. Children are welcome, but I really wouldn't recommend bringing them unless they are meat eaters.

zc0bWotlh_b5Ot0nABpH8Q.text: Amazing Salad and Grilled Veggie Bar and as well as the most amazing tender meat on skewers- sliced fresh and hot in front of you. The most amazing fried polenta, the most amazing mini popovers, and fried bananas.. Don't walk but run to Fogo de Chao... lunch or dinner is  the best meal and great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad Grilled Veggie Bar
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing Salad and grilled Veggie Bar
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate Molten Cake- so yummy.

dE7FNzdcumUvvpwciyEvog.text: This is a great steakhouse. I love the ambiance. If you love steak, this is the place to be. The meat kept coming and coming... I love watching the servers go around with their meat selection! They also have a really nice selection at the salad bar. Not the usual salad bar, loved the grilled vegetables and all different types of chillies & cheese! The only reason, I gave it  4 stars instead of 5, was because the lamb chops were less frequent than any other meats! But the food was really good. We also had creme brulee and cheesecake as desert. Was to die for...I highly recommend this place as it offers great steaks  & it is a unique experience!

30z9hrUTDv2BfKoqcEYJMA.text: If I could give them 10 STARS I would. This Fogo de Chao in Scottsdale, Arizona is the bomb.com!!!! The food is great the wait staff even better. Our night here was a Birthday surprise for my husband. He really enjoyed himself. Can't wait for my Birthday!

TXscAarE6STAw3Irckexuw.text: 1 star for service, 4 stars for the food... This is a place we want to love and eat at often but too often the service sucks and it's pretty pricey on top of a long drive for us. Meat is usually very good, today a lot of it was dry and often when you asked for rare you got med well or they would say they would come  back with a more rare cut and didn't.  The big disappointment was the service though. Our drinks were constantly empty we never got the sides that go with the meats either and could never make eye contract with a server to ask! Finally when we were done he magically appeared and after being asked offered to bring them then, after we will full! He then took 15 minutes to bring check and another 15 minutes to bring back the bank card only to find he mixed it up with a different table!   Huge huge disappointment, as much as I want to love this place I doubt we will return.

Op5b-AcKvNoEc0r1lbgfLQ.text: I've Been to Fogo many times in different states at least 3 times at this location, It's sad to say it's not the same.. The meat was less then satisfactory, the flavor was just not there and the meat was tough! Service was slow and inconsistent, waiters were serving some people on our table and forgetting others, I'm not sure what was going on but they need to get they're game back on in order if they want people to come back!

CZ6VoMFcIuoDcLuXHss5cQ.text: Place is an all you can eat meat steakhouse where they bring to your table recently grilled skewered pieces of meat for you to pick from.  Each server comes with a different type of meat.  They start you with the cold bar which consists of  salad / pickled veggies / cheese / preserved meats, and like-wise.  Once you're ready to eat meat flip your green/red cardboard piece so that they may start coming by to serve you meats.  The closeness of tables and noise levels are too much for an upscale place like this.  Staff is expected to be professional, no less.

k7lB2ntO2FyfuYKHrTudvw.text: ordered: - dinner  pros: - brown sugar and black pepper bacon - pork had great smoky flavor - all the beef was tender, garlic sirloin and ribeye were the best - parmesan coated chicken thing was juicy - dem bread rolls - lemonade and guarana soda were refreshing in between meat drinks - went for restaurant week [we're poor] and service of meats was still quick and everything at the salad bar was refilled quickly and tasted fresh - meal comes with dessert, tres leches wet af, cheesecake was good 2 - the food coma after the meal  cons: - reservations were made for 7, arrived at 6:55, we were given a pager [maybe their definition of a reservation is different than mine], we were not seated until 7:30 - finished a plate of apps/ meat before we got our drinks, server forgot my mother's drink [cmon yo, youre not even taking food orders, that was literally your only job] - the food coma after the meal

x2dyb-oeJ6YX4dFu_9LYYg.text: This is one of my favorite fogo locations the staff is very friendly all the meats are great especially the ribs.

r_83gklsX4nNph6Mnc8lQA.text: This was my first trip to Fogo and it was a special outing for a graduating friend. I must say that I was concerned about strict dress codes since we both wore shorts - 98 degree weather outside. A few meats were on the dry side, but that's to be expected, mostly small cuts, chicken and one pork item. The beef stood out, specifically the house specials. The market fresh salad bar is very generous and well-stocked and I know not to fill up on those goodies before I have a chance to taste some of the meats. I will make Fogo my monthly outing from now on.   The staff is helpful and they're always on hand if you have questions or have special requests. The dessert portions are gargantuan, so you can share one dessert with your significant other. Their drink selection surpasses most places I have patronized in the past, although we settled for Guarana.   This has been hands down the best experience I have had at any select restaurant in Arizona, bar none. I have traveled around the country and around the world, and I am a gourmet chef with three decades experience - also taught gourmet cooking classes, and I must say that I have never had better service, even at places costing five times as much. Before you waste time and money at mediocre shops, try this first!

ev-rIW7nT_Hs3p8egDtuww.text: From start to finish this was the best experience! The wait staff was so friendly and fast. We were discussing my birthday, and they brought me a special dessert just to be sweet. The food was incredible and didn't all have the same smokey flavor (most brazilian steakhouses have the same taste). The buffet and sides were perfect, and complimented the wonderful food. The money is well worth it, I would pay that every day to receive that kind of service. I love this place, and I recommend it for any occasion.

-oBaU26t2DDm9XMKcy9jhA.text: I took my wife here for our 10th wedding anniversary last week and it could not have been a better experience. We got there just after they re-opened for the dinner hours around 5:15pm and were immediately seated. They explained the system with the green/red disc and off we went. EVERYONE was friendly and very knowledgeable. I have to mention Chris and Lou. You guys went above and beyond the service you usually get from anywhere. If these guys aren't management, they need to be. They stopped by to check on us a few times but not enough to be annoying. We were given a creme brulee from Chris at the end of our dinner and also engaged in some friendly conversations as well. My wife LOVED it. The meats were amazing(we tried almost all of them). I really only had one complaint and that is the pork ribs were not "fall-off-the-bone" like most rib places serve them and how we like them. They were a little tough. Keep doin what your doin because your doin everything right. We will be back for sure. Thanks FdC for a great anniversary dinner.

rwLJNgXnVP2Vc9I_ti7lNA.text: This was my second trip to this location and I noticed their salad bar had fewer items from before.  It was still very good but am disappointed that they seemed to have eliminated some items. I am not a big meat eater and came for the salad bar so I noticed these things. It was still really really good however.

-1Q2qOoilw9bXo5gmgdWLQ.text: The steaks here will melt in your mouth.  The salad bar is amazing I strongly recommend this place for special occasions they will not disappoint.  Prices were steep but worth every dollar.  All you can eat steak house Brazilian style.

obuyPiOnUdKwIiBTA2IBsw.text: We have to throw out kkdkat F's review. What the hell is it with people reviewing a business that isn't open yet?  My experience was fortunately when they were open. I went Saturday night, their third day open, and it was a glorious night. I missed the 6:30 reservation but still only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table. They were very accommodating with my friends 2 year old and did not charge us for her to sit at the table and eat scraps of his food. If you have never been to a Brazilian Steakhouse (as I hadn't) it is a ridiculous idea. You flip the card to green when you want food, and red when you don't want food. Problem is that the food guys come so much that a mere 45 seconds of "green" will have your plate full of more meat than you could possibly consume. To offset this meat bonanza, they do offer a salad bar.   The place kind of reminds me of a Golden Corral, but upscale, where you don't have to get it yourself. The clientele is old, overweight, and un-sophisticated as you would expect at an all you can eat restaurant. The price ($42.50) is high enough only to discourage the dredges of society. I saw quite a few younger people out on dates, probably not ones that would have the palate to appreciate even restaurants at half this cost.   The salad bar alone ($19) was more than well enough equipped. Featuring 8-10 different salads, raw vegetables, and a few cold cuts. Each meal includes three sides that are shared family style, a fried banana, mashed potatoes, and polenta which are all replaced the moment you finish one. The trick if you do not want another, is to leave a bite of it on the platter. They wont replace it if it isn't finished. They also bring the most delicious bread imaginable that has a warm, gooey, cheesy center. The two year old ate 6 of them.  Meat service includes 15 different types of meat here, of which I tried about 8 and they were all on the decent to good range. The only exception to it being the lamb chop which we both agreed was the loser of the bunch, with the favorite being either the bacon wrapped filet, garlic beef, or the parmesan encrusted pork chop. All items are served in small portions, enabling you to try several different ones. I don't think I had two of anything. It is definitely a huge meal and my recommendation is to eat nothing all day, and then be very concerned what your cardiologist might say afterward.   The restaurant is probably going to last through this depression at least, as they serve in high volume and turn a lot of tables. It isn't uppity enough to turn away the low end clientele, and it isn't crappy enough to turn away the affluent folks. The service is spectacular. I don't think I asked for one thing all night, and the food is good. My only gripe is the meats were all very well cooked, which is obviously a testament to most peoples tastes and not wanting to actually taste the meats. It would have been nice to have a "rare" option, but the did decline the request.

haoMQWyKFgeZi2Pue_PHug.text: We went to Fogo De Chao after hearing so many good things about it. I will tell you our good and bad. The good... 1.) Excellent Service 2.) My 5 year old was free and 10 year old was half off 3.) Ok food  the Bad.. 1.) Our server who we became friendly with must have gotten off somewhere around midpoint of our dinner and vanished forever. i understand they work as a team but it was strange.  2.) The salad bar was ok but other than the mozerella balls and chicken salad nothing to sing about.  3.) The meat all tasted the same. The gouchos are a little boderline rude even to a 5 year old who is clearly confused why there is 8 men stickings swords of meat in his face. Calm down a little please.  4.) At almost $50 a person before drinks and dessert Ruth Chris is a MUCH BETTER OTION!  5.) Even with the kids being pretty much free it was still $300 for 3 adults. We all had one soda and shared three desserts between the table.  We left there kind of puzzled like well we might go back for lunch maybe but I don't know. 6.) I wanted to buy  a mozerella ball to take home to my nanny. I was willing to pay $15 or $20 for on little ball and they wouldn't sell it to me. Now come on people we just spent $300 on dinner throw me a bone.  Overall Not the experience we were hoping for but not the worst place I have ever eaten.

hICOfCrJCiGrDd3GKLv7GA.text: Tonight we ate dinner at Fogo De Chao in Scottsdale. My husbands & our kids first experience. My family was beyond impressed.  From Caiprihana's to beer to wine, it was excellent service. The unlimited food was amazing and top notch. The filet mignon, the best I have ever tasted! It is 5 star, all the way. For every table you have about 8-10 waiters and you are attended to at all times. All I can say is ease up on that salad bar, the second course is what you pay for. Amazing!

Jo5BWjOS2lsmXV19-h-Qng.text: Last Saturday night the hubby & I had a date night & I picked Fogo de Chao for dinner. I made reservations for 8, but we were running very late so I called & asked if we could push it back to 9 & they were very accommodating.   When we finally arrived we were immediately seated in the full dining room. Our server gave us the break down of how they operate here & told us we could get started at the salad bar. We each got a plateful of yummy veggies, cured meats & cheeses. Our favs from the salad bar were: parmesan & manchego cheeses, prosciutto, artichokes, salami, asparagus & mushrooms. After that we flipped our cards to the green side & a slew of meats were presented. We tried 2 or 3 at a time, then flipped to the red side to sample & then flipped back to green when we were ready for more (you'll understand what red & green means when you go!). We tried 10 different meats & our top 4 favs were: picanha-top sirloin (their signature steak), cordeiro-lamb legs & chops & beef ancho-rib eye. Included with the endless meat options are 3 side dishes: polenta, garlic mashed potatoes & caramelized bananas, you also receive a basket of pao de queijo-cheese bread. The sides were just ok, the potatoes were the best, but that cheese bread was so yummy!   Total for everything including drinks (no cocktails) but not including tip was $107. Not cheap, but considering the amount of food you could possibly get, it's worth it! Not a place I would go to regularly, but it's definitely worth checking out, especially if you are a meat lover!

QxnuzwKSY3iyrBow_PcztQ.text: Lou as manager did a great job making sure we understood all options and was very attentive.  That lamb was the best I've ever eaten and the parmesan pork was fabulous. The chicken on first pause seemed dry but I think that had more to do with the comparison of the melt in your mouth beef. Highly recommend.

nFvRb99oBEjLoRu-TXtcaQ.text: Service is fantastic, amazing experience, great food.

B9G6U18seMxPY77mkZOe-g.text: I've been to several Brazilian Steakhouses in and out of the USA and this was definitely the best. The food and service are both amazing.

YDihEMyzPhCfexNttMrU4A.text: Food was Delicious, the meat was Amazing! The service Tomas "tommy" was amazing.  Excellent customer Service. Very pleasant servers.  Will definitely GO back.

fInW3iPLe1jGplRYOJcdlw.text: What there for lunch excellent service and food. Looking forward to going there again.

g7CB7ohtzoAZKyuvVcw8Yg.text: I find it hard to believe that the Simpson's have not parodied the Brazilian Steakhouse, yet.  Seems like it would be Homer's fantasy come True.    Came here with a couple of friends who were taking me to lunch for my birthday.  This was my first time eating here, and I always read in the reviews of other places that this is the place that all of the other Brazilian steakhouses in Phoenix are compared to.  This place is top dog for a reason.  The restaurant itself is very nice with white linen, rich wood paneling, and a spacious dining room.    What can you say?  If you are a vegetarian, the salad bar is really incredible.  Figuring we would cushion the blow, we started at the salad bar.  I ended up making a plate for myself resembling an antipasto platter.  It was excellent.  There were cheeses, and prosciutto, marinated asparagus an inch think, mushrooms, artichoke hearts, and things I did not identify, but were tasty anyway.  Once we were done dabbling in the vegetables, cheeses, and prosciutto of the salad bar it was time to get down to business; it was time for meat.    Each person has a coaster-like card that is red on one side and green on the other.  We flipped our coasters to green, and immediately we were overwhelmed by an onslaught of meat.    Like Homer would do, I just indiscriminately tried everything.  Don't ask me what I had, because I was too busy talking to my friends, drinking caipirinhas, and eating meat.  There was also polenta, fried banana, black beans, and bread.  Everything was tasty and delicious.  I ate way too much.  I glanced at the dessert menu, but was just too full to even seriously consider it.   The service is outstanding.  The wait staff was falling all over us serving meat, filling drinks, and bringing more bread, bananas, and polenta.  We never were without anything.  If you are interested in a Brazilian steakhouse in the Phoenix area, this is the place to go.

9V1TEQM3jW3P2FefgHKNqA.text: One of my top 2 best places I have ever experienced. My girl and I went for our first time last night for my birthday and it was an amazing experience with amazing food choices.  Definitely will be going again!

VfpcVoS5GqB-vTnLQgotmw.text: If you have never eaten at a Brazilian churrascaria this place is a pretty good representation of one. Word to the wise...... get ready for a mass intake of meat products.   The menu here is non existent. You sit down, order some beverages, and get down and dirty. The salad bar here is definitely above par for the course (to all of you golfers: the salad bar just shot a 69 at Augusta). I think it had thirty five or so items to excite the palate. Now don't fill up with all of that rabbit food because the next stop is protein town, population you. In my mind I said "bring on the beef!" I think that message was picked up subliminally by every waiter in the joint. The moment I was done with my salad our table was surrounded by beautiful glistening beef, lamb, chicken, even a little pork. I made the fatal mistake of thinking I could  try a little of everything. At the end of the meal I was so overloaded with meat products I almost passed out at the table. The quality of the meat and flavors was top notch and highly recommended.  I guess I should also note the service was fantastic. All of the meats are made to order. The lamb was a little over done for my taste and they had a fresh skewer of rare meat out in a flash. All of the drinks were full and the house had a pretty good wine selection.

uIY1RaBPfB7W5wKtlEpPTw.text: over rated....the salad bar: not exactly exotic ( cucumbers, pees, lettuce --with salt and vinegar)....meat mostly pork the big pieces with too much salt...and the other beef very small portions...and what is this of putting banana (dessert)  and mash potatoes before the main dish???? if i want to spend over 60.00 per person i will go to a real fine dinning place waiters and cutters running up and down : yes running- i don't let children run in my kitchen. tables to close together and between the manager, waiter, cutter and people it crated to much noise to enjoy my "fine" dinning experience. two cutters tripped over my moms wheel chair one was very closed to fall down and cut himself (it was one of the cutters).  i put a three because i was very very hungry and got full with the bread. if i have 300.00 for dinner i will sure not return there.  left out they don't offer neither soups or fruits on the salad bar :( only salty black beans and plain hot rice

QVbb75IpT5nr7Y7G0UxQDA.text: If you have not yet been to this place and have any sort of respect for being a carnivore, get yourself to FOGO ASAP. I don't think it's possible for anyone to leave this place disappointed. Even a vegetarian would enjoy the wonderful all you can eat salad bar, however if you are trying Fogo for the first time, do not make the rookie mistake and go crazy when they turn you loose on the salad bar. Save every inch of stomach space for the Unlimited amount of 15 different kind of meats that you will be consuming.  So go lithe on that salad bar if you must, turn that card over to green and let the glorious amount of meats be carved right onto your plate. The three side dishes they bring you are delish don't get me wrong, partake in those, but don't go crazy, it's ALL about the meat.   The only think this place could do better was create a separate bathroom to purge so your stomach could hold more meat.   Fogo is pricey, 47 dollars  a head for unlimited food, so if you aren't hungry don't waste your money. They will tell you about their house specialty mojito. It is quite delicious but do beware its 12 dollars and that's not advertised.  Do yourself a favor, if it's a special occasion or your just looking to treat yourself to a great meal, GO HERE. PLEASE. You've earned it. Afterwards  the amount of meat and food you consume, you may feel that you disrespected all the starving people in the world. YES you did. But damnit its worth it.

9VHcl9M2v01uT2ejm-EUbA.text: Hubby and I were here tonight for a grand and glorious breaking of his diet. He had been before to the one in Houston, and had been looking forward to the new Scottsdale location. For being open only 3 nights, the service went quite smoothly and the staff and management we met were all great. We started out with drinks- a gin and tonic ($10) and a caipirinha ($8.25)- both were strong and very good. The wine list is extensive, for those who prefer the vino. Delicious little popovers arrived at the table, and we headed off to the salad bar. Far better and fresher than Fogo E Brasa's, it had a variety of cheeses (including chunks of parm and fresh mozzarella), smoked salmon, prosciutto, salami, sun dried tomatoes, olives, marinated bell peppers, asparagus spears, mushroom caps, and seafood and chicken salads, just to name about a third of the offerings.  Then came a veritable torrent of meat. The beef was the best, and came in a variety of cuts and preparations. We liked the Ancho (rib eye), the Picanha (the classic sirloin cut in the half moon shape), and the garlic beef best. The pork ribs were really well done and juicy, and the sausage was quite flavorful. The chicken was a tad dry, and the lamb was too gamey for our liking (and we usually like lamb).   Side dishes were brought to our table, in appropriately modest portions. There were squares of polenta, which I really liked but Hubby did not care for, and mildly garlic mashed potatoes, and yummy fried plantains.   Dessert choices were pretty typical: a creme brulee, a flan, 2 types of cheesecake, and 2 types of chocolate cake. Hubby wanted what he had enjoyed at the Houston Fogo before: the papaya cream topped with creme de cassis liqueur ($8.25). It was more runny than mousse-y, and the papaya taste was pretty subtle, with the liqueur being the top note.  There is a rather unnecessary valet parking service for $3, when the parking lot surrounding the place is huge. Not so huge, however,  that the many douche-bags who double parked went unnoticed. The bathrooms are nice. The dinner, which is all you care to eat, is $42.50 per person. I'm sure we'll be back for special occasions.

VSsZjFH-RI8LtYKhySGJpA.text: Perfect for larger groups ...always leave satisfied.

CSBXUSecgAVb_u9N0n-q7g.text: I went it this weekend for my first time because everyone would always mention how amazing it is, and they were right. This was a such a wonderful experience but the best part of it was our server Annalora! she was absolutely amazing, best server we have had in a while. I seriously wanted to be friends with her! if you are planning to come into fogo request her to your section, you won't regret it. I can't wait to come back!

sgguJ_zkcI4y_3uoHMtw-w.text: A place like no other. From a professional and friendly staff to outstanding food this is truly an experience. The meats keep coming and are A1!

IiVhJDd1_Qnk4-wkkqR2Xw.text: We had an overall great experience. The salad bar was so good I had to stop myself in order to save up for the festival of meats. The meat was well prepared and had great flavor. The cheesecake was the tallest slice of cheesecake I've ever had, and again was very good. We had one person in our group that is vegetarian and there are not any vegetarian options on the menu but refer to my comment on the salad bar.

3-UJNMH6XQ0zTxgVx2mfdg.text: We chose this restaurant to celebrate a Bachelor party. Our waitress Analaura Madrid was fantastic. She could not have made our experience any better. The food and drinks were outstanding. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a nice place to eat.

vxbWHhkamnJLYcClIhLYMQ.text: Best. Service. Ever!  Want to feel like royalty & enjoy an amazing meal, too?  Make sure you're seated at ANALAURA table & she will make your experience unforgettable as she tends to your every need from the moment you walk in.  Fabulous food, fun atmosphere & 5-star service!  Thanks for making our date night even better!  We will absolutely be back!

yQndnPF9DvIHud6dyq41WQ.text: Fogo de Chao was a complete disappointment. $55 per person for the "full experience" which includes a buffet style market table and endless meats that are served table side. Nothing else was mentioned by our server so we thought we'd give it a try. This was both our first and last time dining here.   The market table was complete crap. Don't let quantity over quality fool you. It's essentially a salad bar of typical charcuterie plate items...some meats, cheeses, fruit, roasted veggies, and some random side salad type dishes like apple salad, chickpea salad, chicken salad, etc. -- none of which felt remotely Brazilian and none of which were good. Nothing exotic or prepared, really. I can pick up any of these items at a local grocery store.   Then the Gauchos come by with meat on a stick that they shave off table side. We only had about 1/3 of the meats listed on the menu because that was all that was circulating in our area for some reason. Yes, we flipped the "we want meat" coasters to green. The meat was fine, but nothing special and again, nothing really Brazilian about it aside from the stylized service. We kept getting shaved off the edges, so it wasn't a good solid piece of meat, just like a light crust from the cooking process with a little meat. We asked for horseradish to help elevate the meats. We had our menus for about 5 minutes and only knew about the horseradish because we overheard another table ask. No other sauces were offered. I found out they had more sauces looking at their website after we left.  They brought a couple of sides like mashed potatoes (bland, tasted like reconstituted potato flakes), caramelized bananas (delicious), and Pao De Queijo (bread - delicious), and some other plantain type french fry. These were the most Brazilian tasting items of the entire night. They were mostly good. From their website, it looks like we maybe did not get served all of the sides we were supposed to?  We had the tres leches cake for desert. Also boring and no flavor, much like everything else at this restaurant.   Tables were way too close together. We sat next to two younger guys who were yelling over all of the hustle and bustle of the place and couldn't hear our own conversation. They could do with less tables crowding the place. Believe it or not, I'm under 35 years old and saying these things.  This place was quite busy, which is understandable around the holidays, but they did not staff accordingly. Service was terrible. They clearly favored the larger parties which were plentiful. Took forever to get anything, which all we ever asked for was horseradish and our check. Never came around to check on us. We literally got up and poured our own water from the cart that was by our table, no one cared or noticed.   $150 out the door for an underwhelming meal for two with a shared dessert. I would have MUCH rather spent my money on Steak 44! This was a HUGE disappointment and waste of time, money, and calories. We will not return and I will tell everyone I know to avoid this place.

gLVabJiNhGPtqfogu8X_VA.text: Had a great experience, Dave and Drew were super fun and attentive. Great food and great service. We will definitely be back soon.

zXY1k83qhHGXoCbxYHVIIw.text: First time here with friends and loved it. Food excellent, and the service highly attentive and exceptional. It was actually fun watching the team approach, their collegiality with each other and the way they jointly managed the floor. I felt like we were watching a dance performance. Everyone  was super friendly from start to finish.   I do find these reviews fascinating in that it's rare to see such bi-polar reviews. I can't speak for those that were so disappointed. For us the combination of food, service and responsiveness made for a fabulous evening and fun environment. My cardiologist won't be happy, but I was thrilled.

et1ZRpGhl557dIHvXu3xhA.text: Third time dining at this place. The quality and variety of the food is great however the service was okay. We had to keep waiting on the type of meats we wanted also the soft drinks were 3.50 without refills.

wnKy-eJTqXngiha9lxdTfQ.text: Let me start off by saying that we have gone to Fogo de Chao many times in the past and have always enjoyed it. We've always experienced great service, the food is always wonderful, and the upkeep of the restaurant is impeccable. But not this time.        This place has gone to the dogs, literally.  So, we went there for Thanksgiving and they sat us in the back next to a family who decided it was okay to bring their dog with them. Not a service animal, just their pet. The dog proceeded to throw up on the floor and the patrons, instead of informing the wait staff, decided to just throw a napkin over it. So I let the wait staff know that the smell was making me feel nauseous so they moved us to a different table. However; the staff decided that leaving the dog vomit on the floor  was an option. The rest of the time that we were there they didn't clean it up. Also, they never asked  the family to remove the dog from the restaurant.       Next, the bathroom was appalling. The trash was overflowing and falling on the ground. Two of the stalls had toilet paper on the floor and urine was on the toilet seat. You would think during this busy time that they would've had someone policing the bathroom on a regular basis to make sure that it was clean.      And then to top everything off when it was time for us to pay the bill the manager came back to the table to ask us what our debit card look like because they couldn't find it. Needless to say I was very disappointed with this entire experience.

9zGo_MfVcPvmp289WfW9zQ.text: I've been to a few other chains for this restaurant and they don't disappoint when it comes to the quality of meats and food service.   Why 3 Stars? The waiter was very kind and took care of us and after suggesting we try the higher priced buffet with the lure of higher priced meats such as filet mignon, we went for it. I should've listened to my gut-- the selection that did come out was great, but only one piece of the higher end meats that was promised came around. Everything else was something we could have enjoyed at the lower dinner price. So basically we over payed and didn't get what was promised to us.   As for everything else, it was nice experience and we decided to just be grateful for the opportunity to enjoy the dinner.

jY3eTB34nt9a8hIIX7aQAA.text: I went here to celebrate an anniversary with my girlfriend. I was here 6 months ago and the food was amazing. The meat was just the way I liked it, and the salad bar was awesome. The service was awesome and it was worth the hefty price.  However during this visit, I was really disappointed. We made reservations and said it was for an anniversary. Six months ago they sat us in a quieter section of the restaurant because we were a couple, however this time they sat us in the most concentrated area next to a wall. I don't care about seating most of the time, however there were very loud and large families next to us, and I was banging elbows with the guy behind me.  Our server came by and said he was brand new. My girlfriend and I were okay with this, and he ended up being the best (and only good part of this visit). He was really nice and we tipped extra because of him. He recommended the Brazilian Limeades which were amazing by the way.  However the fun stops there promptly. The salad bar was okay, but it seemed lackluster compared to the visit before. The meat was also incredibly disappointing. Even though I requested medium rare, I was only given slices that were 90% charcoal and had the consistency of a leather sole of a boot.  The chicken was burned and the steaks just seemed so well done, there was barely any flavor left. Some of the choices were alright though. The Parmesan Pork was super good and the lamb was excellent.  All in all it was disappointing though. I give three stars because of the server. He may be new, but he did a great job.

OGY1BlHBiMhL78dc3ADacg.text: Maybe we went on a bad night because our experience was not nearly as positive as a lot of reviews here. It was definitely not up to our expectations based on our experience at similar establishments  We were very disappointed with the quality of the cuts of meat being served. Alot was tough and stringy and in some cases overcooked to the point of being hard to cut with a steak knife.   The Feijoada bar was not being restocked fast enough to keep up with demand. Empty soup kettles, no lettuce etc.  Staff appeared to be trying but was just not clicking. It was like everyone was trying to do everything all at once. A orchestra all playing to their own time with no conductor.    We had 2 staffers try to take our drink order after it had been placed. We would sit for what seemed like forever with empty meat plates then have a line of people trying to serve us.  The same situation only to a lesser degree occurred with beverages. Empty glasses followed by being topped off after every sip.  Again the staffers were nice and really trying. I am not sure if management was lacking organization or micro-managing to the point that staffers were handicapped. Maybe we were in a serving zone transition and the staff was sure who's table it was.   Bottom line lackluster food and questionable service.

XnOTx0aJ_BIbja-LzUwZLA.text: Food is outstanding.  Have been there more than 10 times, only once had less than stellar service.  Better to be seating in the main area to make sure you get the widest and more frequent resupplies of meat.  The salad bar is even good for vegetarians in your life.

wuRfM5-B8KiIJ6HSMcoBQQ.text: Came in Saturday evening since  we couldn't pass up the Restaurant week special. Though some of the higher quality cuts of meat were not included in this offer we still had a great dinner and fully enjoyed the available selections. The Lamb steak is so good and has just the right seasoning. I love the fruit, cheese and meat choices at the salad bar!  My SO had their Premium Caipirinha and boy was it good. Strong but very enjoyable.

YTrRHL96ypoZXHCryjkxwg.text: The service was outstanding at this place! I'm not a big meat eater (the salad bar was great), I would go back here just for the professional level of service we received from the waitstaff.

5fa9ktoZtExP721eK4Z-aw.text: Enjoyed a nice dinner, different cuts of meat was something new for me. Wasn't a bad experience. Would definitely come back again

7ad1SqaT5xJXCWpk34wajw.text: Amazing restaurant! The food is absolutely incredible! You can't find steak like this anywhere. Service is friendly! The salad bar is delicious! All you can eat! Desserts are excellent too. This is the best place for our family.

y2Mwul96cosbtdUB9IpaTw.text: Fast service, clean environs, friendly and helpful employees. The waitress took the time to explain the drink specials in full detail, always a plus. The steaks were warm and cooked nicely, and all were great. I probably tried at least 6 or 7, and were pleased with them all. My least favorite was the lamb, my fave the bacon filet I believe it was. Its pricey for sure, and was very crowded on the night we went back in October. My only complaint was the buffet was kinda ho-hum and the tables are too close together. We were crammed in there like sardines with 0 privacy whatsoever. In the words of Ahnold... "I'll be back."

2FgXU0EAtohCT_CsmswT0A.text: When I tell you that Fogo de Chao has the finest service, I am not not kidding. Since the moment I walked in I was welcomed with open arms as if I were a part of their family. The food was absolutely outstanding, and was cooked to perfection. The staff were some of the most kindhearted and respectful individuals and I can say proudly that I will be eating with them again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KJ1V8Hk0-IcrTWwyQxXyaw.text: You're going to lay around $52 a plate at dinner time. With a variety of steak cuts, chicken, and sausages. Food was all very good, including the Salad. Service was also excellent, managers came by to check on our evening. The establishment as a whole seems to be less "fancy" than it was a few years ago. However, that's just in reference to what people are wearing. Anyways, definitely recommend.

HL1tKNS2c0etL6Yxk7LyCw.text: What an amazing experience. I received a gift card, and had no idea what to expect. Reservations recommended, fine dinning or business casual. Amazing selection of meat served table side, buffet style salad bar. Looking to impress this Brazilian Steak House is the place.

W-Iahh_SwSLApX_BE8pPEg.text: Prix fixe it up and OD on meat... oh wait, let me try to sound cool - protein, yeah! Don't forget the social media pic posts!

YhypVC9geW9IR1ui_HijRA.text: I went to heaven and came back with a new gospel. The gospel of meat. Fogo De Chao allows you to forget all your problems. Those taxes, those unfinished roads, and asbestos in some schools all becomes a far off memory when you are here.  Right when you enter you are greeted by peeps who act like they got a degree from a four year university on etiquette and service. You'll be sat down and have your drink order taken (per usual) and then the dining begins.  PRO TIP: Don't eat a lot of the salad bar - the main attraction is the meat. I never realized that meat could be served in such large portions. Shish kabobs were my only foray into this type of fine dining, but Fogo showed me I was an amateur with every bite!  The rounds are unlimited as long as you can keep flipping that card and have room in that tummy to spare. It was a hefty price tag at the end, but some things in life are worth it, and a trip to Fogo De Chao is one of them.

Bsvl8kqvHqq20Y-ivfT-Fg.text: The food was great but when we asked for a split bill they somehow "Forget" to adjust the percentage/tip amount to reflect each bill.  See the picture posted earlier...  How is this not fraud?   Super shady!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Be careful if you go with a group and the bill is split.  How is this not considered fraud?!

q_LIwQZ3S8Q95RYjZaA9Jg.text: First timer.   I'm about 3 months pregnant and have been craving red meat, so what's better than a Brazilian steak house?   1) On weekends make reservations early or you may be stuck waiting until 9pm or later.   2) It's not your typical salad bar. There are lots of artisan meats and cheeses. Lots of veggies zucchini, asparagus, mushrooms, etc... however perhaps I was preoccupied with the crowd but everything is ice cold. I'm not sure why I thought the steamed seasoned zucchini sitting in ice would be hot. I wasn't the biggest fan of eating cold cooked vegetables.   3) They provide mashed potatoes, fried bananas, some other sort of fried stick and bread. The potatoes were ok, but I think they're instant. Upon reading other reviews the fried sticks are polenta??  Not sure, was not explained to us by the server. Other reviewers also claim the bread is cheese bread, I did not taste cheese or see any presence of cheese, those were also ok.   4) The Meat. Ok, so my husband made it a point I try as much variety of meat possible. The bacon wrapped chicken was very dry, we didn't even finish it. The beef that was severed was cooked to my liking however the crust was very salty. You could still see the coarse salt crystals from their rub. The pork also very dry. My husband loved the lamb, I personally found it too gamey, but that is my personal preference.   5) I attempted to order the Creme Brulee but was told by the server they frequently run out early almost every night. I opted for the papaya in cream. I read the description but thought the sauce drizzled over was some sort of condensed milk with the name having Creme in it. Turns out the Creme was a type of liquor, having a sensitive pregnancy I would have liked that to have been explained prior to drowning my dessert in this.    Overall my experience was ok. I'd prefer to stick to Vegas buffets for the price. I don't think I would return.

49JZ7UhEkeh7thHI7Rz62A.text: Just had Easter lunch there with the family and couldn't be happier with the whole experience.  Complimentary valet and they were extremely friendly.  The host stand was polite quick and efficient.   The entire wait staff couldn't have taken care of us better if they wanted to and of course the food.  From the great choices at the salad bar to the outstanding meat selection especially the filet, ribeye and the house special it couldn't have went any better.  Thank you to everyone who was working Easter to make sure that myself and my family had such a great experience.

X2gtYjUA85qlnMpmroIBkQ.text: This was my husband and I's fancy-night-out during our honeymoon in Phoenix- we dropped $115 for two adults and one drink.  We were served extremely quickly, abundantly, and elegantly- we had drinks, food, and service before we could finish taking in the tall and tropical Brasileirro ambience.  We had more meat than we could ever want, the star of the show being the beef brisket ribs.  Finally, our charming waitress brought us a complimentary Strawberry Cream in light of our recent celebration!  A very lovely and worthwhile experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry Cream
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad Bar

mV52RrQG6Y3D2Aue-nvwiA.text: Oh Yelpers! I don't think so.  I was very disappointed. First, there is an online offer to save about $19 per person which sounds amazing. Turns out that is for a very restricted menu.  If you like unlimited salad bar and lots of different cuts of sirloin, you'll be happy. But not at $50 per!  The rib eye was ok. The filet was very dry. Everything is bathed in salt.  Want shrimp? That's extra. Want sea bass? Extra.  The place was packed. It was clean. The service was friendly and no one was rushing anyone.  Not the place to come for the best cuts of beef. Sirloin, sirloin, sirloin everywhere. The other cuts came around infrequently.  The pork rib was dry and flavorless. The pork sausage was sickening.  The chicken wing was dry and overcooked. I did not try the lamb or the beef rib.

VSUsTGM6eAZ4JkzHh8unoA.text: This was probably one of the best dining experiences I've ever had.  The restaurant is set up nice, very clean in appearance.  The entire staff, I mean EVERYONE, provided a great customer experience.  The salad bar was always stocked fresh and all the meats were cooked to perfection (variety-well done, medium rare, rare, etc).  Dinner could be considered high end, but for me it was worth it.  They do offer Lunch at a lower price point... I highly recommend this place and you can make reservations and it is highly suggested.  I don't normally give 5 stars, but this place earned it and deserves it

bJUaO4dM3rexAMjGw6IPBg.text: Wonderful place that can be just a little better . I would still recommend this to everyone. They just need a better serve off the wine , after we got a bottle we couldn't get the same one by glass and the other one that we got was to warm . Don't serve the table that has all the red tags people need a brake that's why you got the red and green card.  Your experience may be perfect so don't hesitate to visit this place. Food is great , lamb chops where better than last time and the filet was a must try.

hw6dH3a-ki-T9cniR1PDDA.text: If you're looking for an all you can eat Brazilian dining experience, this place is for you!   Start off at the all you can eat gourmet salad bar. You'll  find everything there from heavenly bacon, roasted tomatoes, and asparagus the size of tree trunks.   Fogo de Chao provides an endless selection of meats brought to your table on enormous skewers by waiters dressed in gauchos. The garlic sirloin, lamb chops, and house prime sirloin are delish! You'll also get family style side dishes of sweet bananas, mashed potatoes, and cheesy bread rounds. Be careful, those cheese rounds are addictive!   The cocktail and wine menu provides tasty options and be sure to save some room for the dessert- I HIGHLY recommend the tres leches cake.   The service is stellar - everyone is friendly and helpful. Don't see what you want? Just ask and it'll be brought to your table pronto.   Because this restaurant is a little pricey (but well worth it!), make sure you sign up for their mailers to receive information on special pricing offers.
