4Wuk90Op_aVbhnBhdT05bg.text: Went to Fogo really excited to eat and get the Brazilian experience. Also, it was my first time.. I walked into the rudest hostesses and was very upset with how I was treated as they made me feel dumb and giggled when I said I was confused because I had never been. Other than that my waiter was very helpful and nice. He did charge me wrong and try to get more money from me but fixed it after I told him.

sVb026hapKPV5MHG3xUUGQ.text: This was first experience at Fogo de Chao in Scottsdale Az. We were pleasantly surprised by the great warm service that our server NORMA!!! provided. The place was extremely busy as expected but Norma was available when we needed her and provided us with exceptional service!! She gave us the WOW' experience and I can guarantee that we will be back!

uFLhHRebDlVEfWdBNldE5w.text: I took my boyfriend here because he loves Brazilian steakhouses but I wasn't impressed. The drinks were extremely expensive. The food costs what I thought it would. The staff skipped our table a lot and my boyfriend had to flag someone down just to get more food coming to the table. He liked the food but said the restaurant was just okay. I thought the food was decent but the restaurant was just okay as well. Not terrible but wouldn't go again.

3oD1465EOvd1ynBOdpeM1w.text: I came here for my 3 year anniversary with my boyfriend and it was a hands down wonderful experience.  The wait staff are extremely kind and attentive. One waiter ,Vince, stood out above the rest. He went above and beyond to make sure all our needs were met. The food was so delicious! The staff bring all kinds of meat to your table and everything was amazing. We plan to come here again. Definitely a place to go for special occasions.

8T8TIVo1Il-5UzJEf_gwWA.text: I am a huge fan of Brazilian steakhouses and here is definitely one of the best. The decorate is gorgeous,the atmosphere is relaxing, the service make you feel like home, and every single item on their menu is just spectacular. This place can not go wrong if you wish to celebrate something or to please someone. Their quality is consistently stable, I kept visiting here for about 2 years and they never let me down.

pK6Wwdh0wPTIIPkdY3FXyw.text: Food was okay, not sure if worth the price. We came during lunch., a group of 8. The meat came out timely and in a steady manner , some good , some bad. We had to "ask" for mashed potatoes, and bread. For that reason alone, I'm shaving off three stars. We all ordered the full experience and those items should have been brought out timely and without prompting.total bill came to 329 before tip. In conclusion dining experience was just okay. The full experience is not worth the full price. In the future I will use my buying power elsewhere in a creative and proactive manner. That said, my team left engaged, bloated and poised to enter 2018 on the path to greatness.

N8jq4g8xxKGDU2hPQxoglQ.text: I'm not sure what there is to say about this place. Concept is awesome meats are awesome my fav is the rib eye, lamb chops and filet. But the others are delish too. Sides are all good. Limeade yummy. Service always good. It's pricey but worth it. I've been here at least three or four times and never have I been disappointed. If you want delicious beef or chicken this is it. You will leave satisfied and thinking of when you wanna go again. It's great for a date or large groups. Lunch or dinner...

PGz1HAnm7QglWQJpxkAmxg.text: I love Fogo but I feel like they're always trying to rush me out, and no I don't stay for hours lol. The salad bar is amazing, the wine list is great and it is a meat lovers paradise. Don't turn your card to "red" for too long or they will clean up the whole table and kick you out! That's the worst and it has unfortunately happened to me more than once.

AP-8Z-l4HIMgTGcZST-zBg.text: Vegetarians, stay home.  This place is a meat lover's paradise. I don't think I've ever eaten so much meat in my entire life.  But before the meat service begins, you start your meal over at the gourmet salad bar, which was not why I was there. After picking up a couple olives and leaves of lettuce, and a slice or two of onion, I felt good about having a nice balanced meal.  Back at the table, it's time for the real food to begin. The servers come by immediately, bringing a dozen different kinds of meat, filling up your plate as many times as you can handle. Lots of beef, like top and bottom sirloin, filet mignon, ribs, and ribeye, plus lamb chops, leg of lamb, pork ribs, parmesan-encrusted pork loin, chicken with or without being wrapped in bacon (like I'd eat chicken that's not wrapped in bacon), and sausage. Every meat was delicious, tender and juicy, full of amazing Brazilian flavors.  Also included with the meal were various side dishes, like a pretty good cheese bread, mashed potatoes, and carmelized bananas - but I was here to eat meat, so I didn't have a lot of those.  In the end, I don't know how much I ate - I'd guess each portion to be around 2-3 ounces, and I probably had at least 20 portions (everything at least once, several things twice), so probably around 3 pounds of meat. With all the different flavors constantly coming, it always seemed fresh and new.  At $62 (including soft drink, tax, and tip), it's a little more than I typically spend on a meal, but well worth it. This is definitely a place I'll be back to, maybe a few times a year. It will take that long to recover from my meat-induced coma anyway.

k5Mr1l48U6kARWmfNLaKBQ.text: Definitely a fun place to eat if you have a few extra bucks laying around. The salad bar is out of this world and the schmorgesborg of delicious meats being shoved in your face is an experience! My one qualm is the meat was a little over salted and obviously the price doesn't leave for an every friday night kind of place. Still it is a must for "experience dining"

lQ3fb3XC6QNfvOkVTsJE-g.text: AWESOME SERVICE!  If it weren't for the awesome service, I woulda given this place 4 stars. But man o man, the servers were always accessible without being overbearing.  Loved it.  I also loved the salad bar, and the side dishes.  The meat was awesome too, but I'm just not into meat like that.  Next time I return, I'm salad barring it all the way.

p1lbo3P4uV9sM13giWZl2w.text: Meat and veggies- what's not to like?!  The servers are everywhere and always willing to assist. Service was great. Food  was spectacular.  I personally did not like everything I tried but I tried everything I could. My faves were the  variety of veggies and cheese bar plus the lombo and lamb chops. My sister really enjoyed the ribs which for some reason I didn't try since I was hooked on the lombo.  Huge wine list and I had a glass but when I go back and I will go back I will elect not to have wine so I can try their rum speciality drink that they bring around on a cart. Desserts were nothing fancy. Had the creme brulee but honestly I've had better.  Full 5 stars for the choices and service.  Oh and they bring these cooked bananas to the table along with some bread type things. Both were delicious but I only had one bread type thing since I wanted to save room for the meat.  Craving the lombo as I write this... Mmmmm.

Lb31UUFubdADTg7HNVyVsA.text: Best value is at lunch. Lots to eat to the point of nitrate overload. Great salad bar, service. Always come back on every visit here.

9UnLiTCsedrH_lON3Mwaow.text: WAY to good!!!! its pricey but well worth it.   This is easily the best place for steaks in the valley.  My favorite restraunt out of anywhere in Scottsdale/Phoenix area. They make love to the meat while cooking it.

aMPS8M-F1I_iXmS6BV0LWA.text: Welcome to meat heaven. If you don't like meat, stay away, you will probably faint just walking by their large, glass room of ribs just roasting tenderly.... begging you to come in and take a bite...  Whatever you do, don't eat the salad buffet first. You will get full off of the gigantic vegetables (asparagus the side of a baby's arm, I'm not even joking), and not have any room for the variety of meats these Aladdin-pant-wearing, sword-holding employees have in store for you.   Waiter immediately explains to us that there is no menu. "Wha?" I say. He basically explains that they come around with the chunks of meat on swords and will place as much as you'd like on your plate. It will include steak, chicken, lamb, etc. etc. The coaster on the table is red on one side, green on the other. If you are ready to eat, flip the card to green! When you want a red, don't forget to flip to red or else the men will just keep coming by to offer more meat!  Very spacious place, lots of attentive people waiting on you.  I got a little intimidated at first with all the swords flying by my head, but their 'Brazilian national drink' calmed me down. It tasted like a margarita with hints of vodka.  The whole time that we're eating I'm wondering how much this is gonna cost, I'm thinking it's gonna be super expensive since it's so good and there is no limit to how much to eat! It came out to about $30/person. Not bad at all! Come with your starving stomach, because there will be plenty to try out and it is so delicious!

G7-OcXtUkgBloIzQkXam1w.text: WOW!  This is my first 5-star review for a restaurant.  I believe that 5th star should be held for something really special that made a place stand out.  Fogo did that for me last night.  We wanted to go to a Churrascaria for our anniversary, and being the good Yelper that I am, I read the reviews for Fogo and "the other one" which is a couple of miles from my house.  Decided, based on Yelp, to make the drive to Scottsdale.  Great decision.  I made reservations online and noted that it was my anniversary.  Got there and was seated promptly.  Since it was our first time there we got the run down on the coaster signals and the wine specials and then we were off to the salad bar.  The salad bar was good.  Not particularly large, but the selections were not your ordinary salad fair.  It had fresh mozzarella, blocks of Parmesan to shave, salmon, marinated mushrooms, asparagus.  Just great, fresh stuff of which I tried not to over do because of the meat fest I was saving myself for.  That's where the fun begins.  As soon as we flipped our coaster to green...BAM...meat was at our table in 2 seconds.  No joke.  Top sirloin, Parmesan crusted pork loin, pepper crusted lamb, fresh sausages, chicken etc.. Medium rare is medium rare, just the way I like it.  I could go on and on about how well all the meats were cooked.  Tender, juicy, FLAVOR.  For those who do not like a lot of pepper, stay away from the lamb as it is definitely pepper crusted.  I personally couldn't get enough.  Not seeing the meat you want?  Just ask a Gaucho and it will be there within minutes. The fried Polenta dusted with Mozzarella was so flippin good, I'm going to have to try it myself.   After going into protein shock I decided I was done.  My wife wanted just a little taste of chocolate mousse if they had it.  They came back with a piece of the most delicious cake I have ever had in my life on a plate that had "Happy Anniversary" drizzled out on the plate..complementary.  That was the 5th star! The price wasn't that bad, but the drinks are a bit pricey.  Dinner with 3 cocktails was $140.  That is more than worth it for a great atmosphere, friendly servers and Gaucho's, terrific food, and genuine hospitality.    This is my new go-to place for family, friends, and business colleagues.  Great job!

Jlsdm3FPXfb5yGWfLZ4fxg.text: This place is crazy. You can't beat the price. The food is decent but it took all night for the filet to come out and that's all I really wanted. By the time it was available we had already been dining for an hour on less desirable meats.

xxbORQlqeWpiY03TBiOVuQ.text: Imagine your a hungry lion, locked in a shopping mall full of people. They are athletic, unarmed, and some of them have been good enough to coat themselves in A1 or barbecue sauce. Welcome to the Fogo de Chao experience.  Meat orgy! It's absolutely magnificent, take over half a dozen different piping hot well prepared varieties of meat including top sirloin, bottom sirloin, Filet Mignon, pork loin, beef ribs, pork ribs, and lamb stuffed onto skewers that could double as props for a film about Roman gladiators. Hand said savory redolent skewers to an assorted band of servers that seem to dance in and out of crowded tables full of people with amazing ease all at the beck and call of a little piece of paper. It's fantastic! They have wonderful sides as well including caramelized bananas, polenta, and garlic mashed potatoes. There is also a salad bar, and I think it was nice but quite honestly wasn't the analogy about the damn lion the point here?  Happy hunting.

gGFIfeMmOblANGvTvC6bLQ.text: Service was impeccable. Food was decent. Wish all the meat wasn't so salty.  Full but not full enough. All that salt made me sick

vafqCR0mMxZ5q_LaYDNv1w.text: Service was friendly, very attentive food was good and overall was a very fun cultural experience! I recommend trying the papaya dessert and Brazilian sodas they are unique and pretty tasty!

nCV_PJhLAD97bxfN3iu98Q.text: I had always wanted to try Fogo and I saw that they were on the list for AZ Restaurant Week so I made a reservation for 3 and never looked back. I arrived first and the rest of our party was running late so I was offered a seat at the bar and looked over the menu while my friends joined me. I was asked by staff passing a few times if I needed anything and was eventually brought out a basket of fresh bread while I waited. Once we were seated, our server gave us the run down and we made our way to the salad bar. It was sizable, but not as huge as I expected. Knowing what was ahead of me, I just sampled a few things, all of which were very fresh. I was more than ready to start with the meats. Lots and lots of meats everywhere you looked. My favorites were the parmesan crusted pork and garlic beef. The servers were very kind, offering numerous times to go back for a different cut or cook of meat if we wanted. The sides were also good, loved the mashed potatoes and crispy polenta. I do wish they had bigger containers of the sides as they were quickly gone. I had a caipirinha in the spirit of things, which was a great drink. We ended the meal with dessert, the cheesecake was rich and delicious.   It is definitely a special occasion type of place, but I would absolutely recommend it to others and will keep it on my short list for when I win the lotto :)

4PV8uqMpwreSD0s3mmqk3A.text: As I sit here savoring all of the delicious meat I am enjoying the classy decor.   I discovered the Brazilian Churrascaria in brazil quite a few years ago.   Fogo de Chao does a fantastic job of grilling the choice cuts.  This reminds me of my original experience there.    The salad bar was very fresh and the biscuits have a wonderful eggy flavor.   All of the wait staff were very attentive and friendly.  This is a great place for a special occasion!

gHIU5j9i-_L5jhIxJy8SPg.text: Oh boy! talk about some quality "meat" dining experience. I went on a Sunday night, my friend and i are huge meat eaters, so we were ready to devour the place. The staff were really friendly and immediately seated us and told us "remember try to pace yourself", come on!? really!? i have conquered steaks after steaks who do u think you are talking to!? ( so i thought), let me just say that if you are not ready, keep your little coaster on the red side, because all the tender goodness are practically flying to your table, if you don't pace urself, you are gonna get dominated by the juicy goodness plates after plate.   I personally enjoyed every rack of meat they brought in front of us, the chicken was so so, but ..well it's chicken.   I was pretty impressed by their salad bar, the produce were fresh and delicious, if i want ready to eat an entire cow, i can definitely hangout at their salad bar all day.   Over all it was a very fulfilling and pleasant experience.

RnQSsBb7lWyHCq2CBe1o7g.text: I'd never had Brazilian BBQ before and was I in for a treat.    It started out with an impressive salad bar that included a wheel of Parmesan that you could carve pieces out of, delicious sweetly marinated peppers, hearts of palm and many other exotic and standard salad items.  The basil salad dressing was very good and a must try!  The main course was a never ending supply of ten types of meat. Everything was delicious except the sirloin which was on the tougher side. The lamb and pork ribs stood out as exceptional.  A word of warning, be sure to remember to flip your coaster to the red side, otherwise you will be overwhelmed with slices of meat being cut and tossed in front of you.  Fogo de Chao is an experience to be had. Be sure to bring your appetite!

iorO2Jr_VOxDRGFaEtAgZA.text: I am not sure we will ever go back. My husband and I did not have a pleasant experience. We weren't even offered all the meat they'd told us we'd get and the service was sub-par. I think we'll be spending our $100 at the Houston's across the street rather.

ijnbKeTf9iYJKAYFM4xaGQ.text: This is meat nirvana, and the best Brazilian-style steakhouse I have visited.  I started with a Brazilian beer in the bar, then met up with several friends for dinner here on Saturday night.   We all had a great time trying the 15 different cuts of meat, the unusual salad bar, and the sides of potatoes and plantains (which are all included for under $50). My personal favourites were the filet, ribeye, and the "house beef".

L-sDto3-A8S5a_AZRzb9Xw.text: This place was simply deeeeeeelicious.  They have a wonderful salad bar with lots of cold meats and greens.  After I got my salad I sat down and used the nice card system thingy to get the meat fest on.  They will ATTACK you with food, so once my plate was full I flipped my card over and began to eat. They have the tastiest meats ever, my favorites were the Parmesan crusted pork chop and the bacon wrapped filet mignon.  All of them were wonderfully seasoned and tender.  I left feeling I really got my money's worth of yumminess.

rCxDNV8c7P8s7NjszbUQ_g.text: Let me start by saying...I really like this place. Tonight was the second time I have eaten at Fogo-Scottsdale and like the first time, I paid for it dearly.  I have literally eaten twice what my stomach can hold both times.  Part of the reason is that it's fairly expensive, $50/person, and I feel like I need to get my money's worth. LOL. But the bigger part is that it is genuinely good food. The salad bar is good with plenty to choose from and the sides (plantains, polenta, and potatoes) are also good. When you first sit down the bring you these little cheesy, doughy bread cubes. I have no freakin idea what they are called but they are awesome. Then the meat, this is what you come here for and this is what I over indulge on.  I'm really suffering now but an hour ago I was in meat heaven.  The lamb shanks and the bacon wrapped filet mignon are why I come here. Both were cooked perfectly and were juicy and full of flavor. I believe I sampled everything that they offered except for maybe one thing. The chicken was a lil dry but everything else was good. The service was fine as well. I have to take away 1 star because this isn't Morton's or Ruth's Chris or another top-shelf steak house. I'm actually glad that I can dress casual at Fogo because eating this quantity of food while wearing a suit would suck balls! As it is now, I'm laying on the couch hoping I can eliminate some of this excess food before bed while my idiot chihuahua hops around on my stomach. I'm so meat drunk that I can't summon the will to stop him. I'm actually hoping if he jumps on my stomach enough, it will induce vomiting and some of this pressure can be released. That being said, Fogo was awesome again. Many thanks to my wife for taking me here on my birthday. Hit it up, you won't regret it. Ok, maybe you will temporarily, but it's worth it.

KoLEWQpmG_rnvYlFgH9L_g.text: Great selection of meat. We loved all of them except for one steak which was very tough, surprisingly it was the filet. Never got to try the pork even though we requested it. Service could have been more attentive, we had to waive at the waiters quite a few times. Even then, they didn't always return. For the price we expected better service. They really need to hire more wait staff.

FT180loDMpsuwL7E8lLgiQ.text: Everything was delicious, down to the tomatoes and kale salad. All the waiters were very attentive and made us feel like royalty. A Filipino waiter came to our table and was very nice and welcoming! It makes me a little sad that I was only visiting Scottsdale, as I would love to dine here again.   When they tell you the waiters will attack you with skewers of meat if you keep the card green, they really will come to you nonstop. They kind of rush off quickly, so state that you also want a piece if they are at your table.   The only reason why I dinged a star off was because when my dad asked for a piece of rare filet mignon, the server said none of the pieces were rare but he would get another skewer. Another server came by a few minutes later with another skewer and cut the most well-done piece of meat before rushing off.

h_CBA2YF3FLoFjld630J5Q.text: Best all you can eat quality meat in Arizona. Come hungry, eat slow and don't fill up on the delicious cheesey bread!!

5QShdTCtlJb7C6zga8fJEQ.text: This place never disappoints. I seek it out in every city I travel to. Food is always good and consistently delicious. This particular location was easy to find with plenty of parking. Ambience was pleasant. Service was great. All good.

rzreITC3mLH_g9WPvVQ1uA.text: We had an $80 lunch (2 thankfully we had no drinks) that had highs and lows, Market Bar was fair but one should not fill up on the cheap stuff as the highlight is the meat, started with wimpy skewers of meat small little pieces that they attempted to slice even thinner slices from and you had to be forceful to get more. However that changed and full skewers started coming out and the meat was exceptionally done and very tasty, the lamb was my favorite as was the house steak. Dessert if you had room was awesome for $10 so would I go back yes, about once every 3 years!

Lrtwdc-UMUwArZ7n-vW0DA.text: My father and I come here every time we come out to AZ for spring training. We are bigger men, so the all you can eat stands out to us. The food was amazing and you can really get a lot of different types of meats. Which all all very flavorful. I'm giving a 4 star only because we got a couple rounds of meat and then our plates were completely empty. So I kinda just stared at the manager and he saw as sent the next four guys from the kitchen straight to our table. I guess that was okay but waiting 5 minutes to be seen sucked.

S2lq18vI-OJBOg7Yv3B3ew.text: Most amazing food and salad bar! The meats are tender and delicious, the ambience is wonderful and some of the staff speak Portuguese and are actually from Brazil! We had a wonderful time speaking with them.. Oh and they have Guarana!! Yummy! Please get some brigaderos though :) Please!!! We will be back!

icqKtszYV9gub_4zDm4-KA.text: I would have rated this higher if the service would have been better. We were seated, went to the market table, and had 3 gauchos come by before the sides were served. We had to request the sides be brought out. Our drinks were not refreshed in a timely manner. The service did not match the price of the meal.

oxavum4_-maGlzjJPe_u0A.text: This place does it for me, a meat lovers paradise! Great service and a fun dining experience. Like the lower sirloin and the house special.   Perfect for meat lovers that want to eat all you want and have a unique dining experience.

9LJP-V_av5TFQVJOk3FK4g.text: Have always wanted to try a Brazilian Steak House so we finally went. Significant other was thoroughly enjoying the whole experience, I was left disappointed. I didn't care for the little bread puffs at all, I thought they were greasy. Then the market buffet / salad bar, lots of options and I really enjoyed that and made 2 trips to have some variety in between the meats. We ordered one of their special old fashioned drinks with carmelized pineapple, they never brought it, upon asking again they brought us a traditional old fashioned and were out of the carmelized pineapple..... ok, disappointing. Menu price for the drink was $15, charged $16, no big deal but really? Meats were slow to start but then came frequently. My issue was the cut of meats, we finally asked for fillet and they brought us our own fillet. Seems the most inexpensive meats are served in plenty and had to ask fir a second small piece of sirloin. Since significant other enjoyed it very much we will probably be back. I will ask for the cuts of meat I want next time and not try the others. Would I recommend them, I don't think so.

eK5ITTtuj73rMHp2UY491A.text: Brilliant Just Brilliant. This is not just a restaurant it is a gastronomic experience. The Gauchos are exceptional. Thank You for a wonderful experience.

paZ4JIv268_N20ZafXBc8Q.text: This was my second time at this location. First time was 3-4 stars.  On May 21, 2016 the service was ok, the bar was not stocked with three wines that I ordered ($35-$45 a bottle and the bartender tried upselling to a $70+ bottle of wine, the meats ranged from being delightful to fatty and gristly. Don't be afraid to putting bad meat aside.  The filet mignon was generally very good. Hold out for that.  The chicken and pork cuts were not very good.  Three of us amassed a $200 bill, which I was prepared for, but I doubt that I will try this restaurant again.

hTmMAZXSgn1ZUO386-Smog.text: I was really disappointed!! I've been to the Atlanta location several years ago and I really enjoyed it. However, I was really disappointed with our dining experience here in Scottsdale! The meat was very tough and everything just about tasted the same! My husband and I decided to go out for a much needed date night. We had 7:30 reservations and we were seated promptly! That was good. But once we were seated it took 10 minutes for someone to come and greet our table. Meanwhile, a party of four were seated after us and they were greeted right away! Finally, the server came over and did his bit but it was very lack-luster. Finally we got our drinks and went to the salad bar. I turned my card over and it took several minutes for the any of the Gauchos to make their way over to us. Once they showed up the meat was tough and burnt! Our bill was $165.00 with tip. Ugh! Now I don't mind paying top dollar for good food and service, but that was a bit ridiculous! I should have gone to Orange Sky instead! I rarely write bad reviews, but this place deserved it!

syUWCEAzpygRL6dHQ4o7NA.text: Never was told or saw a sign about the $50/per person (i thought it was 35), so it was a nice sticker shock at the end of this experience. Probably will go here once every blue moon unless someone has a big announcement and wants to celebrate, but it's nice to try it just once. Come here hungry as if you want to eat a horse, because that's exactly what is going down in here.  - the salad bar deserves an A+ . - all you can (eat/handle) banana fritters. Lord.....A+

kQrg7-C9Dl0beIafOhB1eg.text: My original review from 11/14/2012  I wish i could give this place more stars.  Wildly decadent and over the top AMAZING, I almost am at a loss for words.  First and foremost the entire staff is on point with seamless service, they are professional, personable,  and extremely knowledgeable = 5 star service !  Love the interior -classy, clean, simple elegance.  The salad bar completely blew my mind with its gorgeous/ inviting appearance. Not a wilted veggie in sight just fresh looking lush colored choices, asparagus, and artichokes O MY GOSH were as great as they looked. Prosciutto, and cheese was dy-no-mite !  Great looking breads.. feared i would now live vicariously through watching Erich enjoy all that crusty, soft goodness (and the s.o.b makes it look so damn good ..grrrrr !!! ) NO- not this night  as they offer GLUTEN-FREE ...5 stars for the salad bar !  I also love the concept of flipping the card from red to green (red light, green light 123) ha ha  ...I digress.  THE MEAT ...TA-DA !  carved table side is succulent ..savory ..tender ...utter bliss Picanha,  and Alcatra positively melted like butter .The lamb according to my sexy Non GF bread eater was amazing . Caipirinha drinks were Fabu,  and refreshing . We also had so much fun. ..we left sated and feeling sexy .I love when that happens.  Fogo is going to the top of my five star list for it's outstanding service, mouth-watering meat,  GF friendly,  and THE SEXIEST salad bar !  I might never cook again.....  update:   Still amazing I am in love with the salad bar!

CAdFAHzGBfbEqOnpgzIg_g.text: We enjoyed this place a lot. Short on 1 star due to slow rotation of meats. We expected to be there 1.5 hours but it took over 2 hours. We had to ask 3 times for the lamb chops and they were way over cooked. But we left full and still enjoyed the feast and service. The palm hearts were excellent as was the smoked salmon. We had a good time.

qUlXdBiw0R_iBfL1GY3oyw.text: There must a very large stick or stump up some of these people's asses that are leaving bad reviews. The food is great, meat is tender and flavorful. The salad bar was fresh and we'll put together. Customer service was EXCELLENT! We seriously felt catered to and very much worth the price! Will definitely return

ReMGmKwmKJ64vdbflbcxPw.text: I haven't been here in few years. My first experience was amazing. Tonight, I left feeling very underwhelmed. The service was great, don't get me wrong...quality wasn't there and price did not match what you would expect to get for $50 a person.

kZQT5wtJmAisyYKNMRcaOA.text: I am quite disappointed with my last visit during restaurant week.. I've been coming here for the last 3 years, from the first time to the last, boy was there a huge difference! Three years ago I came in for my birthday and had this fun amazing server who stuck by my table and up sold the crap out of us, but he was so great at it that it was just like "take my money, and stick around!" -definitely would had given him a 5 star alone!  This last Saturday for restaurant week was very different [ hope it wasn't different because of restaurant week]. We were greeted by a male server, he went through the process for my parents and spouse, and told us how everyones our server, we ordered a drink and went straight to the salad bar. After we finished our greens, we immediately turned over that nice little red card to green! All the delicious meats were coming to our table, but our waters and drink were low, couldn't find our original server or the water person, so we had to flag someone down.   One of the carvers brought over I believe it was their pork sausage, I took one and my spouse took one, then right before I bit into mine I hear my BF ask the carver " Umm sir can I get another one that's not stuffed with hair?" The guy looked back but didn't come back so I called for him again, he came back and we were trying to explain the situation to him and he just gave us another sausage, and of course the water guy is just standing there frozen, looking at our plate with what looks like hair on it then looks at us, then walks off.. we asked the carver to grab a server or manager, but he walks off, so we had to flag down a server ourselves. Danya was the first server to actually respond to our situation even though other servers were standing near by doing nothing and we couldn't get their attention. We explained to her what had happened, and I'm sure this has rarely happened [I hope] and asked for her to remove the plate and just get us a new one... few seconds later a manager came over to apologize and explain to us how they grill everything on an open flame and sometime bristles debris can land on top of their meat.   Well that's great to hear, but the problem was it looked like coarse long black hair and it was INSIDE of the sausage, not on top or wrapped around it, he then went on to explain how he doesn't know how that could have happened since there weren't any female chefs on... regardless we just wanted an apology, a new plate and just for them to know to keep a closer eye on their food because it was one of the most disturbing things I've seen at a restaurant. The manager then gave my BF the option to order anything off the regular dessert menu, by this time he kind of lost his appetite already which was unfortunate... we ended up getting the Tres Leche cake option and Creme Brule.  All in all this visit didn't leave my parents or BF with the greatest first time experience...  SIDE NOTE*** All the servers pool tips, but I honestly only saw Danya, a dirty blonde gentleman and someone who looked like he was watching over the servers, working and attending to customers. Our original server who greeted us just stood to the side and chatted for the whole hour we were there, only time he even did anything was when we got his attention and asked for a fresh plate and when he initially greeted us...   I honestly didn't think it was fair to see some of the servers working harder than others and having to split tips with the lazier ones, I even tried personally handing one of them money and thanking them for being so attentive with us, but this person respectfully declined...   Not too sure if I'll ever come back during restaurant week again.. but might continue giving this place another shot, because the food is pretty good here, but when paying about $50 a head, I expect great customer service as well.

k5kzj2rII98HbaKEebCzyw.text: My first time here I've heard a lot about! Definitely going back!!! My girlfriend and I went for lunch and the salad bar was excellent my favorite was the potato salad and Caesar salad amongst the large variety of other things....then you get to the meat thing and they were not lying when they said the meat doesn't stop coming until you flip it over to red!!! Lunch time was decently priced as well!!!

ttysIAfod8z32r3Jza5rcg.text: This place. I had extremely high hopes. Major disappointment. $54.95 per person for the "full experience." More like a full let down. The staff are rude and unprofessional. The gauchos were favoring the larger tables and continued walking past our table of four. We all had our green cards flipped, but they still went to the larger tables. We had to call over a gaucho because they weren't stopping at our table. There was one gaucho we asked for a side plate.. he grabbed one and slammed it on the table, it wound up sitting sideways because it landed on a knife. He noticed it, but walked away. I guess that's all in the "full experience?"   As a side came out "mashed potatoes." Which tasted like boxed potato flakes.   The meat is nothing to be excited about. I could grill a steak better at home. The market table or whatever it is that they called it... grilled veggies and salads. Nothing special. Nothing exciting. Sadly, I left hungry and annoyed.   This place is basically nothing other than an expensive home town buffet with different clientele.   First time here and a guaranteed last time. Go spend your hard earned money elsewhere.

C_R-aEVh0irUQsbd9SbQOg.text: You know that feeling when you leave fogo feeling so uncomfortably full but you still have a smile on your face because you know you got your money's worth? I miss that. They stopped by our table so infrequently you'd think there was a beef shortage. And it's not the servers faults. It clearly fogo's procedures that changed. If your plan was to skip lunch and feast at fogo make sure you come at 4pm because it'll take you about 6 hours to get full (they close at 10). We were there from 6:15-8:15 and I'm still hungry. And I'm not even that fat

P2hjckciYQwSUpLF16JMZQ.text: Well this will definitely go down as the worst birthday celebration of my life. Overpriced and marginal food with a lot of the advertised items never offered. Premium cuts of meat were only offered after they were pretty sure that I was full. Cold side dishes and overpriced drinks only add to the disappointing experience and the quality of service that one would expect at Denny's. If it's a memorable occasion the only memories you'll have are those of feeling gouged!

j4F4rZGA6EJMx8pef0UJ6g.text: There are a few great pleasures in life that are so good they make you feel like your in heaven.  Men walking around with hunks of meat and slicing them one after another onto your plate is one of those great pleasures.  What more can I say, unbelievable, tender steaks, pork, chicken, lamb.  Can't go wrong with anything.  But be warned, be prepared to be past out for the next few hours post consumption.  If you aren't, you didn't do this place justice

LklvUokP09p92-rq9k6VSQ.text: So this is my second visit here. The first visit, I wasn't too impressed but I thought I'd give it a second change. The restaurant itself is so beautiful!  Very elegant, modern and feels clean. They have an extensive salad bar that is friendly to every diet type whether you eat everything or you only eat fruits/vegetables. I chose the lunch option where you have essentially unlimited options when it comes to meats, I can't remember what it's called. There really isn't anything special about any of the meats. They have items such as pork, ribs, lamb, chicken, and beef. For the beef, they will accommodate according to how you want it cooked. There was nothing special about how it was cooked though. Majority of their meats came out SO dry and the seasoning is minimal. The course itself is $38 per person which is pretty pricy considering there are other options out there with better quality. I guess the thing that upset me most, is one of the servers, spilled my wine on both my plates, the table, my napkin, and dress. It got everywhere. He handed me new plates and that was about it. I understand accidents happen but I was wearing most of my glass at that point and nothing was done about it. Pretty poor service. I will not be returning and I can't in good consciousness recommend this restaurant to anyone.

0ozSaMllXJvseid3wTXoqw.text: This is a great place to experience the Brazilian steakhouse type of restaurant. Now I have eaten several times at different steakhouses and in comparison this is not bad but not the best. I will say the meat well seasoned, the staff especially Tyler was amazing. The price point was higher than expected for what was presented. The mashed potatoes tasted like watery box mashed potatoes.

Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FYakAxJhS5aPb9UlkTBXvA.text: This was our third visit since the restaurant has opened. It was alway remember to be s very high class steak house however last night the feeling was different. The service was not as good as before, we had to wait although we had made a reservation. The salad bar was good the steaks were not being distributed around the restaurant evenly so we had ask three time to get some. The overall feeling was like expensive fast food restaurant.

zlGne6S35YHkD0GdfEouVQ.text: In my marriage, Fogo has become a tradition for celebrating events. I found out I received a promotion so we came to enjoy a nice dinner.   We were sat immediately since we were on time for our reservation. We were served on immediately. And the food was as good as ever. Endless meat with delicious chimichurri never tasted so good!  Our waiter James seemed to always be there waiting for any request. Lemons. Horse radish. Chimi churri. He had it back quick and was very kind about it.   The manager came by and said hello. The service is always incredible and the food is the reason we come. I love it.

D4jP7tpgjh4Xxa_dj6grWA.text: Very limited selection of meats.  For a high end Brazilian Steakhouse we expected not only great traditional quality cuts but also a great selection of salads and buffet.  We got neither.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!  Whatever was served was of good quality but definitely not worth the name brand "Fogo de Chao"  We are not going back and we don't recommend this place.

0iIBBiPWB1n0qDuQqe7pkA.text: I'm going to make this short and sweet...4$ sign restaurant, 5 star restaurant = 0 star service. Great food, HORRIBLE server. Actually, NO server. Spent roughly an hour and a half there for my anniversary and not one time did our server check on us, ask us if we wanted refills on our drinks, acknowledge us, nothing. It was like we were literally invisible ;/ We had to ask the water boy and bartender that was going around for refills, clean plates and our check at the end. We didn't even bother getting our anniversary dessert because we knew it wouldn't happen, well and we didn't have a server :/ Needless to say we will  not be back for awhile if ever again and I would say think twice if you are a younger couple on wasting your time and money here!

IFnd0wk_Uq6cuAfO51BoPA.text: Meat, meat, meat and more meat.... this place is the mecca of meat, probably the best cuts of meat anywhere.    There is lamb, garlic chicken, parmesan chicken, bbq chicken legs, sirlon steak, rib eye steak, every kind of sausage you can imagine.   OMG.... if your a meat lover you'll be in meat heaven but I must say the salad bar was by far one of the best I've had.    Considering it's a buffet style salad bar, it was still amazing.    You had a choice of soup to whole roasted garlic. The best  part of Fogo are the waiters who walk around with huge metal skewers. Watching them slice the meat is magical.    If your looking for seafood here they have it too but this place is strictly for the meat lovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Basil martini
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Keeping it on green

Auagj62FrzH8F4cgz9my_w.text: This is an amazing place to eat! The food never disappoints! The Salad bar has so many fresh and unique options. It is definitely a one of a kind. My family eats there often. Normally I would give this 5 stars however on a recent dining experience we had poor service. They also changed their system for paying, which to be honest is absolutely genius, however we weren't told we needed to present any coupons,  discounts (military)  or anything before our meal and they wouldn't honor any after our meal before we paid. Since this is a fairly new system,  I think it would be beneficial for for customers and staff if the server would ask in advance if anyone has discounts or coupons. The server wouldn't even get the manager for us to speak to him about this concern.  So what should have been about $39 a person ended up being full price and our bill was over $500. I'll know better next time to present everything when we walk in.

mgC8uLe0AhnKu_cU8ZLmTw.text: Last time we came (Lunch service) If was not very good.  This time (Super Bowl Sunday) it was outstanding.  Well done!

RRfoVqwSMxIEcUme3fvJRQ.text: Very nice restaurant. Very good salad bar, and incredibly good meats. Service is beyond compare and probably is 6 stars. Pricey but really worth it. Can`t wait to go again.

sSamMXCCz9wL--Wr4ZZK3w.text: Brought the family here for a Christmas feast. Even our vegan loved her visit as the salad bar is a banquet unto itself.    The carnivores among us were kept more than happy with the constant variety of fire roasted meats presented and served by attentive staff.  A mere flip of a card from red to green cues the nearest waiter who will lop off your custom serving of meat from a skewer for you to pull free with tongs provided with your table setting.  They'll keep coming until you flip the card to green no more.    Expect attentive, friendly and professional service from the ample army of wait staff.  We were seated promptly and allowed to linger after our meal was served.  Overall, a fun Christmas meal.

APRDvi3IbRsJsF_08ezv3g.text: Had a reservation at 730 an they were so over booked that we had to wait til after 8 to get seated. An the noise in this place is ridiculous for a high end steakhouse supposably. Then we order the full experience plate that the waiter talked us into an it turned out to be a waste of money an feel like we got taken advantage of by this business by the quality of meat. They destroyed it with access rock salt they apply to the meat. Almost every bite tasted like pure salt besides the chicken. Complained about it to the sever an he sent a guy around with meat that was suppose to be better but it was the same. Very dissatisfied for a first impression of this place. An still got charged full price for the 2 of us because they thought sending out a 2 dollar piece of cake was gonna fix it. Waste of 135 dollars. I wouldn't recommend this place.

N4aJxHhTQLhKsnwr-wkKSw.text: Norma was our waitress and she was phenomenal.  Very attentive, great attitude, and so friendly.

CJ_WM7xnJVIPyouthPkYwQ.text: Meat! Meat! Meat!   And I am not talking about the male review! My favorite steak restaurant by far.  I see from the reviews most feel the same as I do, however, there are a few people out there that seem to not realize that when you roast a steak the size of a small roast, i.e., 2+ pounds it will be more reminiscent of a prime rib, where extremely flavorful on the exterior and tender but less flavorful in the center. No problem! They have a million was to dress it up. Everything from A-1 to chimichurri, but that is not to say that the meat is bland. IT IS FAR from bland! And don't get me started on the Brazilian cheese bread, or the most sophisticated salad bar I have ever seen! The gauchos remember you and treat you like family!

CDxDYPCPAWXYmmLwAHeLTA.text: It was my first time, it was a b-day celebration of  a friend. It was lunch time I did order the salad bar, the waiter did give a good service he explained the options. I did ask for a glass of wine which never arrived so I gave up. The salad bar has some good choices some of the dishes did not have any flavor. I liked the Lax and the apple salad, soup was good too. Very disappointed no serving a real bread, we got mini size rolls that were not enough sorry. Can you please provide bread in the near future?

aJ-cOqaDpqzAlJlfeRYg3g.text: I so wish I had pictures. First of all, service was amazing. My boyfriend surprised me with a reservation at Fogo and they had a bottle of wine waiting for us at the table. Our server was very kind and knew the menu very well. The food is just the cherry on top. I swear I woke up wanting to go back. It was a little crowded for a week night, but nothing I can complain about. I can't wait to go back.

kUCXaMyXZiKt3BAVlMbDCg.text: honestly i been at this place fogo de chao few times in scottsdale az there is one gaucho cheff named guzman,,omg he is the best guy in that place he meet me the firts time ask me if everything was good on the meats ,,if i need anything i ask him what was the best meat,,,and he told me i will bring u all the meats right away one by one. omg i cant believe he did, he bring one and each meat to my table,,from now on when i go to that place i ask for him if his not there i prefer not to eat. nex time i will bring a party of 25 to 40 people and i will ask the manager to let guzman take care of my table all night,,i dont care if i have to pay extra,,because i am so happy abou his atention on me. one night i was looking at him,,he walk so fast he is a totally hard worker...thanks fogo de chao and thanks to guzman again i never forget his last name.

rrWv85f7ZzP29BriDLRUnw.text: I have eaten here many times and always had a great experience. So I decided to take my family for my husbands birthday. Biggest mistake! From being seated to asking for our check everything was horrible. Getting someone to stop at our table was near impossible even though our cards were green the entire time we were seated. No one ever cleared our dirty plates or asked if we wanted a clean plates. The only plates we had were from the salad bar. Once you final received your drink don't plan on getting another one. After being ignored by all the staff we decided to leave so we asked for the check which took 20 minutes. Absolutely would never return to this location worst experience and not worth my time or money. My opinion go to a nice steak house.

AeoNPdiuWs_iUqPFtcEuwA.text: A little pricey but well worth it. Should be considered one of the best restaurants period. Service was excellent from beginning to end. Taste was top notch. I had dinner alone but this would be great for a date or special occasion. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View from my table. Loved the market bar of fresh greens

TKG3oU4lH4m5osK-1CGqKw.text: I have ate her many times.  I have generally like it well.  This time it was restaurant month. We had a party of 4 and decided to go with the special. We felt it would still give us all the meats we needed and the salad bar at the special pricing. This was a mistake.  They give you different circle cards to flip. When you have these, you are treated like the 'red headed step child'. It was as though we had the plague. We were seated near the far end of the restaurant. There were two 8 party tables next to us. The servers buzzed around their tables and passed by us. We had to continually ask for meats. I asked for lamb four times before it was brought to the table. I also had to ask for horseradish three times before it was brought.   If you look at my other reviews, I am generally easy to satisfy. I don't ask for special treatment, I don't expect servers to be at my beck and call. This meal was very substandard as far as service was concerned. I think next time....yes I will go again as I have had great experiences here.... I will ask to be seated more towards the center of the dining room. I will NOT do the restaurant special. I'll pay the extra to be treated like a regular patron. It wasn't worth being ignored for the small savings.

AmKfx8HBJv8MF0KRKMc22w.text: Tonight we introduced my in-laws to this restaurant. Since I live with a man who thinks this is carnivore heaven, dining at Fogo is quite the treat! What I love about Fogo is the service and variety. Something that was off this evening.   What was right was the amazing "marketplace".  The salad bar has a beautiful selection of salads, roasted veggies, cheeses and more!   What was also right is their Tres Leches cake for dessert.   What was missing was the service. Typically, the challenge is that there are so many meat offerings that you have to put out the red card to wave the servers away. However tonight there were times where we waited 10 minutes between offerings.  We asked staff members for help, and although nice, we still waited far too long between service.  We had to ask for clean plates where normally they were offered - what was normally a smooth operation was clearly off tonight. We watched servers move sound the room but completely ignore our table!    I still love their restaurant, but was disappointed tonight. Let's hope this was a fluke and they quickly return to stellar service.

4dD3LBTdOxQ-W0MSq5lQNg.text: Fogo de chao is a delicious chain. I've been to 3 in 2 different states and the food has always been on point. Tonight, however, was particularly good.  We came for Thanksgiving dinner and it was packed. I personally would've wanted to scream. The staff, however, handled everyone's requests (and inevitable complaints) with ease. One waiter, Vincent, was exceptional. He made a point to check in on us regularly after my cocktail got lost in the chaos of the night.   At nice restaurants, staff can make or break the meal. I'm so happy to say we had an awesome Thanksgiving dinner...and when we come back we're definitely asking for Vincent!

wsSRJTcurPqp994UGWj8tw.text: Just wanted to give a quick vegetarian review.  Came here with a big party for lunch, and was pleasantly surprised with the complete and very filling meal I was able to accumulate. Great flavors and everything you need without the meat.  So kudos to the restaurant, honestly went in with absolutely no faith I was going to get full, thinking it would just be a bunch of sides and leafy salads, but again was very surprised with the amount of selection and options that didn't involve meat at all.

c7iIKx9mp18Pb5H5i4isDQ.text: It was our first visit here as we had no idea about it, but it came highly recommended as a place wec should go for or anniversary.  Reservations were very easy to make online, and even though we were almost a half hour early, because there were a lot of tables at that time, they graciously say us.  The service and attention was excellent and was a' pleasure to watch & experience.  The meats that came by was mind boggling and the food bar was pleasing to the eye & offered some very unique & tasty items.  The meat, though was fatty & all but the filet mignon was tough & some cuts tasteless.  Disappointing to be honest & for the price, I can't justify going back.  I was looking forward to the experience I was told about, but it didn't measure up.

ZX5AOOOXOcg8ML7Exzk5og.text: My friend and I showed up to this restaurant at 8pm. During our hour and a half stay there was a belligerently drunk man that was sitting next to us. During the course of this hour and half this man consumed two bottles of champagne. The whole time he was loudly cursing stating "bitches ain't shit" he even went on to insult one of their own staff telling the waitor to "get to stepping you four eyed ni**a". At times the staff chuckled because this man was that deliberately drunk and apologized at least 4 times to my friend and I because they knew his behavior was inappropriate. When I asked if this customer was a regular (bc I couldn't figure out why he wasn't kicked out already) the waitor replied "no I think he has autism". When In fact he was too drunk after being on his second bottle of champagne. At one point he purposely broke his Champagne glass by throwing it on the table and all they did was pick up the glass while letting him continue to drink straight from the bottle. He was falling in and out of sleep at his table as well and was still allowed to stay. It wasn't until he got up and poured champagne all over a man's head and then proceeded to pour champagne on myself that they finally escorted him out. Shame on you for not taking control of the situation sooner all because this man was clearly spending a lot of money. What did you think would happen after you served him all that liquor? When I made a statement that I thought it was bs to serve him that much liquor after he was visibly, belligerently drunk the manager stated they diluted the second bottle with water but my clothes and hair definitely don't smell like it. This man was outside the front puking his brains out. Straight liquid from all the liquor they allowed him to consume. Be more responsible. Know when to say enough is enough to ppl especially when they are in that state.

oD-pHR-W2LxqG4EyncfNcQ.text: I can't .... where do I start..... it's not Texas de Brazil ....  the service was horrible. It's like we didn't exist!  The bread was brought out late  The bananas could have been dessert with how late they were brought out. I get that it's a meat to plate restaurant but the waiters never came back.  The food was only ... ok  The price was ridiculous for the flavor of meat.  The picahna was not the best meat.... how is that possible.... how can you make the "house speciality" worse the. The sirloin? I will not go back

9-w-HAT5qvJygqbICA4qug.text: First-time experience very disappointed. Ambiance was nice we got seated right away we had no reservation the waitress was nice told us about the menu and what they served we went to the salad bar we all were pleased. A waiter was mixing drinks on a cart my friend ordered one it was good. We had our plates replaced then the meat started coming we were a little overwhelmed because we couldn't finish one without someone else coming with more meat in less then 5 minutes my plate was full of meat and couldn't tell what most of it was. If you decide to spend $55 on the experience I recommend flipping your card and finishing each coarse. I asked my wife and my 2 friends that came with what percentage would they say they liked of all the items we tried it was 50%.. my disappointment was the rush of trying to have everything hot and our waitress came by and said we had to try some of their sauce which her timing was late already seeing we had tried most and where getting full. She never came back until we where done our plates where never changed out put once after salad bar and our water was out for over an hour. We expressed our dissatisfaction and she tried to give us every desert they had. My first impression for all of us was well we dont need to ever go their again $255 a full belly but it wasn't very enjoyable experience.

7sLNLtiBreT5EFFdg13H2g.text: We were in town from San Clemente, California. The food was so good! One of our servers, Angelica, was especially helpful to us. Very attentive and seemed to love her job. She is even from Brazil! We enjoyed the special attention she gave us even though it was a busy night there. We will be sure to come back again and be seated in Angelica's area!

59kHiWF8IKGfg6IThN3reg.text: Love this place  Last time we came over they were out of a lot of things  But the food is still good  The service is amazing  The drinks are the best  Clean fun and nice atmosphere Prices are not too bad  Just need to make sure you coming ready to eat a lot

ruMOCh7FkORyED0kYdsRYw.text: Went for lunch with the whole family, including a 4-year-old, and everyone was so nice, efficient, and helpful. Norma was super friendly and so sweet with the kiddo. The entire staff was great, and they worked so well as a team. I wish I could remember all their names so I could give everyone a shout out. My mom mentioned she liked lamb, it appeared almost immediately. I asked about the beef rib, someone brought some for the table. My dad's pen wasn't working, a server overheard and handed him one. It was almost magical. I've been there for dinner before, and the price is tough to justify, but the lunch was 2/3 the price and 100% of the experience. I would recommend going for dinner for a really special occasion, but if you ask me, lunch is worth it any day! All the stars!

b9OKtg65tlti5Q3GPJjVlw.text: This place is really good but for the price of 1 you can drive to mesa and to to Rodizio Grill what is the exact same thing and it's half the price per person and a way bigger and better salad bar this place is really good I've been to multiple Brazilian barbecue places throughout the country I just don't understand how Fogo de Chao Travis I want $60 per person charge you for every drink that you drink

zl2XVWcUQW1UOs8DRrrMHg.text: I don't even know where to begin. But just absolutely amazing and delicious. From their cheese bread rolls to their mashed potatoes and to their delicious selection of meats. I definitely recommend this place! It is expensive, for two people it's around $120 but it's totally worth it. We use this restaurant as a special occasion place to go. Which is now considered tradition on our anniversaries And we love it!

cSqvBmDhxBfJk5oyWkZ1TQ.text: Disappointing: spent good money for dinner in a cafeteria, country buffet type setting. The food at our resort was far better than what we ate at FOGO. The food was good, especially the Picanha but NOT worth the price tag. The atmosphere leaves everything to be desired. They were passing out 4oz cocktails...later found out they carried a premium price. Usually when you pay $60 a plate for food the setting is more romantic and the wait staff doesn't spill cocktails on you.

_-HE1S-V3j9SGNVd64XvcA.text: Was there Saturday night for our anniversary.  I have to say "mediocre".  Some of the meat was very dry.  Had a hard time getting the meat guys to make it back to edge of the room.  The black bean soup was gone. Was told they would bring some to my table.  That never happen. The lamb shank was tough. The lamb steak was good. All the beef except for the Ribeye was dry   Had to ask for it because it never made it back to us. Out waiter staff was top notch. But for the price.  We will not be back.

9JWhddUhO89CAqeMpPANhg.text: We celebrated a graduation here and everything was fantastic. Wonderful food and service. The wait staff is very attentive and the variety of meats are delicious. The salad bar has a assortment of salads, meats, cheeses, and soup, rice, and beans.

Swsxkp0ygWlSXXvrRt1g8g.text: My friends and I recently hosted a birthday party at Fogo in Scottsdale. The entire experience was amazing. We had the Wine Room which was the perfect ambiance to celebrate a special occasion. The food was delicious and the service was top notch! Special thank you to Joao, Marco, Danielle, Norma and the entire Fogo team for making our guests feel like VIP's! I would highly recommend Fogo Scottsdale for your next celebration, meeting or family dinner. Thank you again! We will be back soon!

BQSuTq8eAm2wESN-ulbPpA.text: So damn delicious!!!!!!!! Very nice place to have a good dinner at. Looks great inside and the staff is very organized. Everyone was very polite and attended you immediately. Never waiting too long for new meats to come to our table. Although my husband and I ate waaaaaay too much, it was an amazing experience overall (:

sbQIAeN9qYzfcx19jnHAGQ.text: I'll get to the point. Hostess: didn't look happy and never smiled once and couldn't find my reservation. Service: was seated at the back of the restaurant for a party of 8. took 15 min before we had to flag a server down to explain how we're suppose to start eating and took our drink orders. this really pissed me off, but after we got their attention, everything caught up to speed and we went and got our salads and the meats started coming around fast.  Food: the bread they give you is so so soo delicious, warm, soft, and sweet. their salad bar has a good selection of veggies as cheeses and other yummy sides. the meats were so tender and juicy and very flavorful. I wasn't too big of a fan of the chicken cuts, but the prime rib, lamb, house sirloin, and garlic beef were amazing. if you love meat, this is definitely a place for you. we were there to celebrate two birthdays and the server was very generous and allowed the two birthday girls to pick any dessert on the house AND allowed the other 6 people in the party choose between three different types of dessert, so everyone got a slice of cheesecake which was fluffy and delicious.

qxtcaPcgm0FZ3eGyXKpSDQ.text: My service really bothered me.  The man that seated us was uninterested, despite telling him it was my first time (on my bday), and made us feel like we were being rushed.  Without giving us more than 6 minutes he asked us for our drink orders 3 times.  Huge wine selection, poor beer selection.  Waiter also handed me the receipt to sign and walked off without even looking at me.  Not a good first impression.  The food was excellent, came quickly and tasted great.  The salad bar was also delicious with a large variety for my wife, who was not eating meat.  I will go back, but my service will hopefully improve.  I like it when people act like they care I'm there.

DtHTXTdS7id2trv1WB182A.text: Consistently good quality of steaks only one waitress was rude but the other staffs including manager showed very exceptional service.

czap3a9zxehORshmbC12jA.text: When coming in for lunch the waiter explained the service perfectly. We ate off the salad bar and were very satisfied. When it came to the meat experience we were able to taste the amazing flavors of the country. My only compliant is that we asked to try a couple of the other meats that were listed and it took two or three tries before they came out with it. At one time we asked for more bananas four times before we were given more and then 5 plates came out! So their wait staff is a bit off on requests, beyond that it was superb!

5NgeVYohsGEsb3R8CMTlfQ.text: Let me tell you about the best steak I've ever had. Now keep in mind, I've been to six continents, and I've eaten steak in every one. In France, I had steak, in Japan, I had steak, on the border between Belize and Columbia, I've had steak, days before Arab spring's debut in Egypt, I had steak. Of course, the sense of adventure has always been a major factor in my favourite steaks, and this small town in Arizona doesn't have much to offer in the way of adventure, but they did have steak, so naturally I had steak. The steak here was so good that it surpassed every other steak I'd ever eaten, my tiny mind was vaporised the very instant the steak touched my taste buds, each aspect of the steak's decadent being danced on my tongue. The texture, the flavour, the juiciness, all kicked in with just the right amount of force. I was in heaven for a brief moment. This steak is a gift to mankind, and should be treated as such, a steak identical to this one should be displayed in a museum, monuments should be erected just to honour this very steak. I cannot begin to stress how amazing it was, and what your witnessing is just a tiny portion of my emotions toward this steak. Otherwise the service was good, and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. I would marry that steak if I could. That is all. -Merrick.

atr2A20Dm5P1L9zL5QjdTA.text: We came here for my birthday and I've got to say, we were a bit disappointed. I'm surprised by the high ratings. It's not that it was bad but it wasn't great either. The staff was friendly for the most part except for the first guy who came to offer meat. I had never been here and didn't know the tiny fork to my right was to hold the meat while he cut. So the first guy cut the meat and let it fall onto my plate and it almost hit my chest and my white top so that was a surprise. After the meat fell to the plate he told me to use the little fork next time....Mm-k-thanks. A lot of the meats were actually very dry and tasteless, only a couple were moist and flavorful. We loved the side dishes they brought by though, those were delicious. I couldn't get enough of the plantains. Their salad bar was pretty decent but there could have been more options. They were supposed to bring out a happy birthday dessert but no one ever showed up with it and my boyfriend wanted it to be a surprise so he didn't want to have to remind someone in front of me. We didn't want to be late to the comedy club so we left without getting it. Service was quite slow too, especially when we were done and needed to pay. We were on a time crunch so it got a little frustrating. Overall this place was ok but for the price you pay I would expect all the meats to be moist and full of flavor. I love the concept and it's a really fun idea but for that price I don't know that we'd be back. Maybe if we found a discount or coupon somewhere.

26swdc6MdNmDArFabW5LEA.text: We went here tonight for my anniversary. It was great. Service was great food was fantastic. I did not have time to print the free dessert coupon and it states very clearly it needs to be printed and they still honored it. I loved the lamb chops most they were perfectly seasoned and came right off the bone. The drinks at the table were also great.

DPN3kjpKmKf6zojxCCTL4Q.text: This started as a 3 paragraph review of the restaurant, but I wanted to just review what our experience was for the night we went. We went on Valentines day and it was very crowded. There was a line out the door and down the sidewalk for everyone, reservations or not. I verified that they were accepting walk-ins and indeed they were. Had there not been a line for people with reservations, I don't think this would have been a big deal.  The salad bar, gauchos, and meats were amazing, but the level of service and execution for this nights event left a lot to be desired. With 2 full meal services and 8 drinks, the total with tip came out to about $240. At $11-12 a drink, and having only seen our waiter 3 times over the 2 hours we were there, this was grossly disproportionate in expectation.   Fogo had sent out a promotional email on the 8th offering a meal comp for making reservations for Valentines (14th-16th). In retrospect I should have avoided this window of opportunity and went any other time. Our prior visit to Fogo was exceptional, without question. But between the reservations line, poor landscaping in front of the building, being crammed in like sardines, the screaming kids, and the diner behind our table coughing on one of the Gauchos meat skewers, this was just extra icing on a less than stellar cake.   I wanted this to be at least a 3 if not 4 star review, but service and execution really made this a let down, experience wise. With that, I'm right back to where I started an hour ago. Still 3 paragraphs.

HYPxN9ErROHzFJKP755Keg.text: Norma was the best. The food was great.we had sooooo much meat my tummy exploded. In a good way.

c67f9wk6GZg199b4XXLtFw.text: Everything I have to say about Fogo de Chao, in Scottsdale is 100% amazing! I have been to 4 different Fogo chains. This one is by far the best. The service, impeccable. The food, perfect and consistent. The price... Who cares?!?!!  I have been to this location close to 20 times and every time, Pure Gold!!!

CmLZs7yhy5nR-XjUE7skcA.text: Being married to a meat and potatoes kinda guy, I thought booking dinner for Valentine's Day at Fogo de Chao would be a huge treat.  It turned out to be a huge disappointment.  We went last night and will never go back.  We were seated promptly, way in a back corner...about as far from the salad bar as you can get.  This place is packed with tables.  You literally have to stand and wait as servers and other customers weave through the tables.  I found it strange that staff didn't let customers pass first - they blew by customers as if we didn't exist.    We were seated and got the lowdown on how it all worked.  We were excited to be there and dig into the amazing salad bar and try the different meat choices.  Our trip to the salad bar was chaotic.  The line was going every which way and people were reaching over each other to get to the different selections. Everything on the salad bar was fresh, the presentation was nice but what a hassle!  We were given some rolls which were odd.  Soft, undercooked dough filled with some sort of cheese.  I can eat some bread, but the texture of this stuff was just not right.  The meat...honestly, I'm not much of a carnivore, but even my husband was far from impressed.  All of it was dry and so salty that we were reaching for our water glasses constantly.  The service was what was really odd.  The skewer guys would show up in our section in such a rush that they missed our table (and others) most of the time.  You have to wave them down or ask passing busboys to get service.  By the time the pork ribs and rib eye came around (after my husband spoke to our server about the lack of service) all of the sides were cold and we were just over it and full from the massive amount of water we had to drink.  We are not tough to please people.  We don't do pricey restaurants often and were really looking forward to having a fun experience at Fogo.  I regret booking our Valentines dinner at this strange, silly place.  Should have gone with my first instinct and headed to Durant's for  tried and True great food and perfect service.  Live and learn.

1wR4SxAS1n1mgFh1Au9xHA.text: The food here was delicious, the service was good.  It was nice to go out with my sister, husband and brother in law.  What wasn't nice was having full glasses spilled down my husband's back.  While he was being his usual polite self, unlike most of the Scottsdale clientele usually would be, that doesn't mean that it was actually okay.    Had he NOT had things spilled on him, I would have been able to rate the service as impeccable as the food, though the Nouveau riche clientele were generally rude (yea I'm talking to you guy who tried to just jump in front of us at the hostess stand, AND the girl who couldn't WAIT to get at that asparagus - which was HUGE and delicious).  Unfortunately, while the staff and managers were all apologetic and asked if we were okay, that was all that happened.    We've never had drinks spilled on us at Fogo E Brasa, and the atmosphere is much more friendly. Their fashion of letting the staff know you would like more (or no) meat at any one time is much easier on the staff.  While the food is excellent, and most of the service good, I was disappointed there wasn't more done for a table that was having their first experience and got to deal with enough drink to require a mop and new chair. We also had several times when our cards were green and the staff wandered around us, without stopping by. We didn't get a chance to try everything.  So, I guess we're sticking with Fogo E Brasa. (Which is I guess now Brazilian Bull)  UPDATE: even after posting here and to their Facebook page, it's obvious they don't care.  Rodizio Grill ftw.

D3e4bleer9G6cbGfA0VJxQ.text: I really love the fact of the unlimited variety of meat you can eat and the salad bar. Great big atmosphere.  I enjoy it every time I go there.

Dne_wbjfcZycmsugvmU_2g.text: I lived in Brazil and love coming back to eat some quality food.  It is super expensive, but the quality and service is very good.

l4SZWn71ROouReuec_IylQ.text: Honestly was a less then par experience but the service was so amazing they can't get less then 5 stars. They offer good meat selection, have good choices in salad bar but was not completely pleased with flavors of meat. When paying my bill, Lou Di Nolfi came and saw I didn't look completely satisfied. I explained I thought the service was excellent as was the wine but it didn't taste as good as meals id had before. He was awesome, he probably in that moment raised what would have been a 3 to a 5 star. I wish I had guys like him working for my company and it seemed the entire staff there was on point. He assured me maybe the kitchen had been slightly off and I believed him. Would recommend

wnsHsmC4uIh2WpAQhAtpIw.text: This place speaks for itself. What meat-eater doesn't love a Brazilian Steakhouse? I do have to say though - this place could be loved by the vegetarians in your life, too. Their salad bar is spectacular. It's not your run of the mill salad bar. They have specialty salads, grilled vegetables, soups, Italian meats and cheeses, etc. You can actually go and only order the salad bar for half price. I'll likely opt to do this next time. The reason I say that is because I went pregnant and getting a well done piece of meat out of these guys is not easy. I totally understand that beef is MUCH better served medium or so, but ladies don't have that option when they're pregnant. That's the only reason I knocked a star off for them. They kept telling me they would bring me well-done cuts, but I only got one out of about 5. They do come around with chicken, pork, etc, but I was most interested in the beef. Will we be back? Of course. It's not a place we will visit often, but it's a fun experience.

g5cKXltFQT9w-s0COZAsxA.text: I love, love this place! The salad bar is so good and so is all the meat! All you can eat.  The bread, the sides! If you have not eaten here, I highly recommend it. The food is amazing, especially if you love meat! I gave them four stars because the bar drinks are a little too pricey in my opinion, but other than that, the dinner is so worth it!! Great place for a dinner date.

xFbBXYudZZlHlcpHu0MAiw.text: I took my family here for my sister's going away trip as she was moving out of state for a new job.   There was a decent amount of parking here. The front of the place is pretty open with a turn...I think during the weekends, they probably have valet here.   The inside is very spacious and is pretty good for group celebrations of a romantic dinner. There is a bar area to the side that seems pretty quiet and cozy for those intimate dinners.  They have quite a lot of wine in their selection. Walking in, you can see their wine gallery.   What can I say about their food. It is delicious. There is a lot of it. There is also a salad bar and it's pretty good but let's be honest here...you didn't come here for salad. I ate a lot of the filet mignon. It was good. There was lamb, delicious. I don't think I can say anything bad about this place at all. The service was fast.  The pricing...well, you're in a brazillian steak house in Scottsdale so, yeah.   I would come back here again but I wouldn't make it a usual stop. I could get a coronary with all the yellow gold flowing through my veins already.

xty97-gP8T2M3klnNwCdmA.text: Terrible experience and food! Our server was terrible!!! He barely attended to us. I go to the one in Beverly Hills all the time and the quality of neat there and the cook tastes way different. This particular Fogo couldn't even get the cheese breads correctly.

ko097bKBcdEdL4-uHaxnxg.text: I wasn't so impressed with the food and the ambiance for the price they charge. Our tablecloth was already dirty when we sat down for the 1st time. There was fallen meat around our table. It was kinda gross for a restaurant that plays off "high end." Try it once and if you don't like it, don't have to go back again right? That'll be me.

gbF7ydnajZk1QT8iIjFFLg.text: I had my husband take me here for my birthday and let me tell you it was such an amazing experience. My waiter Vince gave me the best customer service you could ever want, the kitchen was absolutely phenomenal and the food was great. I had the molten chocolate cake for dessert with ice cream and it was so flavorful. The drinks were very strong but they were great too . It's a little pricey but well worth it.

1aLbwqM9WwT6LsYjnjIUCg.text: We were the last customer on the day, and it was very close to the closing time (it was 9 PM, not 10 PM). All the staff were very kind and generous though, and the food was good. There was not much choice at the salad bar, but meat coming endlessly was very good.  If you want to devour some meat someday, I am sure that you will not regret!

sNivgKZR6Dbr9TtIjCnXqw.text: Having my party here of over 100 ppl. My mother and I came in to eat dinner to get a feel! Well what must I say? I absolutely loved it. I have on every state in America, all through Europe, Mexico, PR, Saint Thomas and Peru! I've traveled and I loved it! I'm so excited for my party! This is the most perfect place! :) The meats were all so delicious and tender! The buffet was tasteful! And I felt great the whole time!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love this place!!!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

UT8RNYBNT4i82YR0cUhu3A.text: One of my favorite restaurants in the valley. Good price for quality of food. Waiters are always nice, service in dining room is always good. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because no matter your reservation you always end up waiting for your table anyway. Otherwise food is great

1GocYwuhSXeImOsApDQB3w.text: Have been to a number of Brazilian Steakhouses and this one wins!  Salad bar was plentiful and the meat, OH THE MEAT... Fantastic.  Food was amazing enough to overlook the fact that we did not have a specific served.
