Good they work as a team, but made it a bit difficult for drink refills, etc.  Not a huge deal, just a little strange to not have a single point-person to look to for drinks, the bill, etc.

X5jqTEodHXU6dfeuZsAMrw.text: We've been going to Fogo for several years now. We loved this place. Celebrated almost every anniversary, birthday, special occasion and often went just for the heck of it. It was our favorite place to eat.  We did notice a change recently.  We came about 2 months ago for lunch, they were hosting a rather large office gathering in the back room. Other than the party, there were only 3 tables occupied with guests at the time.  Normally, we are greeted by the same lady at the counter, who would ask if we had a reservation, and then seat us. Waiters would usually be bustling all around, putting the side items on the table, offering plates, asking about drinks.  The service was very lacking. We waited 10 min before someone came and took our drink order. We got our own plates. T here were almost no meat servers.  We were offered chicken legs and sausage several times, but did not see any of the beef selections. We eventually asked a passing waiter if we could have someone bring some specific meats.  Several minutes later a man came out with some rib-eye, and offered it to us. We gratefully took it, as that is what we came here to eat.  It was a disappointment. It was very over-cooked and mushed apart.  Another came behind him offering pork ribs.  We took some of the ribs, they were so dry they were almost crunchy, inedible.  We finally took a portion of some sirloin and that was decent enough.   We also noticed they changed some things about the salad bar area. They had removed the big cheese wheel and cheese/meats from the end area and moved the cured meats over to the side, we did not see any cheeses except for the mozzarella. They also did not have the bacon curls, roasted garlic, green olives and a couple other items. I was a bit disappointed, since those were my favorite tidbits to grab. They also changed the recipe of some items, like the potato salad. The new recipe is just not the same. No one ever came and refilled our drinks or gave us clean plates.  We ended up leaving early, sadly disappointed.   Today, we happened to be on the east side of town and decided to go to Fogo again.  We left much quicker this time, probably 30 min or less after arriving.  They have completely changed the 'business model'.  The menu changed, offering the 'full experience' or an ala carte type pick and choose. They increased the price and sadly the service was almost worse than the last time.   It appears they have drastically changed the wait staff as well.  I didn't get ice in my water, when I asked to have some ice, the person looked confused and walked off, never got the ice. I usually get the Guarana soda as well, one of the waiters tried to pour iced tea it it. Then another server took the can off the table, tried pouring the rest of the can in the already filled glass and left with the can still having some of the drink left in it, without explanation or permission to touch my drink.  We noticed also that the meat servers purposely brought meats out very slowly and waiting several minutes in between bringing out the meat choices, which, drove people to go to the lesser expensive salad bar. Obviously more cost effective for Fogo. But not what people come there to eat.  The side dishes that came with the meal are now served in little plastic black bowls and less of it.  We sat and watched as server after server walked by us and never once offered meats, they would head to one specific table, then go in the back. They would not come back out for many minutes and always to a specific table. We again had to stop several waiters and ask to have meat brought to us.  Now, it's not unusual to ask a server for a specific meat you like, but to feel like you have to ask just to be served is not good.  My husband was so disappointed that he said he was done and just wanted to leave. He only ended up with having 2 meats served to him, beef ribs and ribeye.  We waited almost 20 min for someone to bring out the Picanha, which is my favorite. We left right after that.   We likely will not be going back.   Such a disappointment too. We loved this place and have so many good memories. The first time we went several years ago on our anniversary, they gave us the mud pie for free and congratulated us. And it was a wonderful experience every time we went, until now.  We hope it gets better, because we truly did love going there. Really disappointing.

C1xsxChhdvofyfYi3W5J5A.text: This place is good but it loses points for being stupid and not leaving something on their voicemail when they won't be open for short periods of time. Wasted time for my moms birthday by driving all the way out here only to be disappointed.

l2OmBSn8Yb2c_nVkXLUdhw.text: Very bad experience, so bad that didn't even have the chance to try the food. Made a reservation for February 15 for my sis birthday. Got confirmation email for the reservation at 2pm. Got there 5 minutes late nevertheless our surprise the place closed at 2pm, ask the staff what was going on since we had reservation. Staff called manager and he was rude telling us that it was our fault because we were late. 5 minutes really? And the place had closed at 2pm anyway. Very disappointed with the service, especially being at high end location. If there were a minus five star I would give them that.

iXB1AXh2AUbon1BJXcAxfQ.text: This was our first visit here. We were invited to dinner by our friends who are Brazilian and wanted us to try authentic Brazilian food. We were told to come hungry. All I have to say was I was not disappointed. Soooo many food choices and they were equally delicious. My absolute favorite was the filet. Dessert was equally delicious. It was an amazing experience. Can't wait to go back again.

p5eBca2n0tVnBZ5GQOL0ww.text: Awesome food. Price is really reasonable for quality that they offer. They have a salad bar with veggies and fish. They offer almost every possible meat cut available.

FK-dgjDor5F3lETZZEuPBg.text: This place is great! i loved the service!! I just didn't like the overcrowding where you sit. I found it extremely hard to get to the salad buffet from my table while the servers are everywhere giving pieces of meat. I almost always ran into one of them and if not them the the other diners lol! I also didn't like how it is super loud and a little bit overwhelming. Other than that the food and the service were great!!!!!

xxLXlWDTzALy95jN8q8YXw.text: My girlfriend and I had been talking about going here for months, just had never found the time to make it out.  Last night, I took her and her parents out to dinner here to celebrate her birthday.  Needless to say, this place did not disappoint in the least.  If I had anything to complain about, it didn't have anything to do with the restaurant, staff, food or experience.  It had to do with the fact that their meats were so good that I kept wanting more and more to the point where I should've stopped eating 20-30 minutes previous to when I actually did.  My favorites were the Garlic Filet Mignon, Parmesean crusted pork and the Linguisa.  The polenta was cooked to perfection and loved the caramelized bananas they delivered as side dishes.  Everyone got a dessert and loved it.  Since we were celebrating my girlfriend's birthday, they decorated the plate with her dessert with "Happy Birthday".  This is definitely on our list of special occasion dinner restaurants along with some others.  Will definitely go back again.

2-CWhCd3a-O94koMoaWE8A.text: The perfect choice for a great dining experience.  Made a 7:30 reservation on a Friday night and we got there early and got seated right away. Salad bar was a great start and even had fresh haddock. Then on to the main course. My wife and I have been to these types of high end steak places and the best tip I can give you is hold out for the meat choice you really want. We love filet mignon and the bacon wrapped chicken, but it all tastes great... As it should for $50 per person.

9IQn94KOO4-k2swFGYZxWQ.text: Basically a glorified all you can eat buffet. I think they try to overwhelm you with so much food so that you don't realize that it's all pretty mediocre.  Zero ambiance.  Hope you like meat.

4Y99NxLpJXWBdUKxY-rK6g.text: I dont know, I just wasn't impressed. It is an ungodly amount of food. You turn a card over to green when you want meat and these guys come by and slice a little, tiny sliver of all kinds of meat. I tried the parmesan pork, bacon wrapped filet, sirloin, pork ribs, beef ribs, chicken and lamb. There's a great salad bar you can go to that has a ton of things on it as well. They bring out a side of mashed potatoes but ours were cold. There were bananas in a cinnamon type sauce, rolls and a cornbread type of thing as well. There were 14 of us and 1 guy (Christopher) told the other side of the table what the deal was but he didnt come to our side so we were just unaware of how things worked. Adam was basically our server and was super efficient and fun. It was my moms 70th bday and he brought her cheesecake and it was delicious. My sister was at the other end of the table and a guy came by and said he was the customer service manager and asked how everything was. She told him that our table was totally out of sync. While we were on dessert, they were just getting some meat so he comped 2 desserts and that was nice. There were so many people constantly at our table, which is great except that there wasn't anyone in control of the table so when my niece asked for more rolls, someone said yes and never came back. That type of thing happened a lot.  Overall, the food was good and our server Adam was cool but the table as a whole had completely different experiences.

WFBjnzwAznUQo3OgcI3zYA.text: This place does not disappoint.  Make sure you come hungry.  The service and selection are amazing.  They serve as a team so you never have to wait to ask anyone for anything.  It does not matter who is walking by.  Should you need something anyone will bring it to you.  Including any cuts of meat you want to visit again or haven't tried.  Great for a date or company party.  We have done both and were very happy.  This place will always be a crowd pleaser; if you have company from out of town they will not be let down.  I highly recommend the Sangria.  It is made from scratch.

gTdvKX3tmA24j3aUHYPv2g.text: Went here for a work function today. What can I say, this place is awesome! A great variety of meats all cooked to perfection. My favorite was the bacon wrapped filet, yum!  Nice salad bar with good variety as well, instead of bacon bits, they have a bowl full of uncrumbled bacon.  Lastly a slice of cheesecake with strawberries, mmm.  Simply awesome stuff! Taking the wife when I can.

SgJ2FBdR_vnUzilWG8FNAw.text: If you want the meat to keep coming all night, then this is the place for you ;)  I couldn't handle it all, I ended up taking a bite of everything so I could try it all, but ended up wasting a lot of meat.  The cheese rolls are to die for.

ZAdftuu2nv7dZzyGSN8nZQ.text: Amazing food as always, lamb was my favorite, market place always rich and fresh, Lu took good care of us and gave me a free desert for my birthday and great service, a must have if you're around for good food!

nCJeo-SsXxGAccAgrcZN9A.text: Good luck finding out how much the meal cost until you get the bill. So its $50 per person but its worth the price. You can basically stuff yourself until your pants button shoots off like those subway commercials. I would love to come back if I was ever in Scottsdale again.

utgEj5eWbn60RliOWZPvaw.text: We had a great time. I love proper service and I can't say enough about how pleased I am. Every server was happy, polite and very friendly. The salad bar was great. There was a bowl of very dry bacon, how can you not be happy with this. All the salads I tried were top notch. Sliced cheese and meats were great. Don't go crazy there, the meats being served table side are delicious. The sirloins and ribeye were my favorites. Grilled bananas were one of the sides and I loved those. Desert was a chocolate mouse cake, devine. I will be there again!

-bk4LtInTS0QvGC-MU80EA.text: Sunday dinner with family and friends was amazing.  We enjoyed the entire dining experience. The salad bar was great, the meat caravan was delicious and the tres leche cake was yum yum good. It"s a must when you"re in the Phoenix metro area.

hWAPv1dhQ07hgdk59DKnXw.text: We read Yelp reviews saying don't eat much from the salad bar, but didn't listen! Was too full 1/2 through to try all the meat. It's good stuff though. I suggest you not take the first slice of meat off a new steak unless you like a ton of salt. Our favs were the caramelized bananas and red potatoes from the salad bar.

SenYUJBJBPkweDAJ7oJQmA.text: VERY Disappointing Experience! Been to several Fogos across the country and have always been pleased. Been to this one before and was also pleased THAT LAST TIME!!! - NEVER AGAIN!!!  The greatest difference I saw on my recent visit, was that they are cramming more seats in the space than should be. In fact, it may even be at over capacity for safety... I KNOW it's over capacity for decent SERVICE!  We were seated for our 7pm reservation, promptly; however we had to weave our way through the many too close tables to get to ours, which was right next to a server station... Not a problem,,, this will insure good service!  ...NOT!!!  We were greeted quickly, and our two guests had the "how it works" info presented... when we saw a slight break in the masses, we began at the salad bar. While I don't like the serve yourself experience, it is a great starter/first course buffet, with interesting selections. HOWEVER... bring your pads and helmets!! The masses attack!!!  Within seconds, the waaaaay too many tables of hungry customers attack the line... pushing, invading your space, reaching in front of you to get their asparagus, dressing, etc. It's NOT a pleasant experience, ESPECIALLY, when you're paying high dollars for a dining experience!  The customer etiquette is not the restaurant's fault; however, packing too many people in... IS!!  They are putting their short term profits in front of their customer's experience!  It's NOT going to work... for the longterm!  In addition, the server's rushing and bumbling pace was stressful and exhausting! Again, they were all rushing around to try to meet the needs of the waaaaaay too many tables crammed into the space.  After our First course, we flipped the coaster to GO. Other visits, the many server/chefs come to carve off some delectable meats. This time, we have only 3 or 4 visit our table... the meats were great, but where was the chicken, the prime rib, the sirloin, the lamb.. It wasn't until later we realized we hadn't had many selections.  After we had finished... we waited....and waited... and waited for a simple "how was your meal?" Or... "would you care for any desert?" Or... a "can I get you anything else?" or even an acknowledgement that we even existed!   I finally stopped a "blue shirt" (manager wannabe?) rushing by... told him that we were feeling ignored and that "no one would talk to us".  His response: "I'll talk to you... What do you want to talk about... The weather?"  Normally I would have kicked his ass with this smart assed remark; however, it took me by surprise! I was stunned, embarrassed  and speechless! Our guests asked for coffee and he ran off... never to be seen again. Coffee showed by someone else and we asked for our bill and left.  Again... Food excellent... Atmosphere is LOUD and CRAMPED... Service sucks and the "blue shirt", manager wannabe, needs his ass kicked!   NOT going back and recommend that you don't until they start putting their customer's experience in front of their rush - rush, pack  'em in and move 'em out" attitude.

N7-DLrb5tsu249M0NOhP4Q.text: This place is the best. They really set the bar. Food and service are amazing. Yes it's costly but you need to do it! Loved every bite!

jVoFRifes4KLjP9TpCWbMg.text: Amazing meat, and fun atmosphere! I loved how you can just flip a card over and then you are just flooooded with people giving you different delicious meats in your face. Had our business Christmas dinner here, back in December and it was perfect. The sides were also amazing (mashed potatoes - YUM!) Definitely give this place a try if you have room to stretch your stomach.

7nrC2FAPlDpsse5V_3x-Iw.text: YUMMMMMMM. All you can eat quality meat?! This steakhouse is great, I can never go to Fogo without leaving and feeling so full that I can barely walk.

lbZVQB5jG4i_95fBMYhHhg.text: WOW! Rule #1: come hungry.  Actually....come starving.  You may want to avoid eating at all before coming to this place.  So much food....so much food.   You walk in and you just see the wait staff running around at lightining speed getting the food and drinks to their respective table.  When they disperse, they open up a path to this magical salad bar with some really great cheeses, veggies, and some type of raw fish (similar to sushi or maybe it was), but it was really good.    HOW IT WORKS: Salad Bar, Meats, Dessert (service continued or halted by red or green indicator that you have on your table)   You sit down with a "button" that is similar to a circular cup coaster.  One side is red and the other green.  You want that button to be on green when you sit down.   That will trigger wait staff to come by and bring you A TON of different meat varieties.    They brought out lamb, different types of steaks in different seasonings, and ask you if you have any special meat requests if you want to try something in particular or want  another sample of something you've already had.   They bring it on a stick and carve off the section you want depending on how you want the meat cooked.   Along with that, they will be bringing out bread rolls with CHEESE in them! HOLY WOW!  of course - they have the garlic mashed potatoes on standby.      The DESSERT was nice!  a Chocolate Mousse cake that I barely had room for.     EXPECT the meal to START at $50 but I would go in ready for a lot more than that due to drinks that you may want to get, people with you, etc.     Fellas...If your girl has been good to you - treat her to a nice dinner.  She deserves it. Vice versa too, please.  Hunger is not prejudice.

03o3itDJHWS8jo3qOWue6A.text: What's that you say? A VEGAN going to a Brazilian Steakhouse? How can this be?   Two Words: SALAD BAR!   Set in a Fine Dining Atmosphere Fogo De Chao offers a Pristine Salad Bar fit for a Vegan Queen. Choices like Brazilian Hearts of Palm, Whole Shitake Mushrooms, Jumbo Asparagus, Whole Artichoke Hearts, Sun Dried Tomatoes, Butter Lettuce and the list goes on and on.   Some of the traditional side dishes are also vegan safe like the fried bananas and also the fried polenta with no cheese. Both are very delicious!   Trust me you wont leave hungry. I've been twice now and would gladly dine here again anytime!  P.S.  The staff was incredible, our service was flawless and, we were completely taken care of every second of our visit.

rE8UAuub1XADW-v53-uHOQ.text: The service was great, i didnt have to ask for anything they anticipated our needs and they were there in a snap. great food, good ambiance :)

SOLawpGRPMKVy0BvWZDfng.text: Stay away from this place!  I have photos on my iPhone of this place crowded with people and not a meat server (carver) to be seen.  I went and talked to the manager in the middle of our meal.  I said, "Look at this room.  Do you see any meat servers in this restaurant?"  He said, "No, I don't."   This restaurant doesn't really serve meat.  They just pretend too evidently.  It was so hard to get any meat out of the carvers.  I asked three of them for medium well, and they said they would come back with some.  I never saw them again.   The people who work here are rude, uncaring, and evidently not paid well.  Everyone seems in a bad mood.  I must not be the only one complaining about this rip-off.

ak3lOR5ogzhL0EHJbncuBg.text: Thanks for the four pounds my fat ass gained last night!  BUT I WOULD DO IT AGAIN. WE LOVE THIS PLACE. Service outstanding. Food great. And the creme brulee f'ing fantastic!

wnvA_cE2_Xw__72K3m8Ukw.text: Love.  This.  Place.  It is not cheap and I'm pretty sure I had a mild heart attack from all the fat and sodium I ingested; but oh so worth it.  Not the best cuts of meat and some pieces are a bit fatty but this is pretty much a meat lovers paradise.  I went here as part of a ginormous 30-person party and everything went pretty smoothly considering our group's size.  The staff was very professional and tried to keep everything straight even though things got a little bit hectic.  Can't wait to return.

6mcyrkAbnk1b2i0lSoOUZA.text: Dined here tonight with friends. Having never been here before weren't sure what to expect but the awesome salad bar, all you can eat hand carved meats and desserts were delicious. The bacon wrapped chicken and the filet migon were my favorites but everything was good. The bill at $320, for 4 people all you can eat including wines, good deal.

OpeNrDmQ3sTVqF9TrNBl7w.text: Went to Fogo de Chao for the first time with a group of 13! They were very accommodating! The service was great and the meats just kept on coming! The Parmesan crusted pork was a favorite. The fresh salads and sides  etc. were all wonderful and many drink specials to choose from.

_6zXi2X-HFlBQqjds4E8Bg.text: This is one of my favorite places to dine at I always get great service the salad bar is awesome I always have to take it easy because I don't want to get full off the salad :-) and the steak is overwhelmingly good there's so many choices never disappointing. This last time was particularly great I love it when a manager comes over, he had asked what we thought about there spicy chile and we said well its not "that" spicy, he offered us some green chilies and onions (they are not on the menu) phenomenal delicious my husband couldn't get over how good they tasted a great end to a hard week of work .

z04W_p1g4H6w6GqCt80tpQ.text: I never Yelp and literally had to!  I'm in the industry and am completely embarrassed for the owner's of this establishment.  A party of 7 and it took 30 min to get a drink ordered... We finally get our drinks and take it upon ourselves to start our dinner service...so sad for this restaurant because we had 3 newbies that did not experience what they should have.  We helped ourselves to the salad bar and sat back down at the table.  A server came over asked us if we ordered wine (wine glasses on table) and says to the server as he is bringing (20 min long bottle of wine) "sorry I'm bored."  Uhh?  As we are enjoying salad, someone brings us artichoke spinach dip- my thought? I never received a menu to order that in the first place.  We wanted rare cuts of meat that never delivered.  We had a pregnant woman that was unable to eat their offered items and was rudely "forced" to order because she would be charged regardless, really?!? Awesome hospitality.  Drinks were forgotten and at the end of the day I would not recommend this place for a night out. Super disappointing because it could be so cool.  Service is disorganized and dissatisfying.  Save your pennies.

aubSUixmR859-EYpzF6z4Q.text: A bit pricey but great service. Great atmosphere. Great food. Eat in moderation! :) Or else.

xk-EDo6B2jqzCKp7uBZ0BQ.text: What can I say about this place?  Decor, Food, Wait Staff... Loved it!    We were a party of six with reservations for 8:00 am on a Friday night.  It was the first time for all of us and I swear we had the "deer in headlights" look on our faces.  We were given instruction by our first waiter that the staff works as a team and are not assigned to specific tables.  However, he was a bit stiff and when we asked him a question, he responded with "as I said before...." Needless to say, we didn't call him back to help us.  We were fortunate to flag down Junior!  Wow!  So personable and quick with requests!  He made sure we had everything we needed.  It seems like we weren't the only ones Junior made an impression on because other tables kept calling him over!  LOL    The food was so perfectly done no matter what our preference was (rare, medium well, well done...).  The salad bar was so abundant.  We had to be careful not to fill up before we had our actual dinner.  We lucked out that they were having their Summer Special which was $45 per person and included dessert (try their Tres Leches cake!) Sides were also good and you can ask for more.    Even though you had to roll us out of there...  ;-) We will ALL definitely be coming back and we will definitely be asking for Junior!  He made the experience that much more memorable.

E9iTHCgjt2JpQs3O5PGbSA.text: We went here for 0ur 6 yr wedding anniversary. Amazing food. Amazing staff. They even brought  us a huge dessert  on the  house for our special  night. 50$ a person  was well worth this memory! !

KmfkWWjFN30W4YByGx3dUQ.text: Went there tonight.  Was seated on time, and everything started out ok.  When we were done with the salad, we were inundated with meats.  However, after that, further meat was impossible to get.  Specifically over a period of 30 minutes, I asked three different people for filet, with no luck.  Finally I asked our waiter, who complained that they were understaffed, and also said we should have just asked him.  However, we never saw him during that 30 minute period.  To top it off, he added gratuity to our check, for a party of 6.  For $50, I would expect much better service.

IfWHzD7dgeLa_jU6lzdFcQ.text: Meat.  A whole lot of meat.  Is there really anything else I need to say?  Vegetarians and vegans may just want to skip this restaurant.  For those unfamiliar with the concept.  Fogo de Chao is like a buffet that comes to you.  For about $50, servers on carts move about the restaurant and will serve you a cut of whatever they are carrying.  It's not the best or most seasoned cuts you will ever consume, but you will not leave dissatisfied or hungry.  There is also a pretty big "salad bar" that will get some greens and starches on your plate, but it's really not all that great.  Fogo also caters well to bigger groups.  My party of 15 had no problem being promptly seated (with some arriving well before our reservation) and served.  I highly recommend dining at Fogo with a group of carnivores when you have something to celebrate.

r3Zwi6RxeiLk3Xf0H2zhoA.text: The meat was great, but the servers made us feel uncomfortable. Constantly trying to upsell.

kt-3YpBocRPoCisoLTKjVQ.text: Great food. Great service. Junior, one of our servers, by far exceeded our expectations for service. Best server I've ever encountered.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

W8gdPwnzgBxIYDATxW_cWw.text: Wow, my first time there and I would definitely recommend!!! The meat was great and the creme Brule was to die for!  We had a server named Junior and he was the nicest server we have ever had.  His service was exceptional and made our experience so good that we will definitely tell our friends and return.  The only thing I didn't like is the soda is so small and 4 bucks!! Who charges for refills these days!?

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Only creme Brule I have had and the best!!

1Q61JCDwOSEn-NdyavagaQ.text: Best restaurant ever bar-none. The meat is amazing, every bite is like the first bite. The service is phenomenal. One waiter accidently dripped juices from the skewered meat onto our table and in less than a minute there was a fresh cloth on the table, and everything was reset. The cheese bread is addicting. We call it crack cheese bread. It is a bit pricey but this place is proof that you get what you pay for.

UzfXgrAM6w-hW3Q9WCmSLw.text: This place is awesome if you love good meat. It doesn't need a lot of marinades and seasoning when it is cooked like this. Not cheap but worth every penny. Staff is friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

P5wU9m_DQrKkA9NUboN6YA.text: I went to Fogo de Chao during their Meat Tornado event and, I was not prepared for the awesomeness. It was an amazing experience of meat, great waiters, and did I say meat? I made the mistake of going to the salad bar because I did not have enough room for all of the meats. I can't wait to go back to this place.

yv7ryY606Iew4V0nHkqyTA.text: My husband and I ate here recently while visiting Scottsdale from Michigan. Our first time in a "Brazilian-style" steakhouse, and we were a bit disappointed. The restaurant was nice, not too loud, nice ambiance. Most of the cuts of meat were average in taste and quality. For $150 we were expecting much more, especially with the taste. We were mostly offered sirloin and pork, and the chicken was average tasting. All in all I would not return, I would rather pay that money for a quality filet elsewhere.

D8Ct9yiFJUtibNRnLuQdmA.text: Made reservations for dinner Friday night through open table at 8pm. Arrived at restaurant and it was very busy. I advised that we had a reservation at 8pm and they told me they were seating 7 thirties so it would be a bit of a wait. We only waited 15 minutes then were seated. Restaurant was nice and elegant. Many people were dressed up in fine attire and some in shorts and sandals. The salad bar was impressive as it had many delicious choices. The bar with the side orders was empty almost the entire time. I only tasted a few of the roasted potatoes and the white rice. No beans, no scalloped potatoes ect. A little dissapointed in this. The meats however were outstanding quality. I really like the fact that they ask you how you want your meat and give you your desired cut. Every meat I tasted was juicy , flavorful and just plain amazing.  The only meat I did not like was the Linguica. The price was pricey at $50 per person but well worth the service and quality of food. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wonderful salad bar.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The meat menu for the night

sITf4av-WIMj9Z9KbF1a0w.text: Our party of 8 went there for dinner and had a fabulous time.  We had been to other Brazilian Steakhouses, but this one's meat just tasted better.  Service was impeccable as well.  Overall, a very good dining experience.

BAaBlp84QxZcb3I8Qn-kEQ.text: Another excellent Fogo de Chao experience, every bit as good as meals enjoyed in the the Austin and Chicago outposts.  I will say, though, that the Scottsdale edition might be the nicest looking restaurant of the Fogos I've seen.  As usual, the Picanha (the signature cut) was outstanding.  However, what really caught my attention this time was the Fraldinha, or lower sirloin.  I do not recall this being so good in previous visits, but it was juicy, tender and intensely flavorful.  Of the two fillet mignon offered, the standard (non bacon wrapped) was the best.  Perfectly medium rare, with a beautifully buttery texture.  Sadly, the bacon wrapped version was too overdone.  Although sometimes it's nice to break up the beef parade with some chicken, I am always disappointed.  The lamb and pork ribs, however, are good alternatives.  The salad bar is fresh and abundant, but don't fill up on too many items here.  What's always impressive to me is the huge wheel of authentic Parmesan Reggiano and it's hard not to carve off a few chunks of rich, salty cheese.    Side dishes are typical: mashed potatoes (which are light and airy), fried polenta squares and caramelized bananas.  The latter are particularly nice to give your taste buds a break from the meat onslaught, with the sweetness playing a nice counterpoint to rich and salty beef.  As usual, I will need at least 6 months to recover from this experience.  But, I'll be back.  Just not sure what city it'll be in.

9G8-4eLP2CaTBnHshks_Fg.text: Great Brazilian steakhouse. Chain but doesn't feel like it. Service was very attentive, felt like we had multiple servers plus all the meat dudes. Kids enjoyed salad bar and many of the meats. Adults ate too much.

nxrhEPgC82FhPXm9eeq6Vw.text: WOW! I was blown away. The moment I sat down, I was greeted by the largely brazilian staff like a member of their own family. I wasn't expecting the orgy of meats that awaited me at Fogo de Chao.

PVv46ugExKh11SiYN9wPlg.text: Treated my friend here yesterday for a birthday lunch. The salad bar was great, the cuts of meat were mostly amazing, and for most of it, the service wasn't too shabby either.   In my opinion the lamb t-bone, small chicken legs, and bacon wrapped filets were the best of the meat they brought around. Other cuts ranged from "great" to "dry". And boy did they bring around they meats. I was a little worried that going there for late lunch they'd have a limited selection, or stuff wouldn't be as hot & fresh, but that's not something you should worry about.   The only thing keeping this from being a 5 star review was the service at the end. The check never came, and we had to flag someone down - which by itself is a passable offense - but also, I made a special comment when booking online that I was taking my friend out for his birthday and they never made any mention of it, which was extremely disappointing. I even saw a sticky note when we were being seated that said, "note: BDAY!"  I don't know if either of us could have handled dessert had they offered, but they could have offered him a drink on the house or something. Or at least said "enjoy your birthday."  Loved the meal, was sad for it to end on a disappointing note.

c12oJ_syXDj1Vx-LuIOKtQ.text: Three words for you...  MEAT ON SWORDS!  When you first arrive, they seat you to the table and explain the epicness that is about to ensue... First you take a trip to a salad bar.. oh no no my friend, do not turn your nose up at this "salad bar"... they have freshly made mozzerella, smoked salmon, asparagus... the salad bar is amazing. After you have your fill of the delicious mozerella and ripe tomatoes... the meat feast begins! Guys walk briskly around the restaurant with giant swords of meat.. yes... GIANT SWORDS OF MEAT. If they see your card is on green, they slice you off a big ole chunk of whatever meat you would like. I suggest the lamb, it is amazing.. every piece of meat i tried there was mouth watering and cooked to perfection. I have never been so full my entire life... This is a great place to celebrate your anniversary, or take that special someone out.

Isg643DpcLIXh35V71LSsg.text: Upscale dinning that's pricey but very good! Would recommend for a nice date dinner

lvedo8XhUu0y4jSV1slKXw.text: The food is great, the atmosphere is fancy and it's a lot of  fun to go to!  HOWEVER the service here sucks! We only saw our waiter twice, the first when he took our drink order and the last when he dropped off the check... he never checked up on us, and every time we needed something we had to stop another server which was annoying.  Anyways, yes it's delicious but I probably won't come back for a while. $50/person (not including drinks and tax) plus dessert (we got a creme brulet, IT WAS SO GOOD) is way too much especially when you have to tip a server who gave you no service.

THs9fgvuYQzAbO_Ri8dYAA.text: I come here pretty often, but this time I was informed they are assigning a waiter to your table, where as before you could have a few.  Although they've done this, all of the staff is still available (I hate when you ask someone for help, and they send your waiter over to take your request) to assist.  This is always a great place for good food.

cXdZEWaPrUsGbclYOp8Jlg.text: Fabulas place, great food, wonderful atmosphere, does not break the bank.  Wait staff is top notch.

_NmNeVTTOIHHymXABfC1cA.text: Oh my gosh, this was a nice place for dinner. It is definitely up scale, but causal dress. You need to come to this place hungry. There is sooo much food. The salad bar is like no other, very refreshing. The staff and servers were very friendly and attentive. Classy joint.

ouaH7mQcJEYBvZTzakxSQA.text: We used to love this steak house. Not any more. Service is horrid, only offered good steak once, right after we started eating. The rest of the meat was not good. Never did get lamb. Had to beg for water. No service really at all. We won't be back.

GuHpsZ7ngtQUHuM0U314kg.text: Ehhh this place is good for meat connoisseurs but it wasn't for me. It's tastes were good but nothing out of this world and am not sure if the price is justified. I guess for special occasions this is good but other than that not much.... also our server was very unattentive so that didn't make the experience too great.

1vmVakt_L7RqEbMuxdX6WA.text: A trip planned to Scottsdale once again brought us to Fogo de Chao for lunch. Driving from Goodyear is a challenge since construction of I10 (which we try to avoid during the weekends) with closures of lanes take place. However, we bit the bullet and decided to make our drive because of what we anticipated would be a wonderful meal. Again, they did not disappoint us. We have had great servers in the past and recognized several of them throughout the years. This visit was an absolutely marvelous.  Our server Karina has to be one of the best employees they have. She has one of the most beautiful smiles and is right there to take care of your every need.  The food has always been stupendous, however, when you have a server that is one of the best in every way it only adds to your whole experience of a wonderful meal. We simply cannot say enough about the quality of their food and their servers.  It was also nice to see the general manager walk throughout the restaurant several times just to make certain all customers were happy customers. It was a memorable day and we look forward to visit them again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best lamp chops ever!!!!

8bXhsNfRu7fs1iUhV0EEbw.text: I took my husband here for his birthday yesterday.  I knew the price of the meals and wanted a special experience for him.  I told the waitress and the hostess it was his birthday. Ok - I'm not expecting the song and dance or anything like that - but there was zero acknowledgment.  Even if they scripted Happy Birthday in the mashed potatoes or something ... but nothing.  For the price you would think they would think of something creative.  If you want to take a loved one out for their birthday - go somewhere else.

-yKdxee_heBkgBoZlq0CxA.text: I've eaten my fair shar of Brazilian steakhouses and the location in Scottsdale is on the bottom of the list. We went in knowing what to expect and really didn't get the experience we were hoping for. Especially when it's automatically a $100+ dinner just for 2 people. To begin with, the host seemed rather grumpy. Not exactly setting the mood for a romantic expensive dinner. Our server greeted us when we sat and then disappeared for the remaining hour we were there. I'm not sure if they switched server sections and therefore we got a new server or what, but we had about 4 other servers or helpers stop by to get us water refills or just to randomly check on us. But never our actual server although we saw him roaming the room at other tables. We got the full Brazilian experience and still had to request the prime meats to be brought out to us. The mash potatoes were great but I felt the meats to be either super rare or too well done even though we always requested Medium Rare. They still weren't bad but a little bland compared to other Brazilian steakhouses we've been to in the past.  The check was ridiculous though. We were asked if we were ready the check and it took them 10 minutes to even bring it to us after requesting it (I actually timed it because I was frustrated at this point just waiting for them to even ask us about the check). After I gave them my card, it took ANOTHER 5 minutes before I got it back. Absolutely uncalled for just to process a check. Overall, very unhappy and dissatisfied. But judging by other reviews, apparently this isn't new behavior for this particular location which is quite sad. For this much money, we deserved better.

2ju9ujxAe0ObYReauJlZ3g.text: I've been here few times before and every time I'm amazed at their service. There's always someone nearby for service. Water, side dishes, and bread bowl keeps getting refilled and dirty dishes cleared quickly. The salad bar is fresh and taste amazing. The BBQ has enough selection to please everyone. My favorite was the lamb. All you can eat salad bar which includes cold cut meat was $26 and with all you can eat BBQ it's $51. Well worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad bar.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brazilian beer, really good!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sides.

dzkD7ivG_ygbQDRMFI-sJQ.text: Really really disappointed. So I thought I've been here before and I have not, so I was excited to try another place in Arizona, even a chain national brand. Let's be positive here first.   The ambience is great, white table cloth, clean environment, everything is looking high end, great, done, woohoo.  We get to the "salad" bar. Nothing wrong here, I liked the assortment of cheeses, salads, little sides like olives and the other charcuterie type items were great. My brother told me not to get too much of the salad bar items, I know why. These are just fillers for the real meat. They also bring mashed potatoes and fried plantains (that were terrible).   So my buddy orders a Diet Coke and it's in a glass bottle. Ok cool. Get to that later.  So we get to the "17 different" meats. Now if you are vegan, obviously you will not want to go here. So I'm not vegan and we continue to eat. We get the first couple meats and I'm like ok this is pretty good. Different style with the whole skewer type serving. Then we get to some of the other meats like the garlic steak and bacon wrapped chicken/steak and a few others that were absolutely awful. The garlic steak tasted like a fishy taste and I almost threw up in my mouth. It almost ruined my whole meal. The others that I don't even remember were so dry and almost flavorless I was in shock. I asked for most of the cuts with the crust on it to get some flavor and still not exciting. I mean I tried 5-7 different meats and only had one bite of each. I even talked to my brother and he went to one in another state and it was the same issue. Dry, not great flavor, not juicy, and just overall not good experiences. He even told me he didn't want to tell me so I didn't get disappointed, but I did. The best meat was the lamb. The porks were bad and the chicken was dry big time and a few steak items.   The diet cokes. Ok, so our lunch for 2 ppl with no booze was $85 and some of that is because they charged us for 2 cokes because they are in bottles not from the machine. Don't you think you are making enough for mediocre steak that you don't have to charge for each Coke and then ask if we want a refill 20 times in 3 min?? Makes no sense.   Honestly I just don't think it's worth the price and not that great of a product. Probably won't be back, even though I left with a food baby in me.

tlGaYO0_MPNMOyKais3xgw.text: Not the best visit this time around. Most of our meats in addition to the rolls were all over done and dried out. Conversely, the bananas were underdone and nowhere near their caramelized best.  The service was also spotty (though well-intentioned) with requests having to be repeated and a 20 minute wait for our bill as lunch was quietly winding down. We'll be back and know we'll have sharper service again, but this visit was a bit of a miss.

JxZPQQnGqlMBLmc0MtNNag.text: I been in estancia brazilian steakhouse and fogo de chao for many years in austin the service was always amazing and professional this is my first time in fogo de chao and this will be my first and last the service was unprofessional and rude I don't recommend it to anyone

KK5fBRsGFula3FgWzmOMWA.text: Went with friends with high hopes of great meal & atmosphere...severely disappointed!! Let's see where to start.. first off, it's like a big cafeteria, no significant atmosphere to the place. Our unfriendly server, with a heavy accent and who never so much as cracked a tiny smile,  pretty much told us that if we wanted the "full experience", we should order the $57 p/p meat extravaganza.  When my friend ordered the salad bar ($29), our server was clearly displeased and even said "so you 'just' want that?" ( ... well, it's on the menu, so yes...)  My husband and our other friend ordered the chilean bass ($40+ ea) and I was the only one to order the "full experience" to which she immediately looked at us and said "and to let you know, sharing the meat is NOT allowed".. looking at each one of us.  Excuse me? If I take a bite of sea bass from my husband's plate, he can certainly take a bite of my plate.  The gauchos took forever to get to our table and even though I had my card turned green, our table was passed up time & time again.I was promised a wide variety of meats and only saw the same 4-5 cuts go by.  No way did they deliver on this "full experience". Our server stopped at our table once the entire night and I had to finally hand my dirty plate to a staff member who was just walking by!  Twice I had to flag someone down for water...twice! Finally my husband just got up to get the water pitcher himself; at which time, 4 staff members descended on him.  Then came time to pay our bill, credit cards where handed over and when it was time to sign, I promise you.. this guy stood over my friend's shoulder; looked like a mob hitman and just said "Mr. ____?" I thought someone's card had been declined.  He handed the bills over without a word. We unhappily signed the cards and as we were leaving, we used the restroom.  There was toilet paper all over the floors of the stalls, no seat covers, garbage can overflowing and an old worn out, torn leather chair in the corner! yuck! I took pictures but can't find how to post them! Seriously, we dropped $212 and wished we could take it back. The food was good but the service was so awful; it spoiled it for us.  No one was helpful, no one smiled at you and no one said Thank you.  I am still in shock.  Think twice before going here!

Rzing4NK27cYPboLx6RxCA.text: Wow ! What an amazing place and the quality is unmatched with excellent service and ambiance !

huhhDtIFH7LFOy6a55nVwg.text: We ate here along with a large group. It was my first time at Fogo, though I have heard many great things about it. I LOVED the salad bar. I could have happily eaten from there alone--the fresh mozzarella was divine. However, the meat is the highlight of this place, and quite an impressive one. Wayfaring servers with meat on swords--what's not to like? My favorites included the filet mignon with bacon, parmesan pork, and lamb.   Of the sides on the table, I really liked the Pao de Queijo cheese rolls--like big, soft bubbles! The mashed potatoes just tasted like mashed potatoes and the bananas just weren't my sort of thing.  While the meat service was constant, the regular table service was lacking. My section in the middle of the table was almost entirely ignored. I only acquired a drink because my husband directed a server my way; I only had one water refill the whole time, and my finished plate awaited pick up for about 30 minutes. People seated around me gave up and walked to the bar to get drinks.   The dessert offerings that night were chocolate mousse cake, cheesecake, and tres leches. My husband chose the mousse cake, and I thought he made the right call; I had the tres leches, which tasted bland to me. All of the dessert slices were pretty small, which is probably wise considering the meat smorgasbord.   My husband adored the place. The service issues were frustrating for me, but overall I liked it. If you're a carnivore, it's the place to go.

_3Y2WYISGsnj_YbeTFLTow.text: Don't eat all day so you can enjoy all the delectable meats. Their salad bar is nice for those who need something healthy on their plate.

ibcyP6mFP9yziUNSB27BJA.text: The food was good BUT it seems like we were served the same meats over and over again, I seen other meats being served, we paid for the FULL EXPERIENCE, so I was quite confused, everything was beef, but I seen I chicken, and pork floating around, I did get the lamb, but it was really packed either for my table to be skipped over

fsmq6piZGV5JyeUQehIdiA.text: I came to this place 4 Times. Yesterday, I decided this will be my last time. Low quality, unprofessional waiters and bad service. 1- low quality service, when I pay money I expect good service  2- the waiter dropped the food on my wife, he did not help even. He ran away like if nothing happened 3- the waiter dropped the bill, he did not pick it up  4- there was additional item on the bill, the waiter waited to see if I will check, then he said ooh sir , I am not sure, but did you order this item?  I go to this place just for the experience, if the experience is not good any more what else I will for.  Unfortunately, I had two foreign people from Spain yesterday, I liked to show them this place, I was disappointed.

vD6_G2lNhDCYZjO5TdRQDQ.text: I'm gonna go with the people that said the meat had no flavor. The buffet portion was nice, but overcrowded. It took away from ambiance of being a "nice" restaurant. The garlic beef & lamb were my favorite. Don't get dolled up to go, everyone was dressed pretty casual. The service however was great. We had the same waiter the entire time & we stayed around 2 hours. I think this place is more about the experience. You have to try it at least once. I ordered the tres leches cake to go & it was way too sweet, something I never say. The polenta fries were awesome & the fried bananas tasted like old overripe bananas repurposed. If I ever go back I'll probably just order from the bar menu, but that's only if I'm in the area.

DtnKJHmzxBxrIhoiQKYqIA.text: The restaurant is a chain found across many cities known for its cleanliness, good service and most importantly the varieties of grilled meat. Went for launch and as usual had the combo meal (salad bar and meat). Giving it four stars due to the lagging service of the meat cutters. Over the one hour, filled my salad plate twice (which got me full) and only had 6-7 cuts of meat. Compared to other chains, the meat cutters will keep coming and going during the hour (10-15 times) until you are filled from the meat not the salad.

9SMOkdpODrjixzXq2oGIpQ.text: Our waters were never below 3/4 full the meat was always hot every time it's nice not to be half way through a steak and it gets cold on you this place allows you to always eat a hot piece I love that! The waiters work as a TEAM that's amazing! We were asked multiple times by the people cutting the meat if we wanted a specific cut, and within 3 minutes he was back cutting it for us! 5 Star Service through and through! Sign up for their eClub our bill went from $74 to $43 TOTAL FOR TWO for lunch due to being able to use 2 coupons for the table according to the fine print! That's cheap for amazing flavor and prime cut steak and chicken not to mention the market table! The waiters deserve every ounce of a 25% tip VERY IMPRESSED

YQTn8hVgXkQNwXRGuWB1Og.text: We went for the summer $39 special, which includes most of the offerings minus some of the finer cuts. First the good -  quality of the meats served is quite good. Even though our special didn't include rib eye and lamb, it didn't seem like we were missing out on anything. Service was very good. Salad bar was excellent. Restaurant was clean. Now the bad -  the cocktails we ordered were probably the most watered-down drinks we've ever experienced. And at $16 each, one would expect an undiluted mix.  The top sirloin, which is the best cut in the special, was pretty tough to locate after a certain hour. We even asked for it. Twice. FdC has and electronic point-of-sale payment system used at your table. The default tip is 20%, which is at the high end of the range, especially for a quasi-buffet style restaurant.  True, one can edit the tip to whatever level you want. But who wants to look like a cheapskate knocking down the tip to 18%?  We paid the 20%, but the FdC approach is offensive. Even with the $39 special, dinner for 4 with a modest bottle of wine came to $350 all in. On balance, a good experience, but not a good value.

_2zKXU3B8Gvib014nr8UmA.text: Honestly food wasn't that good. I thought it was a restaurant but turns out it was buffet style so you can't order a dish you want. The cheese balls you get as bread was really good. But like I said it's buffet style and they bring the meat to you and cut alittle piece so no sides.... we got so full in 10 mins. And then the bill was 150.

dv1VbgAadEkqZEsMwQKMnw.text: Ah, Fogo de chao... you never disappoint! I've been to several of your locations across the county and tried the (only!) AZ location last night, for my delight.  Compared to other Fogo locations , this location is small and tables feel a bit cramped on top of each other. This is NOT a place for a dim-light, low-noise, romantic date. This place is bright, full, lively and full of that awesome Brazilian energy. We are loud people anyways.  Skip the buffet. Maybe pick a leaf or two of lettuce, but focus on what matters the most, which is the amazing variety and quality of meat. The meat is GOOD. If you are planning on going to a regular steakhouse and pay $50 for a cut of filet, better go to Fogo and pay $55 to try all cuts of steak you want! Medium rare top sirloin (picanha) and garlic sirloin and the bomb, btw. You will be happy and you will be full.  You will be interrupted a million times because the meat keeps coming. And keep coming. And there's always someone checking on you, so expect to be interrupted mid-sentence a bazillion times. It is what it is. The customer service in this location is top notch. I felt like everyone was checking on us through the night to make sure we had everything we need. I felt very well taken care.  As a Brazilian, it was also very refreshing to speak in Portuguese with so many super friendly servers and service staff. Our server was Karina and she was an angel through the night, excellent service, personable, amazing. The managers or maitre (not sure the labels there) were also amazing and attentive. And then we also had the caipirinha artist, Vince. Vince made us tableside caipirinhas that were probably the best I've had. And I've had a few in my life. Caipirinha was so good and well made I forgot to eat after my first sip. I just wanted to drink lol  Don't skip the pao de queijo, I've had at least 8. That's what I eat when I go to Fogo: pao de queijo, caipirinha and steak. What else do you need?  With that exceptional service and amazing quality, this is the place to go. And I'll definitely go back!

pYCoov4iplK4wHd9LiKluw.text: DO NOT dine here alone.  That's my biggest and most important disclaimer if you plan on making your way to gorge yourself at Fogo de Chao.  Bring a date, heck bring the whole family, but don't do as I did and come alone.  There's simply too much.  Too much of everything.  Too quickly.  And too much variety of everything that it'll have you and your stomach begging for mercy as mine did.  Now then, hopefully I've drilled that critical piece of advice into your skull.  So let's talk about my visit here.  Fogo de Chao is (I think as of this writing) now the last Brazilian specific restaurant in the Phoenix area now that north Scottsdale's Carvalho's has shuttered.  Headquartered in Dallas with 50 locations nationwide, Fogo's only Arizona location lies along the west side of Scottsdale Road just a block south of Lincoln Drive.  I've seen Churrascarias (Brazilian steakhouses) featured on television shows, via online ads and of course from several reviews of this place.  But the price point had kept me at bay from here for a time.  But on a Saturday at lunch I figured I'd waited long enough.  So I came right at their 11:30am opening.  Good thing I did as this more than 200 seat behemoth was jampacked by 1pm.  The menu here such as it is, is pretty simple.  You tell your host which of the four different meal options you want.  You can get the market table (effectively the salad and sides bar) by itself.  Or you can get the market table with sea bass, salmon, or the endless meat Churrasco experience.  And really, if you're coming here for anything other than the full Churrasco experience you're doing it wrong.  Its discounted quite a bit at lunch too (lucky me).  Before I dove headfirst into the meat and market table, I first started with Fogo's signature Premium Caipirinha.  Cachaca, limes, and cane sugar mixed with ice.  I love me some caipirinhas and Fogo's is a good one, though they might've been a bit liberal with the ice.  Now to the food.  There's some like 50 items at the market bar including salads, fruits, veggies, soups, stews, meats, cheeses, sweets, and on and on.  Knowing that I had a whole bunch of meat coming my way, I pretty much knew I'd only get one shot at the market bar.  So I loaded up my plate with as much of each as I reasonably could.  When I got back to my table, I saw both to my delight (and somewhat to my horror) that they had thrown in a complimentary limeade drink, sides of polenta with candied bananas, bread, and garlic mashed potatoes.  And this is before I even received a bite of meat!  I worked away at my market table portion before finally turning my table light green to send in the churrasqueiros.  And before long skewers full of deliciously cooked and seasoned meats arrived at my table with each churrasqueiro slicing each cut right on the spot.  In all I had 7 different cuts.  Ribeye, top sirloin, flank, pork loin, pork rib, lamb, and chicken.  After devouring a whole market table, a whole mess of meat, a bunch of sides and two drinks, I (somehow) had the great idea of ordering dessert.  Their papaya cream dessert sounded like the perfect way to cool my insides and offset some of the epic meat sweats that were already percolating within.  Basically its papayas blended with vanilla ice cream and topped with creme de cassis (a blackcurrants liqueur).  This actually helped to sooth my insides a little bit, but it nevertheless made me even more full and more destined for the fetal position than I already was.  Total cost for the Full Churrasco experience, Caipirinha, Papaya Cream dessert, plus the multitudes of freebies, tip and tax came to $95.  To be fair, I do think I got my money's worth in terms of the volume of food and drink I devoured.  However I don't expect the majority of humans would be able to handle this much food.  You either have to eat to excess like I did to get your money's worth or the price just becomes too excessive for a normal portioned meal.  The service I received was wonderful from the wait staff, the churrasquerios, and even the host staff.  And the restaurant atmospherics are great for a date, a work get together, or for a big family occasion (and I saw a little of all three today).  I'm glad I gave this place a try, but only those with deep pockets or a roomy stomach should dare to enter this monument to excess.
