Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Papaya Cream

N2XAr2uFyomYk4Bc9CYYNQ.text: The service you will recive at Fogo De Chao is unparalleled! Everything from the elegant atmosphere, customer service, and food is truly with every penny. David, the Customer Service Representative, is hilarious! David knows how to connect with each and every person at your table and gave us many good laughs. You will not find better service anywhere else you go. Everyone on the floor works as one united team. Job well done! As always, thank you for having us for and we can't wait to join you again for another amazing experience!

2AfnLzQTJyUNRj5ZliowEg.text: It was my very first visit here, but it is most certainly my last. During my visit there was a drunk and belligerent person sitting next to us. The entire time we were there he was shouting racial slurs and cursing. Management was well aware if the situation, because they kept apologizing. However, they never got him to leave. At one point he broke a champagne glass. He was drinking a bottle of Dom Perignon from the bottle, so clearly management wanted to collect money from him. This guy was very intoxicated to the point that he fell asleep. Then out of no where he decided to dump his bottle on two of the customers. One of the customers was my friend. The guy was then escorted out and police were called after this.  Management clearly need to get their priorities straight. The way this situation was handled was very poor and really made me feel uncomfortable. Clearly money was the deciding factor in this situation.

5_bkGNbb0Pj9PL7ki0o3fA.text: First timer here at Fogo de Chao, however I went to a similar Brazilian steakhouse with the same concepts. My cousin, best friend and I came for my birthday. We had drinks beforehand and that kind of filled my stomach. Note to self: don't drink again before Fogo de Chao.   I was happy the reservations weren't filled up because Valentine's Day was the day after. I was even able to easily change our reservations for 30 mins after our original time since we were running behind from drinks.   It was my friends first time as well with no Brazilian steakhouse experience. We were both excited to see what's up with the hype. When arrived we were quickly seated and introduced to the restaurant  The salad bar has plenty of hors d'oeuvre selections ranging from mozzarella balls, crispy bacon pieces, asparagus, you name it.   THE MEATS: That's what this place is really all about. It's honestly like an all you can eat meat buffet! They have all different types of meats and they just keep comin around with meat skewers. They have a card (red side and green side) you flip the card to green side if you haven't had enough and want more and flip it to red if you need a break pretty much  My favorites were the filet mignon and ribeye. FIRE! P.S. are you given a free birthday dessert. I chose the strawberry creme which is actually just cream that is strawberry flavored. It's like slightly melted strawberry ice cream in a cup. I would probably just stick to getting the creme brulee or a cheesecake had I known. FYI

Wly4P0zIjMx8xsPff4REnA.text: Like the environment here! Love the lemonade and beef here. Good place to celebrate with friends and family. The pineapple in the bar is my favorite.

-07FCWl4MnIrYMOMeVOLUg.text: We came as a party of 16 to celebrate my mother's 50th birthday. Ana Laura was our server and she made the entire experience amazing. She never complained about the party size or having to increase our party size. Originally we had a reservation for 12, but it had to be changed to 16 last minute. The food was amazing, the atmosphere was great and the service was beyond amazing. Thanks to Ana Laura for the amazing service.

uO-ej_NlPIe2AbSGnl7pDg.text: First time at Fogo in seven years.  Found out they had a $15 summer lunch salad bar.  We used to go for dinner when the salad bar was about $18.  Once it was raised to $23 we stopped.  Well, the salad bar was great.  The salads, veggies, and fruits were fresh.  We ate too much.  My favorite was the papaya, watermelon feta salad, chicken salad, and bacon.  Also love the pop-up rolls.  Will be back next summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $15 salad bar for lunch, a bargain

Zpg8VqaKabavoHgrxJ8I_w.text: Went here for valentines and they were really busy. I feel like I didn't get as much choices of meat like we used to but the ones that we got are still so gooood. Felt like our server didn't want to be there. Only checked on us once and I asked for our check but he forgot so I had to ask another server. Overall the place is clean and front desk was really friendly. Would come back again if they're not that busy.

ANUBMSq_9lSZvQPyKdqzrQ.text: Amazing service!!!!! Antonio was very attentive and extremely kind! We'll absolutely be coming back in hopes to see him and David. David, the customer service rep. was also very sweet and made sure we had everything we needed to make our experience fantastic and memorable! Not only did these two lovely gentleman take exquisite care of us, but we had a great encounter with Matt as well. He answered all of our questions and kept us well fed. Love this restaurant. Hostesses are welcoming and beautiful and the overall staff is fantastic. Antonio is our absolute favorite forever! And my friend! Thank you!!!!

DFJfDQnTMJfv6W2NjT8LJw.text: Enjoyed going to Fogo de Chao this past weekend!  My children took me there for my 65th birthday!  I cannot tell you how everything from the meats to the foodbar  was absolutely wonderful!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone!

fJwyAmiN6LFgcKRhjNs8iA.text: I use to be a meat lover until I decided to eliminate that off my diet. This place is very accomodating, especially if you do not eat certain foods, but again you do pay the price. If you are a meat lover, I would suggest going here for their meat options is amazing! If you like being served meat at your table side, you'll enjoy this restaurant. Their price is oftely in the pricey end but then again it is in the heart of Scottsdale.  I have to commend their excellent service! I like going to restaurents when they greet you at the door, check-up on you, and make sure you are taken cared of.  When I came here, I ordered their sea bass which was excellent. They didn't have their seared salmon but the general manager was very nice to take a few percent off our tab for waiting 20 minutes for my order. Like I said they are very accomodating and they make sure they take care of you.

4Eu13CzdCmb9GyORb-G1Gw.text: I love this place. Always great service and solid quality meat. Good bang for your buck.

3uFUh8HDxwmgAPi5mpwAaA.text: This was our first time at a Brazilian Steakhouse and we were so impressed! Great service, incredible food, and a wonderful atmosphere. Corina was our server and she was absolutely amazing! We will be back!!

OJktwIX-GUbaIruiYQz9Kw.text: Came for a bday/anniversary dinner for our first time and wow! we got the salad bar and the all you can eat meat dinner. Started with the salad bar with cheeses, salad, fruit, and slamis etc. They were good. Then we started with the meats! Had our card on green the whole night and we tried almost all the meats available. our fav was the lamb and the top sirloin. The staff was very friendly and upbeat and making sure we enjoyed everything. It was pricey, but worth it and will be coming back again to eat more!

DG6Ao0r_GV09S3vGUlRfaw.text: Always a great experience! Norma was very accommodating and answered all of our bizarre questions! The customer service is always above and beyond. We always consider this place for date nights or any special occasion!

yWFYsU7uwsMPYUc1i6mL6w.text: We decided step out of our normal date night outing routine for my husband's birthday and venture outside our 10 mile comfort bubble to Fogo de Chao for its "experience dining".  We had made a reservation for 6:45, walked right in and  were seated right away but a lot of people were waiting. Reservations definitely were the way to go, especially for a Saturday night. The entire restaurant was packed. The dining area was a constant flow of different meat skewers going from table to table and drinks carts and giant seafood appetizers making their way to tables. This is definitely a place you come hungry too.   Our waitress was really amazing and explained to us the way this whole thing worked. There was a coaster on our table; one side green and one side red. If you flip the coaster to green, the meat will come to you and if the coaster is red, they will pass you by. First though, she encouraged us to take our trip through the salad bar.   There were so many more things than salad to choose from. There were all kinds of fresh fruit (Star fruit, dragon fruit, pineapple) and vegetables (asparagus spears, artichokes, peppers), cheese and cured meats. Do not be concerned about not getting enough meat at this step in the process as it is literally at your beckon call at any time in the dining experience.   We took our plates back to our table and additional food had arrived of cheese bread, mashed potatoes and caramelized bananas. We were having a rare night out without our kids but these tables sides would have been a big hit for the kids.   Then it was go time...literally.  We flipped the coaster. Green, open for business.   Here is where I cannot stress this enough.....pace yourself!   Admittedly, I made a critical rookie error and failed to understand that even though the meat came, you didn't have to take it and before I knew it, I was elbows deep in amazing tasting bottom sirloin, sensational Parmesan pork, mouthwatering bacon wrapped filets and more.   I tapped out and flipped to red.   After I made my way through my body weight in steak, I had to take a breather. I drank some water, enjoyed some of the fruit from the salad bar and the bananas at our table while trying to give myself a meat pep talk to get back in the game.   I never did.   I rallied for a few bites of the tres leches cake we got for my husbands birthday (tip: join the email club ahead of time for coupons), went home, and went into a certified delicious food coma.  Will I go again? Possibly assuming I have a better entry strategy. The food was all so incredible and although I felt like I was 50 lbs heavier leaving, I didn't even make it through a fraction of the available options.

9yNfk8rMDMytJ4QTmezKLw.text: I had a terrible experience at this location. I have been to other ones in other states and always had a great experience. We went for a very special occasion with another couple. First of all, they would not pick up the dirty plates. It took them about 40 mins because I told two people. Then, the usual plantains and mash potatoes that they bring right when you sit down came about 45 minutes later. The bread, that I love, I asked for more and the waiter kept forgetting it. We only had like three types of meat offer again and again. Finally, I was fed up so I went to complain, which my wife hates, but I thought it was needed. The manager came by and offer us free desserts. But when we got the bill, they were charging us for the dessert.  I think someone should be training the team. This is not a cheap choice of eating out, so you expect at least better service.

GmcMj_5ayTrrcNWbrJi-SA.text: MEAT!  That is what you get here.  Every time I have gone the service has been outstanding.  They will keep serving you until you keel over and die from a heart attack so be aware of the stop sign!  The salad bar has quite the selection as well, but I would minimize your intake here so you can try all the MEAT!  My one complaint is it seems like most of the MEATs have similar seasoning.  They have a large variety of different types of MEAT, but at some point it just all tastes the same...maybe I just have MEAT overload at that point.  This is definitely a place to experience, but I could never go here regularly.  I myself would rather go to a gourmet restaurant and have one great meal rather than gorge myself with MEAT, but I can see the allure of Fogo for sure!

ZuVLZav7PuNzrlnhYho50A.text: I'm still thinking of this place a month after my first experience here. I absolutely loved Fogo de Chao! If I could change anything about my experience I would have skipped the salad bar altogether and just eat the meat and the sides they brought to the table. My absolute favorite was the petite filet and their house sirloin. The service was top notch and could not have been any better.   I was here for my 2 year anniversary and they gave us a dessert for free. We had the Tres Leches cake which was phenomenal!   I can't wait to go back!

iLnMs9hbHtDvGj1jAprO9w.text: Not only do I really like meat that is brought over and carved in front of my face, but I loveee having my selection of salad and smoked meats and cheeses. I honestly don't think it's very worth it for me to come to a place like this because I can't eat that much food anymore (compared to when I was 17 and could probably eat an entire cow). Because of this, I only come for lunch because it's slightly cheaper with similar food (if not exactly the same) as dinner.   This particular Fogo de Chao has great service and a really great manager. I was really impressed and it made my food taste even better!

xvG9A0zAumYSPsVSsOfQYA.text: We have been to this restaurant twice now and absolutely love it!!  The buffet is always well stocked with delicious fresh vegetables, meats and cheeses but of course the real winner is the roasted meat that is carved at your table.  All the succulent cuts are wonderfully seasoned and cut at your table by temp you like.  We had the lamb, top sirloin and ribeye and everything was perfect.  Along with the great meal is great service, everyone is there to make sure you have everything you need at all times.  Finally you have to try their cheesy biscuits they are so great!  You definitely have to try this place at least once it is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. meat plate and ice cold dirty martini

K0kKE5Nwg25h5MHqybWMDQ.text: I enjoyed the meal. Service was great!  I do however feel really annoyed that a small piece of meat that I couldn't finish ( that I wanted to take home to my dog ) I was told NO!  I understand a buffet type place not letting people load up a Togo box. However this was farrrrrr from that. Just a bit tacky the story as to why.   I was told that they couldn't be held responsible if the food made my dog sick.  Lol. If it will make my dog sick. Then why did I eat it?!?   Not wanting to tear them as if was a good dining experience. However I was annoyed.

OVj5U6ZOSyaY89sjBhlA0A.text: My wife and I have been twice and had nothing but the best time. Great food each time and we left stuffed. Great salad bar along with the meats.

shrpg9jZTgIUtmRl-YxsuA.text: Tried this place during restaurant week and was not disappointed. Definitely come hungry as the price includes all you can eat and there is so much to choose from! Loved the amazing salad bar and literally tried every kind of meat that came my way. Celebrated a birthday and got a chocolate lava cake that was excellent as well! Will definitely go back!

t0FW4cNgFZxW3tCiK5VuiQ.text: My hubby and I celebrated our wedding anniversary on August 12, 2017, and loved it!  Great food and wonderful service.

VNNgdjVK2Lt6gOdnvy7D-A.text: Have you every wanted to be fed like King Henry VIII?  A big goblet in one hand, exquisite, endless dishes of extravagant foods being feed to you almost intravenously until you have gorged yourself jolly and need a coma to recover?  Well, your highness, there is a haven for you in Scottsdale.  Fogo de Chao is paradise for the carnivore AND the vegetarian alike.  You will be seated at a table amidst a spacious floor plan and promptly greeted politely with a drink order.  Then comes the salad bar, which hosts a cornucopia of fresh lettuces, tomatoes, sundried tomatoes, artichoke hearts, hearts of palm, macaroni salads, cheeses, olives, cucumbers, prosciutto, salami, smoked salmon, ceviche, and hot white fish in a delectable sauce, among other things.  There is a round, 2 sided card at your table.  Red means stop, green means go.  When you have finished plundering the salad bar booty, turn your card so green is faced up.  This begins the carnivore carousel as a parade of servers will sprint to your table with one carving station after another of meat.  Oh, sure, you can wave them off if you're not interested, but who are you kidding?  Try EVERYTHING!!!  My personal favorites are the lamb chops, the lamb tenderloin, the sausage, the filet wrapped bacon, and the #1 - the top round - I order everything medium (did I mention that they ask you how you'd like it prepared?  And then they bring bottom round, garlic beef, chicken wrapped in bacon, ribs, center cut sirloin, rib eye, and probably a couple more that I can't remember.  Everything is tender and juicy, fresh, well seasoned, and fit for a king.  You are also served polenta cake, fried bananas and mashed potatoes, also never ending.  You may also request sauces - I'm particular to the mint jelly and the creamy horse radish, though they offer others.  And don't forget dessert - the cheesecake tastes like it was shipped in from New York that day.  GO FOR LUNCH!!!  It's only $29 at lunch time, $19 for just the salad bar, kids 6 and under FREE, otherwise $14 for kids.  A small king's ransom, but worth every penny and then some.  Then go back to your castle and nighty night.  Please don't behead your wife.

8bUurIk_bS26wZeIMumjDQ.text: This is my favorite steakhouse in town right now. Maybe not the best but right now it is my favorite because of the amount and quality of food you get for the price. They also have an amazing wine selection. The service is great and I don't know if it gets any better as far as a meat selection! Love this place. The Beef ribs are by far my favorite!

PQWrHhX4D6tOsOI2JgUBcA.text: Really nice place. I will definitely come back and recommend this place. The servers we're so attentive and were always asking if we needed more drinks or anything else. It was so nice to see such hands on waiters. Salad bar was nice. My husband and I along with our kids had a memorable expirience. We drove an hr just to check it out. I'll be driving back!

bRPPZm2UWwwHZXwHktV5DA.text: For my second time to Fogo De Chao, I was once again pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of the food. This steakhouse is unlike any other dining experience you will ever try. Our servers were Luigi and Chris. They were the most attentive and personable servers I've ever met. They made my date and I feel as though we were in their home for a private dinner. Marco the manager definitely cares about the service and quality of this restaurant and knows the business from bottom to top. We are making this place at least a monthly dining affair.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tres leches cake

QuvWmNaJ64XWajl8Zb-3IA.text: This place is the greatest steakhouse I have ever been. The service is prompt and the attendants are kind and more than willing to serve. They go out of their way to make your experience one to remember. The meats are incredible and the endless salad bar is phenomenal! I cannot explain how incredible this place is, if you want to experience what luxury is please spend the extra money and do it right.

yG-sQ5mpRFNkjaAXCBzPhA.text: If you are a big fan of meat, this is the place for you. A constant rotation of meat servers walk around and offer you various cuts and you decide to accept or pass. The quality was very high, and cooked to anyone's liking. There is also a charcuterie bar that you can enjoy prior to embarking on a full blown meat coma!

2t1sHp7WssNmzQQSzQuAhQ.text: Fogo de Chao, Scottsdale, Az is a chain restaurant which has first class meats, chefs, gauchos (servers who cut the meat to order at your table), ambiance. You will enjoy everything except the check.  My favorite is the beef rib and the picanya.  Would recommend for those meat eaters with deep pockets.

I4usslajiNqV5SryHbPfhg.text: The food and service are top notch. Great experience. Great atmosphere as well. Highly recommend. Would definitely come here again.

ZcFnIhS8_2ayNufqAtjPfg.text: One of the best meals I've had.   50 per person well worth the price.  All food had great flavor. Fried bananas were amazing.  Salad bar was amazing.  Bartender was great.  Gave us a great wine suggestion and very friendly.  Can't say enough great things about this place.  Planning my next visit already.

mF-HiV_coi97Wph4Mil8VQ.text: man I had to drop them a star because who ever took the reservation was so rude and short on the phone it was a women I think it was the same women that was there when my party bit to the restaurant she had just a nasty attitude then too all the servers were nice and the food was grate but it that was my 1st time call I would if never went I'll be back hopefully I won't vet her again

12WY5NNBQ5hzkTCmtxieaQ.text: The first problem started our reservation. We had one for 6 and were not seated until 6:40. In our reservation we clearly stated we had 6 people, plus an infant. They did not have a table ready for us.   The service was great in the beginning and the people with meat came often. After about 40 minutes, they pretty much stopped coming around even though the green coasters were turned. My brother watched the baby at first and didn't really eat the first 40 minutes, so it was annoying how they just decided to stop coming around. On the bright side, our drinks were always full and very prompt with offering us fresh plates and keeping the table clean. They kept their delicious bread coming - which was a plus   We asked for a check and waited another 30 minutes for it to finally come around  Most of the meats were tasty and cooked well.  The salad bar leaves something to be desired. They need more options. At 50$ a person, it is pricy. I'll take my chances at another location next time I want a Brazilian steakhouse.

9uNZXvfoVzdt3ori8hhyQg.text: We had high expectations for our visit and we're disappointed. Food was great but we expected the service we have had at other similar venues and we're disappointed. The meat servers were slow to come and we had to continue to ask for the meat we preferred as well as clean plates and table foods to be replenished. Other tables seemed to get more attention so maybe it was our service area. Was a big event for us with out of town family. Disappointing.

3eoXD4lAxDJ6kL9_jMoxbQ.text: We've had something similar at a "Mongolian" bbq joint down in Florida and it wasn't all that great.  So the wife I don't think had high expectations.  I was looking forward to this meaty delight as I'd heard good things.  Arizona Restaurant week provided a good opportunity to get out and sample this fine establishment.  As it turns out...this is what I was seeking.  The service by the staff that puts the food in front of you was great.  As we grabbed a table at the bar waiting for our buzzer to buzz in less than a minute we had a basket of cheese stuffed bread in front of us.  It was good.  The salad bar was good also.  Tried to go light on that to save room for the delightful meet onslaught that was to occur in the near future.  Notables were the potato, chicken, and apple salads.  All very good.    Now...flip the card over from red to green..and the staff that are running around every few minutes with different cuts of meats will drop by your table and ask you if you want some of what they're carrying.  It's an awesome site...seeing multiple filets skewered and getting hunks sliced off from whichever ones are cooked to your preference.  ...and let us not forget about the bacon wrapped fillet pieces also.  Some of the most flavorful things you will ever taste.  My wife isn't as much of a steak person as I am and she loved them.  The bacon-wrapped chicken was very good also.  The lamb also, very tasty.    The dessert was good also.  Wife had what was a pretty good piece of cheesecake if I recall correctly.  My key lime pie was also pretty good (not the best key lime I've had...but pretty good).  The "bad":  This could've been 5 stars.  There were 2 things that kept it from being so (one that bugged me more than my wife, and the other that really irked her and bugged me a little too).  1.  The AZ Restaurant week ad for this says "During restaurant week guests will also choose from a selection of 12 decadent desserts." for the 3rd course.  We were given a choice of 3.  Cheesecake, Key LIme Pie, or a Chocolate cake.  I'm always irritated by False advertising.    2. The service was spectacular by all of the chefs.  It was great in general, until it was time for the bill.  We were beginning to wonder if they wanted us to eat for free.  We were waiting for over 15 minutes since they cleared our table for the bill.  At least 10-15 after someone had told us they would check on our bill.    So Fogo...you almost had 5 stars.  I cannot complain about the food though and the service in getting it to our table.  That part of it was great.

xOvsukRpYa4Dg0PRrF3hNg.text: Meatgasm.  Meat.  Meat.  Meat.  Why thank you, Brazil!    This is a man's paradise.  Beautifully cooked and seasoned meat and all you can eat.  The first dude to flip his card to red is a sissy.  Don't make plans after you eat here. You'll be so full are you likely to pass out in the parking lot.  Brilliant!  My favorites include the filet mignon with bacon and the ribeye.  The mashed potatoes and plantains are also great!  The salad bar is nice too, but skip it and eat all the meat you can possibly fit in your belly.  The first time we came here some doofus refilled my Mai Tai with iced tea.  Before I could let my complaint roll off my tongue, there was a manager there to correct the problem.

nch5OBdWoSKzWRx5DipCYg.text: I came to this place for my birthday celebration with my fiance and another couple. I was definitely in a good mood.  THE FOOD  First, the salad bar. I am not much of a veggie lover, but the selection here is impressive, especially in light of this being a place where you eat the cow, not the cow's food. Besides a variety of veggies and dressings, you have a few cold cut meats, cheeses and smoked salmon to select from. From personal experience, tomatoes are good, all cheeses and meats are too. Salmon was simply delicious.  For the main course, it's all sorts of meat, mostly varieties of beef plus lamb and chicken. I liked all of them, but most of the beef was a salty to my taste (hence the loss of a star). Some of it can be explained by my getting the first cut off the meat several times, which meant that I got the salt seasoning in addition to the salt in the meat.  That aside, the meat is high quality and the main objective here is to remember not to get too much too soon, so you can enjoy everything the place has to offer.  Sides were small (as they should be) and included polenta, mashed potatoes and fried bananas. All good.  The wine selection is extensive and from our limited tasting, quite good. We had Cabernet and malbec.  SETTING This is a rather large stand alone restaurant, but has surprisingly personal feeling, especially if you consider the amount of staff running around. It is not too brightly lit and has generally darker tones to the interior. There is also a cozy bar to the side of the main entrance that is a pleasant place to wait for others to arrive.  SERVICE Attentive and not at all pushy.  OVERALL I came here in a good mood and left in an even better mood and feeling like a python after eating a cow. Which was close enough to True amount of food in me. Highly recommend this both for the experience and the food itself.

fVYlBdWR_gwnQM6Ac-Vl0g.text: All you can eat great quality food. Make reservations online or you will wait forever. Really crowded. Some of the meats were a bit seasoned and overcooked. Try the cheese bread they bring, so yummy!

zZ01ikSMq8jdC7WgGcIrLw.text: Always great food... love the lamb chops and the beef rib.... yum.  Great salad bar too.  Service was good and Lou was great!  We went for lunch and did not need dinner later  ;)

z2lUNtSQjyZok9sQitkNkQ.text: If you like fine dinning then you will love this place...they walk around with all different kinds of cuts of meat and chicken ect... If ur full flip this card they give you that is red on one side for stop and green for keep the food coming and you WILL be impressed...service was beyond exceptional I couldn't help but to be blown away, very unique place

lo9-1Ci650gyELfyyYHxJg.text: Overpriced. Meat is what they do. They constantly bring by different meats so you won't go hungry. The portions though are so small, I doubt very many people ever get their moneys worth. Oh well. The service is good but not good enough for the price you pay. For the money, I'd rather go to a  good steak house.

MucE_QfX6WrrA1qj5NIQHw.text: Don't fill up on the Salad Bar.  These are great words of wisdom that a friend gave to me many years ago before I went to the Fogo de Chao in Washington D.C.  Good advice.  I eat my salad after the meat.  Meat is the main reason to go to Fogo de Chao.  And it was not disappointing.  But, be sure to vocalize what you want.  Tell the individual with the large sword of meat that you prefer yours Rare or medium rare or burnt.  They will find that for you and bring it to you.  Here it was no exception.    My one complaint was that we ordered a magnum of wine off of the wine list.  After a few minutes, the waiter came over and said they were out of that magnum but here was another that was equally as good.  I asked if the price was the same.  No he answered.  It was $50 more.  I called over the manager, Ryan, to complain.  Ryan admitted that they had been out of that bottle for over a week.  He did not have an answer as to why they couldn't have printed up a new wine list with their laser printer.  And Ryan was somewhat offended when I told him I felt like they were trying to up sell me the other bottle of wine when they didn't offer it to us at the price of the wine that they didn't have.  That said, after Ryan and I discussed the matter we were able to work out an acceptable resolution.  But really, in this day and age of computer inventory and laser printers, can't you have a wine list that is up to date?   That said, we had a great meal.  Meat delivered the way we like it and a cool refreshing salad at the end.  Perfect!  Thank you for a great dinner.  We look forward to your new San Diego location.

IJ8vhHRCwtEthbSetKEiAw.text: Unlimited steak!  Yes this place is a dream come True, although it is an expensive dream, it is worth every penny.  If your going to buckle down and spend a few bucks, I would highly recommend Fogo de Chao.  Once you are seated, there is no wait, the food comes immediately.  Filet Mignon, Parmesan Pork, Top or Bottom sirloin (Yes there is a bottom sirloin), Rib eye, etc.  They bring you steak until you can't eat anymore.  They also bring you unlimited mash potatoes, cheesy bread, and fried bananas.  Not only is the food top notch, the service is a well.  I don't think i've ever been there and had a rude or incompetent server.  I don't think i've ever left with out a bulging belly, and a food coma!

RXxeINkDHC8q33PISdBbTw.text: I have heard great things about this but we didn't have a good experience.  We went for my birthday(3/29 8PM). We were seated quickly (in a back room) and the 1st server was pleasant. That's where things went wrong. While we went off to the salad bar, we were told bread, water, etc. would be brought to our table. We returned 10 mins later, no water, no bread, no server to be found. Eventually, a young server happened upon our table and was surprised we had no bread, water or PLATES. Went off to see too it. Another 3 or 4 similar visits and someone else asked us if we needed something. I said, yup, water, bread and PLATES (we still couldn't have any of the meat coming around as we had no where to put it) and a manager.  The manager arrived and asked what we needed and, well, yeah, had to point that out to him too as if it wasn't pretty clear we had no plates after 20-25 mins sitting there with nothing to do but toy with the salad scraps.  Off he went.... more time passed and eventually we got the water, bread and some plates bit by bit. One would think he would have quickly resolved this but nope. BTW Skip the bread or whatever those round balls of doughy things were in the basket.   The meats.... most of them were dry and they cut pieces off the outsides which were hard crust. There were two that were fairly good (rib eye and top round) and my dinner companion enjoyed the pork encrusted with parm. By the time we were situated, the servers had stopped making the rounds in the back two rooms.  Most everyone left  One most interesting things was at one point, our "server" (young maybe 20s I swear his picture is the one in the additional tips for the business offered...get rid of him) that was supposed to bring a plate was so busy chatting and flirting with a couple at another table (he was there a good 10-15 mins and over and over - taking a business card from the female) and the rest of the "servers" who were not making the rounds with meats were grouped in a bunch talking... it was a wonder the "manager' didn't make some effort to stop the behaviors.  The server with the plate in his hand finally managed to drop it in front of me without even looking down at us or saying a word before running back to his discussion across the room.  Me, I would have fired him on the spot as it was THAT BAD.  Salad bar - lame at best. It looked nice but not really much to speak of for such a huge place that is high-end price-wise. For instance, the tomatoes were a main item - they shouldn't have been served they were so under ripe - just one example.  Sides -  Slapped down like an after thought on our table - Mash potatoes that were horrible - had to be from freeze dried. For that matter, the mash potatoes from freeze dried at the market are better by a factor of 10.  What's with you  Fogo de Chao!  Honestly, I can't imagine that the review I saw here relate to the food in this place. Just because they have a lot of different meats (17 we were told) does not make a place a good value or the food well prepared.   I could not WAIT to get out of there and wrote "HORRIBLE SERVICE" on the check. My comment was we could have eaten at one of the very best steak places in the valley for the same price range compared to this horrible service/food that was equal to a buffet line and meat that shouldn't have been served in 9 times out of 10 samples we had. I left with a greasy feeling in my stomach.  The worst highlight - sitting without plates for 15-20 mins. and the manager having to be asked if he saw anything particularly wrong with that.  Sitting there in an almost empty room (3 tables out of 20) and NO servers coming around. Watching one of the waiters talk to a female guest at a table for what seemed like all evening at various points - I hope she has a job for you because if your management sees your behavior, hopefully, they get rid of you before they lose any more customers.  Keep in mind that this is not a 2 dinners for $20 special. This is a $50 a person plus extra's Scottsdale higher end eatery.  Although, it was worse than Applebees and that is saying A LOT.  NEVER again.

yRwYUp5Oz4hLkKsrlJAhvg.text: A friend of mine recently invited us to join for his birthday dinner at Fogo. My initial thought was "what am I going to be able to eat here?!"  but was assured that their salad bar was "banging".  So, alas we arrive and the woman and I hit up the bar while we waited for our peeps.  She got a really great dark beer and I tried to go outside of the box and ordered a melon martini.  It was terrible, but I didn't want to send it back cause it was kind of my own fault.  The bartender, however, noticed my full glass and asked if there was something else he could get for me.  Thank you sir!!!  I got a glass of Malbec instead, and it was great.  Our friends arrived, and we were seated.  It was like a whirlwind of craziness after.  Our server twirled on over and explained super fast how the place worked and what it was all about.  He went around asking what we all wanted to drink, and when he got to my lady, he called her sir...annoying.  She clearly is a woman.  Whatev, stuff happens sometimes when you're high on meat fumes.  After he was done with our drink order, we all got up to grab some salad.  Now, I know that this place is a meat house, but if you're gonna charge me 23 bones for my salad bar, please, make it great!  I grabbed some lettuce and started walking around to see what else I wanted.  There were these huge asparagus piled high, so I grabbed a few.  Then I grabbed some green beans, huge beet slices and broccoli, too.  I went to the dressings and was kind of disappointed.  There were ranch, caesar, and what looked and tasted like zesty Italian from Kraft. Boo.  Everything looked really good, but nothing was seasoned at all.  I mean, I appreciate being given the option to season my own items, but plain bland everything?  I want some flavor people!    Once seated, meat on sticks came from every direction.  It's kind of funny to watch.  Two of my dining companions ordered limeades, and no joke, had to ask for refills from multiple people (at least four times!) before someone came by with a pitcher.    The boyfriend of the birthday boy decided to propose that evening, and asked them to please bring the ring out on the dessert plate, and they did so very well.  I'll give them a star for that.  It was cute and sweet, both literally and figuratively.  I just ordered an after dinner coffee for my dessert, and everyone seemed please with their treats.  Ugh, then when it came time to pay, we decided that I would put $100 on my card and the rest was in cash.  When someone FINALLY came by to pick up the bill, I explained this.  He looked very confused. So, I repeated "Just 100 on the card and the rest cash." Simple enough, right?  Not so much.  It literally took about ten minutes for someone else to bring our monies back and when they did, the guy used all the cash and put the remainder of $61 on my card (I'm just glad is wasn't more than what I asked him to put on)...but still, I serve bro! It's not hard to do!  I was completely underwhelmed by my experience here and do not plan on returning.  At least I won't suffer from any meat sweats.  NEXT!

z1RDkom-1Czg6qRdpsulHQ.text: This restaurant is located by My sister's Closet in North Scottsdale. This is the typical Brazilian steakhouse, except there's no grilled pineapple! I was greatly disappointed. Nevertheless, I did enjoy the display of circling skewered meat. My top favorites are the house special, the pork sausage and the garlic sirloin. Other than the parade of delicious meat, there is also the salad bar. Even though I enjoyed the different cuts of meat, after I've stuffed myself, I can't recall what I've ingested. If you're ready to be stuffed and experience food amnesia, this is the place to go.

vU9upCyicRlVv8ImTwHRbw.text: My husband and I recently celebrated our 14th Wedding Anniversary at this restuarant with several of our friends back in September. The food was fabulous! The ambience perfect! Nice bar area too! We went during restaurant week so it was super busy! Our waitress began to slack a bit and we had issues at the end of our meal, but the Manager on duty quickly resolved things for us! This Manager went above and beyond to make us happy and ensure that we would be repeat customers! We will! Thank you Fogo de Chao! We will be dinning there in 2 weeks! Our friends from CA will be joing us! We are looking forward to another wonderful dinner!  Thank you Pamela,

_4juR0Ha7b7cz9utZMiEvA.text: Ok, what to say that everyone else hasn't already said...  Found this place by accident.  I've been to many, many Brazilian steak houses and they all have one thing in common -- they are slow.  Every few minutes someone comes by with something new, which is cool, but you get full pretty quickly and then you're done.    Not here.  Here you get an avalanche of perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned meat.  Honestly, the salad bar is epic, but why waste the stomach space?  Go for the meat.  You will not be sorry.  I'm going there again tomorrow night for my anniversary and I can't wait.  Neither can she :)

WxJbZqIds1woqA4eSAgOAw.text: I have been to forgo in Beverly hills, San jose, and las vegas and this location is by far the best.  Excellent service, ambiance and fresh food.  This is one of my favorite restaurants in the US. Make sure you stick with the higher end cuts of meats, filet, lamb chops, and beef ribs.  Don't fill up on breads, chicken hearts, chicken legs, and pork.

63Fp4S91wjVVnMpgMb_h6g.text: Nothing special, great service and lots of meat. The chicken was a little dry and meat was "okay". I'm a beef connoisseur and was not impressed with price of the food compared to the quality and taste of the meat. If I pay $170 for me and the wife to eat dinner (and bottle of wine) I expect to be blown out of the water.

HS1wF3F0DHyWRZMflvKTcg.text: I've had two experiences at Fogo.  One with a very large party and one with a party of four.  Both the service and food were consistent.  For anyone new to Fogo, it's a fixed price (about $45) for salad bar and all you can eat meat (beef, pork, chicken, lamb).  Start with salad bar (save room) and flip your little card to green when you're ready for meat.  A parade of servers will offer their wares, say yeah or neah and wait for the next.  Flip card to red when you don't need service.  Salad bar is fantastic.  I can't resist the smoked salmon, mozzarella balls, and apple salad.  In fact, on my second trip, I loaded up so much from the salad bar, I skipped the meat entirely.  I'm also particularly fond of the polenta and bread (which is more like a popover).  Based on my first experience, some of the meat offerings are better than others.  But since you can have as much or as little of anything as you would like, try everything.  I can also recommend the papaya cream for dessert.  Don't worry you won't have room.  It's light enough that you can make room.  As far as service, it is excellent.  As soon as you flip that card to green, servers are there.  The only complaint on both visits is that they do ask if they can bring you a particular cut of meat, and then they don't follow through anyway.  It's not like you'll go hungry, but it can be a little annoying.

lBT80k6fWi6S8wHpMIEcng.text: It is an OK meat place. The service is sometimes average and sometimes outright incompetent. Our drink order was lost several times, extra fried bananas never showed up. In addition, this particular Friday night was a magnet for parties with screaming babies strategically placed in such a way to disturb everybody.

1xP9-tHTxV70_ibEea3j7w.text: We were so disappointed!  We were on vacation in Scottsdale and wanted to try a Brazilian restaurant.  It was nothing like the one we have had home.  Actually it was completely worse than all three Brazilian steakhouses we have close to home.  I tried about 12 different meats and I think there were only 2 out of the 12 that were tender.  The rest were over cooked or hard as a rock.  We really wanted to love this place as I kept trying more and more of the meats as they came around hoping the next one would be better.  Besides being hard, the meats didn't have much flavor.  The salad bar was okay and I don't know that I would even pay the cheaper price to just eat from their salad bar.  This is sad that I have to say the highlight or our meal was the fresh bread and salami slice you get at the salad bar.  :(

QWWxBpeYziDyZO9RKRmcog.text: Always enjoyed Fogo, since going to one in LA.  This one is a bit less, as they do not have the same selections -desert, wine, salad bar -- as the LA location.  Went to the LA location about 14 times.  Otherwise, meat and service are quite good, and a very nice experience.  I have been to this one twice now, and sometimes the servers are better than others.  Also, sometimes the pacing can be a bit weird -- too many at once, vs the normal one at a time.

CC0-wmEJ4BjEr02h84SRcw.text: OMG!!!! This was my first time at a Brazilian steak house and this was beyond my expectations. Everything about this place was fantastic!!! The whole on off indicator was very cool. If it's your first time there they explain how everything works. Starting off with the appetizer buffet area to actually getting the whole deal with all the different types of steaks. You have the choice of picking rare, medium or well done. The whole dining experience was outstanding!!!! I can't believe we have a location in La I can't wait to go back!!!!! Thank you for the amazing experience.

dC1ymj0MvtUJ8SN7L1xWqg.text: excellent restaurant a little expensive but it is very good attention quite good, they have no staff or anything special to celebrate a birthday

9UXfm3vWrmCjHCzaBFGeKA.text: Have been coming here for special occasions for the last 8 plus years...never disappoints. The admission price is steep per person, but unlimited meat and great service make it well worth the price of admission. Also the only place I know of that makes good lamb chops. Try the limeade too!

tcD5RCuobSryOTEQIV4OoQ.text: If you love meat, you should come to Fogo de Chao.  Many different cuts and preparations of many different meats - beef, pork, lamb, chicken - are offered continuously.   Someone is always stopping by your table with something new.  The  meats also come with interesting but filling side dishes, so pace yourself so you can eat the meat, which is the main event.  I have also skipped the meat on occasion and gone just for the salad bar, which is excellent and full of good things - not typical American salad bar items.  I was happy with it.  This place is not cheap but it's highly enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad bar

gDNyZU1q2f4IHab43rBR6Q.text: This place is just awesome! Friendly faces when you walk in. It's dressy, but you can come casual and no one makes you feel awkward. Fantastic service and the best part is the salad bar is packed with fresh goodness!! Which means you can start eating soon after you get seated.  Once back at your table fresh cheese bread, mashed potatoes and some kind of fried banana (which tastes unbelievably great) is waiting for you! Then the most wonderful thing happens... Chiefs start to bring a variety of Hot sizzling meats and cut you off a slices of heavenly happiness just the way you like it! The GM is always kind to my little ones and make us feel at home each time we come! This is truly a First Class operation.

S7_VvWuV4YEaS2DrL7I5kQ.text: So much delicious food! Lots of variety. I like that you can mix up your meats instead of committing to one. Friendly waiters. They were very attentive and polite. Was recommended to me as a romantic place for dinner, but I wouldn't say that. We had one issue with getting multiple checks because you have many different waiters (only thing I didn't like), but they made things right without us even complaining. I really appreciated that. I definitely will be back here again!

QlPMxMm5MMZ6NcxiDpdFLw.text: AMAZING SERVICE AMAZING FOOD amazing experience!  This was our first time here and it did not disappoint! We went on a Sunday afternoon with a party of 6 and was seated right away with no reservation. It did get busy though right after we were seated so I do recommend to call ahead of time and make a reservation .  They have these like circle cards that you turn around to green when you want the waiters to come around with meat and when you want them to stop just turn it over to red !   Their limeade is to die for! It's super fresh and taste like no other limeade I have tasted before .   They have all kinds of meet from chicken , filet , lamb , sausage everything ! And it's all you can eat too ! So come hungry! They also have a salad bar where they have potato salad chicken salad veggies fruit etc   Also if you want a fresh plate because all the meats are blending together just ask !   Definitely worth every cent!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Their limeade was amazing ! So fresh and refreshing!

trqx5ro5JDFHznoM9A0C8A.text: After a friend and I tried the other Brazilian steakhouse in Peoria, I wanted to bring my husband to try it. We were near Scottsdale today so we tried FOGO. I have to say, what an experience! This place is fantastic! The salad bar way outshines the other steakhouse. The food was excellent and service great. There was a small hiccup with the sides that come with the meal. They apparently were forgotten. By the time they were brought to our table we were done with our meal and ready to leave. I spoke to the manager and we were more then happy with the outcome! I would definitely come back to this place and I highly recommend it!

8uhgx-t9HwXwlLE-Lf1kBg.text: Awesome service & amazing food. Salad bar is excellent. I came here last night with my business partners and had to bring my son back for lunch today! Tayson, Nick and Gilbert took great care of us. We'll be back soon!!

91e1RwBxVdOk5LKrx1Dv8A.text: This place is definitely an experience ! I'm not the biggest meat lover but my husband was in heaven. Probably one of  the best restaurant service I've had!

7GkZtfZ-NDdYnsejuHlRpg.text: Deliciousness - 4.5/5 Happiness 5/5  I am often too critical. So say my friends about movies and my wife about, a lot of stuff. But here's a place that I can't really find anything to complain about except myself (OVERATING ALERT is in effect here big time).  I love Brazilian steakhouses. For those that don't know what it is, its an all you can eat restaurant with salad bar (including soups, salads, cured meets, smoked salmon, various cheeses) shared sides for the table (potatoes, a cheesy bread, polenta, and mashed potatoes) and the STAR of the show - a variety of meats carved tableside. You turn a coaster to green and the meats keep coming in. You turn a coaster to red, the meats stop.   First, i LOVE the place. GIANT wooden doors. A huge room with beautiful tables. Literally an army of wait staff to serve you. I ordered a bottle of wine for the first time there recently and while mega-expensive (like wine at all restaurants), the servers were quick on the pour and didn't drop even a splosh on the white tablecloth (better than I can say for myself).  LUNCH is a great deal - you get almost the entire dinner menu for roughly half the cost. Just don't plan on eating dinner!  The salad bar alone is sumptuous enough, and I have had to learn not to fill up there beforehand since what I want is the stead, lamb and chicken (they also serve pork as well - I can't eat pork).   The one thing to know is that you need to be aggressive in asking for some of the meats. Notably, it takes a few tries to get the beef ribs and the lamb chops, both of which are absolutely worth the hassle to get them to bring out.   The only other thing to watch out for is the price - you get the bang for your buck, but the bucks accumulate VERY quickly here. Still I've never left unsatisfied, unless by my own hand when I've let myself become overstuffed!

LVt3ul0u1ZVxbTZjtxqN2w.text: Always upscale Scottsdale dining with a beautiful environment, presentation, service, as well as beautiful people.  Impressive salad bar that has plenty of meats and cheeses as well as smoked salmon, prosciutto, candied bacon, plus soup, beans and tenderloin.  The grilled and marinated meats are mostly juicy and brought to your table that are sliced off the skewer.  Very filling and impressive, you can choose the salad bar or both.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gauchos bringing grilled meats cut tableside
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Included fried plantain bananas
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gauchos bringing grilled meats

7jwOrf5VbkZgh_EmdYlANg.text: We have been here twice now and We both really liked it the second time we brought friends and the service was less consistent that the first time but we had a lot of people check on us. I hate that I have to ask for ribs but love that they make it happen as soon as you ask. I also really like the chefs table and could probably eat enough there and never need all of the food to follow. It's definitely a welcome change to the average dinner out. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the meats are sometimes very dry, lamb in particular is over cooked and when I asked for some that was more rare, they brought me the same stuff. Also would like to see consistency in the quality of service.

ARsnzRN8FT4cYP08Z0MQqw.text: Wow what a spread.  At $52 a head for dinner, it is a bit pricey, but the meal and service were fantastic.  I feel like I would be leaving a 5 star review if the price for dinner was priced at $40 or less.  My wife (vegetarian) was able to enjoy just the salad bar but at $27, also a bit pricey.  The food was exceptional.  My favorite cuts they brought to the table were the Ribeye, New York Strip and the bacon wrapped Fillet.  The servers were very accommodating, asking what I would like served if I passed on options like sausages or chicken.  The Salad Bar was also awesome, several items to choose from.  The Mashed Potatoes, Fried Polenta and cooked bananas side dishes were also all welcomed, just ask your server if you'd like more of anything as they are also included with your meal.    I'd be interested in trying Fogo for lunch if the price is more affordable than dinner time.

Fgeyn_keGEcH5NkX4pXusQ.text: This is our favorite restaurant, bar none.  Discovered it first time in Baltimore in 2013. Since then it is our go to place for celebrations. Yesterday our son graduated ASU with his masters in engineering!  You know what they say, go big or go home. That's right we FOGO'd it!!  Our waiter, Claudio, was amazing.  Very attentive to our party of 8.  The food was amazing and the service top notch!!  Five star evening!!
