Phc_N34O8xXR9zT9t7lVEw.text: Yummy is what I would describe it. The salad bar was the one that really sold it to me. 5 stars to them! I recommend!

qCVBO7lW_AxL90i5j3m-uw.text: The food is tasty, but you are rushed to hurry up and eat. The meat does not come out very often so you honestly don't get a lot of meat. Very expensive for the bright lit atmosphere, rushed service and the casual attire of all the patrons. Bathroom was extremely dirty.

yblKdUswmg3d8LOkNb87TQ.text: Worst service ever! You pay so much money to have a nice meal and they just give you cheese & salad bar, MEAT NEVER IS SERVE!!! we spend there 2 hours trying to get some nice meat and service was the worst, is I did eat 4 different types was it, besides, I order a drink they did bring a different one and told me it was ok they weren't going to charge it and they will bring the right one, 5 min later they come and ask me to take my glass because customer service guy told them I can't drinking if I won't pay for it (THEY MADE twice mistakes, first letting me keeping the drink telling me they won't charge it and then taking it from me because someone else told them too) so rude and unprofessional!! I'm very disappointed because we travel a lot and we have been in other great fogo de chao restaurants before. I'll never visit this one again 150$ bill for cheese and salad THANK YOU!!!

ShTl40CBOLWyIhqkdklDeg.text: They can take all of my monies. Alll of my monies. The amazing salad station. The really cool waiters wearing boleros bringing around skewers full of high quality meat cuts down to the delicious wines served. Worth the $55 per person. Every time I come here I feel at home. I feel loved and wanted and just happy. This place has the best customer service around. Tips Come hungry. Do not fill yourself up at the salad bar. Ask for small portions so that you can properly sample everything before going heavy on what you really want. Lastly? Make room for dessert!  One more thing, make the reservation. You do not want to get stuck waiting an hour to be seated... oh yeah, They have beautiful restrooms. And a bar area. Also they valet your car. Huge plus!

rx20BtMRo0asAekItKiYeQ.text: I'm being generous to give 3 stars.  2.5 would be more accurate when I weigh the value of the experience against the price. The base charge per person was $53.  Add a couple of drinks, a dessert plus tip and the bill was close to $200 for two. For that,  one would expect a great meal, not just a good one.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.   The salad / anti-pasti bar was really good.  What you are really paying for is an opportunity to gorge on various meats. Most were good. None great. Some quite weak (briny chicken legs, ho hum lamb chops).  If I'm up for a $90 pp meal, I'm going elsewhere.

S9OUiHZXnON0xe1l2KcF9g.text: Great food, Great Service.  The lamb was the best.  Great salad bar, but don't fill up on it.  All servers had a smile.  I will be back.  This is a great place.

NcfOgLNI8bXNvECslpPPQw.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. The service the food the ambience all of it. I've eaten at other restaurants of this brand but this is the best by far. Tender meat beautiful buffet and good wine. A tad pricy but I have gone here three times and this place has yet to be disappointing. Keep it up!

qzm1JGM9wqT3NNtnxN3NIA.text: great food however for the amount of food i eat the price is WAY to hight. definitely need to go hungry and don't fill up on the bread and salad bar items they have. we came here before for an engagement party then the last time we came was for a 40th birthday party. great place for hosting a large party. they have the back room and then we had the entire restaurant reserved for lunch for an engagement party

3MSK8WwmVl0yPD8qMo-Umw.text: This sort of place (churrascarias) actually used to be one of my favorite kinds of restaurants to enjoy. That is until I became a vegetarian about a year and a half ago... Now, as you might imagine, I don't tend to go as often. But when family comes to town to visit, I let them pick the food destinations...  So now you're probably wondering what a vegetarian could possibly eat in the midst of this parade of meat. Well, the nice thing about Fogo de Chao for me is their killer salad bar, sides and desserts... Starting a wide array of veggies at the salad bar from the hearty asparagus spears and artichoke heart cups to the selection of cheeses and crafted salads and adding on to that the fried polenta sprinkled with Parmesan, cheesy mashed potatoes and fried banana sides, I definitely wasn't going to go home hungry at the end of the night.  But the food didn't stop there for us just yet... We ended up choosing the Signature Papaya Cream and Flan desserts for the three of us to share. First, the flan...  It was very good. Rich and unusually denser that the typical flan, it had a very flavorful caramel taste. Although, if you've just stuffed yourself on a bunch of meat (or in my case veggies), it may be a bit much. The real dessert star was the Papaya Cream though. Light,  yet extremely flavorful with the added bonus of the natural digestif qualities of papaya, it was the perfect sweet ending to our meal.

sBDIzxAxj61AQF4QZFIthg.text: Disappointing..on previous visit found this restaurant enjoyable but somewhat noisy but could overlook based on the overall experience..this last visit on Saturday evening left much to be desired..the meats were overdone and you couldn't find a medium or medium rare cut..sides were not replenished unless you asked..this experience was certainly not worth the $$$ and will not see me again..too much other fine dining available in the valley

8deCvC8ipSt89y2zl7XLHA.text: My family and I decided to go here for my dad's 60th birthday. I was excited to try a new restaurant. The service was amazing! We had waiters and people with meat coming constantly so bravo on service. The salad bar was good but nothing spectacular for the price. I also didn't enjoy every meat option I had (I had 8 out of 12). I remember the lamb being disappointing. I left the restaurant extremely full but not extremely satisfied. I'm glad I tried it but honestly, this place isn't for me.

78tF0jL234zibdapcVw4Hg.text: Fantastic meal and wonderful service! Lou was the best and treated us like royalty! New salad bar outstanding!

Mdcbol67QESmD12GqmlUQA.text: Fogo De Chao was the first churrascaria I had eaten at many years ago back in Dallas. The first time you experience one, you'll understand why the eateries are near and dear to many people's hearts. At these Brazilian steakhouses, gauchos encircle your table to offer you various delectable cuts of beef, lamb, chicken and pork. The format is no-menu, single fee, all-you-can-eat extravaganza.  The price at this Fogo in particular as of this writing here in Phoenix is $42.50 per person, which is a bargain considering the amount and quality of food offered. Once you're seated, you're offered drinks and then you're free to immediately indulge in one of the most high-class 'salad bar' experience you'll ever have. Really, calling it that doesn't do it any justice.  After you've had your fill of vegetation and the like, you may begin the onslaught of meat. There is a small card that is next to you that you flip to 'green' to attract the gauchos and 'red' when you'd like to take a break. Come to Fogo expecting to practice gluttony. You will savor mouth-watering cuts of meat including fillet, top and bottom sirloin, lamb chops, leg of lamb, bacon wrapped fillet and bacon-wrapped chicken, pork sausage and ribs and others. They're all exceptional though you may like some things more than others.  There are a few words of warning. You will consume a lot of food. The meats are highly salted to bring out the most of their flavor and the beef is cooked to the rare side. In short, this is not a health food experience. This is for the meat lover in a meat-eating mood.  You can feel free to intersperse the vegetables at the salad bar while eating the meat. As well, a few sides are provided: garlic mashed potatoes, fried polenta and fried bananas. Fogo has many fine deserts though I tend to stick with the recommended Papaya Cream, which is a lighter fare after consuming pounds of meat.  As for the rest of Fogo, the setting is noisy but gorgeous. There's always a festive atmosphere about the place. With all the hustle and bustle occasionally, you might be overwhelmed and you might be forgotten about for a few minutes... unless your card is 'green'!  Overall, Fogo offers good value for money, an excellent setting and an unbeatable churrascaria experience. Probably my favorite restaurant of all time.

bTWdPG6OtKMAzxQT6OdZMw.text: I reserve leaving feedback for very few restaurants.  Fogo made the cut after last night's dinner. Each time we visit this location we are blown away with the service, quality, and quantity that feed into the entire experience. Our criticism comes from a service standpoint, if you want to read about the food...move on to another review.  We were approached later in our meal to see if we were avid yelpers  in order to provide feedback for recognition. Derek, unbeknownst  to us, was the top salesman in wines and won 2/3 of the contests they last participated in.  He was rather discontent however due to the lack of financial stability he received with the shared tips policy.   This abundance of information was provided on our first interaction with Derek as he cleared our places.  This conversation  was the only negative experience we had during our visit. Our primary server Danya was superb in everything she did. I prefer iced tea and I tend to drink a fair amount when dining out. My glass never sat empty nor did my wife's. The sides were constantly replenished. When we wanted a specific cut, Danya made it happen with a quickness at that. I don't pay decent money for a meal to hear about problems of servers, rather to be well taken care of.  Any other day without Derek would pull a 5 star review hands down, and because of Danya,  a 3 star was avoided.

WGPIpRFAkKYAF36pbI_10w.text: Definitely a great experience. Even if the service makes me bring it down a star, the food alone is worth 4 stars. The salad bar is amazing and the meat is tender and savory. If you're not sure about it 'cause of the price, it their lunch mon-thurs. it's about $12 cheaper and is worth the experience.

TB2DK9dshDtdcioy1-kNuQ.text: OMG best Brazilian steakhouse ever! Don't walk, RUN to this restaurant. An absolute must have! The salad bar is delicious, but it is really about the meat. *Sigh* the meat selection is not only great, but some of the best meat I have ever had. Their signature drink is amazing. The service was great! You will not be disappointed!

brUWl1KoslF7j6MQLCVfCw.text: My husband took me here for my birthday dinner and we were so looking forward to it until we stepped foot into the building. It was all downhill from there with very little upswing. Hostess was MIA when we walked in, not usually a big deal but with such an upscale place I guess I was expecting a greeting, oh well. She came back and seated us at the smallest table for 2 I have ever seen. Situated along the wall with a four top at our elbows and a service station at my back, literally. Ok not bad, I can work with this I guess.. Server explained the dining experience without introducing herself and was not seen again. On to the salad bar which was oh so disappointing. Luke warm, flavorless asparagus soup, caeser salad with almost no dressing or croutons on it, sad looking pineapple and papaya slices were just about all the choice we had. The potato salad was probably the best tasting thing in the whole bar. On to the meats! The best part in my opinion. Most of them were pretty rare though, read bloody, not my 1st choice but most had good flavor. Some did not. The chicken was very dry, as was the pork. The best was the leg of lamb, so much flavor and very moist. The 'fried polenta' was not polenta. It was some sort of previously frozen root vegetable not polenta. The bananas were nice and the cheese bread was pretty flavorless, not my favorite. About halfway thru the meal a server knocked a water pitcher off the service station behind us getting my back sprinkled with ice cold water. The customer service lady was very nice and offered us a free dessert. I choose the key lime pie and my husband got the cheesecake. Both were very bland. Frozen then thawed and drizzled with Lyons flavored syrup. Not worth the calories and definatly not worth the $9 most people pay for them. So very glad we had coupons for dinner because it was not worth the $109 bill without tip. Overall very dissapointed with my experience and won't be returning. I'll take Texas de Brazil anyday over this place. Don't waste your time or money here.

0S5JNiYC9V8AqHlJuNc1bA.text: Great food and lots of it!  Service was awesome!  Come hungry!  May not be the best for kids as our daughter did not enjoy the variety like us.

Q1HaVcqGhgrg6owuG59wgQ.text: This may not be fine dining but it sure is good food.  I was the first one to make fun of  people who went to this place in DC until some friends took me to the one here in Scottsdale. I am also a boo hooer of salad bars but this one was different, it had beautiful parmesan cheese, the real deal, nice charcuterie and roasted asparagas.  The meats were succulent and delicious, i love the lamb chops, the filet mignon and the signature sirloin.  The stand out was the service at this Fogo de Chao, the meat carvers were on top of their game and it turns out they are  all from Brazil and work here in the states for one year.  One of them told us that he was going to Open the Denver Restaurant and then was off to Baltimore for 2 months.  It turns out that the owners rent places for them and the share quarters around the country.  management at all other restaurants are Brazilian except the Scottsdale one.  The wait staff is composed of local college age people who have been indoctrinated into the Brazilian style of european service.  it is a delightful experience! I don't think anyone could eat here as a regular diet but a few times a year won't kill you.  I for one can't wait to go back!

ADj0A2J7eF1hUc8WCtKOcg.text: This was my first experience with a Brazilian steakhouse and I had a great time. The fresh salad/vegetable bar was very well stocked with a great variety of fruits, vegetables, and Brazilian favorites. The meat selection as they came around was very good, but I couldn't help thinking that I saw sirloin's much more often than the more tender rib selections. Lamb was a once a night occurence, so I walked away full, but thinking I missed out.on some of the better cuts that night. In addition, when we had been there just 45 minutes there was a clear message that it was time to go. I'm not used to that an a fairly expensive restaurant, especially when we're enjoying drinks, but they needed to cycle our table. Would I go back? I think I'll have to try another Brazilian steakhouse and see if I walk away feeling the same.

dl0nIFI48PDhHKF9qM2XOQ.text: Maybe because it was Valentine's Day night and it was busy... but unfortunately, I'd have to say this place is OVERRATED.  Good thing about this place is that the restaurant is located in a nice upscale area and is easily visible from the main road.  Fancy decor and high class environment.  People understand that it is upscale so for the most part everyone is dressed up.  Good ambiance for a romantic dinner.    For the food, you're paying $50 for each person for a salad bar and unlimited meat.  Now the food wasn't bad at all.  Everything at the salad bar tasted good and it was all fresh.  The meats portion really depends on how much of the different choices you like.  Being that it was my first time, I wanted to really experience what they had to offer and get a little bit of everything.  Problem with that... everything wasn't great.   I would have rather ordered a dish that i preferred and got full off that.  But instead i ate a mixture of things that liked and things that I don't really care to try again.  At the end of the day, none of the different cuts wow'ed me.    The reason I'm giving this such a bad review was the service.  Again, I'm sure it was because it was Valentine's Day but It was just horrible!  Servers come to tables with the different meat randomly and there were times where everyone had empty plates and it took a while for another server to come.  Also, some of the meat never came to our table so we had to ask for them towards the end of the meal.  At the end of the meal, they brought out our dessert twice and forgot the hot tea.  Different waiters were asking if we needed anything, but they would forget about it.  They just didn't seem organized.  Finally, we had to wait over 30 minutes for our bill.  They did apologize for it because their "system was down."  Finally, we got a bill and noticed that the 2 beers we ordered and the dessert wasn't on there.  I thought that was a nice gesture to compensate for the wait.  However, a couple of minutes later another waiter comes and tells us that we received the wrong bill!  He then gives us the correct one with everything on it.  I'm not complaining that we had to pay for what we got, but that just made them look so bad.  Ultimately, if I make reservations at a restaurant, come dressed up, and I'm paying $50/person for a so-so meal, they better be on point when it comes to customer service.  Our servers knew that it was our first time there and they did nothing for us that would make us want to come back.

lpBLr3b0FjaIakpkcqTMIg.text: For $100 I think I'd rather go to Mastro's or another steakhouse.  Service here was excellent and you definitely get a wide variety of meat options, but I only found two out of the 6+ choices tasty. The lamb leg and the bacon wrapped filet were delicious but the sausages, pork, chicken, pork/beef ribs and even filet mignon were unimpressive.  The salad bar a $22.50 upcharge wasn't exactly worth the price. Nothing stood out, and there wasn't anything amazing that I went back for seconds for.  Sides were complimentary, which included fried polenta, mashed potatoes, and fried bananas. They were pretty good, but don't compare to the lobster mash or truffle mac and cheese as Mastro's.  The ambience is definitely nice and upscale without being stuffy. Plenty of kids running around and guys with backwards facing hats on. This was my first legitimate Brazilian steakhouse experience and I think it will be my last. If  you're looking for variety go to KBBQ and you'll also leave feeling overstuffed, satisfied, and still have an extra $50 in your wallet.

vdqYFC1WhTf96N-N41WA_g.text: Not only is this a magical meat adventure, now you can partake for a weekday lunch . . . incredible!! I have been several times now and the food is always delicious and the service is always fabulous! I always look for a reason to make the drive to Fogo!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy!

13hezAn-ns3QwmU6M3bxgw.text: Came here for a dinner with my girlfriend and her father. Amazing service especially from our waiter Junior. Be sure to ask for him! He was very helpful in suggesting wine selections and his own favorites from the menu. His personality and enthusiasm really made our night special. This place is like a wine tasting but for meat. The selections are wonderful and artfully prepared. Be warned that when you flip your card to get meat, there will be a lot of it! Definitely try the lamb chop, one if not the best. Highly recommend this place for any non-vegans.

tEpNq3j2afEuAnkdAiH5Ng.text: I will never dine at this location again. I have been here, and to other locations, multiple times and this is the worst experience I have ever had. Dining at this location previously on Christmas Eve and the San Diego location during restaurant week, I know that even when they are busy the servers tend to the customers in a timely manner but tonight was completely different. We were sat and our drinks brought to us promptly but that's about where the good service ended. After that we didn't see any server for the rest of the night. No one came to ask if we would like a refill on our drinks which sat empty for over an hour. When we finished our meal we sat there waiting for our check. 20 minutes later we decided to stack our plates thinking maybe someone would get the idea. A bus boy came by to take our plates after 10 minutes or so. Still no check. The bus boy returned about 20 minutes later to see if we had been helped and went to find someone to bring us our check. The food was outstanding as usual. The customer service on the other hand was deplorable. As I was leaving I decided to speak to a manager. The gentleman that came out treated me as if I was lying to him when I explained that the whole meal not a single person came to our table besides the men bringing the various meats and that we waited for over 45 minutes after eating our meal before we received our check. He made snide comments about how that couldn't be possible and that maybe they were just too busy. He ingeniously thanked me for the feedback and walked away leaving me with no apology or real concern on his part. When the table next to us receives multiple refills on their drinks and gets their check before us when we were done long before them, there is a problem that needs addressed. All I can say is that for those of you that do choose to dine here, I hope that your experience is better than mine and that you don't have any plans for the rest of the night because you will probably be spending more time than necessary waiting to be waited on.

VYGhVS5RhcYirhHWa1knUA.text: I am a frequent visitor of Fogo and have been to multiple locations throughout the country as I make is a mission to visit each Fogo when I'm in a different state: Chicago, NYC, Las Vegas, Mexico City, and LA. This is my second visit to the Fogo in Scottsdale, Az. The first time I came here had to be the best Fogo experience I've had. Unfortunately on this lunch visit, the service was HORRIBLE. The staff which are usually so attentive we're more worried on setting up for dinner than to attend to me and my father. had to ask for a bread refill multiple times to different staff members and coincidentally every one of them kept "forgetting". I was shocked to even notice the manager was lacking. This restaurant who is known for there meat served me what seemed to be leather. The meat is usually so juicy and flavorful. I was hesitant on even leaving a $5 tip as this has to be the worst Fogo de Chao experience I've ever had. Will not be returning!! I hope no one else has an experience as worse as mine.

jwDYhtClSOZ8oRN4nm7uvw.text: Lamb chops were the best! Beautiful atmosphere, not overpriced, best Brazilian steakhouse I've been to.

0q99gQYe9BwoFoy2-qpVIw.text: Took my daughter and her boyfriend there for his birthday. Food was great, service was amazing! I can't count the numerous times we were asked if we were ok or needed anything! Everyone we encountered was attentive and worked hard to make sure we got what we needed! If you can't afford it, join the eclub. $25 off for your birthday. Then random discounts throughout the year! Thank you to everyone we encountered. There was a manager who was great! There was guy making drinks at your table! Amazing! The lady who made sure our drinks were filled. The list goes on and on! We will definitely be back! Thank you!

G25KlvFhd_Vt4KxSzNtCzQ.text: Party of 6.......Escorted to our table. Waiter began explaining the concept before we were all seated. I had to ask him to please wait until we are settled in. He apologized and walked away.....2nd waiter arrived to explain the salad bar and meat course......Salad bar did not live up to my expectations.....Back to the table and here comes the meat!! It kept coming and coming and coming!! I had to flip my card to red indicating " I'm good on meat for now". .....the meat carvers were very accommodating and professional , but after awhile the meat started to taste the same.  I'm done! Overall the restaurant is big and beautiful however I won't be back. It's more of a meat show , not a dining experience. For that reason I'm Out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IhF-ecL8BRW7S7pKGp8fMA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in AZ. Very unique experience, if you've never been. I love that you don't have a dedicated waiter/waitress. You don't get that one server in a bad mood or that's new, overwhelmed, working the tail end of a double.  They all work as a team so you get constant, prompt attention to your needs.  The "salad bar" is amazing considering I hate vegetables. It has Lox, fresh cheese, cured meats, fruit .. delicious.  The meat selections are incredible and if you seem to not have got what you wanted, tell one of the guys and they come bursting out of the kitchen right away with your request.  If you have a chance, book the private room behind the hostess stand. Well worth it. I've been at least once a year for 8 years.

kpmR2AB8LxgOX8SyGURTSA.text: This place is...weird. With such hefty prices, I was expecting something a little more elegant. It feels a bit like dining aboard a Carnival Cruise ship. There's this huge salad bar buffet with people loading up their plates and stuffing their faces with too much food. The lights are very bright at dinnertime and the tables are lined up tightly together all in a row.   But the food is very good. The unlimited gluten-free cheesy dinner rolls taste like popovers. I kept asking if they were really gluten-free because they tasted so good!  The meats carved up tableside were all delicious and the servers were friendly, if hurried.   In all, I recommend this place if you're looking for a different dining experience every once in a long while but a relaxed dining experience it is not.

4LkS_5lp3WxJgvvdKcL7uw.text: Dined at Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse Friday night for dinner and it was very tasty.  So much food and fun!  This was our first time at Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse, and we weren't really sure what to expect.  The best was I can describe it is a "meat parade".  There are so many different kinds of meat to choose from, and the market table...WOW!  We also enjoyed dessert even though we were stuffed...lol!  Looking forward to a return visit again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RfmF8RMg-gskgpyAd9HD2A.text: I would not recommend spending your money here. We made reservations 3 weeks in advance to celebrate my son's birthday and from the moment we checked in service was horrible. We sat 30 mins without one piece of meat coming to us. I had to complain to the manager, one of three I might add. Before anyone came out with the terribly unseasoned fatty piece of meat. Other than that no other food was served to us. My sons birthday dinner was ruined and nothing was done to rectify the situation. For the amount of money you are paying (which ranges from $55.00 and up per person) for an experience as they say...you would think between 3 managers they would know how to keep the food flowing and manage the dining room..absolutely terrible!

koIteCxLBs3qs5G0TRJk9Q.text: We absolutely loved it here. Its not a romantic setting, if that is what you are looking for. Many guests were dressed down and some were actually wearing hoodies and sweatpants which surprised us. We went for my birthday so I was dressed up. But thankfully, dressing up still goes with the restaurants environment. The service was noteworthy for a positive review. All servers were very kind and polite, and man do they make sure you are doing okay. The food was good. So for $54 per person, it's basically all you can eat. There is a food bar to start with. Includes salads, cheeses, soup, rice, veggies, etc. Then the meats (beef, chicken, lamb) are brought to your table upon request and served onto your plate. We got full very fast. The meats were delicious. They're signature drinks are very tasty. And they gave me a complimentary slice of cake with a candle.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tres leches cake is to die for!

xV0zXbjat2XEnOJaV-SO3w.text: Love this restaurant ,not a big fan of the salad bar , but the meat is delicious and the customer service is always good !  My whole family likes to come here at least once a month, papaya ice cream is my favorite !

H7LDL-CXC_5UjzNL5xBntg.text: I love meat.  I love it.  I haven't been here in years and came for a friend's bday.  They have amazing meat, no doubt about it. Their lamb is perfection on a skewer.  If you are a vegetarian, don't even bother.  they do offer up sides and have a huge salad bar, but I skip that.  I come for the meat. It's a prepaid meal, so you can sit for hours and eat all the meat you want.    The decor is gorgeous.  The only downfall is the nonstop constant interruption.  Now, the waitstaff is attentive, no doubt.  But even without the green 'bring meat' card, we were constantly bombarded with people coming up to us. It was exhausting and hard to have a conversation.  STill a great place to go have amazing meat.  Do not eat all day and have AT it here.

QBsYUveU8H2Djf62t5qiRg.text: Went here for a date night that's long due.. we love to Come here at least once every 6 months. The food is always excellent. You truly get more for the money you spent. You will get into food coma. I am a little disappointed with the quality of customer service that night . The hostess wasn't very nice, very stand-off ish. Not sure why but should be nicer to your guest when they come to your restaurant. Hopefully she will be nicer next time. Our bartender, wished we remembered her name, she was AMAZING!  They were slammed and yet she makes sure you are the only one sitting at the bar. Now let's chat about their signature meal which is MEAT! Lamb was so good it melts in your mouth, sirloin, chicken, pork and oh my bacon! You are intreat for every bites you take. I didn't even tell you about their salad bar! The unlimited salad bar but you don't want to fill yourself with salad because you want to eat the meat . All and all we always enjoy our time there no matter whAt. It's an experience!

cpXNv8OoD17yMN0Q4OHQyg.text: If you want to feel classy but be treated trashy eat here.  No good meat should ever be served after being walked around the restaurant.  After being served a variety of meat except the fillet i was less than pleased.  I knew it was not a classy place after one of the managers walked around and offered a buy one get one on the next visit and then offered 15 dollars off next visit if we signed up for email.  Im pretty sure the cows the meat were cut from were crack dairy cows.  Bottom line is if you enjoy to pretend your classy and you want to wear your house slippers to dinner this place is for you. Also if you enjoy paying 15 dollars for a glass of wine to which the bottles value is actually 10 dollars hot this place up.

I5SxhhUmFJNl6x-xXNaozw.text: The meats are amazing. When your turn green it's a go!!! We call it auto in, then it's rapid fire of whatever meat you can think of. When you turn red you can put your hands over your head to make room to go auto in again. It's a great date night and also a fun place to go with large parties. The mashed potatoes, caramelized bananas, and the cheese filled bread is amazing. Be careful to not eat too much of those or you won't have room for the main attraction! Meat!!! If you want to celebrate a special occasion or have a good time with a group, Fogo is the place to go.

q4VWL-ooUADqf6J0UW99fQ.text: What says romance more than a medium rare filet mignon?? At Fogo de Chao you'll find more than just steaks, but a plethora of hardy meats, a fabulous salad bar and undivided service. And I forgot to mention, it's all you can eat!  I came on weekday to avoid the rush and try out their luncheon menu since I've dined at the other locations. I made reservations via Open Table and didn't know if it was necessary but glad I did because it was busy with casual and business eaters.  At the hostess table, I checked in and was promptly escorted to a table by the wall. The server asked if this was my first time because there is a certain way to order food. When the green coaster is flipped up, this notifies the gauchos (carvers) to come to your table with the meat(s). Each would carry a long skewer ready to cut you a slice by table-side.    Once seated, I ordered our drinks and made a mad dash to the Market Table (a.k.a. salad bar) which had a huge variety of cold vegetarian options, cheeses, smoked salmon, and on the side hot dishes included a butternut squash soup, freijoda (black beans with pork) and white rice. The soup was outstanding and my favorite veggies were the pear and endive salad, the roasted veggies, hearts of palm and the quinoa tabbouleh.  Now came the highlight... the meat! I won't bore you with all the succulent description but I'll highlight my favorite cuts in order:  Filet Mignon Garlic Steak Fraldinha (bottom sirloin) Cordeiro (lamb both the rack and meat cut)  Each one of these were juicy, well-seasoned and perfectly cooked to your preference. To get through all these proteins, I always requested the small cut so I could sample and come back to my favorites.  Just when you think you're done, they also serve family style side dishes of garlic mashed potatoes, caramelized fried bananas, fried polenta and those addicting pao de queijo (soft cheesy rolls). The servers kept an eye if I ever needed a refill which was a nice touch.  Who could think about dessert? All I thought about was flipping my coaster to red!  My only problem with this location was the lack of space between the tables. I had to maneuver around the chairs and carvers when we walked to/from the Market Table.   For lunch, I highly recommend ordering the "Fogo Churrasco Experience" ($33) where you can enjoy all the variety of meats and the Market Table.   Everything about this meal hit the spot and I look forward coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Free parking
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Market table
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sides dishes: garlic mashed potatoes, caramelized fried bananas, fried polenta and pão de queijo (soft cheesy rolls)

-SDys1KQiD8lgEVxzGKS9Q.text: Very good food. They were overwhelmed with a big group so the meat was very slow and service was subpar but the food made up for it.

3QOuTv56zBIgn-gnCQlaUg.text: Horrible staff in the front. Very snobby. Made reservations and after speaking to the girl canceled. Never will come. Called after to speak to a manager. I was told they would call. Never received a call back.

CyyZAMo6KhibDJKuwFZ_ew.text: Excellent & fun place!!! Brazilian food is amazing especially from Fogo De Chao i have been to several in California & Texas, now in Scottsdale. This location is near Old Town area, expect to spend but it's worth it.  Food is excellent all the meats you could ask for. Great for group setting or Dinner date.

bZSrr6AheDYo8jaT7CeRzg.text: My family and I came to this restaurant to celebrate my cousin's wedding. I heard from all around how great this place is, so you know I was excited and eager to eat. Apon entering the restaurant the decor was beautiful, you can tell this is a very upscale place. As we were seated they had a table waiting for us and provided cheese bread which was delicious. The waiter came up to us and explained how this all works. On your table, there is a circular card which I thought was a coaster on one side was green the other red. Green indicates you are ready to be served meat and red means not at this time. You have a choice of many different types of meats, a salad bar and sides of rice, beans etc.  As we made our way to the salad bar I was very unimpressed with the very minimal choices they had for an all you can eat salad bar. Being an upscale restaurant I expected so much more. Some of the items on the salad bar were not even labeled so I had no idea what they were. As we made our way back to the table and flipped our card around the meat started coming our way. They have many different choices pork, chicken, beef, etc. As I was trying the different meats only a few stood out. The bacon wrapped chicken and parmesan pork were my favorites. I tried several other types of meat some were too salty and others were really bland. I even asked the waiter for a specific type of meat I wanted and it never came around. At times this place can be a bit overwhelming with everything going on.  In my honest opinion, I really did not think it was worth $52.00 per person. I would have rather gone to Orange sky or Donovans and had a steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EmDCJcsSM6RnIvakF5OXZA.text: Had the absolute best meal in a long time!  The variety of meats were all delicious.  And our waitress, Anna Laura was the most bubbly and conscientious waitress.  I would recommend this place to anybody who wants to sample a variety of meats all cooked perfectly.

s44-Bac30Azf85Et9PLBOQ.text: This particular location is really nice and fancy. But I mean.. it is Scottsdale. It was my first time eating here and only knew what to expect from what friends had mentioned.   The salad bar is fully stocked with everything you may want on a salad. Its a lot of food and I was told to pace myself so I didn't get full before the meats. I enjoyed two plates of salad and was very satisfied with their selection.   The endless meats were good. The portions are small so it keeps you from over eating. Personally I thought they could be better seasoned but they were still good. The only issue was that all the servers came at once so it was easy to get overwhelmed on the meats and end up getting full faster. I asked for well done and most skewers on hand are not necessarily well cooked. When I was brought a well done piece of meat it was burnt and I didn't end up liking it.   A small bottled Coke was $3 with obviously no refills. This I can do without. Buffets should give free refills! I didn't know the pricing before coming in. Had I known it would be $115 for two people, I probably would have reconsider. It was good, the service is decent (my main server never came back), the food is delicious, like I said the salad bar was beyond what I expected. With cheese and meats plus different types of salad mix, it was really good. The meats were good.. not amazing, but good. Was it all worth $55? I don't know yet.   I'd probably come back now that I know what to expect. I'll probably starve myself all morning so I can my money's worth, though!

pENMmuMGtUencchMipfwbg.text: I believe we had reservations here, but had to wait a few minutes still for them to get it ready for us. We had a relatively large group, and were seated in kind of a back area. I was starting to wonder if we were forgotten at some points as we had to ask for several different types of meats to come by to our table. The service was good, but we've had some pretty spectacular service at other steak restaurants and Churrasscos. The food was pretty good. I think some might have been a little more overcooked than I liked but still very flavorful.

EeaNpk_-apniQHfMb4aS0g.text: Fogo never disappoints. Tried it in Philadelphia, DC and now in Scottsdale. Yes, it's pricey but it's so tasty. I'm small and don't eat much so I probably don't eat my money's worth. But who cares. It's a delicious meal. If you want delicious meat, mashed potatoes and fried bananas come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the filet mignonette wrapped in bacon and the Picanha. The Mojito was good too.

PIyUg4lXDWwPqXxJhAMAQA.text: I came here for lunch for my brother's b-day. We started off with a plate of salad. The salad bar had all sorts of different things like salami, cheese, prosciutto, salads etc. It was good and something light to eat before we chowed down on the meat!   For those of you that have never been to a Brazilian steakhouse, you should definitely try it out! It's definitely a great experience and it's an all you can eat restaurant! There's a little card that has the color green on one side and red on the other. Whenever you want the guys to come around with the different kinds of meat to your table, then you want the card to be on the green side.   So The guys come around to your table and they ask you "how you do like your meats prepared". Based on how you like it cooked, they slice a portion of it and you grab it with your tongs that's been provided at your table.   I didn't give them 4 or 5 stars because of their meats. I've been here once before which was amazing, but for some reason today it wasn't so great. I believe they have ten different kinds of meats and I swear pretty much all of them were overcooked. Some of the meats were dry and super salty because of the seasoning. Before I loved how most of the red meats tasted, but today I couldn't finish most of them and only stuck to one.   The appetizers that were brought to our table were mash potatoes, polenta, cheese bread, sugared bananas, which were okay. My favorite dish out of all of them would have to be the mash potatoes because they blended it so well! It was smooth, kinda like a pureed food.  The service was great like always and since it was my brothers bday we got the papaya cream. The papaya cream is one of their signature dessert and it's basically papaya and vanilla ice cream blended together. It's good and light!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Papaya cream
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Ny0YaSC1NKDCc5ksxTaMSA.text: A little pricy but if you appreciate a great deal of good tasting meats this is the place for you.

oJ0al379iMUgCf6atqhwdw.text: Do not...I repeat...do not eat anything the day you come here. You will need the stomach space. Hostesses were not very helpful when we arrived 15 min early and provided no instruction as to when/where to wait. We told them we would be at the bar next to the desk and they said they would get us when our table was ready. They forgot about us.   After going back to the desk for a third time, we were finally shown to our seat. If you are seated next to the wall like us, it will feel like you are in Mario Kart, dodging meat servers, waiters, chairs, and people getting up for salad. We enjoyed several of the Signature Caipirinhas, which are tangy, sweet and refreshing.   The salad bar had some really unique options and don't forget to visit the hot bar next to salad for items to accompany your meats galore. They will give you a few sides table side, including polenta (yum!) and mashed potatoes and a fries banana dessert. We appreciated the little card to signal when you want more meat or when you need a breather (and elastic pants).   As for the meats, we were overwhelmed by beef that all seemed the same. Even as beef lovers, we tended to prefer the pork, chicken (the one on the bone) and sausages. While many mention the high price, the amount of food (and expensive meats) constantly offered to your table is worth it. A bit chaotic and I doubt we will go back but a unique and fun experience to have at least once.

WrOIAV_IPrUMtXurO13XPA.text: Fogo de Chao reaffirmed that I love meat. Thank you so freaking much!  I will say that the integrated Yelp reservation system does wonders, I highly recommend it.  The meal comes in two phases: salad bar and served meat. You'll get some side dishes, and meat carvers will come to your table to offer you various cuts and cooking temperatures. They actually carve a different part of the meat block depending what you want, which I thought was really cool. Technically they're only supposed to come when the card they give you is green instead of red, but they came nonstop anyways and I love them for it.  Keep in mind with this high end service and variety of meats the meal will be somewhat expensive, around the $50 range. However, if you haven't gone I suggest you do, because this sits at my Top 5 Restaurants of all time right now.   And as much as you love meat... please don't come alone. The more the merrier, otherwise you'll just look like a sad pig rolling in the mud.

IMB7m24thAlQeiOsVddZJg.text: It was outstanding Hot and delicious! My son is in heaven! Fast attentive service and excellent Quality. Try the 15 kinds of beef.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. He&#39;s getting his protein.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fire and spit.

XIgPWKIQMndUQlSXZM3vrQ.text: We went to Fogo for the first time to celebrate my husband's birthday after it was suggested by a friend. The experience was fantastic!  The service was the perfect blend of attentive and not bugging us. If we needed something, someone was there to get it for us.   The food was delicious. The meat was obviously the star at Fogo, but the salad bar was the best I've ever had... a lot of variety with a little something for every taste.

BdKQ52VrEm6bbRNxPBYqMQ.text: I've been to Fogo De Chao a few times and each time it's been great!  This time we had reservations at 7:30 and while we were not seated until 7:50, our short wait allowed us time to learned about a great Brazilian rum.    After we were seated we indulged in an almost gluttonous dance of fresh salads and a perfectly cooked selection of meats.  Then to top the evening off Lou came by our table  to see how our evening was and we laughed and chatted with him for a few minutes.  All in all a great night at Fogo De Chao!   Thanks Lou and team!!!   We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chowing at Fogo De Chao!!!

sJVx9d6ZKsC5keMyOp5XCg.text: Ah-mazing!!! Best experience in a long time. Come hungry!! Great service, unbelievable meats, amazing salad bar, and good wine selection. Wish there was one in Sacramento!

lXsvD4mB4X83PkSQVv6yHA.text: This place is great, but Be sure to bring your appetite! The salad bar is amazing, stocked with cheeses, sliced meat, fresh fruit, a roasted beat salad, chicken salad and much more. Everything is bursting with flavor and taste fresh! Then to the main course... during dinner you are served some creamy garlic potatos, polenta and yummy carmelized plantains which are out standing. Then there is meats after meats brought around, shaved off a giant knife!  For service...the entire team is was helpful & friendly. Drinks were always full & they asked if we had meat request! Our main server Phil was FABULOUS, his recommendation of the Fogo beverages were great, he was friendly and even had a great sense of humor when we made jokes! Never would have know he just finished training, we loved him. He even asked the manager to take my daughter to see the kitchen, which was really awesome! Oh and if you're celebrating a birthday remember to save room for dessert. And one tip: avoid the bald server, he is aggressive and rude.

ROYbGbJ4aupKwwyMqJRRuA.text: Fantastic Experience, Outstanding Meat Quality, Magnificent Service, Worth every dollar.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Picanha   pea-CAN-ya

LZNet0frHyYbpF6v8LRT8w.text: Oh. My. Meat. MORE OF WHATEVER THAT LAST ONE WAS, PLEASE! Staff is ON IT! If beef was grass fed and fish was wild, it would be five star worthy. :) Applause to you, Fogo de Chao

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oh. My. Meat. MORE OF WHATEVER THAT LAST ONE WAS, PLEASE!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Staff is ON IT! If beef was grass fed and fish was wild, it would be five star worthy. :) Applause to you, Fogo de Chao

TgZD8EWaAiq6m9WR8wfqZw.text: I was so excited for my first Brazilian experience!  I couldn't take my eyes off the Churrasco (roasted meat on an open fire) which welcomes you as soon as you enter!   Taking our seat, we are graciously greeted by our server and informed of our 5 step process for an unforgettable experience: Step 1: Visit our gourmet salad and sides bar. Enjoy over 30 items including fresh cut vegetables, imported cheeses, cured meats and Brazilian side dishes.  Step 2: Turn your card green side up, signaling that you are ready for our gaucho chefs to begin tableside service.  Step 3: Choose from the 15 cuts of delectable fire roasted meats that are brought to your table, sliced, and served by our gaucho chefs.  Step 4: When you are satisfied, flip the disc to the red side until you are ready for more offerings.  Step 5: If you wish, end the meal with one of our delicious desserts  The salad bar was impressive! My jaw dropped when I saw the jumbo asparagus and tabbouleh salad! I would have been satisfied with just that, but before I could cover my entire plate with greens, I looked ahead and was the imported cheeses, artisan breads, cured meats! When we returned, we had pao de queijo (warm cheese bread),  polenta, garlic mashed potatoes and caramelized bananas waiting for us at our table!  These side dishes were delicious! It was extremely hard not to fill up on the salad bar and sides!  Ready for dinner, we flipped our card to green! The gaucho chefs were a little slow on service but our server was right there to take any request to help speed up the process! I have to be honest, we weren't a fan of most but found 2 of the 10 varieties, the Cordeiro (Leg of Lamb) and Lamb TBone, our favorite! We didn't waste our time and passed on everything else! We had about 4 rounds of the Lamb Leg and TBone!   Our server insisted we order dessert but we just didnt have room in our tummy's! He asked us to look at the menu and tell him what we would have ordered if we could, so we told him the Fogo de Chao Signature Papaya Cream.  Along with the check, he presented us a complimentary bag of the papaya cream!   Hopefully all locations provide the same food and experience we have had here in AZ!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sides
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad Bar
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheesy Bread - YUM!

HIRAS5nVRKAqbasU1yQa5w.text: This was one of the best Brazilian steak houses outside of Brazil! The service was very good and the meat was coming round at a very good pace. Dan, the manager, made sure we were happy with everything - all in all, one to try out when you're in the Scottsdale area. Not cheap but well worth the visit!

JChqv42eEUChsj3R38TWWQ.text: Great location for a family dinner. Food was absolutely delicious and the service was great. All the waiters were very attentive and felt right at home. Can't wait to come back to town and visit.

xkj2KF_HxHQQx2Dou99Pjg.text: Great service awesome food , Daniel one of the severs provided best customer service .. There was a female that had no personality but I won't let her stop me from giving this place 5 start

Qk9tavxQTlrL4MnJfB_hJg.text: 1st time visiting as part of Restaurant week. Group of 7-we were treated to outstanding service, delicious and fresh unlimited salads, veggies and other sides. Loved the table side plantains! Yummy. And of course the meat. Wow, once you turn over your card from red to green the gauchos begin rounding the table with pork, lamb, steak, chicken, and sausage. Wow. My favorite was the filet minion. As part of the price fixe service we were also treated to a free dessert. For meat lovers and low carb fanatics, this place is a must.

dUXsf9uKqhxzwCSC2iTI-Q.text: What an experience!  My second visit to a Brazilian style steakhouse (the first in Atlanta).  Had a large group of 15 people.  I wish they had given us a private room, but they did put tables together.  The food and service was top notch.  Spent about $100 per person including tip, but well worth it.  The beef ribs are the best!  A nice surprise was how good the coffee was.

VwFsddgtzgfbPxXEDFgN1Q.text: My Son and his wife had there 1st Wedding anniversary dinner here last night. I called the restaurant in the morning to see if I could take care of the bill as a surprise. The hostess said I could but would need to go to the website and buy a gift card and phone the gift card number in. It would be applied to their bill. I did this and confirmed my sons name and and reservation time. Apparently when my son got there was a note that he saw that said "anniversary" and "gift card". Great,  surprise ruined. It gets worse. He wasn't sure why it said "gift card" and didn't mention it to his wife or the wait staff.  The bill comes to $130 with no gift card applied ($150 gift card). He pays and walks out. He is wondering about it and calls my wife to ask her about it. She explains what I did. He then goes back and asked the staff what happened to the gift card. They realize the mistake and refund his money and apply the gift card to his bill. I'm definitely not happy about how this was handled. Seems like  a pretty simple process and the staff blew it.

0EG32nmAvM99MNw_eby95w.text: It was our first time here and we quickly realized that if you like your meat well done or anywhere near fully cooked, this is NOT the place for you!!! Thought we'd try it out for my husband's birthday and we were both so royally disappointed. Too bad because we had high hopes and were thoroughly let down. We barely ate anything because all the meat was still bleeding and to make matters worse, because we kept asking for well done meat no one would come back to our table!! Not the ideal dinner date, especially for a birthday!! Won't be going back...but at least we can say we tried it!!

kgUeusHaoNJ1iPQD8FT9RQ.text: I'm sorry, but a big fat MEH! I would never, never, ever, ever, pay $120 for a sirloin steak dinner, which is exactly what we got. It became a joke between me and my husband--seriously, every meat that came by was sirloin. Oh, and there was some dry chicken. And a really chewy bacon-wrapped filet (once). By the time we finished eating, we saw that there was a pork chop, some lamb, and some sausages floating around, but we were done. We sat there for over an hour and none of those meats ever made it to our table. How is that even possible?  They have a decent salad bar, but it's pretty limited, and the ranch dressing tastes like Hidden Valley. Nasty. I wish I had gone to Talking Stick, or Jasmine Palace, or even freaking Sweet Tomatoes for what I paid at Fogo de Chao! Also, the meat all had a strong gas taste, which was really unappetizing. So completely disappointing. I wouldn't go back unless it was free, much less pay what I did.

FTmIGib5jHDOjunPrDVwYg.text: Just another great meat feast!  This place is pretty consistent among its locations.  As usual, the market table (I can't call it a salad bar) is a meal on its own with excellent options not found on other salad bars.   The sides are included, with Carmelized banana, polenta, cheesy mashed potatoes and of course the gluten free cheese buns are awesome. Order a second basket, and hide them in your purse!  But it's all about the meat, cooked the way you want it, delivered to your table in a constant parade until you finally surrender and turn up the red card.   I finished off with the Key Lime Pie, rich and tasty and not excessively tart. Add in the special Caprina cocktail, and you don't need anything else--except maybe someone to carry you out to your car.

0KqmNGsPjoohvS0NEoulzA.text: The atmosphere is very energetic. The decor is nice but it has a little bit of a cafeteria feel because the salad bar is so prominent right when you come in and people are milling around the salad bar.  This is an all-you-can-eat place for 50 bucks. The salad bar is fabulous, I will say that. Tons of fresh selections and tons of variety as well. Not your normal salad bar. The salad bar could be your entire meal and a pretty good one at that.  This is a Brazilian steakhouse so you have people walking around carving pieces of steak for you. The steak was generally done to perfection depending upon how you like it but for some reason, at least half of it was very chewy. Even a bacon wrapped filet was chewy. The seasoning was quite good. A rib steak didn't come by until I was full and that's my favorite steak. I was a little disappointed at that.   The salad bar should not be the centerpiece of the meal. I expected more from the steak.

ysC1vGxGjqpAEyvAdeIUxw.text: The food was OK. But the experience was not.  I called an hour before I went and asked if I needed a reservation and the girl who answered said, No. It's pretty slow tonight. (It was a Wednesday).  I get there 45 minutes later and I walk in and she asks, Do you have a reservation? I look around the restaurant and there are at least 20 empty tables. I said, NO. I just called and you said I didn't need one.  She said, Well, sorry, there's a 30 minute wait. Maybe you'd like to sit at the bar.   Because I was with a client I did.   The bartender didn't know how to make drinks. I ran three of the biggest clubs in Boston and know dozens of bartenders. This guy at the bar was simply not cut out to be a bartender in a fine dining establishment. His drinks, including Espresso Martinis, long islands and just simple vodka soda and cran were awful.   Needless to say, two other parties without reservations were sitting bored at the bar, waiting for  their tables.   I will never, ever go back to this place. And may not go to the one in Boston ever again (which I've been to many times) because of the sleazy hostess, (black girl), who was obviously ordered by incompetent management to send people in to the bar to pad the restaurant's daily take.  This restaurant screwed with the wrong person.

u_VGIhpEMS5_dGY9HPDOXA.text: We came here for my husbands birthday.  The food, the service and the atmosphere was amazing. Nothing bad to say

0UmgMaWjYXk6srfQHQd2_g.text: Outstanding service. One of the best meals I've had! The key lime pie was better then the one I had in the Florida keys.  Most laid back upscale restaurants. Outstanding experience I've had in a long time!

e98Cs9HzHskJFWEYUII3gg.text: After many years wanting to try a Brazilian steakhouse my wife and finally jumped in with both feet and afterward wished we hadn't.  The meat is all overly seasoned to the point that you really can't taste the meat.  Salt is pretty much the only flavor I tasted from the sirloin.  In addition, most cuts were over cooked.  I wanted to try the lamb and asked for the most rare piece available - it was pretty much well done.    One thing I will say is that the staff is very good.   Too bad they didn't have quality cooked food to serve.    For the price of our dinner for two, we could have had an amazing meal at over a dozen restaurants in Scottsdale for half the price.

EqNsWzF98r4l-_Ih1z3Peg.text: I got a coupon for $25 off lunch or dinner for my birthday month through the email promos, so I got some friends together to grab lunch! FYI lunch is $30 per person whereas dinner is $50 while having the same food!  We got seated quickly , and our server Derek was very friendly and we ordered our waters and the sauces (chimichurri, horse radish, and mint jelly) for our meats later. Before I got started with meats I had to get my favorites from the salad bar: pickles peppadew peppers, orange kale salad, smoked salmon, potato salad, and butter lettuce! The meat taste better with these sides, I can no longer only eat meat.  My favorite meats are the beef rib, ribeye, Parmesan pork, and bacon wrapped filet mignon. I tried some meats that was sub par.. Pineapple pork chop had no pineapple taste or scent, but it was tender. The bottom sirloin I had was super charred, and half was uneatable. Lastly, the garlic sirloin I got was completely burnt, but the gaucho was in such a hurry, I couldn't ask for a properly cooked one.  Despite the food quality complaints this time I still enjoyed it. Our server Derek was the bomb; he heard it was my birthday and got me a free desert!  Overall this place is well worth it for lunch price, just make sure that food coma doesn't get you afterwards!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Key lime pie on the house!

jn8IDpltCwxz-oElu677NA.text: If you like meat,than this is your paradise! We enjoyed the service and meats were full of flavor. The desert is just final super touch to it all!

LjdqwZvV0ecg8IYJFeHNpQ.text: My son wanted to have his birthday dinner here. It was such a great decision. They have a private room and it fit all 25 of us. The staff was great and kept the food coming. All the different proteins that they brought and the sides I just couldn't stop until I was rolled out of the building. Everyone loved it and we can't wait to go again.

cFbKCauWoRT7okaSQutmKg.text: This is my favorite restaurant! I love everything about eating here. The food is amazing and you really get a lot for your money. Most people come here for the meat but it's also Vegetarian friendly! They have a cold buffet where you can choose from many options. If you're worried about the price I recommend going for lunch because it's cheaper. I speak so highly of this restaurant and have always left full and happy!

se3HUgOaezu4QDVAcTWkow.text: Nov. 24, 2016 This was the most amazing all you can eat meat experience ever. A carnivores delight. There is lots of different cuts of meats to sample. Pork, Chicken, Beef and Lamb. Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly. I love the fact that you can have it from rare to well done. They give you a card that is red on one side and green on the other side. Red means no more meat for now and green means show me the meat.  What I recommend is to ask for a small piece of meat because there is so many to pick from and you want to be able to taste all of them.  I would leave my card on red but when someone with a meat skewer I did ask what it was and ask for a small slice.  I really did not eat from the salad bar, but I'd did look very good. I did eat plenty of the Brown sugar and black pepper bacon because it was so crispy and amazing and who doesn't like bacon. The Pao de Queijo is a warm, soft cheesy bread roll that is so yummy. Of course I did leave room for coffee and Creame Brulee that melts in your mouth.  Again come here with a big appetite and enjoy the amazing food and warm friendly staff. And no you can not take your leftovers home. They get 5 stars for great food and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pao de Queijo is a warm, soft cheesy bread roll that is so yummy
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Let the eating begin
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brown sugar and black pepper bacon

HDbTT5VBKyCfmRjAwOO5PQ.text: I treated the my hubby for a nice dinner and he chose to come here. I love how they have different types of meat selection and a full salad bar. Yes, of course this is an all you can eat place and you better love meat if you come here. We both left with very full tummys but unfortunately we are not big eaters. I just got full from the salad bar and cheese selections. All in all he dinner was nice. This is my hubby's go to place... So I was happy that he was happy.

LsYXRybD8CF80Mv5KFgdSg.text: Great service and the meats are cooked and served well prepared. Ambiente needs improvement. Too much bright light and at peak times the lines at salad bar can get crowded. Maybe less tables and more intimate setting would help the experience. Staff was friendly and on top of things.

se1baFiAKPtMpxAr0kzkKg.text: Let me first say I've gone to this particular Fogo for many years and usually had 4 star service. With how packed they usually are, it's virtually impossible for 5 stars. But this past weekend was ridiculous. And I don't typically write so much, but the details are important.  On Friday I made a reservation for 12 friends and kids for 8pm over the phone. My son's and my girlfriend's birthday dinner. We arrived promptly. The young hostess said I had no reservation and would have to wait about 1.5 -2 hours for a table that large. Keeping calm, I asked for a manager.   The manager was very nice and asked if I called the reservation in. I did, so she asked if I could show her my cell phone call log. Happily, I showed her that indeed called the day before, twice. She left for a few minutes and got us a table. Nice job, but beginning my evening with panic and frustration is not something anyone expects. On the way to the table I told her that we had 2 birthdays and she said they would each get birthday deserts on the house. Standard. Cool!  After seating us and taking our drink order, I went to the hostess stand waiting for 1 lagging friend. I spoke to the same hostess about the incident and she said it had been happening many times for the past few months. Obviously someone during the day was not doing their job. And she reiterated that we would be getting birthday deserts.   About half way through our meal we finally received our drinks, except for one of us. It took a while to flag down someone down who turned out to be another manager. He said no problem. At least another 15 minutes went by and no drink. Finally our server came by and said he'd get it. Another 15 went by, almost done meal now, and she got the drink. He had a "could care less" attitude and never apologized. He simply picked up their tab and crossed off the drink without telling them. And never asked the rest of us if we wanted additional drinks the entire night. But he never really came by the entire night, except to deal with the one drink.   Additionally we realized that for the 2 hours we were there, there were many meats that never made it our way. The more expensive meats. We were presented with Bottom and Middle Sirloin, and chicken 30 times, but filet, lamb and some others once or never. We had to ask for them to bring them over, which also took time.   Frustrated, but making the best of it and of course stuffed from the food, which was good, we paid and left. No desert ever made it over.   Having had office parties and other get togethers here over the years, I was really taken aback by all of the failures of the evening. They market themselves as a high-end restaurant, and should be judged that way. It may be sometime before I and talked into going back.

4f4-hbLWUEQYwOi-3dMMYw.text: This was my first time here. The salad bar was so fresh! Great choices. The server's came to our table with freshly cooked meats of all types on a stick. (Shishkabob?) Excellent service. Enjoyed it. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The place! I&#39;ll be back!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad bar was the best I&#39;ve had in a long time. You won&#39;t be disappointed!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great food! Especially fresh salad bar. Great service!

TVIuOvTNBsijg78o-qVdRA.text: Since am half Brazilian this is my place to go and eat it's  all-around great place to eat and you do pay a little extra for it.  The ambience is upscale.  The service is attentive.  The cold dishes are delicious and very fresh.  The meats are excellent.  They have lots varieties of meat you might want to try your favorites first.  Either way,  love the place

OKqRG_rHpJ76Vz9PQyc07A.text: As you walk in, the service is prompt and friendly. Its a laid back, upscale and relaxing ambiance. The dimmed lighting make it a nice inviting atmosphere for a romantic date. The waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu. They have many different types of meats which include beef, lamb, chicken, pork...everything a meat lover wants. They even have a robust salad bar as well. With the meal they also give sides of cheese bread, mashed potatoes, fried bannas and polenta. You can eat your fill and be satisfied for the rest of the day! Lastly, the Tres Leches Cake is to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scrumdiddlyumptious!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Num num num!

3kUV57EdholJ91UbB-ZKnQ.text: Yuuummmmmm!! Love this place. One of our favorites when in Phoenix. Excellent service and fantastic food. Cannot be beat.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

G6OMBEHym2LKAJbXRg9OlQ.text: Food is good, service is great. Really really busy and hectic.. I'd rather go on an off day on an off time.

PdL_G38IIjEl9f9B4aEUdA.text: One of our favorite spots in Scottsdale! My fiance and I come to Fogo quite often (in fact we got engaged here) and always get excellent service. The steaks are delicious and the salad bar is impressive. We've come to Fogo just the two of us, sometimes with our son and have even had parties here. It's always great service and delicious food.

OIiQYY99K3TwxDMF7thq9g.text: Excellent service, excellent food, wonderful salad bar and the meat is beyond fabulous! I took my son for his 18th birthday and he said it was the best steak he has ever had in his life. Now, this is a young man who has been to many places to eat steak before. I took him here for a reason, I wanted the best for my son on his birthday- so I chose the best Brazilian steakhouse in the state! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy Birthday!!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My son on his 18th birthday!

zA01UvJQaf8SZNBImrlyfw.text: Having been to a few of these Brazilian style meat-sweat dinners, I've come to love that you can eat at these places like an upscale caveman. Continuously arriving charred proteins are a thing of beauty but, it doesn't come cheap. And as great as it is to be able to leave in a paleo-induced coma, what really disappointed me here was the lack of attention to detail. The meal alone will set you back about $50/person before tip, drinks, wine, dessert, etc. Throwing all of that in, it is easy to run a tab closer to about $100/person. For that, I expect a little more than just a meat fest. My biggest gripe is that for a place that earns a large dollar amount per person, I would think they could put a little more thought into their wine program. The list comes in a heavy leather-bound cover which is promising until you open it and read mainly mainstream, easily recognized names and labels. Also, none of them have vintage dates next to the choices so you have no idea what year you could actually get. This results in anyone who is the least bit interested in vintages to have to ask the staff. In doing so, I found out that the staff really has no clue about wine and they had to go to the cellar to sequentially check each one. 2 of the labels I inquired about they did not even have any more of in stock. The 3rd choice I inquired about was a year that was horrendous. Each time I made an inquiry, the server disappeared for about 5-10 minutes to check on it so by the time I made my 4th inquiry, I was about 30 min into this process and ready to drink Chateau du Shit if that was all they could produce. The fact that they have fairly mainstream labels, they don't list vintage years, they don't seem to put a lot of training time into their wine program with their staff, and they don't seem to keep their lists up to date with what they do and do no have in stock make me really question their commitment to the wine aspect of the meal. In many places, this is not a huge deal to me but when you are spending about $100/person, I expect the entire meal experience including the wine to be pretty darn good. While the meat was plentiful and tasty, the wine program sucked and the tab was pricey which is why I can't go more than 2 stars for this visit. I'll go again because I like to take down animals en masse as much as the next person but next time I think I'm going to stick to water.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yes please!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The carnage!

SCfJQQ3mM5nHhRIdBAFC_g.text: I haven't traveled a lot but I have been to 5 different Countries.. I can honestly say this was one of the BEST meal that I ever had!  It was the sum of all of its parts. The food, the atmosphere, and the service were all excellent! Lou was the manager on staff that evening and he, along with our server Norma were very attentive and it felt genuine.  I left very full and satisfied. Best Birthday meal ever, I cannot wait to return!
