Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tres Leche. Delicious

GmWlgm2GJy_Yv7tuExuLxQ.text: OMG the absolute best place in the world! The meats are off the chain good.  The service was even better, all the staff was super friendly!! If you are a meat person ask to see the grill. I thought there was no way i could go in back and they were so accommodating.  I cannot say enough great things about the experience. Super happy customer.

k-5nkYtLW-G6a7AbOKB0_A.text: Had heard lots of things about this place and finally had to see for myself. Must say food and service is great, the only knock I had is it's a bit pricey so definitely a special occasion place and all though they kept coming around with different types of meat non stop most of them were rare, very hard to get some well done meat. But I would still recommend this place to everyone to try at least once. I would also recommend you go on an empty stomach because it's pretty much all you can eat of every steak, chicken and pork they serve with an all you can eat salad and fruit bar and yes don't forget the bean and linguica soup.

KLUZwDBZNagtdTqtXGIAhQ.text: This is my 5th time here.  It only gets better and better.  We brought to friends that had never had the Fogo experience.  One is a real "meat snob".  Wow! Once again,  the staff outdid themselves.  We had the pleasure of being served and checked on by Junior again.  I was thrilled to see him at our table because he always gives us exception service.  And a smile to boot.   Everyone had a great time,  amazing food and spectacular service once again.  Fogo is the perfect treat.

zMCezHJ6iE7VCMVh8Wys8Q.text: I was looking forward to a different experience but soon enough I realized this chain is  overstated, overrated and overpriced.   The salad bar was good, thus my two star rating.    The meats offered were not up to par.  Having enjoyed good Argentinian Churrazcos and similar fares in other South American venues, what Fago the Chao offers, at least at their store in Scottsdale, is simply different cuts of flavorless  meats, very thinly sliced, served by comically attired "gauchos" servers.  The slices of the couple meats we requested were not thick enough to sink our teeth in to. Obviously, I was not expecting the 3/4" slices of beef that usually are served in a chrrasqueria, with the choripan, morcillas, chimichurrry and other sort of accompaniment. I know I was not dining in Bnos. Airres but, I expected something slightly better.    We cut our experience off soon enough, paid our hefty bill and decided to write this restaurant off our list.

CfWzVInVV_takRWAwGf-8w.text: I had really high hopes. I last visited this location in 2012. I remember it being like a Ruth's Chris or Morton's. Now it's more like a Sizzler. So disappointing.  The only bright side was the meat. If you don't care about ambiance, it's fine. But not worth it: Our first server came by when only half of our party was seated. She said "you're ok with drinks?" We had literally not even a glass of water. No drinks here!  I replied "Ummm, no. We need drinks." She walked away. No answer.  The next server said "You all know how this works? Great, go help yourself to the salad bar." Before I could explain that no, my spouse has never been here, He walked away too!  The meal went fine. Not great, very hurried. Shockingly, people were walking around in ripped jean shorts and flip flops. It was not what we'd hoped for. We were all dressed for date night.  The worst part? The ladies room hadn't been serviced in hours. 2 stalls were not usable. The handicapped stall had a DIRTY DIAPER in it. I warned the very nice but obviously frazzled manager and he was mortified.  4 people, 1 bottle of wine, 4 cocktails. $360. Nope.

bfrABQEIgqr5a2AElwLNcA.text: Although it's pricey, it's totally worth it if you go at lunch. You can sample all the meats which a delicious and wonderfully seasoned. There isn't one meat that isn't tastier than the next. The trick is to just order meats that you like, make minimal trips to the salad bar. I had 4 filet mignons and snacked on meats and cheeses from the salad bar while waiting for more meat to arrive. Also, only order water. Drinking sodas or wines adds to your bill very quickly. The sides that they give you are delicious too. You have to master the art of eating all you want but not getting stuffed to the gills so you can walk out of there feeling full and not sick. It's totally worth a try. Everyone should experience this restaurant at least once in their life.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet Mignon, medium rare, so tender

XjnbC76bv4v_Fko9pqSAjA.text: The food here is awesome, no doubt. But the customer service was really disappointing. Our server was initially rude and wouldn't let us reject a bottle of wine we didn't like after tasting it. Why pour us tastes if we can't say that we don't like it? But he honestly just seemed inexperienced. He also didn't seem to know the wine list very well. I was upset so I spoke to a manager and she was very nice and she remedied the situation by bringing us a different bottle of wine.  But then the service just continued to suck. The worst part of the night for me was when a waiter actually made a comment about how much meat I had on my plate as he was clearing plates. He said "You're really saving up over there!" or something like that. Really dude?! It's an all-you-can eat steakhouse. I was grabbing as much meat as I could because we came in around 8:30 (still plenty of time before closing) and we felt like we were being rushed out the entire time. We only saw most cuts once, and a few cuts never even made it to our table which is fine, but I'm going to take as much as I can get if I feel rushed. But it just felt really unprofessional for a waiter to make a comment about how much a customer is eating. Then we had several waiters come by our table and try to rush us out almost as soon as it was almost 10:00. I know that they close at 10, so obviously we needed to get going, but it was a little excessive. Don't waiters have sidework they could be doing instead of pestering customers? There were still other customers eating, we weren't the last to leave. I paid so the server would get out of my hair and he made some comment about "letting the cashier get out of here" and then he made another snarky comment about the cashier needing to leave after I had already paid when he came back to pick up my signed check. To make things worse, he actually snatched my half-full glass of wine as he was leaving. My boyfriend was shocked.  So, I feel like Fogo de Chao is the kind of place where everyone from every income bracket comes at least once for a special occasion. I'm a teacher, I don't make a lot of money, but I took my boyfriend here for his birthday, and I wanted it to be special for once. I spent almost $200 on the check, which is more than I would ever normally spend at a restaurant and I feel like when you spend that much you want to be treated like any other customer. Other than the manager, who was nice, everyone on the staff was pretty rude to us. And we shouldn't have come at 8:30, but if you're going to be rude and rush people out the door, don't accept customers past 8:00.

vmuwq884lGtJXjn4_zS40w.text: Update: just to avoid confusion, the name Marco to avoid is the server, not the head Maitre'd (this guy is very nice)...  Normally I would give this 5 stars but last Friday was terrible, and I don't mean the food, it was the service from this one server.  I would say 2 words "AVOID MARCO", that's right, this douchebag is probably one of the worst server we have ever encountered (he was serving in the back for large parties I guess so just wanted to make sure in case there is another Marco there).  We came here to celebrate my birthday, if it wasn't for the company and great food, I would have probably not come back at all.  I would definitely come back because this is one of my favorite restaurant but next time I will make sure we don't get this rude server's table. Let me highlight some of the douchebag Marco's rudeness:  1. I ordered a bottle of wine to celebrate my b-day, typically when a server brings the wine, he or she will present the wine and open it so that we can taste it.  No, he just put the bottle of wine in front of me and left and said "Here..." and walked away.  My friends with me are like, what's up with that...He came back, and rudely asked me "Do you want me to open that?"  I just wanted to say "Yes open it you douche :-)" but I didn't, it was my b-day and I don't want to spoil everyone's dinner.  Wait, not done yet, after he opened the wine, he just laid down cork in front of me and then walked away again.  I mean really?? didn't even bother asking if I wanted to taste it first grrrr.  So I proceeded to pour the wine to my friends and then he saw me and asked "Do you want me to pour it?".  Really, are you kidding me??  I mean c'mon, tell me this guy is not a douche?!  2. So my wife asked me if they're doing the summer feast special, which I'm not sure, so I begin to ask douchebag Marco and he explained that it was for everyone and that I didn't have to remind him also he asked me "So do you have any questions??".  That minute, I almost was going to really punch this guy, how rude, it's like I don't have the right to ask question.    3. So we finished our food, and we gathered to take some pictures.  My wife was taking the picture and we told her to ask any server.  Unfortunately, douchebag Marco walked in carrying just a tray with empty drinks that he just cleaned up on another table...my wife politely asked him if he could take our picture, you know what he said?? "Why don't you take some pictures and I will come back.."  What the F!@#...seriously, he couldn't just set down the drinks for a sec and take the picture?  I hope the manager can read this, because this douchebag "MARCO" needs to go back to server training and learn some manners and etiquette and how to serve and respect the customers.  Next time you go to Fogo, 2 words "AVOID MARCO" a.k.a douchebag

FLM7EsKGUH7NR-0bE60Y6w.text: Yelp, On April 30, 2015, you lost my trust.  The four star consensus indicated that I would have an enjoyable experience when dining at Fogo de Chao.  You lied.  It's going to take me awhile to get over this breach of trust, but I'm going to try to deal with this speed bump in our relationship.  After eating here, I am shocked that they manage to fill seats.  The restaurant is filthy.  The ambiance is best described as if Olive Garden and Chilis Too had a lovechild--which would be fine, if it wasn't $50/person.  I would have been happy to pay what the experience warranted--somewhere around $7.99 (excluding tax and drinks).  So to receive the bill (originally with extra drinks charged to our tab, which we asked them to correct) and pay $150 dollars for two adults who had one drink a piece, added insult to injury.  I would have rather lit $130.00 on fire, taken the other $20 and gone to Chick fil A and had a more enjoyable night.   More importantly, the quality of the food itself was deplorable.  Everything was dry.  For the parmesan crusted pork, they use the kind of parmesan that tastes like the scraps off the parmesan factory floor--the kind that doesn't have to be refrigerated, costs about $1.99 for one pound of it at the grocery store? Anyone know what I'm talking about?  The buffet was disgusting.  The food looked old.  The food tasted old.  I mentally prepared myself for food poisoning as I nibbled on a piece of cheese.   It was honestly one of the most bizarre dining experiences we've ever had.  My guest and I kept looking around the room in awe that this many people were paying 50 dollars/head for this quality of food and service.  We discussed leaving after sitting down and getting our drinks, but didn't pull the trigger.  We deeply regret our decision to stay.   I think one-star reviews should be given sparingly, reserved for when an establishment is truly deserving.  I tried to find one redeeming aspect of the whole night, and I couldn't.  I won't give two stars for a consistent one-star experience.  Go to Ruth's Chris. Go to Mastros. Hell, go to Applebees.  Just don't go here.

oVh53D9ftaFuQWbdgJKksw.text: We love everything about fogo de chao. Service is smooth, Victor Di Nolfi  service manager is excellent if you ask for anything you get it ASAP. The waiters know how to do their job ( uniforms are Brasilian cowboy style ) Food is delicious ... The meat is melt in your mouth wonderful (hello picanha :-) and the salad bar always has a few surprises.  Go at lunchtime and enjoy the experience for $20 less than Dinner rate.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sunday brunch !

pzHGP5l0hNSc8sfxoJWyrA.text: Heard all the praises for this place so decided to take my family for a visit. The service is awesome but the food is so-so, every once in a while a server would bring a huge piece of steak/ lamb to you and ask if you want a piece which will make you feel fed up after like 3 turns. The salad bar was terrible. Check came out to be $250 for 4 person and some drinks. The whole experience was kind of meh.. Perhaps because I expected more when reading the good reviews.

_GkVTma1JGCxnk8-8i9xeA.text: Came here on a business trip with my wife and son and food was delicious and the server name Norma was fantastic! She made sure we were getting good service and foods are always on our way! Thanks for your help and the friendly staff!

dUveM1lWvs7vDIeZEpohzQ.text: When it comes to Brazilian steakhouse's look no further then Fogo de Chao. All others who claim to be Brazilian modeled their restaurant after Fogo de Chao in my experience. The meat is always fresh and delicious. The staff is extremely friendly and if you don't watch it they will try to put you in a food comma. Make sure to pace yourself and remember green means go and red means stop. Do not feel bad to flip it red, or you will not have enough room for desert. The molten chocolate cake is to die for and you have to try some Xingu Gold Beer even if your not a beer drinker this beer is awesome. If you are a beer drinker try the Xingu Black Beer. I have been to Fogo de Chao several times and I have never been let down. If you have young kids and cannot find a sitter I would suggest lunch with the kids and a nice romantic dinner with your spouse. Please remember this is a classy, romantic restaurant so don't be surprised by the price. It will cost more then $75 plus tip depending on what your drinking for a party of two. Remember quality is never cheap. I have recommended Fogo de Chao to several people and I will continue to recommend Fogo de Chao to anyone who asks for a nice place to take their spouse or their date.

yxJSVtgafCVIaDujDl80vw.text: Excellent service and food. Ambiance was nice but relaxed. The manager, Norma was courteous, fun and articulate. She was a pleasure to engage with and is always great to meet a fellow Californian!

bHyWxEvnFk5EH_Coua7Wcg.text: Fogo de Chao is a great place to go if your hungry! I call it the "meat parade" because they are constantly serving you meats of your choice. This location has a friendly staff and is well worth the visit. The salad bar is great too.

XWq0Jbcoec4DwooBI7zIDg.text: I've been to several Brazilian places before. The food was excellent. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because they didn't have any "exotic" meats. Also the salad & side selections  had fewer selections compared to other Brazilian places I've been to around the country. Other  Brazilian places I have been too have had everything from Ostrich to Antelope as part of the meat selections. This place had beef,pork,chicken and lamb in various cuts. The deserts were excellent too, but not included in the cost for the meal. Deserts were just under $10 each. Everything served here was excellent. Plan on spending about $60 per person if you want desert. The staff was polite and efficient. The atmosphere was good too. I would definitely go back again.

XL4E4KBw9lWjq6gpIaP9PQ.text: We were looking for a place to eat meat. Lots and lots of fantastic tasting meat. We found it. Ol' Wichita knows his meat when he sees it and this place is it. First off we started over to the salad bar, which I thought was going to be a diversion so I wouldn't eat so much meat. Everything was so fresh and tasty that I just didn't care. I did not go nuts over the salad bar but did help myself, as meat was what I was really after. Then you turn over the card so it is showing green. I guess it's a metaphor for the money you're about to spend. Anyway, that didn't matter. We were besieged by matadors carrying long scewers of meat. They cut off pieces to order and boy was it good. There must have been a dozen different people racing from table to table hacking and slicing their way through tons of the finest crafted meats I have ever tasted...beef, pork, lamb, and chicken. I liked the bottom sirloin, filet mignon (wrapped in bacon), house special (sirloin), and pork ribs. It was all really good, but when I say I enjoyed the above, it was just that those things were so beyond my expectations that I just had to mention them.   These guys all went out of their way to make our dinner a dining extravaganzal? experience. It was at once delicious and entertaining. We-will-be-back!!!! Speaking of being back, check out ol' Wichita's webpage to hear some good old industrial strength classic country music. Wichitacountry dot com. I do it all alive and in real time with no help from anybody else. Thanks.

g4ndalDgGgBNEoTj0uIOOg.text: love coming here, but need to remind myself to come extra hungry!  the salad bar is awesome and the meat is to die for...a little spendy but definitely worth it if your out on the town.  the atmosphere is great for dinner conversation but lively enough it isn't stuffy.  Can't wait for the next night of feasting ;)

IgiXpqVyx3521zg5Ry59zg.text: I ate my weight in meat. The selection is great here as is the quality. They have a salad bar as well that is great (although I'd love it if we could have our salads tossed for us). The salad par has lettuce, around 6 or 7 dressings, great fresh Parmesan cheese, a selection of deli meats, and more! For the steaks, what didn't I try? Filet mignon, filet mignon with bacon, bottom sirloin, top sirloin, lamb chops, their house special, you name it, they had it! I call this "fancy and expensive fast food" because you can be eating high quality meat within minutes of sitting down! The servers always come around, but sometimes they come in waves which I do not like. Also, you feel kind of pressured to eat which can be seen as a downfall to some people. Overall, it is a great meal and a lot of fun! For a more intimate steak dinner at this price though, I'd be more likely to recommend Ruth Chris, Mastros, or Flemings.

aLyLtRNm01Z5aOsF-7xBFQ.text: Honestly quite disappointed.  I have been to numerous places like this and this one was lacking.  The salad bar will minimal...not a lot of goodies, toppings, soup, or anything the others have.  The meat...had little if any flavor and some of the filets were so fatty I couldn't choke them down.  I am totally a meat and potatoes kind of girl and I was bummed.  My husband was sorely disappointed as well.  And then the price...higher than most other places, but we were ok with that going in to it, but not now after eating there.  Needless to say it was ok, but we won't be returning.

9xuMJ0TiPq4rEjHe_BwXJg.text: Come with an appetite!  I went for a work event which was real nice. We had the private dining room and the whole 9 yards.  All I can say is if you're not a fan of red meat or have a cholesterol problem don't bother. The ambiance is not as format as I assumed it to be due to the location and hype. Although, the meat and presentation is great. Anything you want sent right to your table and cooked however you would like. Just don't leave your card on the green for too long otherwise you will have more meat than you can handle.  On the other hand, the specialty drinks are good. I don't recall the name of it but they served a traditional Brazilian drink that was wonderful. Not as strong for my liking but good. The salad bar was great too. Everything was fresh and there sure was a lot to choose from. Probably the best I have seen in a while.

B1vXXs8ezdkAm80Jv0Qltg.text: Meat coma.  Prepare for a meat coma.  Last night my husband and I celebrated our sixth wedding anniversary.  After much debate on where we were going to celebrate Fogo won our votes.  We've visited another similar style restaurant in Ahwatukee so we knew what we were in for - or did we?  Fogo last night was very happily a different experience from the last time we did a Brazilian steak house.  This was upscale and so much more busy.  We made reservations on line and while we were five minutes late - it wasn't even an issue.  For the record we had an incredible time and I guess the next few things are just minor but I think would have added another star.  My hubby is chatty and can strike up conversation with anyone.  But the staff was not so much into it.  They didn't engage his quick little one liners and didn't feel obliged to "listen" to anything.  The expeditors were a little more willing but not by much.  I was seriously starting to get nervous by how fast everyone moves @ the restaurant.  So fast in fact a collision happened right in front of us.  Plates went everywhere.  The hubby tried (for the record this was his third attempt) to engage a gaucho about how they cook the meat - this gentleman looked @ Josh and said "hmmm I dunno" - I got the feeling he didn't understand what was being asked of him.  He just knew to cut the meat off the skewer and continue on.  Perhaps that's what they have been advised to do.  Not sure.  It was just awkward.  Everything was good.  The cherry peppers were delish (my first time) all of the meat was delish.  Not very seasoned but good.  The purity was awesome.  The salad bar was great.  I made the best Caesar salad I've had in a while.  The mozz and parm were FANTASTIC!  Hubby loved the little bread basket. The wait staff said that they were told what goes into it but not so much how to make them.  (you see a pattern here with the chatty)  :)  At the end of the night when we could take no more we were approaching comaville we waited for our staff person to bring the check.  This is what confuses me.  Who are we tipping.  The gauchos, the really sweet gal that never let my water go empty, the cutie that "crumbed" our table?  The gal previously mentioned asked if we had received our check.  And then went to find it.  When everyone was running around furiously this is where we waited the most?  Hubby says that it's almost nice to not feel like they are rushing us out the door.  But when we wanted to leave - well, we waited.  All in all it was a very successful anniversary.  We will be back I'm sure.

EnStz-jdbo8wW0ZxmcAuAw.text: I didn't  go for the great salad bar or even the best dinner rolls I have  ever had. We went for the steak....every one of the options(over 10) were fantastic. The fact that you get to try as many and as much as you'd like makes it great.  No this isn't a buffet like it  sounds. GO hungry and leave happy,period.

HjgMrF73wVb2UckJeOlvLg.text: Wonderful salad bar, mixed feelings on the meats, some wonderful, some dry and a little overdone, but overall a very fine meal. Service is impeccable. Nice wine list if not a little pricey.

XPFp8kMvjoXABlYMOhCS8Q.text: This place has everything you expect to get when you go out to eat~ Great Food, Great Atmosphere, and Exceptional Service. In today's economy I insist that if I am going to spend good money I should be rewarded in return. The meats are so delicious...you can choose to taste them all but I love the picanha and I ask the waiter to just keep bringing this wonderful cut. It literally melts in your mouth. While most people prefer well done you would be doing a disservice to yourself  to eat picanaha well done. All Brazilians eat  picanha  either  rare or medium rare. I prefer medium rare..It's the best meat I've ever tasted.  The staff is so attentive and courteous-they really stand out. I love to tip them generously because they really deserve it. Not like most places I've been to. The salad bar is delicious. I would love it if they'd incorporate sushi like most other brazilian steakhouses in NYC but I won't hold it against them.  Be sure to go hungry. The atmosphere is not too uppity and not too casual just a really pretty elegant experience. I have been here with the girls, with the family. It's great for all occassions.  You won't be disappointed with the food or service. Love this place!

TGvnNSn1aYU4fpeYlHrNQQ.text: Meatlover's paradise! I've been to a few Brazilian steakhouses but I was really impressed with both the service and the food. If you go, GO HUNGRY!!! I know you're supposed to go there for the meat but the fried bananas and the cheesy bread puffs are sooo amazingly good, I have a hard time staying away from those. After working my way through a wide variety of meats, I left in a meat stupor. The meat, by the way was delicious. Quite a big variety of meats, cuts and they were all flavored really well. The service is really fast.

7uzoJp3onglNpV65VGXihw.text: Great food at this overload of a restaurant.  You definitely need to come here a couple of times before you get the hang of things.  The salad bar is great and all the meat was perfectly cooked.  Since it was my first time here and I was so enamored with all of the beautiful cuts running around, I didn't slow down, and relax as much as I should have.   On the other hand, Manny Ramirez of the LA Dodgers was sitting at the table directly next to us so that was pretty cool.  The bacon wrapped fillet was the best bite I had all night.  I kept taking more every time that particular Gaucho came around.  The staff here is excellent accomadating my request for rice at no charge.  They also have a beautiful chimichurri sauce that you can ask for as well.  My only gripe of the meal, and I do mean only, was the fact that they charged me $18 for a glass of lemoncello at the end of the meal.  That is ridiculous, especially if my father in laws Grand Marnier was only $6.50.  The lemoncello was a $28 bottle, so I can't comprehend where they got the nerve to charge so much.  Other than that, Saud, Fogo de Chao! Wonderful job on your fabulously different take on the classic steak house.

IntpBtEtm9TNoYeq47Xekw.text: This place is fantastic. The service here is the best I've had in a long time. They really treat you like an honored guest. The food is also amazing! It certainly is a carnivores delight. While EVERYTHING was delicious, the stand outs for me were the bacon wrapped Filet Mignon and the their juicy garlicky signature sirloin. Just so you don't O.D. on meat they do also have a wonderful salad bar which has various peppers, cheeses, and cured meats in addition to the good selection vegetables.

YSL60cDi2fWPH-8CFdrBOw.text: Fathers day came two days earlier for me and all I can say is WOW !! My daughters insisted on taking me to this restaurant  for a dinner. The moment I walked through the front door I knew the experience would be a memorable one. The service was outstanding and so was the food. I felt as if I was on a cruise ship being pampered by the crew. I've dined at may fine establishments in my time and this one will bring a smile upon my face every time I reminisce,not only for the fine food and service but most importantly because I had my beautiful daughters with me.

co4VCIyk-6B37evt-xt8-A.text: This is by far the best restaurant in Scottsdale especially for the one cut price of $42.50. After the hostess seats you the waiter/waitress will come by and explain how the system works. First, you can go to the huge salad bar and pick from the many vegetables and they even had my favorite peppers, Peppadews. After you are finished eating your salad, you can flip the card they give you to green which means that you want meat. Someone might ask if would like a fresh plate and then a gaucho (the person that has the meat on a skewer) will come by your table and tell what kind of meat is on the skewer and ask you if you would like some. I recommend the fillet mignon wrapped in bacon or the top sirloin. Excellent customer service and the best I have in a Scottsdale restaurant in a long time. Throughout the meal fried banana, fried polenta, and mashed potatoes are replenished. You must be careful when picking wines or liquor because the price can add up and its where they make the big bucks. After you are finished with your meal a liquor cart comes around and the person will ask you if you would like something. They have port to expensive wines to cognac. For dessert I would recommend the papaya creme if your not an avid chocolate fan. It is not too sweet and taste a little like frozen yogurt. However, if you are a choclatier, then I would go for the chocolate molten cake. If you want to go it is best to make a reservation because it's a very popular place.

31rZrSZolw8xmhM-FKOxtA.text: This place has great reviews on here and was part of my reason for going to eat there. Well now i see why. The food was just incredible along with very good service. A tip that i must pass on is to request the beef ribs. They do not come around with them unless by request so it is important to ask. I though all of the meat was good ( except for the chicken which was dry) but after having the beef ribs nothing else compared to it. They are the reason i will certainly go back. Now the service is really good because they work as a team but I do not know if i love this aspect because you kind of lose the personal feel that you get with having an actual server. What did bother me a bit though was that we had 830 reservations and after dining for about a half an hour one of the female bussers made it very apparent she wanted us to leave because they close at nine. However, the restaurant still had many tables left in it and if they close at nine they should not accept 830 reservations because when you are paying $50 a person you should be entitled to more than a half an hour. I was also not impressed by the decor of the restaurant or layout, it was just sort of blah. The food and service will definitely bring me back though and it is worth checking out

BCHIa1dD1xZy8MZmaMmxxw.text: Best Brazilian steak house in AZ.  Also the only Brazilian steak house in AZ.  I'm joking but maybe not.  Lol.  Everything is ok.  The sides were the biggest disappointment...  Enjoy.

HX2ppLyXnP7fVkT3geG9cQ.text: When we arrived to the restaurant a few of our party were looked at as if they didn't belong and weren't welcome.  When you are promised to taste what 11-16 meats you'll be able to enjoy. And you only taste about 6-8 that's pretty sad. There were at least 2 beef dishes that were OVERLY season with salt that made it unbearable to eat.   We had our green signs up and it was like nobody came to us. We noticed they worked the back of the room more and left side. We were seated right in front of the salad bar.  Getting the sides were difficult as well. They didn't come as freely or as needed as well.  The manager came over to us and we asked if we could try the filet mignon. That took like 15 minutes for someone to come over to us.

CaMVLj0WBjq8LR_yyO6KvQ.text: I had a very good birthday dinner.  We went late on Sunday afternoon (before the dinner rush) and there were very few people dining. Having only a few people dinning cans be a blessing or a curse at Brazilian steakhouses. Tonight it was a blessing because they had plenty of workers and they were all very attentive.  The salad bar was a bit underwhelming compared to other places I have been to. It was not a typical build your ow salad bar (only a handful of ingredients for that) but there were several mixed salads and most were pretty good (but we were not here for the salad)  The meat was plentiful and very delicious. They were very good at providing meat that was cooked to your preference. Best N.H. that it was slow, some were very generous with the amount of meat they gave.

3CarndHJ6mbVK58HeDVPxA.text: We specifically made reservations here in the spring knowing that the crowds would be here from the high season. Took entire family. Upon arrival they claimed to have no record of our reservation and smugly handed us a table buzzer and told us to wait thirty minutes or more for a table. No apology. Took zero responsibility for their screw up.   This is the kind of restaurant that is making so much money they've lost touch with reality and lost touch with customer service. The check in girl in the front should be fired.

fWg8lxs6eGRvGAodCeYGbA.text: Food was great, but the waitress was amazing! Ana Laura was the best waitress ever. We had 16 people at our table and she still personalised our experience

G-exxtjWvFU-OYbYFSp7Hg.text: Went for double date night. Was a fun different experience food was good. We had the summer special for $39 and enjoyed it. Not sure we would pay full price, but definitely good to do at least once!

reVQMJgkziG41bQDEMMAxA.text: Came here for a work event. Everyone was so very kind and helpful with about 80 of us! And the food was all very YUMMYYYYYY expecially all the beef dishes

grjMwVGfSWEOSJXkKhvzeg.text: I honestly don't understand what the big hype is around Fogo de Chao. I've always wanted to go here and was very excited when we booked our reservation. Came in with a party of four for restaurant week. Two of us opted for the restaurant week price ($44) while the other two chose the all you can eat option. Basically the difference is the restaurant week option does not allow you to choose from the prime meats (ribeye, filet mignon, lamb) and with the restaurant week price, you get dessert.   From outside, it looked very fancy. When we walked in, we were immediately surprised at how casual and bright it was inside. It reminded me of some of the buffet spots in Las Vegas. I was disappointed because I expected a more intimate setting comparable to high end restaurants. We were immediately seated and made our way to the salad bar. None of the options here were particularly great- I got some charcuterie (cheese, meats), potato salad (I could name a million other places that make better potato salad), caesar salad, green beans and white rice.   The meat itself wasn't anything great. Some of the meat choices were bland, and we all agreed that we could make way better steak dishes at home. My boyfriend snuck me a piece of beef ribs and they tasted like they were dumped in a bowl of salt. They came around with other side dishes like fried bananas (these ones were good), delicious polenta and mashed potatoes. The service was great - in fact they repeatedly offered me the prime meat even if I was under the impression that I wasn't allowed to have any of it. For dessert, we had the NY cheesecake and chocolate mousse which we enjoyed.   Our bill, with drinks and a bottle of wine totaled to almost $300. I kicked myself because I spent so much money and came out of there disappointed. I unfortunately will not come back.

Gosz28LW3fdqNNl_oW0GZQ.text: OMG! I go here and leave wondering if I'm going to have a meat hangover. Who am I trying to fool, of course I am. It's so good you just want to have some of everything. I've been going there for years even though it's a 45 minute drive, it's worth and I've never been disappointed.

nwvtuO-wNzZ7jbw8dGRkww.text: I've been to several different rodizio restaurants in the past (and really enjoyed them! ) and recently discussed them with hubby who mentioned he'd never been to one.   Since hubby loves trying new things and we both love Brazilian food I decided I'd have to plan a trip sometime soon.   With restaurant week coming up I hopped online to study the menus and decide what places we needed to try.  When I saw Fogo De Chao on the list I thought it would be the perfect time to give it a shot, especially given our recent conversation.     I planned a date night with hubby but kept our destination a surprise.   When hubby saw where we were he was excited to try it out.   We both started with their traditional Brazilian drink (I don't recall the name) hubby getting his plain and I went with the strawberry hibiscus flavor.   Drinks took quite some time to come,  but they were busy so we were fine with that.  Hubby really enjoyed his drink but mine was so strong I couldn't drink it.  I gave it to hubby to drink and he said it was significantly stronger than his.      If you've never been to a rodizeo before,  they typically have a large salad and side dish bar you can help yourself to and Fogo De Chao was no different.   I thought they had a nice selection of salads but was extremely disappointed in the sides bar.  It consisted of hard, dry white rice,  a stewed bean dish (which wasn't bad), dried yucca to top it and a small pot of lentil soup.  I didn't try the soup so I can't comment on how it was.    Next,  they have a small coaster on the table that is red on one side and green on the other.   When you're ready for your main course you flip it to the green side and the servers walking around with assorted meats will come by with their offerings.  In addition,  the main course comes with bananas,  garlic mashed potatoes and crispy polenta.   I'm not a polenta girl,  but hubby enjoyed it.   We both really liked the bananas which were well cooked and slightly crispy.  The mashed potatoes were also good but we chose not to fill up on them.   Our meal also came with small cheesy bread but I found it to be dry and inedible (hubby didn't try it).  The assorted meats that came around were good,  but not great.   Hubby and I prefer our meat on the med rare to rare side and almost all of the meat we were offered was extremely well done.     Since we came for restaurant week,  our dinners also came with dessert and we had the option of cheesecake,  chocolate mousse cake or tres leches cake.  Hubby and I both opted for the tres leches cake which was very good.   It was sweet and creamy without being too heavy after such a large meal.  I really enjoyed my dessert as did hubby.   Overall it wasn't a bad meal by any means but it wasn't even close to as good as the other rodizios I've been to in the past (and they were less than half the price of our discounted restaurant week meal).  I'm glad we were able to try some place new and that hubby got to experience a rodizio.   We both had a nice night but I don't see us returning to Fogo De Chao anytime soon.   It's possible that we caught them on a bad night (they were extremely busy and it was restaurant week) but it wasn't the experience we'd hoped it would be.

p74oLXRPMgLJRwtCyXKkjQ.text: We went there yesterday afternoon to celebrate my birthday. Unfortunately I cannot say the experience was a good one. Don't know what happened  but the meat was not the best quality we have had, the servers very serious, no smiles. The young lady who received us as hostess was not that nice, seemed a bit condescending. We did have a reservation. Our server seemed to be there by obligation and that reflected on his demeanor in serving us. I felt, unwelcome, and quite frankly did not enjoy our family outing. I have been to other Fogo de Chao restaurants and this has been the only time I have had this negative impression.  I feel sad having to write this about them, hopefully they take my notes as motivation to better. I don't think we will be returning anytime soon.  Sometimes the greatness of a business is  in how they better themselves.

bNk8Y7GNa0coqyYtUrHvvw.text: Our server Norma was amazing. The food was wonderful. Definitely a fun experience, come prepared to eat too much food.

Nhqi05RtgUPsrRKVpyA6zg.text: Food: Awesome but eat slowly. They bring meats out all night long and if you eat too fast you might not have room when they bring something by.   Service: Our waitress that took care of us the most was Carina. She was one of the best waitresses we have ever had anywhere but the rest of the staff was great too. Carina you are awesome!   Atmosphere: Pretty laid back and definitely not pretentious which I appreciate. It has the steakhouse vibe with Brazilian swagger and flare (love the pants)!  Overall: Came here after I made a comment after seeing the commercial for our anniversary and it's by far my new favorite restaurant! Thank you Fogo!!

PRSIod0aRVpRYYn4eVFR2g.text: I tell you what, the only reason I came to Fogo is that I got a gift card for Christmas. So I made a reservation on Open Table finally and Fogo was our choice tonight. Its a protein night.   After walking through two sets of double door, we were greeted by the hostesses. To the left is the bar and to the right is the dining area. It's only 5:30 but already packed. Good thing I made reservations. Very modern looking with lots of people running around.   Right as we're seated, one of the servers explained how everything works here. All your pre-meat is all you can eat at the buffet table which has salads, cheese, veggies, and other goodies. I have to say it's a unique buffet cause haven't really seen this type of stuff at other places.   For you meat which includes beef, pork, chicken, and lamb. They give everyone at the your table a card which is turned to RED. When you want meat turn the card to green and the guys with meat will come by your table and slice your preferred cut. They even give you your own pair of tongs to grab the sliced meat.   So I loved to pre-meat meal. Loved the smoked salmon, Caesar salad, different cheese, prosciutto, and grilled veggies. Just make sure you don't get to full on this cause you still have your meat.   The meat is great. You can pick what you want. They just ask you if you would like whatever they are serving and if you want rare, medium or well done. Saw beef tenderloin, lamb, chicken, pork chops, sausage. It's all good. I enjoyed all the meats. I even saw some bacon wrapped too. So they got everything.   The service was excellent. This is no joke. They had at least 3 different servers helping us and others filling our water glasses, exchanging our dirty plates and multiple people ask how everything was. Even had a Manager ask us if we needed anything special or meat and was willing to bring out for us. What stood out was my son and wife asked for tea and then wanted a hot water refill so with the new hot water they also go new cups and tea bags too. No questions asked but what was surprising was my son stomach wasn't feeling good at the beginning and the servers were helping him find a bubbly drink to help calm his stomach. He got a Pellegrino with mango something in it and it did help calm it down. Very nice. Shoutout to Karina and I think Bryan. They are all great  We were stuffed but we still have to try their dessert (FYI it's extra cost). So many options. We went for the Key Lime pie and the Papaya cream. Loved the Papaya cream. It was vanilla ice cream mixed with Papaya. Very smooth. The key Lime pie was different than others but was very good too.   We loved it at Fogo. It's pretty expensive but  comes with so much. All you can eat meat and sides. Oh yea forgot, they bring to you table this cheese bread. It's so go when hot. Also bring mashed potatoes and fried bananas.    So great atmosphere with friendly service that goes out of their way to serve you. Food is great. It's a meat paradise. We enjoyed and will be back again for another meat coma.

RUTkyh3B2L2_HbYzLuVTgw.text: Meat tasted great - well seasoned. Great place to eat until you can't fit anything else in your stomach. And Ana was a fantastic server. She was always on it!

v__qZXrM3V-TJncmwQSaXw.text: Meat, meat meat!!!! Wow !! So full of food. Had a salad bar first. Great bacon at salad bar. Had spinach and romaine salad. The salad bar could have been better. No shredded cheese or toppings for salad. Than all meat. They come around and slice you off a portion to eat. I had filet mignon, lamb, sirloin steak, sausage, chicken New York strip steak. And so much more!!!! The service was excellent!!

yuiaWfUrhZRZJmi917u40Q.text: Say it with me people "picanha" it's always amazing and the salad bar never disappoints. Recommendation be very hungry when you go

8i4CzW02gV4sISWtewJH3A.text: Meat cooked to perfection. All of this experience was fantastic. I would suggest to those looking to eat here to fast before going, as there is a substantial amount of food to eat. The salad bar was full and was wonderful and the meats that they walk around with is juicy, tender, flavorful and just perfect. 10/10 would recommend to meat lovers.

nHCtOb2t_4aQxzcbww1POQ.text: Ohhhh my meat goodness! My sister and I planned Valentine's Dinner for our husbands this year and picked Fogo De Chao. I am so glad we did because the food was absolutely amazing. WE ALL LOVE MEAT but didn't expect this place to be as meatlicious as it was. It's a Brazilian all you can eat experience! It is definitely on the fancier side, being in downtown Scottsdale, I would recommend dressing nicer if you go for dinner. From what I understand though, they do not have or enforce a dress code. When you walk in the restaurant is very open and loud. It has a ton of tables throughout the space with an extra banquet/dining area in the back. The walls have a bunch of different paintings, wines, and fancy decor. It's all tied together with beautiful chandeliers. If you are expecting a quiet evening, I do not recommend coming here. The atmosphere here is a little more upbeat, smiling faces, people talking and people walking around. When it comes to food, you can order something off their menu or order the buffet. If you order the buffet, you start out at the salad bar, and the meat is brought around to each table on a skewer. They have a variety of meats to choose from, so they have many waiters walking around with different meats for you to try. They come to your table and cut you off a slice of your liking. Valentine's night they had over 17 different meats to try. I love that they had a little cardboard heart card to use, so the people with the meat knew to come to your table to offer you more. Green means "more please" and red means "need a break." I would say the Lamb and the Filet Mignon were my favorites. Each meat was moist, tender and full of flavor! On top of stuffing yourself with meat, you get a side of mashed potatoes, fried banana, and sweet potatoes. Be prepared for the price tag, but well worth it for an all you can eat, top-notch experience. My husband and I will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So much delicious food!

jB08aWU9BxJx1rS_MX1RJQ.text: I enjoyed Valentine's Day At Fogo de Chao but honestly the experience could've been way better. First, I arrived at my reservation time. My date and I followed the server through the busy dining room to the very, very back empty room, next to a door that was cracked open. We sat down, and moments later, someone comes up and says "we are going to move you in the front - you will get better service up there anyways" I was highly confused by the initial placement of our seating (away from other guest) and the statement. I looked past it and sat down at our new location in the dining hall next to other guest. During our dinner, I felt like it was a mixture of pop up ads and sales guys. Besides the normal "do you want this wrapped in bacon" at all different occasions, sales waiters came to our table and offered to sale us a $12 shot, asked to sign up for an email club, asked if we wanted seafood on ice, asked if we wanted a bottle. It was honestly unbelievable. There wasn't enough time in between to have intimidate conversations before being interrupted again. At the end, I paid $135 and wished I made better arrangements. When you eat at Texas de Brazil- you do not get bombarded while eating so not sure why my date and I were bombarded here.

oURCKmyFCoZsi-eyi6cm2A.text: What a great restaurant. What an experience. There donation and time to the community and families is exceptional. I'm very impressed with the above and beyond service provided; they accommodated for a Make A Wish family to come and enjoy a Saturday lunch. I'm impressed by their hospitality and attention to others in their community. Big shout out to Chris, Clair, David and Angelica!

xUOmk_vW2FcXIqb4ZdRpRw.text: Great restaurant. Took my husband for dinner to celebrate our anniversary, and it was an amazing experience. Our waitress Sam was great she was very attentive. The food was worth the price.  Many choices of tasty, juicy meats being served table side. I will definitely be coming back.

REy8ZquKcCMrNYn9QCaLiA.text: This is probably going to be an unpopular opinion, but I just wanted to give an honest review. We came here for the first time last night for a friend's birthday and I woke up this morning still feeling a little ripped off by the experience.  Pros:  - The staff was amazing! If this review was based on the staff ONLY it would absolutely be five stars. They were consistently coming around with food for us and were very proactive with our needs. - There was a lot of variety. We did the full experience and I was very surprised by the variety of the meat we received. They also kept loading us up with bread and mashed potatoes (which, sad to say were my favorite part of the meal). Cons - Most of the meat we received was overcooked. I am a firm believer in cooking beef medium rare. Even when we asked for medium rare cuts, more often than not it was medium well or well done. Twice they came around with Filet Mignon and twice I was severely disappointed by how overcooked it was. Especially since we paid extra specifically for that cut. By the end of the meal, I just had so much waste because I was constantly on the hunt for better cooked meat.  - The price. Obviously, we went here knowing we were going to spend $50+ per person. The problem is it really wasn't worth it. I would have much rather gone to a steak house where I could order my own steak portion and be guaranteed to get it correctly cooked.  - No happy hour in the main dining room. We got there early so we had a drink at the bar first before dinner. I ordered the Alamos Malbec that was on happy hour for $6. I was sad to learn that HH prices are not available in the dining area. My $6 glass of wine became $11.5. This only bothered me because I know that Alamos is $9ish a bottle at the store. I get the need to markup glasses and bottles, but that markup seems steep.    Overall, I would still encourage people to try it out for their selves maybe once. It's a cool concept and it was fun having the meat cut directly at the table. You're definitely paying for the experience more than the quality of the food. At the end of the day, it just felt more like an overpriced buffet to me.

QxL0zctsZmfY3t4Ur2sJlg.text: In 2002 I worked in the wilds of Brazil for several weeks. All the food was terrific, but my favorite kind of place was the churrascaria. There you could get a delicious meal with unlimited food for $5-10. Just amazing. We are very lucky to have a decent churrascaria right here in CdA, which is unusual for a small US town, though you will pay way more than $10! The food is pretty authentic and tasty, though I've yet to score chicken hearts in three visits there. Have to admit that the salad bar is more American-like, and not too special. The service is very good and it's a fun experience. If you are unsure, go for lunch which is quite a bit cheaper than dinner, but with less variety in cuisine. I have to say that I liked their older location on Front St. better than the current Riverstone place, but it still has a nice atmosphere.

Q0YFq70uO7kdnfLUaJr8BQ.text: A wonderful culinary experience, again. Scottsdale was our fourth Fogo de Chao restaurant. It did not disappoint. Our server Nicolas took very good care of us. We can't wait for our next trip to a Fogo de Chao City.

y3mpndnVxNU5RfxympPAJw.text: I decided to celebrate my birthday at Fogo, and I picked a great place!  Not only did I enjoy myself with the endless cuts of meats and high end salad bar, the staff was very friendly. The filet was my favorite along with the lamb. They were both very fulfilling. I even received a complimentary birthday dessert. I love this place and I will be back!!!!

zAEOj4WXCbHhd9sa5Eh7PA.text: They stopped by with beef, pork, and lamb meat until you flip the disk from green to red, whew. Meat cooked perfect and served off the skewer, cut off by the waiters onto your plate. The buffet style salad bar had a good selection. Side was mashed potatoe, enough for two.  My wife and I enjoyed our 30th anniversary here, and we recommend this Brazilian style restaurant to be a good place to celebrate any memorable event. Enjoy.

0F9kK78oKsjbKmNZ82duYA.text: Boring and sterile ambience, extremely mediocre salad bar that, for some reason, they are extremely proud of, very strange format of serving, all the different meats tasted the same, and the cocktail I had (The Brazilian Gentleman) was the absolute worst cocktail I've ever had in my life. Not because it was made poorly, but because it was simply a disgusting recipe. And to top it all off, their prices are highway robbery. My bill came out to $180.00 for two people (each with only one bar drink) after the tip. Absolutely never going back to this place again.

LW0aTFNAx9M85Zu0uNwstQ.text: Awesome sevice! Great date night spot. A little pricey but the meat was delicious! I was hoping it would be a little darker and more ethnic with fire and dimmer lighting but the setting was still nice. I guess they need to see your table is why! White table cloth open floor plan style. It was super crowded but it was a Saturday night so it was a little crazy when the meat started coming and everyone was seated so close to each other but once it died down it was very nice. They are very on top of service and getting you food quickly. Never had a moment where we needed much! All in all a great time with great food and an experience everyone should try once if not more! :)

P7Xh5G_WNrVZ_zTdusOMNA.text: Came here this evening for my birthday and it was a great experience and yummy. I have been here a couple times before during AZ Restaurant Week and it has never let me down. Came with some people who had never been so it was a new and exciting experience for them. Our waiter, Brian was very attentive and made sure we had drinks flowing and the cuts of meat we wanted brought around. We opted for the full experience. The salad bar is always a good starter, but go light on it as to not fill up. The veggies are fresh and the array of toppings and dressings are good. I love the smoked salmon and deli meat and cheese selection as well. The salad bar also offers rice and soup which is a nice addition to the meal. And those cheesy bread puffs are so delicious. Sides of mashed potatoes and fried bananas are also refillable. I almost fill up on those alone but have to stop myself. Pro Tip, just flip your card green and leave it green so the meat is always flowing to you and just say no if you don't want the particular cut that comes by and wait until they bring around the filet and ribeye (or cut of your choice). You can also ask the waiter for a particular cut to come by and they'll get it sent over. If you come on your birthday as I did, it comes with a free dessert, also sign up for their email list and put in your birthday and you'll get a $25 off coupon for the full experience. The full dinner experience is well worth the $50 price, but even if you come for lunch, it's $25 (doesn't come with some of the prime cuts of meat) but still worth it. It's definitely a fun experience if you haven't tried it and love meat.

ZWBSQZifezP3l3i0eYa2SA.text: Got to celebrate my birthday here! In fact we've done the majority of our big celebrations here. And I never regret it. I have been to handful of Brazilian steakhouses and we keep coming back to Fogo!! The meet is always incredible and the salad bar never disappoints!! In fact I would be happy to go and just have the salad bar!! Bacon wrapped chicken and sirloin steak are my favorite!!

57-UmlYh-wmXZLEvecGkeQ.text: We somewhat enjoyed our experience here. One thing that we were confused about was that I ordered the full churrasco, and my husband just ordered the market table because he doesn't eat much red meat. One of the servers looked at us with such disgust when we ordered that and he realized we weren't both getting the full. Isn't it our right to choose what we want on the menu? He allowed seemed like he was going to ask us to leave or force us to order something we didn't want.  Everyone else was super kind and did a great job. We were just really taken aback by the one server.  Food was ok. I really only liked the prime sirloin, I would probably just get that next time. My husband enjoyed the market table and said there was a good selection. I actually would rather save my money and eat at a local restaurant instead for better food.

z_T7UbabL64BBLZtFd3IrQ.text: The waitress gave us the weekly lunch menu instead of brunch weekend menu and never corrected it.  Big difference in choices and pricing.  I am giving 3 stars because food was still good and a 2nd waiter came over and saved the day by telling us the creme brulee was excellent. He was also attentive. He came by more than once. Maybe she was having a bad day?

6k6l9j1ryoIxlZxDkLAA8g.text: This place was awesome the meat selection was spectacular one little hiccup they forgot the side dishes that you get with your meal but they more than made up for it and I was not disappointed I did not realize there was a gaff Until one of the wait staff said where are your side's oh well . We got here in between lunch and dinner when there was a staff change so no big deal if you want to get your meat sweats on this is the place

qrGbreKhjKwpJiIHVdBMVQ.text: Our favorite restaurant to come when we want to celebrate. The food and service is always on point. If you love meats,. Cheeses, vegetables, rice beans and authentic Brazilian tastes.. this is the place!

NVSTzpKX1CNhIhPMX9JRHA.text: Went in last week and had the best service ever by Ana Laura. My wife and I had never been to this steakhouse before and didn't really know what to expect.... the way they serve the food is quite unique but we loved every minute of it. Ana Laura was very welcoming and walked us through the whole process. On top of it all, the food was amazing! Highly recommend.

ewFHTi7xv1e5DV6i6dFmGw.text: Our company opened the new year with a bang, or in my case, a severe migraine!  Because our customers are always open and are always working, they demand that we be available as well - even the principals of the company. Holidays are irrelevant as their lack of observance is relative to hemisphere.  I didn't want to go out in the rain, which is unusual for me, but my Beloved was willing to drive wherever to take care of her honey! She figured that great pieces of meat and dessert would quell my migraine. Oh, how she knows me so well.  Since I don't drink alcohol, this would have to do in my case.  A secondary agenda was that I was looking for a nice, upscale place to gift 3 couples that really helped us with our favored charity drives over the holidays. These couples were so instrumental in greatly benefiting two schools for the blind and underprivileged children. And I figured Fogo de Chao would be a great venue to show our appreciation, and present them with their gifts.  With that in mind, my wife navigated through the rain towards this restaurant. She had never eaten here, and the last time that I was here was in 2010 - which is eons ago in restaurant standards.  We were greeted at the door by the selfie taking groups who insisted on such prolonged poses. The effect, as annoying this would've been under any other circumstances, was completely reversed. My wife marveled as to the festive atmosphere that greeted us.  We were promptly seated, and began to partake of the scrumptious dinner that was presented to us.  The salad bar is simply amazing. Except for the green beans which didn't taste that fresh, everything else was just marvelous. I particularly liked the pickled cucumbers, and the massive asparagus (I am an asparagus fan), and the poached eggs.  Additionally, the caramelized bananas and the garlic mashed potatoes were simply sublime.  Then came the meats. My goodness, I thought I went to meat heaven - the ones that we tried were simply savory. I would truly recommend bringing an appetite when dining here, as you will be reaching to flip that chip in no time if you have any less of an appetite.  The Piece de Resistance  for me was the flan for dessert. It was superb. Not too sweet and not too tart. Just perfect. My wife had the chocolate mousse cake, but she didn't like it, and only took a few bites and set it aside.  All in all, at the end of our dining experience, prior to settling the bill, my migraine had completely subsided. Everyone was happy, until I went to the bathroom after settling the bill.  Let me explain...  The bill was $146, and I paid $200 in cash, and my change was approximately $53 and some change.  Because of their server pool, and the perpetual hand off between servers and a lack of interaction with regard to specific details, there had arisen some confusion and miscommunication as to whether or not we paid.  This was exacerbated by the fact that yours truly's policy of tipping for good server is around 30-75+ percent. So, I gave our servers a $50 tip. I left it at the table, and I excused myself and instructed my wife to hand it to one of the servers.  As I returned, and were about to leave, one of our servers (there were several of them) stopped my wife as she was walking through the tables and asked her if she had paid her bill as she was handed this $50 in the bill fold.  Unfortunately, this particular server stopped her and asked this question in the midst of various tables for many of the guests to hear. It was simply uncouth and tactless. Then when my wife clarified that it was a tip, she just proceeded on without any appreciation or gratitude.  Needless to say my wife was mortified, and I had to hear her venting in the car all the way home. And my migraine had summarily returned.  Sadly, on the way out, I was actually going to inquire as to how I could purchase a gift certificate for the three couples that I had previously mentioned. But, after this incident, I will continue to look elsewhere in the myriad of wonderful places throughout the valley.  If this seems petty, it is important to point out that the last time that we encountered such an untoward display was in an upscale Italian restaurant called Iannuzzi, over two decades ago.   Ironically, the issue there was also tip related. This happens so rarely that it really perturbs my wife, who never likes attention drawn to her; especially in an embarrassing manner such as this.  This establishment just needs to work on its communications, and professionalism that should be in keeping with their upscale status. Hence, why I only gave it a 4 star rating, when it really should've been a 5 star. Of course, if my wife had her druthers, it would've been a 1 star but I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt.  To be succinct, the only proper and appropriate response from that server would've simply been... "Thank You!"  Enough Said.   Time to get a prescription for Percocet! Not!

VOcpq0oMLxOw9SNd_xuVsg.text: No better bang for the buck if you like good meat and great selection of veggies. Sign up for their coupons online, and you'll get $25 off coupons a few times a year.  Everyone there is great and they go above and beyond to take care of the customer. Love it

8M2QEgglbKRZsVqeUku4nA.text: First time dining here... definitely will be returning! Not only was everything exceptional (and plentiful), but the staff is amazing as well! Marco made special recommendations (taking my food allergies into consideration) and accommodations; server Vanessa took great care of us, and brought me a list of allergens in regards to each of the food items offered. Many other dining establishments I have been to have a diminished amount of options available, or the server is unsure if soy is present, or in what capacity (ie - an ingredient that can be omitted vs a marinade that has been infused). Marco even offered to prepare each of the meat options that typically are prepared with ingredients containing soy in a different way so that I could still enjoy the variety. They have a red/green card system for when you would like to have the Gauchos bring around meats and you can visit the buffet as often as you would like.  From appetizers to salads, veggies to meats, breads and fruits, and even desserts... all was fresh and flavorful.  And Marco prepared the best (and prettiest) Chilean Sea Bass with a mango topping plated with asparagus for me, along with the freshest creme brulee I have ever tasted. Bellisimo!!

1d45VJ5U9T6lE58o3DTnCg.text: Went in for lunch, which, I think is the far better value, as the food is the same as dinner...just $20 cheaper.  First off - atmosphere and layout - very nice.   We were seated promptly, explained the process, and asked for drink orders.  BF had a back and forth with our server on the beer selection, ordered one the server recommended, and then...it never materialized.  It's very hard to flag a server in there, as once you're seated, you pretty much have the meat guys running the show, or, you go to the salad bar.  Anyhoo, we lost interest in it, and it didn't show up on the check, but still...serious fail to miss it, as again, they had a discussion over it.  To the food...all of the pork or chicken items were seriously dried out.  The ribs were unpalatable, the bacon-wrapped chicken was horrible. The beef were better choices, but not great.  We prefer our beef medium rare, though most of what came to the table was medium to well-done.  Some of the cuts were very bland, while others were strongly seasoned.  The salad bar...for all the ravings on here, I expected something fantastic.  It was OK.  The "meats" were the same you'd find pre-sliced at Safeway, the cheese selection had three choices, the veggies all looked very fresh, however.  The cheese bread they bring at the beginning was totally yummy.  Had about 4 of them myself.  lol  Overall, if you're looking to just eat copious amounts of meat, and you have little regard for quality and preparation, then you'll love this place just for the all-you-can-eat factor.  Otherwise, you'll likely be disappointed.

1UHs-AUcYN57_pc9DBrg_A.text: One of my favorite places to go for date night. The food is incredible; can't find anything like it anywhere else. Service experience is unique and very fun. Lou, head of customer service, is always on hand to make sure each guest is having a great dinner. Will continue to be a customer! I would highly recommend everyone try this place for a fun date at least once!

uEXE-niTYmhbiwtPBK-kyw.text: I don't see how anyone can complain about this place. They bring you a huge slab of meat and cut it right at your table. People keep walking up with amazingly delicious food one after the other offering you a cut.   The Filet Minon is some of the best I have ever tasted. $50 is more than what you would usually pay but it is so worth it. All you can eat primo slices of meat.

8rJeCpCrqjryu5H3yjrVyQ.text: Great Price and Good Food!  I think the reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of the customer service that they provide.  All the staff members work together as a team and it made the experience wonderful. You need a new clean plate? Their on it! You want something you havn't see come out yet? No problem they'll go get it. Another cocktail? well they have someone coming around with a mobile cart to bring you one! I was 100% satisfied with the customer service end.  The food was pretty good. Now don't get me wrong it was delicious. However I am comparing it to another Brazilian steakhouse I've been to in San Francisco and for around the same price their food is EXCELLENT. Now the customer service on the other hand is not as good. I wasn't overly impressed with the salad bar,  I would probably skip it next time I go and just focus on stuffing my face with more meat!  Bottom line: Great food and exceptional customer service. I would come here again in a heartbeat.

YZbWnfHgEelIQHiv1zwhuw.text: I would like to be able to say our experience at this restaurant was as wonderful as it has been in the past, but this time an incident occurred that has caused me and my friends and family to never return there again.  My daughter and friends took me to Fogo last night for my birthday.  We enjoyed right up until the bill came.  Some insensitive, ignorant waiter wrote a very derogatory message on my daughter's ticket. When we saw the comment we were appalled, disgusted and extremely angry.  It is unbelievable and inexcusable that such a comment come from anyone at any establishment, but from this upscale restaurant it is even more appalling!  How dare he!!  The management was insincere and handled the situation very poorly.  We asked that the guilty party be brought to the table for a formal apology to my daughter.  That never happened although we stayed and waited at the table for quite a long time.  Instead the GM offered her a gift card to come back for another visit.  Was he some kind of crazy?!  We will never return to this restaurant!!  My daughter has been hurt beyond belief, and is dealing with the emotional fallout this incident has caused her.    How about some harassment and sensitivity training Fogo!!!

sc_wyrc-3lJqBJQ9lvlIKQ.text: We had such a good experience , food was great , service was amazing , our server Marcos was pleasant and the manager Marco was very hands on . Will def go back and bring our family . Salad bar was fresh and the meat was right on time . I'm a happy customer

pK1p7Wk6o0Eo9qEKcI_T3w.text: I had a great experience with fogo de chao in Sao Paulo Brazil..so I wanted to try here in the USA, so I was very very disappointed with the food and the side dishes, the meat was not taste like in Brazil. MEATFEST! place was clean, service was excellent.  did I mention MEATFEST! we didn't drink and bill was $149 WITH tip for 2 people.... they had an awesome salad bar, TONS of MEAT, and they just kept coming, and coming, and coming..... GzFAkMnJiP2OIWPspjZyCg.text: Another one of my favorites, this is the palce to go if you want to impress someone and has hands down the best service and meats, you must try the beef ribs!!

rZk1vfWUlNRs2TYERIog3A.text: In anticipation of what may be my last lunch at Fogo de Chao for a long time (a change in my work location will make this an untenable lunch option), a decided to write my review of this place *before* eating a meal there.  Once upon a time, Fogo e Brasa was the churrascaria in Phoenix.  It was OK from what I remembered.  It became Brazillian Bull, and more recent memories seem to conjure up images of salt shakers, salt flats, salt water, salt, rock salt, and even more salt.  Before I ever tried Fogo de Chao, I thought BB was a reasonable option due to its lower price, but after trying Fogo de Chao (which I actually like to pronounce as correctly as I can: "shoum" with a very soft 'm'), I decided that it would actually be a waste of money, and calorie budget, to go with the cheaper place.  So, why is Fogo de Chao so good?  Two things: the food and the service.  The salad bar and sides are great.  I always like to get a few of their fancy cheeses and the smoked salmon, and a few other odds and ends before my meal.  The Pao de Queijo is delicious.  It's OK to budget space for one or two pieces.  The meats are all good.  You do have to be careful, though: if you don't pay attention, you may find yourself with some chicken on your plate, which can take up valuable gastric real estate better used on a good cut of beef or their leg of lamb (my personal favorite).  They also cook them nice and bloody - every once in awhile, they undershoot it a bit, and the sheep jumps off the plate and runs away.  Best of all, they're seasoned well - even if you get stuck with a mostly-outside piece, it's not too salty.  The only complaint I have is that they never bring me the leg of lamb often enough.  And the guarana is $4.  A little steep for a can of soda, no?  Really, this is quite the fine establishment, and a worthy place to spend ~$40 on lunch.

lTxMpyXMYIGGAFYdFA01AA.text: This is a usual Brazilian steakhouse. It's very upscale. Don't fill up on the salad bar though, because once you turn over your coaster from red to green, your place will be FULL of succulent meats from tasty animals! Chicken, beef, lamb, pork OH MY! Make sure you are good and hungry before arriving. All of the cuts of meat could be cooked the way you want it (rare-well). We went here to celebrate my boyfriend's college graduation and the servers brought him out a fancy and free dessert.   You can get all the good cuts of meat and salad bar at lunchtime for less money than dinner time. This place is pretty cut and dry. Nothing special except the flavor of the meat, though for that only, I give it 4 stars.

yithFiu0eC4NNLCBSuVntg.text: I went here for the first time for New Years Eve and it was AMAZING. the customer service is great and the servers were on top of everything. I highly recommend the filet mignon wrapped in bacon. Probably the best steak I've ever had. It is definitely on the pricey side but worth every penny.

_jm6I4xDf72oJ5kW6i52hw.text: What great service!  Took my wife and 8 guest to The Scottsdale location for her 50th birthday and everyone was attentive and courteous. I am looking forward to our next visit.

zWhIygJP2W5G0Lv92P1OOw.text: I just don't get it.  This is your classic Brazilian steakhouse type joint.  I think they are all kind of the same.  I will say the service staff and salad bar at this location are top notch.  The salad bar has several options and does not have any of the mess associated with your usual salad bar at restaurants.  Reservations for dinner are pretty much a must but while we were there I saw a little of everything in terms of dress.  Don't feel like you have to get dressed to the 9's at this place if you are not up for it.  The meat is good but after a while it all sounds and starts to taste the same to me.  At a little over $50 bucs per head it can get expensive quick.  I have no issue paying over a hundred dollars for my wife and I to eat out but for a buffet.  Not for this guy.

cgTWASbek42eB4UqRD4F9Q.text: Wow, just wow! Love the concept of an all-you-can-eat Brazilian steakhouse. I recommend making reservations if you are planning to come here, but they won't seat you until your entire party is present. This place is great for groups. And I love the red light/green light system so no one is bothering you for more food when you're not ready and you stay seated for protein and a selection of sides. Just remember to turn over your card as needed. You only get up for the salad bar. The selection is okay. This is a great way to celebrate someone or spend time with family and friends with great food. And definitely come with a big appetite. A couple things though - there was one meat I was dying to have and even had to have a waitress call them over and they still never came. Eventually over time I became too full to have it when I was asked if I still wanted it. For the price, I'm not sure if I ate as much as it's worth so beware of that. Don't come here if you don't appreciate high quality, perfectly seasoned meat or if you're a picky eater. On a good note, they give complimentary full-sized dessert for birthdays if you tell your server. This place was really good but probably a one-time thing for me.

PVLhi7NaS210i-XrNWXR6w.text: First off I thought this was going to be a nice restaurant. Boy was I wrong. The set up a strange with green and red cards of bring me more meat or stop bringing me so much meat. And a very 1970s salad buffet.

_jl16UTJ6CsuQ8gKIfU3FA.text: I understand 'meat sweats' a whole lot better after 1 night here. The meat was good, I didn't care for all of it. The salad bar was okay. Considering the sheer amount of food, the tables for large groups is not nearly big enough. The cocktails were good, seemed a bit on the weak side though. Waiter was friendly but the meat slicers looked like they hated their life. Not a place I would go more than once a year unless it was free.

PKdevQ8163o-WUkp9Qfh3Q.text: This place is much too overrated. Unlimited food doesn't really matter when the food isn't great. All of their different selections of meat have little to no flavor... it just tastes like they sprinkle salt and pepper on everything. The salad bar was like any other salad bar... nothing special. The service is great and that's why I'll give them two stars instead of one. I just don't understand what the hype is all about.   A family member of mine was thinking of having her wedding reception here and after sampling the food - she changed her mind. They also said the waiters wouldn't serve the salad in the private room; everyone has to leave the room and serve their own salad... including her, in her big, fluffy wedding dress. Tacky.

8gIPCeaqbRrY61a10Gk-IQ.text: My boyfriend and I go here all the time! We love it and we always make sure to have an empty stomach before we go. The wait staff work together so anytime you need anything there is always someone to help!   If you love meat then this is definitely somewhere you have to go!

hxvzsADEG6jbAcUwHUiGrA.text: From go  A wonderful place to go. The salads are good but the meat is great every few seconds someone would ask if we wanted this or that. We left so full I was light headed and I didn't even drink any wine or alcohol. Wonderful staff very on top of it. Thanks guys see you nest time

U8gclsdh5MwQudpYBBv1QA.text: The food was decent but don't expect to get friendly service.  The staff was relatively unfriendly from the manager down. We'll try another Brazilian restaurant next time...

xfv1UCDFDKzaqLZ3VisrEA.text: We had a charity fundraiser today with 180 attending. The service was impeccable,  the food fantastic and they helped us raise thousand$ for our medical mission. We'll be back!

w5PvWDM8ElmN1bciR0yGsQ.text: Another marvelous time at FoGo De Chao... Splendid service and workers. Lou and Christopher in particular, took awesome care of us there today celebrating Sophia's Bday!!!

yQ02DlEtDeq0KnIr9UoRsg.text: Great food! Love that cheese bread and yellow appetizer sticks. Fillet mignon and chicken in bacon is sooo good!

Lhupw1HTZ3sR5tYwQoagwA.text: I absolutely LOVE Fogo De Chao. Now here are a few things you should know...   It's expensive. Know in there knowing it's going to cost you $50 a person. BUT also know that you are going to experience some of the best food you've ever had. Go in knowing the cost and that you're paying for incredible food and a very unique experience. It's worth it for me, make sure it's worth it for you too.   It's all you can eat! So come hungry!! There is a very extensive salad bar and then the meats come around when you're ready.
