M4ql35uB5ot5bcOpBMrIaA.text: My wife and I have frequented this restaurant a number of times and had grown to love this place. But yesterday's experience will be our last.  I had made an on-line reservation, and in the request comments of their website I specified that I was bringing my wife for dinner to celebrate her birthday on 12/12/12 (date of our reservation).  We walked in about 10 minutes early, I specified who the reservation was for and we walked right in. At the time (6PM), the restaurant was still empty (it was more than half full by the time we left, about 60 minutes later).    The food is always top notch at Fogo de Chao. The salad bar (especially the smoked salmon, various cheeses and sun dried tomatos are some of our favorites) is well stocked with specialty items.  The meats are always excellent and the diversity offered is the main attractive element of this place.  So where did things start to go wrong for us?  I should mention that we accompanied dinner with a couple of glasses of sparkling wine.  Things started going downhill when our glasses were empty. Both my wife and I were not in a drinking mood, and so, at the first instance of being asked whether we desired more wine, we respectfully declined.  Less than 30 seconds later we were asked again, by a different waiter - this time we thought it was kind of funny to have so much attention paid to us (and we figured that since I had mentioned it was my wife's birthday, they wanted to pay a little extra care to our table), but we declined again.  Not more than 30 seconds later, a different waiter comes by again and asks us the exact same question.  Now it was downright annoying.  Not more than 1 minute later, we received the precise exact question.  My answer this time was more curt, "We do not want any more wine." Fortunately, they did not come back a 5th time.  I have noticed that there is little comminucation among the service staff at Fogo de Chao.  The right hand rarely knows what the left hand is doing.  At this point we had concluded our dinner and the waiter had removed our plates. I was expcting a little slice of birthday cake with a candle to drop by any second. Instead, the waiter comes by with our check.  I was upset at this turn of events.  We're not at In-N-Out here paying $10 for a couple of burgers, and was taken aback that apparently nobody had read my reservation comments - what is the point of including such comments?  I went to the front desk and told the hostess that I was disappointed that Fogo de Chao could not even acknowledge my request. I was asked what my name was and I specified the name of my reservation.  I was told, "I'm sorry but I just forgot", was the reply.  Really? So I'm spending well over $100 (including drinks) and the reply that I receive is "I'm sorry but I forgot?".  The hostess then asked what table we were at, and mentioned that they would be bringing something by very soon. We waited for 10 minutes and decided to just pay our bill as bothof us wanted to get out of there. Finally, a different waiter came by with a slice of cake, apologizing for the hostess (again with the "she forgot" commentary) with a candle for my wife.  It is the little things that make such a dinner memorable. Fogo de Chao completely dropped the ball, in my opinion.  They did remove our drinks from the bill, but instead left a sour taste in our mouths.  Asking us 4 times, within a 2 minute interval, if we want more wine is more important to them than paying attention to the small but crucially significant details that make a birthday dinner special.

WR72LdV6_yPVTkjp8VecCQ.text: My hubby took me to Fogo de Chao for our anniversary. It was the first time I had been to a Brazillian style restaurant. The atmosphere was great and the food was good, but I am not sure that I would go back. The reason is beacuse I do not feel that I can eat enough of the food to justify the cost. I do eat meat of all kinds but would just rather have a great filet and call it a day. Now if you are a meat LOVER and like alot of options during your meal then this place may be for you.

2RH1Ga0Kitwj0IqIkG0eRA.text: OK, so maybe my barbarian talk review was lost on many readers so I have decided to edit my initial review of Fogo. Needless to say, this place will bring out the inner meat eating barbarian in all of us.   I have been to the Fogo de Chao in Philadelphia and the one in Scottsdale numerous times, both locations offer the freshest items and both have their signature wait staff who bring the meat on the fly when your card is green.   If you're bringing new initiates, advise them to come prepared. That being said, this place isn't a "buffet". It is a bit classier than that and as I mentioned, you will be getting quality items from both the salad bar and the main course with excellent service all around. Regardless if you get "your money's worth", it is an experience everyone should enjoy at least once.   The Philadelphia location is right in center city and the AZ location is in yuppy Scottsdale. However, like "Jason V." mentioned, there were definitely more family tables at the AZ location than the one in Philly. No judging here either, but I agree that Fogo is not the place to bring infants and toddlers.

qsqvqWVlVE-oJ5XNdAiRZA.text: The food was amazing!.. We went here for a friend's dad's birthday and the food was awesome!! Besides the food though, there sat us at a table that was by the door, which was okay, there just seemed to be a lot of traffic. There was a very large party next to us that had 2-3 young children that were running around and screaming. It was not a pleasant dinner and it was very loud. It definitely was difficult to talk across the table. Towards the end of dinner, we wanted to get desert due to celebrating a birthday and the wait staff seemed to disappear on us. By the time they came around and asked if we would like desert, everyone was ready to leave. We definitely will try this place again because the food was excellent, but hopefully next time the atmosphere will be better.

3fiYbcVacS1FT2qoTqEcfw.text: I have eaten at the Fogo de Chao restaurants in Houston, TX and Scottsdale, AZ multiple times. Both were amazing. The food is excellent and the service is outstanding. It is well worth the $40 price even if you do not plan to stuff yourself since it is all you-can-eat. You are paying for the quality, not quantity. There is such a variety of different cuts of steak, as well as pork and chicken. All have their own unique flavor and all are extremely tasty. If you are not a huge meat eater, you can get just the salad bar for half the price. That is also worth the trip in my opinion since it contains many unusual options such as hearts of palm, fresh mozzarella balls, and sun dried tomatoes that are not found in your average salad bar. The side dishes served at the table are also very, very good if you like Latin food. Black beans, crisped polenta cakes, and steamed plantains. What more do you want?

ci3X6Yl6Emr6jJCJxzSdkQ.text: My wife (Brazilian) and I give this 5 stars and in a bullet fashion...here is why.  Valet parking - sorry folks, if I'm going to kick up a hundo for a meal for my wife and I, this is to be somewhat special and elegant.  Kudos for the valet parking especially considering my wife was wearing 5" heels so she appreciated me springing for it.  Not sure what my old man's problem was that he was too cheap to do it and he walked with his wife for 10 minutes to get to the front door.  This was on a Saturday night mind you.  Cordial - From the moment we walked in the door we were greeted and taken care of without having to ask if they forgot us.  We had our 14 month old with us and we were trying to get a picture of the three of us so the hostess rushed over and snapped a photo of us.  Food - My dad and I are carnivores but he did nail down some seafood at the salad bar.  The apple-chicken salad was awesome and the ladies enjoyed just about every facet of the salad bar.  Let's just say there was parmesan everywhere!  As for the main course, the rodizio was as good as it gets.  My old man and I nailed down as much meat as the intestines would handle.  If you haven't done Brazilian rodizio before, nearly everything is seasoned with rock salt.  Many of the cuts were being brought on two skewers, one more on the rare side and one more well done.  I like my meat to the rare side and the flavor was incredible.  Restaurants like this make you wish you had a bottomless pit.  Meat lovers, please visit SOON!  Service - This is a key again for me.  I have no tolerance for paying for a meal, let alone one this expensive, and being treated like I never walked in the door.  Honestly, I can cook up a good meal and serve myself and save the complaints and the excessive $$$ if necessary.  Fogo did not disappoint one bit.  The servers were very friendly, on top of the table constantly...not one mistake in anyone's drink...even kept my little guy's apple juice full.  One thing we really liked is that there was one individual who was hitting the tables asking what types of meat we were waiting for specifically, not only did he remember...we soon had the meats we preferred flowing to the table faster than we could devour them...definitely pleased with this extra attention to detail.  Only two things that weren't positive and I wouldn't say they were a negative by any means...in fact if they didn't happen, this would have been a 6 out of 5 rating from us.  First, my dad and his wife shared the Flan from the dessert menu and claimed it wasn't as "light" as it should be.  Honestly, how in the heck did he have room for dessert in the first place?     And the last item on my soapbox is one I'm sure a few in Phoenix complain about but it's hard to get the restaurants to enforce.  I'm originally from the midwest and we dress up to go to Applebees so folks, please don't come to a restaurant like this dressed in your damn basketball shorts.  We were there on a Saturday night and fortunately most of the Scottsdale folk dressed adequately for the occasion but there were some exceptions.  Honestly I think this place is busy enough that they should be more strict with the dress.  My dad lives in Paradise Valley not far from the place but my wife and I made the trek up from Maricopa to enjoy this cuisine and we WILL BE BACK!   Fogo, thank you for a wonderful dining experience.

qi4Z1zBMhgWN624t1ZYjTA.text: Awesome place.  Great service.  Great food.  Not sure what else to say.  If you have not been to Fogo de Chao, you should go.  Beware of 'food coma' after eating here.    ;-)

NBnzSR16fKx_b5O9DsYWNQ.text: Positives: There was a wide variety of salad, meats, and sides that come with your meal; drinks and dessert are not included. The service is phenomenal and absolutely what you'd want when you spend that much money for food.   Negatives: We are absolutely meat lovers, and enjoy good flavor, however with the exception of a couple of cuts, there really wasn't too much to it, other than over salted entrees. Also, we went here for spring restaurant week and normally the prices during this week should be much cheaper than normal for a 3 course meal, and instead it was only 6 dollars cheaper than any other normal dinner night. I thought this was very deceiving when I made reservations. I wouldn't mind paying the money, if they were upfront about it.   Worth trying once just to say you went there, but we probably won't be going back.

1hklpYSdGiyys9KOoWY40Q.text: I rarely write reviews for restaurants, but thought that this one fully deserved it - in the best way. I took my dad for a late Father's Day dinner last and had the most amazing time. We arrived 10 minutes early for our 7:30p reservation, but were immediately seated. Our water was filled as we sat (the server, who showed up at the table before us and the hostess pulled out our chairs for us) and the server explained the process to us in a friendly manner. We ordered our drinks and hit the salad bar.   The salad bar is to die for - all types of lettuce, rare veggies and additives like marinated bamboo, fresh mozzarella and FULL artichoke hearts (amazing); all fresh. There is also apple salad, potato salad, and more that I can't even remember.   Before we got back to the table with our salads, our drinks were waiting for us on the table. We left the token on red as we chowed down on our salads and chatted for a while until the sides arrived; mashed potatoes, caramelized bananas and fried polenta...all fantastic. After explaining the side dishes, our server took our salad plates and brought us fresh ones for the meat.  Immediately after switching the tokens we received non-stop service from the meat servers, who always made sure to ask how we wanted the meat and if we wanted more, etc. and were happy to explain the cuts. The meat itself was divine. The only complaint that I could think of was that the rub for the lamb was quite salty, but I don't really enjoy salty foods and my dad loved it, so I think it's more of a preference - the meat was so good, I just cut the edges off and kept eating.  Our drinks were constantly filled always before they were completely empty (we were drinking water and iced tea because neither of us wanted to fill up on wine or booze). More than that, every so often the sever would come by and ask if there was any specific meat we wanted more of at that moment as not to make us wait until it came around or if we wanted more sides (the sides, the salad, and the meat are unlimited). They also give you fresh plates anytime they see trimmings or bones, etc. hanging around on the plate, which I appreciated.   All and all, it was a great experience and well worth the price ($50 per person)! Mind you I am pretty stingy, so something HAS to be worth it for me to pay over $100. We were not rushed whatsoever (We arrived at 7:20p and didn't leave until 9:30p). This is definitely on my list of best restaurants for special occasions.

tjpZSTZb9xailiquVcIU7w.text: Best place ever. Plus kids eat free. Meat and more Meat!! My husband loved it. So good.

nr_9ECcSwVz8inlyWmZlfg.text: Fogo de chao was a great expierence. Great people and great meat! If u want a great waiter ask for junior hes the man!!

ZoGEzj6S40T3Sarsf6_ZBA.text: Get ready to get meat drunk, then fall into a meat coma!! Although this is not a nationwide chain, this is what a chain restaurant can and should be, it's great. You begin with an immaculate salad bar. Definitely the best one I have ever seen or tasted for that matter. Hell you have to love a salad bar that has a whole wheel of Parmesan cheese for you to enjoy. Enough with the salad lets talk about the star of the show, the meat!! Transcendental might be too strong of a word, but it is pretty damn close.  It is endless amounts of meat prepared 15 different ways, all seasoned perfectly. You have to love something that is seasoned so well that if adding salt or pepper to it at the table would over season it. This place is pretty much a buffet that comes to you and after trying several meats its great because you don't want to move, lol. And the best part is, is that you tell them when to come to you!! I could go on and on but if you have about 60 bucks to spend and want to enjoy a great meal just go here and leave in physical pain from over eating like I do!!

j-po6_zje76pMU8WOb_5VQ.text: This place is awesome, I've never been to anything like it. If you are in the mood for meet then this is the place for you. Even if you aren't they have an amazing Salad Bar. Make sure not to fill up on salad though as you wont be disappointed by the selection of meats that await you.

3ArnvuY2W3b0_Cpt3sqShQ.text: Yum! We love this place. It's a fun place for special occasions, and the food is delicious. It is pricey, but for a once in a while treat, it is worth it. I recommend making reservations, even if you don't think it will be busy. Plus, they'll ask if it's a special occasion on the phone- let them know if it is a birthday, anniversary, etc., and you can score complimentary dessert (that you will likely be too full to finish). We just made reservations for Christmas Eve, since we cannot be with our families this year, we figured we'd spoil ourselves!

roUqufIIMKUynPNn59M0WQ.text: I took my boyfriend here for a late Valentine's Day dinner...we were first timers. I had been on the web site before we left so I knew the prices; I believe it was $47.50 for the meal and $19.50 for the salad bar only. I don't eat meat so I'm glad they had the salad bar option as well. Since it was a Friday night and we didn't want to wait forever to eat I jumped online and made an online reservation through their site. Once we arrived we only waited a few minutes before being seated. Parking took longer than that...it looked like they had complimentary valet but I didn't have any cash for a tip so we wanted to self-park which looked like the majority of customers did. The parking lot is shared with some other busy stores so parking was very competitive. The restaurant has an open feel and was pretty packed. The atmosphere isn't very relaxing though, the whole restaurant shares the one salad bar which was pretty packed all night, there are the meat chefs buzzing through all the tables constantly, and each section seemed to be run by multiple waiters, bus boys, etc... It just had a very busy feel. There is no menu. You sit, you get an explanation of the service, and you immediately start eating. The entire experience took less than an hour.  Drinks: I ordered a diet coke and it came in a mini bar bottle with a glass of ice. He had an iced tea. The sodas are $3.00...per mini bar bottle so if you like to have a few glasses with dinner...you should order an iced tea which is free refills.  The salad bar has 30 different items which included a spring mix, looked like butter lettuce, spinach, sliced tomatoes, fresh balls of mozzarella, roasted peppers, giant asparagus, green beans, croutons, taboule, bread, potato chips (thick sliced potatoes), mushrooms, cheeses, dressings, and more. They also had some deli meats and fish but I don't eat meat so I didn't pay close attention.  Your meal comes with sides...to be completely honest, although they were nice with the meal, the flavors were somewhat bland. The pao de queijo (warm cheese bread) was exactly like a popover...the fluffy baked good you may enjoy for breakfast with butter and jam. They were okay (pretty bland); I only had one. The crispy hot polenta was served in squares. They were definitely crispy and it was tasty...reminded me of hashbrowns both in flavor and texture. The garlic mashed potatoes were also just okay for me. They were creamy in texture...almost to the point they tasted artificial and were topped with cheese. They weren't served hot though so the cheese did not melt at all. The food was all warm. It seemed like they may pre-dish everything since they get so busy. The caramelized bananas were not sweet. To tell you the truth...they were so bland I thought that they were plantains. They look very dry when they were brought to us...no extra sauce or anything. They just looked unappetizing. We both tried a bite...I guess they could be used between dishes as a palette cleanser.  We also asked for rice and black beans. These are only brought out upon request. The rice was very good...a mild but delicious flavor. The black beans were drowning in bean juices but tasted good...until I bite into a piece of meat and had to spit them out! Yes, I made the decision to spit out food into my cloth napkin in a nice restaurant.  I could not swallow it. Since I mentioned at the beginning of the meal that I don't eat meat, I was very surprised that they didn't warn us about the beans but everyone's human so I didn't really care. I just asked for a new napkin.   For meat service, they have a two sided card for each person; red means stop, green means come at me with those meat sticks. My boyfriend picked out which items he wanted to try...he liked the filet mignon the best. It added up quickly though, they're small pieces but with the multiple meats, the sides, and the salad bar we both got full really fast. I can't stress enough that the service was seamless and everyone was so friendly. The bill, after tip was $97 and change. Keep in mind, we did not have any alcoholic drinks and I only had the salad bar. This experience was a different one and I took my boyfriend here for the meat, to compensate for all the vegetarian meals he shares with me, but overall I would say the food was great, but not the most amazing thing I've have ever experienced. Next time, I would prefer a nice steak house with a more relaxing feel...especially since it's not everyday that we spend $100 on dinner for the two of us.

xA4maiVPEXAOWxfaHmQKAg.text: I have no idea why this place was crowded. I'm now convinced that this is a place that people go just to say they went. Went with expectations for large quantities of high quality meat. Meat was overcooked, fatty and low quality. Medium should be pink throughout not well done and grey. My plate was covered with meat scraps and I probably got around two bites of meat that I actually ate. I didn't think this would ever happen in my lifetime but I spit out filet mignon- how does a steakhouse screw up one of the best cuts of beef? Sides and salad bar weren't appealing either. They brought the wrong bottle of wine. The only good thing about the place was they didn't charge me $50 for the dog food they served.

splPi6wDjvwqJGl-6-4z_g.text: Best steak experience ever!!!! This is definitely a splurge type place if you are lucky to be in a town that actually has one. Service got a little shaky towards the end of our meal but it was terribly busy, being that it was Saturday night on Valentine's day weekend. Five stars does this place the justice it deserves for both the ambiance and top notch food quality! Would do it all over again if I had the chance!

5GsRq6-JeB8CFpRmj84Qkg.text: This was my first time eating at the Fogo de Chao in Scottsdale and it might be the last.  I have eaten at the Fogo de Chao in Dallas many times so I knew what to expect, amazing service and perfectly cooked and seasoned meat.  For the $30 you will spend on lunch, you should not expect anything less. As I walked in, I was not disappointed.  Everything was first class.  The salad bar was just as you would expect in a five star steakhouse.  I learned from previous visits not to waste too much time at the salad bar.  I came for the meat, cooked Brazilian style, and I was hungry. As soon as I sat down, I flipped my card to "green", which signals that I was ready for meat.  "Red" means stop bringing meat.  I didn't really care what came to me first; I knew it would all be delicious.  As luck would have it, the first "gaucho", Portuguese for cowboy, to come by had one of my favorites; top sirloin.  My mouth was watering as he sliced off two big pieces from the rotisserie skewer.  This is where the fantasy of what I was expecting ends and reality set in.  The meat was dry and rather bland.  What!  This had never happened to me at this restaurant before.  Of the dozens of times I had eaten in Dallas, the food was always perfect and top notch.  The Scottsdale Fogo de Chao was turning out to be a disappointment. I thought to myself that I simply had one bad cut of meat and it was bound to happen sooner or later.  I tried the filet mignon, the lamb, the chicken and the pork.  They were all dry and flavorless.  The only thing that made spending $30 on lunch worth it was the fabulous meat, yet what they were serving was not even as good at Texas Roadhouse. I'm sure that one day I will go back and give them another chance.  Every day that passes I convince myself that it wasn't as bad as it was.  As soon as my memory fades enough, I'll be back for at least one more try.  Besides, it is too much fun to drop a bread crumb on the table and watch the headwaiter scramble to come clean it up.

6hqi-8jwllTgOb2-sMoVEA.text: We've been going to Brazilian Steakhouses for many years.  While the food here was typical of Brazilian Steakhouses, what separates this restaurant is the service.    The manager came to our table early during dinner to see if there were specific menu items we wanted.  My 8 year old daughter was catered to.  They refilled the carmelized bananas three times for her.  While it's always pricey, we enjoyed our dinner and dining experience.  We will return!

nREbKPu8zCm1RC1DOaWPjg.text: I love food, yet I am admittedly not a huge steakhouse guy. So I have not been aware of the growing popularity of Brazilian steakhouses as a "thing." And Fogo de Chao is apparently the apex of the Brazilian steakhouse experience. And so it came to pass that an opportunity came to check out Fogo in Scottsdale (hey, it was either this or Benihana) so we said, what the hey, and pulled the trigger.  So Fogo has a unique structure. They have a salad bar, which - by itself - could be and is a draw. They have a great selection of coldcuts and cheeses, delicious pasta salads. They have a hot food bar with rosemary potatoes, scalloped potatoes, wild rice, black beans and that I could've easily filled up. But no. No, listen to me. Do not fill up on their polenta sticks, plantains, and puffed bread. That's a ruse to keep you from the honeypot.  'The honeypot?' You say, quizzically.  You see, once you're seated at Fogo they give you a card. One side is a red stop sign. The other is go. Sure, without it, they'll bring you some great mashed potatoes at first, but once you flip green. Boom, you are in the danger zone.  Meat will come. From so many people. Meat on a stick. Parmesan pork. Top sirloin. Bottom sirloin. Filet mignon. Bacon wrapped chicken. Even bacon wrapped pork. Plus lamb shanks and more more more!!!  In all seriousness, the cuts of meat are great and varied. From well done to rare and a singular experience that'll make you feel like a king.  The food there is delicious. The experience is pretty epic. Good for a birthday, anniversary, dental graduation. And it beats Benihana.  It is expensive. Between the two of us, after wine, the bill was almost $200 dollars, so not an everyday kind of thing, but good on occasion but definitely felt worth the money.

f2n0gkpzyNkKgoj5QD8m0g.text: Had a really great experience here. From the food to the service to the overall atmosphere. The market bar had a great selection and the choices of meat and the quality was outstanding. Will definitely be back again.

LdKtNIxYiDUz4Xc0Lzq9Kg.text: Our Sons and their families came in from Portland to surprise my husband for his 70th birthday and reserved the private party room and our experience was great! We have 3 young grandchildren and the staff was very attentive to all of our needs including chocolate, dairy and gluten sensitivities! The Market table was outstanding and all of the meats served were done to perfection! We will definitely be returning!

E-infAXRYds2--OaEqR6_A.text: Something about this place just doesn't have me excited to go back. The salad bar is what I would expect at that price point - but nothing too over the top.   Obviously most people come for the meat...yes the variety is awesome, but the meat is great to so-so to poor. We had an abundance of their least quality steak coming around as well as bacon wrapped dry chicken! In over an hour we only saw many of the meats once. I asked politely three times for the ribs, and after 20 minutes of waiting I gave up. I felt scammed - the pork loin was incredibly dry and a lot of the steak reminded me of zoo animal smells. How many times do we have to say NO to the sausage? I realize it's their cheap filler, but c'mon...  The highlight of the night was the filet, ribs (beef), chicken, the bread, polenta, and the mozzarella.   It was nice leaving full, but I'd rather grill at home next time!

K5mC_DbIIVXpO7z-xUbnYw.text: Father's Day was super busy so that's why I am giving a 3 instead of a 2. I do understand, first hand, that being busy effects service. We actually had great service from everyone, except our server. At the beginning he was around often but then he never really came back. The main issues were in regards to availability of items. They were out of 2 wines that we ordered and the dessert we ordered. They said the creme brulee wouldn't be ready for 2 hours and they wouldn't serve it before. We had to ask multiple times to get any lamb at the table, which turned out to be a bit overdone and too gamey. We also had to ask a couple times for the filet, which sadly was the only steak that wasn't good. Flank steak was amazing!! Bacon steak was great, sirloin was great, and pork was good. Luckily another server helped us with anything we needed. Paying our bill was a nightmare. Took 30 minutes. They over charged us and then disappeared forever when we asked for it to be adjusted. The highlight of the night- a completely separate server, after an hour of being told about the dessert, brought us a creme brulee. And it was delicious. We did speak to the manager. She didn't seem to care or acknowledge anything. Not that we needed anything free (Father's already got a free meal on the next visit, the problem is that no one wants to go back.) BUT there were no apologies or care. Bummer experience for such a pricey place.

nV68VMw8FOdV0Ua2y6tbnA.text: Great place! I took my daughter & 10 family members here for her birthday and everyone loved it! The food was incredible & the concept is super original & really fun. The staff were friendly & helped us with a birthday surprise and brought out my daughter a birthday cake we had gotten for her. Couldn't have been more pleased with our experience.

C56z5s0210Po0kQ2bv0n4g.text: Let me start by saying WOW!!! Can you imagine a place where they just keep bringing you more and more of the best food?  This is it! The sirloin and ribeye were awesome.  Defiantly a cut above your normal steakhouse.  Then they brought out the bacon wrapped filet.  I was in heaven...until they brought out the filet (without bacon)!  This is by far the best cut of meat I have ever eaten. I can't say enough about this place and would go back in a heart beat!!! And then the molten chocolate cake was delish!

QWnCpxHv-_CF06eGZSmSdw.text: Celebrated my sons' birthday here this past Saturday. There were 4 of us, I almost died when the check came.  I made a reservation but they seated us earlier than our time.... So what's the point of the reservation?! I requested they sing happy birthday to him when I booked the res online, they did not.This place is too noisy. I didn't like the way the tables were situated. My son kept getting bumped in to. The food was average, nothing to brag about. Highly overrated. The servers were attentive but you don't just have 1 so not sure how they kept track of everything. I gave 2 stars because the restroom was nice and there was an abundance of food.I am a food snob from NYC. Compared to my experience at Tucanos in Alberquerque, NM, there is no comparison. Will not be returning.

2gaHF6mcxHN4WNTmBPVc5w.text: So went to fogo on Valentine, and let me just say we were not served well.   Had reservations at 6:30 was promptly seated by our host, but then that's where it went south. After our host sat us, we waited for 20 min for a server to ask if we wanted any drinks. We went greeted by a server or anything. In fact I was very confused on who my server was. I understand that it's Valentine's Day, and maybe there was a mix up, but we didn't have a server for our table period.   The food was delicious but I don't understand why they ask how we like our meat, because virtually all the meat that we asked ( med rare) were well done.   When we were ready to pay we literally sat there for 30 min trying to get someone's attention. I finally got the hostess attention that was seating another couple. A guy came over and gave our bill. Then another 20 min sitting there waiting for someone to pick up my card, had to waive another person down. And guess again waited another 20 min for my card to get back.   Needless to say we were not happy whatsoever.  Have never been so disappointed in a reputable restaurant.

ZrYV_VGol0FDNrKIGSjK-Q.text: Crowded, rushed, inattentive service with small portions of tough meat. Bright sterile decor seems designed to hurry patrons out the door... if only someone would stop by the table and retrieve the check. A terrific disappointment.

IpOvbU0IytcC2ZlRb8ynJg.text: Meat lovers dream!! They also have amazing potatoes and a salad bar and their bananas and bread are delicious, but be careful not to fill up on throes and save room to try all the meat! Everything tastes amazing!! Great place for Father's Day!  You flip your card to "green", and servers come to you with different kabobs and meat and chicken. When full, or you need a breather, flip your card to red and they won't bother you.   Great service! Make sure to come with an empty stomach, very generous portions!!

WrQqQAmbGnFnz2W2JH25og.text: Love having meat tossed in my face every 10 seconds. If your a meat lover then this is the place don't waste your time with the salad bar just sit down and turn your meat card to green and watch a all protein war come to your plate chicken and some pork are dry so stick to the red meats although the apple rubbed pork is tasty great service and people watching

jR7XvtdwRHPpBc2cyi32vA.text: Manager Joan is arrogant, pompous and deterring guests from visiting. I will never visit this restaurant again.

a8cKHwW8UbKvvPutFBuhFw.text: Fogo de Chao is a Brazilian Steakhouse, where they serve all kinds of roasted protein (chicken, all types of steak, sausage, etc) tableside with somewhat kebab style skewers. You flip a coaster from red to green indicating when to be served and green to red indicating when to stop being served. You can flip back and forth as much as you like.   We came with a group 8+ deep, without reservation on a Friday, and they were more than accommodating - although the hostess jokingly flashed me the mean face when I told her how many people we had coming. The atmosphere is spacious and warm, seemingly upscale but not so smuggy you couldn't come in sweatpants with your family.   We got a couple drinks while waiting, such as the Caipirinha (my first time having one) which was delicious and the peach Bellini which was tasty but thick. Ran about $13/drink, where beer was about $7-$8 each.  They serve fried polenta sticks and some type of bread, both OK, as appetizers. There are plenty of options at the help-yourself food bar, including smoked salmon, greens, and meat/cheeses. The trick is to pick sparingly here and save room for the onslaught of skewered protein.  By far the best meats were the ribeye, sirloin, and mignon. The bacon-wrapped chicken was dry, the lamb was amazing however it was encrusted with black peppercorn to the point it became overpowering. Make sure to watch the cut of the meat when they ask what seer you want, because there were a couple times the beef was what I would consider medium-rare to rare when I was asking for "medium". I prefer my meat on the well-done side and I'm not the carnivore kind of guy you might see on Masterchef.  Overall, the Fogo - much less the Brazilian steakhouse - experience is a must try. Caution: Be prepared to drop some serious cash! Given it's Scottsdale where you may end up parking next to a Ferrari, our check was $173 including gratuity and not counting tip or our earlier drinks/beer for two people. The last time I spent that much at a "steakhouse" it was because of strippers. No strippers at Fogo...

u4oez4Dz27UDWfQCgZY3Lg.text: Very tardy on posting this review.  We actually ate at Fogo de Chao last year (2016) for Thanksgiving dinner.  We chose this restaurant because our son doesn't like the traditional turkey dinner however my husband and I do.  Fogo de Chao advertised that they would be offering, in addition to their normal menu, sliced turkey and all the trimmings.  We thought perfect, everyone will get something they like.  Our dinner reservations were at 5pm.  We were seated promptly upon on arrival, however, when my husband and I went to the buffet station which was where the turkey was supposed to be located, there was nothing there.  We asked our server about this and were told that they ran out of turkey and trimmings earlier in the day.  As I said, it's not like we went for a late dinner, we were there at 5pm. Needless to say, we were pretty disappointed. The meat offerings at the restaurant were just OK, we've eaten at Texas de Brazil in Aruba and Florida, and the food was much better.     I sent the restaurant an email after our experience and got absolutely no response.  This certainly was extremely poor planning on their part, felt a bit like a bait and switch.  We will never eat at this restaurant again because of the lack of customer service, it seems like a response to my email was the least they could have done after ruining our Thanksgiving meal.

Pn_9XY61Hk2yx9e_ZZvqJQ.text: Horrible value for the cost. This was our worst experience at a Fogo, and we won't be back. The more expensive offerings were never brought to our table. The men offering meat had no idea what they had. And the Filet Minion was definitely NOT Filet Minion.

g1NVqNbwZyq-Rob8g-TYxA.text: This is meat lover heaven!! The service was really good and they explained the type of meat options. I loved the variety of options for different cuts of meat. The wine selections were great as well. I would revisit again.

BDek55jgNjQ0wr1xBwCwgQ.text: The steakhouse was great, the service was spectacular! Vincent was the best server I've ever had

CUlzJ7QjXZc1iqbMLHsvTw.text: Nothing special it's quantity not quality steak is either too salty or bland cocktail was decent but then again don't just go to restaurants to drink I go to eat. Couldn't find anything that I liked the pork was decent steak was garbage this is saying something outback could probably provide a steak better if not the same. Would not go back for the price could have went to Ruth's Chris. Had to also get out of my chair and get my own plate and cutlery to end here won't be returning

qtby6cGYDAVv1TtyBkZR9w.text: I am late in writing this review so it is over due.  Last week my husband and I celebrated Veterans Day & his birthday at your wonderful restaurant in Scottsdale.  My husband Jay and I ordered the Chilean Sea bass & it was absolutely delicious!.  We planned to order the Steak...etc... but when a neighboring table raved over the various flavors my husband and I could not resist.  Needless to say we were in flavor heaven which included grilled asparagus and cheddar mashed potatoes.  We also had the salad bar and those hot rolls ...fabulous..., which meant we had to take some of our food home.  It was truly a great experience and if that was not enough, Tahson one of your waiters talked to us about the brazillian drink - The caipirinia? , we then ordered 2 of those drinks and my husband received a complimentary slice of birthday cake and again we were in flavor heaven.  We have been to many of your restaurants in LA, SF, LV, DC, Phili, Boston, VA, FL, Chicago, & now that we live in AZ, this will be our new go to place here.  So as I end this review with a thank you that is beyond words.  I must send a special note and thanksgiving wish to the following team members of this lovely establishment.  I will start my well wishes to the manager, Claire, then Favi, Susana, Drew, Christopher, Steven, Tahson= Brazilian Caipirinhia cocktail :) and last but not least Hector and Chanel who I called today to find out how to place this add in Open Table ( she said just use Yelp) :)  so thanks again everyone it was a wonderful and flavorful experience. We will see you again soon. Until then please take care and have a happy and Blessed holiday.  Thanks, Mel and Jay :) in Gilbert AZ

Kzd0IvzP64e84jJgc0DiLg.text: The meats were super salty. I loved the mashed potatoes, bread, and banana whipped cream. I would go back for those, but it's pretty pricy for just that.

MYqG8JovvynCOEBnhwYtNg.text: Fogo has slipped a bit since they opened - the salad bar isn't quite as spectacular as it was (where are the sun-dried tomatoes, pray tell?), but hey - let's be honest - you don't go to Fogo for the salad bar, right?  This is still the carnivore capital of Scottsdale - a legion of men walking around with swords lined with various meats, and all you have to do to get them to offer you some is turn a coaster from the red side to the green side?  Sign me up!  The Picanha is the house special for good reason - it's amazing!  The top and bottom sirloin are also very good, as are the beef ribs.  Oddly, the ribeye (normally my favorite cut) is among my least favorites at Fogo.  Skip it and get the lamb chops instead (rare).  The sausage is tasty as well.  Not a fan of Filet, so I don't waste the tummy space on it, but those with me who favor it give it a hearty thumbs up.  I really ought to try the chicken sometime, but...it's chicken, and they have beef!  That said, the pork ribs are also quite tasty.  Skip the pork loin, unless that's really your thing.  Let's talk about sides - the cheesy poofs (cheese bread things) used to be fantastic - this time, they were about 3 times as long as in the past (off night?) - they have polenta and garlic mashed potatoes to fill you up on cheap stuff - skip those, but eat several of the fried bananas!  Of course, you saved room for dessert (admit it, there's always room for dessert).  The molten chocolate cake is killer, as is the key lime pie, and the creme brulee, but...I always get the Papaya Cream - papaya and ice cream blended together, and topped with a black currant liqueur that adds a tart complexity to the wonderfulness that is papaya blended with ice cream - try it, if you don't love it, call me and I'll come over and finish it for you.  Great place to take people when you want a dinner to remember - part dining experience, part meat theater - always memorable.

lwuRUX77Zi2NizHxm6-fGw.text: Food was excellent!  The chimichurri sauce was flavorful.  My top picks for the night were Cordeiro - fresh young leg of lamb sliced off the bone and Costelo de Porco - tender pork ribs slow-roasted to perfection. (Mmm!)  Dessert for the night was creme brulee- and it was oh so good!    Ambiance definitely sets the mood!  Love the place!  Great for a couple's date night or a group dinner date.    Service was good.  Our server was very diligent and was always checking in.  Some of the meat servers, I felt, were a bit in a rush which concerned me as they carry a big knife along with them.   Overall, my experience at Fogo was superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Which is your favorite meat?
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Anniversary dessert:  créme brûlée

a-cbKHYHQCu6ox1gcz7URA.text: It was a nice experience! Food is great- Meat lovers would enjoy it! I had the mango martini which was perfect! I didn't try any pork or chicken or sausage. My favorite was lamb and garlic sirloin.

nANPpcIZDd0NBV7erAZyXw.text: This place is pretty epic.   As you walk in, it looks nice and clean. You get seated and they start you off with drinks. They bring you bread, fried cheese (?), fried bananas, and garlic mashed potatoes. Then you go to the salad bar for salads, lunch meats, cheese, veggies, etc.   You sit down and they start bringing you all kinds of meat. Lamb, beef, pork, and chicken. And, it's not just any beef, either. It's the good stuff like filet mignon and flank and sirloin. Suggestion: just ask for the bacon wrapped filet mignon right off the bat. It's the most succulent piece of heaven I've ever had. Skip the rest ;)   The food is neverending! Jk it ends when you can't eat anymore. I ate until my heart was beating outside my chest. That isn't even an exaggeration. You'll understand if you ever go there.   Price? Pricy. I went at 930pm and paid 49.50 for the entire experience.   What I learned: 1. Don't go in jeans. Wear lose clothing.                       STRETCHY PANTS NEVER FELT SO GOOD BEFORE.  2. Don't load up on so many carbs.  3. Go straight to the bacon wrapped filet mignon. 4. Show up earlier to make more eating and digesting time.   Why did I give it 4 stars for what sounds like an amazing experience? I didn't like some of the stuff like the chicken and some of the beef.   THE END. (Bows, rolls away, then falls asleep)

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I&#39;m warning you, this is what you&#39;ll look like.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fillers
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vQVkE8Kb4T_X8Cj81Teddw.text: First, on a personal note, I can't eat a lot in one sitting, so all-you-can-eat places generally aren't for people like me. $65 to eat an amount of food I could get for a third of the price doesn't make sense to me. If you can eat $65 worth of meat, by all means, come here.   I was pleased with the meats. All were prepared well, and the flavor was amazing. I got to have leg of lamb, lamb chops, various steaks, and some pork loin. All were satisfying and tasty.   My problem is with two things: value for the dollar, and soft drinks.   The website for the establishment says all beverages and desserts are extra.   Fine.   But for $65 a head, I think I should be able to have a bottomless beverage, not $4 for each 12 oz can of ginger ale. This is America. Get with the program. Bottomless beverages are expected in this country. Install a fountain.   I got to try a bite of the key lime pie, and it was no better than a slice of Edward's frozen key lime pie that you can get in any grocery store.   Why do I mention this?   Because a single slice of key lime pie here is $8.50. I can get the whole pie and a can of whipped cream for that and still have change left over.   I am a frugal person, and I believe this place lacks a few amenities that its price tag would usually indicate. I probably won't be back any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

XUtZdBSQew7WzY4PhZaRjw.text: Very limited selection on the salad bar. There's no live entertainment like other Brazilian churrasco place I've been to. For the price you pay..this place is not worth it.

2MJJFYS5ZetOn7hqyEPWaQ.text: Let me preface with saying that I am a meat lover and have loved multiple years in Latin America. I have been here multiple times and have brought multiple friends here and we are never disappointed. I would recommend going for lunch for two reasons. One it is cheaper and two it gives you time to digest before going to sleep and falling into a food coma. The waiters come around with large skewers of meat and you choose which cuts of meat you want. One of my favorites is the picana. They also have this amazing cheesy bread. There is a salad bar but to be honest I don't even waste my time with that.

KCuPckJwW_oHL1idmcH0Fw.text: First off, the food is excellent and all the meat is very well cooked and seasoned. The servers of the meats were amiable and fun. Loved the atmosphere and the sides available at the bar. The polenta fries are to die for and we devoured them. The cost is well worth it, and I will be going back. The one star knock is because our server was never around. We had a reservation and our section wasn't very crowded. After dropping us at our table he disappeared and we had several other servers pick up his slack. We still had to flag people down and waited a while between drink refills. Maybe because the tips go into a pool he didn't feel the need to make himself available, but we were unimpressed. He also overcharged us for our daughters meal since she was under 12 and when asked he said that the policy was under 11. Honestly the price difference wasn't a huge issue, but you'd think he would have abided by their published age after I pointed it out. I thought he was going to adjust the check, but he didn't and we got our check after not having seen him for over an hour from a different server. By that point we were ready to leave and it wasn't worth our time. I will go back again and hopefully the server will be better.

Ihe2Az9sOzUKHocvnrtOkg.text: As Fogo's go, this one is not up to the service and food quality of the many others I've visited.  Meat was readily available at beginning, then went silent for 15 minutes.

2T0nqQDJEf8AhK2gSUBLxQ.text: If you want an out-of-this-world dining experience - this is the place!!! The atmosphere is elegant and comfortable done in style! The service is phenomenal! The food is to die for!!! Watch their video via their website before going and eat strategically to get your money's worth....  This place is expensive - check their web site for current prices. I wouldn't bring small children here and I would recommend at bare minimum, dress jeans and a polo shirt.  A solid 5 stars!!!

XBJnF0Ii45eY-4D7L7fBdw.text: It has taken me a few days to not write this review as a knee jerk reaction.  We decided this year on Thanksgiving we were going to surprise my daughter with a new dining experience and not cook.  So we thought this would be the perfect place since both my husband and I have been many times when we lived in Dallas and it was amazing there 8-10 years ago.  We had reservations for 4:30pm and didn't get seated until 5pm. The waitress walked us through a very congested and packing dining room. Which really needed to have at least 10 tables taken out to let people walk paste them.  I must have had to apologize to 4 customers since I had to force them to move their chairs so my family could be walked  all the way to the other side of the restaurant for the waitress to say I really have no clue where you are so suppose to be seated.  We walked halfway back and she basically seated up on the kitchen walkway area and half smiled and said you should get your meats first in this spot.  If, I hadn't been so hungry we would have walked out and went home and cooked a grill cheese.  Unfortunately, and $200 later I convince my husband to stay at the work dinner we have ever eaten.  The Salad bar was nothing like I remembered in Dallas and the turkey was not in a warmer just on a cutting board nice and cold.  The stuffing was rock solid.  Now it was time for the meat.  All my daughter could say is Mom do I have to eat this your steak is way better.  So we asked for our check and left.  The experience was terrible and food not great.  Don't waste your money in a town full of amazing restaurants that you can chose from this was a disappointment for sure.  They seem have have changed their dining model to more of a buffet quick eat and pack as many people in a restaurant as you can up to code.  They need to lower their prices if they are going with this new dining model.

N1X5xp2G3UdB5sHnMvU84Q.text: I've been meaning to try Fogo de Chao for the longest time and I finally got the chance to. Overall, it was a decent meal but I wouldn't rate it among the best churrascaria places I've been to.   Being that this is Phoenix, and there aren't any high concentration of Brazilian/Portuguese populations nearby (at least that I'm aware of), I could see why people would love this. First off, it's all-you-can-eat and the meat is of decent quality (certainly better than any Asian buffet in the area).   Personally, my favorite were the beef ribs as it was melt-in-your-mouth tender. The other meats weren't bad, but it was a notch below what you would get at a high-end steakhouse. The meats were also of varying saltiness, with some of them being a bit too salty for my liking.   Salad bar was good but don't make the mistake of piling your plate there. After all, why would you pay $50 for raw and grilled veggies?   A bit nit-picky here, but I felt like the servers came inconsistently - at times, they would all come at once and there were moments when you'd be done with the meat and the next guy wouldn't come for at least a few minutes. Another complaint is that they don't have one of my favorite Brazilian bbq dishes - grilled pineapple with cinnamon!   It's not bad for what it is, but if you've had churrascia in ethnically Portuguese/Brazilian areas (like in Newark, NJ or Framingham, MA), you could do better for about half the price.

_u31pyLGGwk_HB7DMwjZZw.text: Oh. My. Meat. Came here for a date night and tried all the wonderful meats. Everything was delicious and so flavorful. The mashed potatoes were a highlight of the meal and went great with everything we tasted. From Kevin to Dani, everyone we interacted with was so nice and we could come back in a heartbeat if not just for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WFJnKauhMtHMoKpDTXIuxw.text: Wow! This is a unique, excellent dining experience.   Came here the other day for dinner. $49.95/person but it's all you can eat. The salad bar was stocked with delicious vegetables and cheeses to start with. My favorite was the bacon wrapped chicken. Boyfriend loves all the different cuts of steak. All the meat has wonderful flavor and it's all very tender.   What was even better is that the service here is pretty incredible. They all work as a team so there's multiple people that will service your table. The managers come over to make sure your experience is great as well.   Only complaint is that regular drinks (soda, limeade) were not included in the price. Desserts are understandably extra (and well worth it!) I had the molton chocolate cake and my boyfriend had the cheesecake. They were both great portions and tasted yummy!   It is a tad expensive, but we will definitely be coming back.

vGXqfsOwCHtSwxVmHMkybg.text: This is our first time here. The restaurant is beautiful and the aroma of the meet when you walk in is just intoxicating. We  were "greeted" by some unfriendly hostesses so I  was slightly taken back by that considering they set the tone for the initial experience here. Let's get to the amazing part. The salad bar was just spectacular. Everything was fresh and unique. The bread at the table was amazing. I'm a bit of an iced tea snob and their tea was very good. Then here comes some of the best seasoned meat that were all cooked to perfection. I don't know how we did it but we had dessert and the papaya cream was unbelievable. We left so unbelievably full but very happy. The meal was a bit on the pricey side but worth it food wise. You definitely should give this place a try ; hopefully they'll have some new hostesses with a little class and better personalities.   I would've given Fago 5 stars but I feel that for the price I paid the customer service should've been so much better.  :(

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A variety of meats
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dessert- papaya cream
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

Ok0WiduH2VpwH1P0oYTOcA.text: We went here for Thanksgiving tonight. Our reservation was for 5:30,normal dinner hour. They advertised turkey for their Thanksgiving menu. All out of turkey at 5:30? Are you kidding me? Then we thought we might as well eat the meats. Pathetic! Tough,overly salted,and just horrible. We will never return!

eozdUtUj-hO0lkufuZLN9g.text: Took the baby daddy here for Father's Day. I highly recommend booking your table online through their website. It made it so much easier! We walked right in and they immediately sat us.   The food was amazing. They have a salad type bar where you can get everything from fresh and sauteed veggies to candied bacon. The best part was all the delicious meat you can eat which is cooked to your liking. Even my 4 year old said she loved the food.   I took off one star for 2 reasons... 1) They have a system which incorporates "drink coaster" like cardboard circles in which one side is green (to tell them keep the meat coming) and one side is red (to tell them you don't need food at the moment). Even while our coasters were flipped to green, they would still pass our table. There seemed to be a single corner of the restaurant in which they were focusing on, leaving others to sit and wait until they eventually decided they wanted to come our way. 2) Their alcoholic drinks are WAY overpriced for what they are. I ordered a drink that was MAYBE 4 ounces (most of which seemed to be ice) and they charged me $14 for it. The drink was just ok. Definitely not worth the $14 for sure.   Other than that, I'd return again for any other special occasion.

wdyxX8vA_avkz1AXxRckEQ.text: After my first visit the other night this is now my GO TO place for steak. I love the concept of sampling various cuts of meat at the same meal. The meats are really prepared with great flavors. My favorites were the filet mignon, the lamb, and the ribeye. The salad bar was stocked with great cheeses, peppers, salamis, and other tasteful goodies. It was our 30th wedding anniversary and we chose the right place to go. The staff were absolutely the best. If you haven't tried it yet this is a MUST DO for everyone.

iD6ftOCc11mGRA0Uh_iKHw.text: This restaurant had awesome service from beginning to end.  The meats were all easily available, and if they weren't multiple people checked on the status.  I would highly recommend this place. Just be prepared to drop some cash.

tGMelGhjrWG44k8neGpiMg.text: This place is awesome. This is the first Fogo I've been to, but I've spent some time in Brazil and have had "real" BBQ. As with most Brazilian BBQ places, the strategy is to stay away from the salad bar and just load up on meat. Having said that, their salad bar is very fresh and is loaded with some pretty interesting items. The asparagus was cooked perfectly (something I need with beef for some reason).   One of the drawbacks from places like this is overcooked meat. I prefer Medium rare to rare for high quality beef and the servers are more than willing to find you steaks that are cooked to your liking. You're not going to get anything too exotic to choose from like you would in Brazil...i.e...chicken hearts, but it's a nice place in a convenient location. Of course this is in Scottsdale, so you know it's more upscale than it probably needs to be, and that's fine with me.

N14DhwaLOrJcQ_TiO4tTJw.text: Fogo de Chao is probably one of the best restaurants I've been too. Obviously, its pretty upscale but definitely worth the money. The location couldn't be better. The food and service is amazing. Couldn't ask for more.

6AzNRixd3hJD8iuCJi7-pw.text: Best steak house in Scottsdale AZ hands down!  They have the best lamb chops on the planet, that is practically all I eat when I go.  All of there meat is fantastic except for their pork ribs, stay away from those, sorry guys!  The salad bar is awesome with a lot of variety.  Marco was amazing and suggested I try their tres leches for dessert and it was one of the best things I have ever tasted.  Our service was fast and prompt.  I will go back time and time again, this place is the best!

wqoHLCTsoUBRljx4K2LS_A.text: Alright, I'm going to make this as short and sweet as possible. If you're vegan or vegetarian, yes there's a giant salad bar for you, but don't waste your time and money. If you're a meat eater but mostly fish or chicken because red meat is soooo bad for you. Go jog to your favorite sushi bar and fill up on those cute little morsels.  If you are a True carnivore.  I mean you embrace the fact that we have been blessed with canine teeth for the ripping and shredding of flesh.  If you pass by a farm filled with cows and you don't notice the smell of poop and moreover you are suddenly blazing a trail to Carl's Jr for a $6 burger.  If you look longingly at your local butcher's apron and think about sucking that fabric clean.  Well my friends, Fogo de Chao is for you.               Now the place if very nicely adorned.  Staff very professional.  Prices are pretty high.  But at the heart of it beats a BBQ joint.  Here's the deal:  The salad bar is awesome.  All of the various extras they bring by your table, delicious.  Having said that, only a fool partakes in those features of this restaurant.  This is all you can eat meat, off a skewer, and when the gauchos come by carving off every type of meat imaginable, you better not have filled up on fluff!  You can get all that other stuff at a million restaurants.  But you cannot get meat like this anywhere else.              The meat is so simply prepared, just heat and salt used as ingredients.  But don't let that fool you into thinking it's boring.  While I admit, I am a sauce man.  Love all kinds and love it all over my BBQ, no matter what kind of meat.  This meat is of superior quality, and so there is very little needed to be done to it to make it taste fantastic.  Look, I can go on and on about the tasty virtues of their perfectly cooked meats.  All you need to know is say yes to every hunk of protein brought by on a sword until you are ready to burst.  Then force down the Creme Brulee, it really is pretty damn good!

0m1ZSSXD2wK9UnYy8epD-w.text: I absolutely love coming here.  They have a wonderful atmosphere as well as wonderful food.  I enjoy almost every cut of meat they have.  The bar has a very nice feel to it and quite the selection of whiskey.  I don't know what else there is to say. Flip over your card and enjoy the Meat, Meat, and More MEAT!!!!!

ekuh7wxNdrYvhcexIgU-tg.text: For my Very First Review, I wanted to do a no brain-er.   This is by far the best restaurant I've ever been to. If you Love beef, you will love this place. At about $50 per person it is pricey but the beef has awesome flavor and it's all you can eat so get your grub on.   If you Vegetarian, you can get just the salad bar and it is still incredible. I can't give this place enough stars since it is the only restaurant that easily pleases both Carnivores and vegetarians!   I've been to this location several times and each time the food has been amazing. The truly greatest thing about this place is the consistency. Each time we have gone the service, food and experience has been the same. Amazing.   My personal Favorite is the House special. It has great flavor and is mouthwatering. The lamb is also great. each cut is great in it's own unique way. If you like well done or rare, ask the server and they will ensure you get it. Believe me you won't regret trying this place.

MC3xYtzrAKN3Mi2z3RpQVA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to dine here for our anniversary. He loves Brazilian steak houses so naturally we were knowledgable on the process. We were sat at one of the tables tucked away in the back. It felt as if we were isolated from the restaurant. Our server, who was a younger woman, greeted our table and was very short with us. She briefly debriefed us on the process of the restaurant an said we can ask any one of the servers if we needed anything during our course of dining. I thought that was a bit unusual, but I was happy that we already knew what to do from past experiences. We had the wine list open and were waiting over 10 minutes to get someone attention to order. A server never came so we decided to give up and just go to the salad bar. Half way through our salad a server came to our table and asked if we wanted anything to drink. At this point we were already annoyed since we were waiting a long period of time to get someone's attention. I declined to our server and said that we would not be ordering any drinks for the evening. We had our green card faced up for a longer period of time before having anyone come to our table. I think it could of been due to the fact that we were placed in an unusual area of the restaurant. We began to keep our green card up for the entire period of time we were sitting at the table so that whenever a server would pass by they would see. By the end of our dining experience we were just extremely disappointed and ready to go home. We received little to no attention at this restaurant that requires a good degree of attention. I will probably not return to dine here again. Very bad experience.

jHXxBsDpdJ82FtYMtjawRQ.text: Ate there twice at lunch time and the service was great both times. J Robles served us at one time and he was very polite, attentive and funny. The steaks were flavorful and really quite filling for lunch. Definitely worth it esp with the discounted lunch price.

U-fNtGcNTRyWRjQnHkXQ4A.text: A wonderful experience as always. The food is great and our server Derek was exceptional. Given the price it is a rare treat but well worth it when we do go.

BF5Hl-I4O74O1rtfedZ-vQ.text: Great service.  Tasty food.  I like it for lunch because later, I can skip dinner.  Their salad bar satisfies the vegetarian taste buds.  I like this place alot.  I think it lives up to the hype.

uBjVUPubUUArTkhZFlcxMQ.text: Wow, this dinner was pretty spectacular. I've never had an experience quite like it.   So, you start with a lovely salad bar, they had butter lettuce (yessss) and a delicious basil dressing that went great with my tomato slices. There were also a variety of cheeses available and smoked salmon, yum!  Now lets get down to the meat. There was a Picanha (the prime part of the sirloin) which was gorgeous, Filet Mignon, Beef Ancho, Lombo (pork loin filets encrusted with parmesan cheese!), Frango chicken wrapped in bacon...yay, Linguica (slow-roasted pork sausages) and my favorite, Cordeiro, the leg of lamb, moist and delicious!  This is a great concept for a restaurant, I can't wait to bring my husband for his birthday!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FhB15BcHSs64_lFBgO982Q.text: Good food.  Not as many spits as I am used to in NY but all was very good.  Hosts were all friendly especially Louis

AsQA_WUMqIejESZkhgnrzQ.text: Amazing as always. I have never been disappointed. I have been to Fogo in Beverly Hills only. But then tried this for the first time today for lunch.  When we noticed lunch was only $30 we jumped on it! We were wondering if there would be less of a meat selection due to it being lunch-but nope! The same great meats and excellent service. I love this place. If you want some delicious tasting meats and love the all you can eat experience-YOU MUST COME HERE! You will NOT BE DISAPPOINTED! I PROMISE!!!!!

eaO4H6ezhRtqrbvRRSaSCw.text: A quick FYI: This coming week for Restaurant Week they will be offering dinner for $40 per person...a great deal!  I love LOVE this place! I love the wide selection of their Salad Bar and Meats. I also LOVE their desserts!

gpCD_8QO10arOj5M7ofJ8g.text: If you ever feel hungry and tired or same kind of food, this place is for you. Start with an amazing salad collection filled with any type of cheese and amazing dressings. Don't get fill up with that save extra room for the unlimited, all you can eat meat that will change your life with every bite. I  Love the food and the service.

M8scSS_3uCY0si3pFeUP_g.text: Great service.  The food is excellent, the seasoning on those cuts are very distinct and unique to the type of meat they make.  The filet mignon wrapped in bacon is one of my favorites.  Go easy on the salad bar because the meat is definitely the best thing in the restaurant, if you like a good steak, that is.

Tgi3kbMxS-P-PEt_dCYREA.text: For meatatarians! Wow, bring on the beef. From chicken legs to lamb this place serves you as much meat as you can handle and then some.  Everyone is given a coaster like deal that is red on one side for stop, and green on the other for go! The servers will continue to come to your table as long as the green side is up. I believe I have tried all their cuts of beef, but my fav is the house beef. So tasty and mouthwatering. The salad bar is full of delicious options: salmon, brie, chicken salad....etc. The side dishes are also great: mashed potatoes, this awesome little bread, and plantains.  The desserts are delicious!

gRMzkzrLffK2nuEk1W9tHw.text: First, salad bar. For a place that relies heavily on meat as the star of the show, the salad bar was great. Kale salad was amazing, and the selection of cheese and charcuterie, although small, was really good too.  They also bring you some sides to the table. Mashed potatoes, fried plantains, fried polenta and some sort of cheese pastry. All delicious.  Now the meat. It was disappointing. The meat was good, but undeseasoned. it needed some sort of sauce maybe. I made do with the basil sauce from the salad bar. I overall enjoyed the food, but it was not worth the money. For a steakhouse, the non-meat items would be the only reason I'd ever want to go back.

wJJ-wkgFekzYmyP0aOv-_w.text: Perfect Father's Day dinner. Reservations were on time, no waiting. Service was excellent and the food could not have been better. Even their desserts were perfect. I would go back for any special occasion. It's a lot of food so plan a few hours to enjoy it. They don't push you out the door.

d_4wr398CGFoUVnefx2QJg.text: I have been to the Vegas location. Scottsdale is the best of them. Service was the best of the two as well. The meat entrees in Scottsdale were better than Texas de Brazil in Vegas as well. Service was a bit better at Texas. The salad bar was not as elaborate as Texas either but still excellent. However, after all is said and done, the Scottsdale location was exceptional.  I will be back. I highly recommend it!

QYHPl_WDOY19nRaCQM7vGQ.text: I recently visited Arizona and really wanted to go to a brazillian steakhouse. Having gone to Fogo when it first opened, I really wanted to go again.  First, when we got there. We sat immediately. We also had meats en route to us not 30 seconds later. This was very nice.  Sadly, our drink orders were forgot about. Along with that, all the meats were very bland and were nothing special. 50 dollars a plate was about 35 dollars too much.   I have even been to the Fogo De Chao in Las Vegas. That restaurant was far superior to this one. I feel like they just don't care as much at this location.

MZ_aaG6nCRu4vg56cZjwzQ.text: We had family in from Chicago and went to Fogo last night. What a great time. The food was phenomenal.  The service was excellent.... We couldn't ask for anything better!!! The GM even checked on our experience to ensure we had a great time. One of the favorites was the garlic beef. Smoked salmon and sea bass were good too. The salad bar was really fresh and so much to choose from. I would highly recommend this place. The family and I will be back.

nxdt5laKd3jRvq3RYonVxA.text: MEAT HEAVEN!  I love this place, great service! I felt that the cuts weren't as varied as other Fogo de Chao locations. However we got a complementary dessert, something that we didn't get when we visited their Chicago location. A little bit on the pricey side, but well worth it.

09pb7KrBPxBRgDMnX2IswQ.text: We thought we would try this place since we were celebrating my husbands birthday and we LOVE the Churrascaria in San Francisco! Food was delicious and I'm Only giving this place 4 stars since it fell Short of a few items from SF. If you want prawns it's extra and the buffet bar was limited on options compared to our go to place. Other than that Service was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3bc6Or1gCwgPlE5scbqCAQ.text: Wow! What an exceptional culinary adventure! The service was impeccable and the selection of meats was incredibly delightful. However, we were even more impressed by the skilled service provided by the bartender Tony and the very attentive service of the server Lucas. They made our night! It was an unforgettable expierience and we will be returning.

PWfxGl68KVH59hXmhvzKJw.text: One of my favorite steakhouses in Scottsdale.  World class salad bar, plethora of wine options.  Meats perfectly cooked to my preference.  Attentive staff, multiple points of contact throughout my dining experience.  Chocolate Molten Cake with ice cream, was the cherry on top.

PxgYRvhfnspo2koeVz0y9g.text: I have been to several of these located in various major cities in the US and my experience has been the same for all of them: worth every penny!  Come hungry and be prepared to leave fighting for your next breath (because you are full, duh)  Word of advice, be judicious with your choices at the salad bar, or you my not be able to savor each cut of meat that comes around.  For some reason, that elusive filet mignon seems to arrive when you've nearly had enough.  The salad bar is stuffed full of things that are not salad (of course it has various salads and dressings too).  Smoked salmon, Spanish Manchego cheese, and various fruits to name a few.  Another thing, also do not scarf down the rolls they bring to the table the first thing you do when you sit down...they are so good you'll keep eating them.  Lastly, just forget counting calories or trying to be healthy... accept the fact that this dinner is a treat and you'll work out some other time.

lIg-00_iQmthdxCe4mlZtw.text: O.M.G. This place is AWESOME.  Initially one would say it's a carnivore's paradise, do NOT sleep on the salad bar.  Now I love me some cow and chicken just like the next person, but the salad bar is what it's all about for me.  I've eaten there three times over the past four months, and the one word that comes to mind: Consistency.  Fogo de Chao not only delivers the same great food time after time, they have EXCELLENT customer service.  Wanna know how good it is? My husband and I had a bit of a challenge transitioning our 6 month old son (now 8 months old) from the bottle onto other foods. On our first visit to Fogo de Chao, a relative offers up "give him a lamb bone"... so we do, and he LOVED it.  In fact, my husband had to fight the kid to get it back out of his hand (True story!).  If you are looking for a way to sample several cuts of meat while being fulfilled by an incredible salad bar, Fogo de Chao just might be the place for you.  Oh, and the desserts are amazing.  My ONLY gripe about this place is that they don't offer bottomless fountain drinks for the non-alcoholics like myself.  If you like Coke, Sprite, diet, etc, be prepared to pay $2.50 a pop (no pun intended) every time they bring one of those little 6oz bottles out to your table.  I guess they figure if you can pay big bucks for the dinner, what's a few more bucks for a soft drink?  My recommendation: come HUNGRY, or you will waste your hard-earned money.

LgjTOkG4lcwVCmHB0ztN1Q.text: Our annual trek to FDC for my birthday. Make it a point to go there somewhere each late-May. Love the food, selection, and generally the service. Sometimes there were lulls in waiting for specific cuts, but Lou, the customer experience leader, was helpful and very friendly. He helped track down the servers with what we were looking for. Not extremely kid-friendly, but not too bad. Young ones are free and have a decent selection at the Salad bar to choose from.

TVsLfTya296vvtR6vWyWXg.text: Wow this place is pricey but worth it. Endless delicious cuts of meat coming back and back again were incredible. I can't wait to go back even the salad bar was amazing . I guess if you go for lunch its half the price with the same exact menu. So I'll be giving that a try but overall service was incredible. They were on top of it . The wait staff had a team mentality. The only problem now is the pain I'm in from eating too much. But I can't wait to go do it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Picture from inside the restaurant.

9g6tSKy_9qt5tlUKteqsNw.text: My boyfriend had raved about this place for awhile so back when Phoenix Restaurant Week rolled around and Fogo de Chao was featured as one of the participating restaurants a group of us gathered together to go experience a Brazilian steakhouse.   It was packed, which was to be expected as usually this place is on the pricey side, and I think there was some problem with our reservation but it was sorted out and we were seated in short order.   Now I was just here for the meat but after some prodding I decided to do a loop around the salad bar so I could say I experienced everything. Man, what a salad bar! They had everything from fruits to and veggies and the regular old salad with lots of dressing options to meats and cheeses and whatever else you could possibly want.   When you're ready for the meat to come to you, you flip over a little round card that is given to every place at the table. Red means no, green means come at me boys! This signals the servers walking around with skewers of different meats to stop by and ask if you'd like a slice. The answer is always yes yes yes! I tried to try one of everything and between the chicken, steak, pork, and lamb I had a menagerie of animals on my plate. Everything was succulent and juicy and the best part was with some of the meats you could tell them how done you wanted it and they would flip to the appropriate section to slice you off a piece.   There is of course a moment when a lady decides that there is simply too much meat to fit into her mouth anymore and with some reluctance I flipped my card around to red to stop my stomach from bursting.   The cherry on top of this sundae was that our restaurant week flat price included a choice of one of three desserts and it was delicious.   I would definitely recommend this place to those of you wanting to try something new and the price point makes it a great special occasion restaurant. (I know where I want to go on my upcoming anniversary!)

U6Dnoip7cd3BBo3zbJHZmQ.text: I have been here quite a few times now with my girlfirend, her family, my family, etc.  Every time this place has delivered in spades....  my girlfirend loves the lamb, her dad loves the sausage, my mom loves the salad bar....there is just something for everyone.  The waiters are very courteous and attentive.  There was one in particular who is excellent but his name slips my mind I'll be sure to update this review when I remember. Also I have gone for both dinner and lunch and they are the same, in fact I felt lunch may have even tasted a little fresher.  In other words just go this place is well worth it

NzzN7efGkKcX6gYF3vDasA.text: Fogo De Chao deserves a solid 4 stars for my experiences there. However, the salad bar deserves like 5 or 6 stars - there is no better salad bar in town!  The meal comes in two phases: salad bar and meat like most Brazilian steakhouses. You get a little coaster type button that you put up on one color while you eat salad and another color while you eat meat. While this is happening you get side dishes and drinks. My favorite side dish is the bananas, AMAZING. When you are ready for the meat - meat carvers will come to your table to offer you various cuts and cooking temperatures. They have every kind of steak, plus lamb and chicken. The steak is very good here, but it is not the best I've had even in Arizona, hence the 4 star review instead of 5.   It is so hard not to over eat here, so I recommend coming hungry, and don't skip the amazing salad bar because you are looking forward to steak!

FOi5ywHXtbLmrMJHMs_VIw.text: I came to Fogo de Chao for AZ Restaurant Week in 2010.  The first disclaimer is that you have to be a serious meat eater if you want to enjoy all the benefits.  I do not eat beef as a Hindu, but I was actually able to enjoy quite a bit of the experience.
