I got an opportunity to eat really good BBQ Chicken, sausage, a hybrid chicken-pork dish, and several seafood items from the buffet tray.    Fogo de Chao is very similar to tradition Brazilian BBQ.  I have actually been to a Brazilian BBQ in Rio, so I know this was very authentic.  You start off at the salad bar which has other small items such as cheese, seafood, and fruit.  You have quite a wide array of seafood to enjoy for non-red meat eaters.  You then sit down in your table and you get a button.  Green means bring it on!  Red means, stop for now or game over!  If you have your button turned to green, you will get constantly questioned about food.  I made this mistake in Brazil, and I had everyone and their mom come to my table asking if I wanted food.  I was so into the food, I didn't realize this simple little rule.  Once you want to call it quits for good, you get a selection of a few desert items.  I think Fogo de Chao does a good job replicating the traditional Brazilian BBQ.  The quality of food is very similar from what my red-meat eating friends tell me.  This is a good taste of Brazilian BBQ if you do not want to travel all the way to Brazil.

q-R9ZI-8JI0CbtUvfRK5ig.text: This place is amazing. It's all Brazilian food. They are employees who come a round with a sword with meat on it and they come to your table and give you some meat. I recommend the bacon wrapped beef it is to die for

Ylxws_ymjGhhFE8J0J-jPg.text: We frequent this place for special occasions and it NEVER disappoints! The service is great and the food is always excellent. The Manager is almost like family!  He always greets us and chats.  He has made us feel welcome every time we have visited, checks in with us to see if we are okay and thanks us for coming when leaving.  On special occasions we are given the dessert menu and are asked to order anything we want. Now what restaurant does that? When you arrive the waiters bring you hot cheese puffs as soon as you are seated as well as warm Polenta sticks, mashed potatoes,and fried bananas.  I must say the Polenta sticks are to die for as well as the cheese puffs.   We love the market table for lunch.  Its only $15 with all you can eat.  There are many choices of salads,i.e. kale, Caesar, Bib lettuce, chicken & potato salad, cheeses, meats i.e. salami, Prosciutto, nova lox, apple fruit salad, hearts of palm, fresh cooked beets, asparagus, zucchini, and many more items. The basil dressing is my favorite. The full experience encompasses several sirloin cuts of meat, leg of lamb and lamb chops. rib eye, filet, pork, chicken, & ribs.  The full experience is around $32 for lunch and $50 for dinner.  Its worth every dime.  Many times on holidays they offer a $25 gift card to return.  They are constantly promoting specials for your return and believe me, you will want to return time and time again.

WkS8NcBJ-U-f5-KeFskMjg.text: Quantity over quality. The salad bar is decent and so are the sides, like the potatoes etc. however not a fan of the meats. Most of them are over cooked and over salted.

bHhGTmLjOiC93kD9Jn_7-Q.text: Delicious! This restaurant is worth every penny! The staff was great, food was awesome, pricey, but you definitely get your money's worth and get it back from all the different cuts of meat. The manager made his way around the dining hall and was super friendly. Casual dress and everything was great. I would highly recommend reservations since they open at 4:30 on Saturdays and it's already packed.

WCvfqectaxRhVucQsMMO8g.text: Marco is the best of the best! Good with faces, remembers everyone and he welcoming. Makes the restaurant what it is. He is the face of the Fogo De Choa Scottsdale

iN-GIqSdfHoOu-RJpLZYTg.text: This place was outstanding. This was my first time here, I was a little afraid with some of the reviews but it was no where near that experience. I had made a reservation for 7pm but was running a little late they were willing to move it to 730 for us. They were a really good staff the meats were so delicious I could not get enough. The waitress was outstanding. I love everything about it. Date night was a success. The plus was the wine was extremely delicious. The waitress knew definitely what to recommend as well. I would say of course I definitely go back and I honestly say it's more for adults, kids is fine but I would feel they be overwhelmed with just eating meats. It was perfect for just the two of us.

O6IJ23FkggkKqTZfQM7ATQ.text: Excellent service today.  The food was amazing !  People should always have a bottle of Fogo De Chao Melbeck.

eu9Sbp2_BfoOPK_TzvYZNg.text: If you this is your first time visiting a Brazilian steakhouse then you might love it. We have been to a few and found the meat to be good, not great. The team service approach meant that we had someone asking how we were doing almost every minute. At first it was nice then annoying as they seemed to ask the second we took a bite of something. The salad buffet looked like the food had been sitting out a little while. A unique experience, but lacking in character and flavor.

a8nat_hSVcfR9AjL0XfENw.text: If you like red meat, then this is your heaven on earth!  Fogo de Chao Brazilian's two course meal; premium salad bar and as much meat as you can eat, is a prix fixe at $49.99. Now this is a steal by whatever measurement you can come up with.   Consider that across the street, Fleming's starts at $44.99 for their Prime Rib dinner; same is True for Ruth's Chris or any of the other steak places in town.   Now don't get me wrong. I am not saying that Fogo de Chao Brazilian's quality is in the same league as Ruth's Chris, Morton's, the Capital Grille or Dominick's; but it as good, if not better than anything we've had a Fleming's. See review.  The other thing that's pretty cool about Fogo de Chao Brazilian's is the entertainment of the Fogo experience -- when their Gauchos start coming around after you turn that card up green. Priceless.    The four of us had a great time. The bill came to $230.50, not including taxes and gratuities.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iQ1aT11a6j9DbTEbrDKfiQ.text: All you can eat steak? Ummm...yes, sign me up! I love the concept. Green side up means keep on bringing me that beefy goodness. Red side up means ok stop, the meat coma has commenced.  The restaurant is intimate, upscale and romantic. Its like a fancy buffet with several gauchos walking around with an array of different meats on a stick, there to satisfy all your carnivorous desires. Well worth the $52 dollars a person.  Tip-  have to try the Brazilian cheese bread balls, they are addicting!

RSH5bWGngn8CqvDiM6Gy1A.text: I was very disappointed for sure. I used eat at the Fago in Atlanta in Buckhead and liked it. When I saw they had a restaurant here in Scottsdale I decided to take my brother in law there for dinner. The menu offered a large array of meats as part of the "experience", as well as a bountiful salad bar. The hostess asked if we would also like the shrimp and lobster appetizer and we agreed to order that along with the experience. The appetizer was mediocre at best. Served cold with a red sauce and the melted butter arrived when we were half through. The shrimp were large and the lobster tail was small and two very large claws were also on the plate but obviously came from a larger lobster, not the one where the tail came from. All were tasteless and the melted butter did little to improve that.  The menu offered filet and tenderloin along with chicken, pork, lamb and lesser cuts of steak as part of the experience. Some of these were garlic infused as well as bacon wrapped. The meats were average at best. Most tougher than I usually experienced. Not very flavorful except for the lamb. When I asked for some filet and tenderloin they said they would bring some. None was ever offered in the 39 to 45 minutes we were seated, as they continued around with the touger cuts of meat. Then the filet arrived. It was not a filet, rather a sirloin cut to look like one. The tenderloin never made it to the table. Did they have one? Its expensive to eat there for the meat you are offered. I would get the same or better for a fifth of the price for two at Longhorn Steak.  They need to fo better.

VyKK1c_jvTMQ6xoc4mTQNw.text: This place is more expensive than the TOP Brazilian Steakhouses in Manhattan in the touristy ($$$$$) theatre district!!!! They are not losing money on anybody except the occasional NFL lineman that may wander in

Hy8PrCZqvFGe23wXJWHeAA.text: On Wednesday night, My husband and I went to Fogo de Chao to celebrate our tenth wedding anniversary. We enjoyed our dinner and left. When we got home, after picking up the kids, I noticed I was missing my phone!! I left it at the restaurant!! I started going crazy and called the restaurant no one had seen it or turned it in. So I asked if I could go and look for it. My husband and I spoke to Christoper, he said of course! Well we live a good 25 mins from the restaurant. Christopher not only stuck around after his shift, he helped me look for it and it was found wrapped in the linen already packed ready to go! He pulled out the bag from its bin, thanks to the findmyiphone beep it makes, and took out the linens to get my phone! Thank you so much Christopher!! You didn't have to help me, especially for just a phone, but you did and I am so grateful!!

yXs8uq-6GrnQpoHJ5HvI8g.text: Fun experience if you've never gone before.  Traditional Brazilian steakhouse where they walk around with a variety of meats beef, lamb, pork and chicken. They stop at your table throughout the evening and slice the meat table side.The meal also includes a wonderful market bar that is full of a variety of salads, cheeses, and more. I am not much into meat so I opted to go just with the market bar. You do have the option to order a fish entree as well. I was pleased with the meal and enjoyed trying some new dishes I had never had before. The gentleman in our group said they liked the "house specialty" a top sirloin and the bacon wrapped chicken the best. Dinner was concluded with a yummy chocolate fudge cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate fudge cake
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

I_rjIJvrx9v9WN-y30Bxhg.text: Fantastic dinner for my wife's Birthday. Great service here. It is a must do for us when we come to Scottsdale.

vakoRpX7KSe5dLKW07nKPg.text: Fogo de Chao great decision to come here with some small minor mishaps. This is a Brazilian steak house. The meal options at this location is a fixed menu.  They do the Rodizo and that's it so if you're not a meat person I don't suggest this place. We as a group had to order sangria and it was very good wish it had more fruit besides just apples to have sitting in it. Once then we decided to venture to the salad bar , be aware to not fill up to much on the salad and sides. I suggest trying the apple potato salad and roasted peppers. All side dishes are included in the meal  which are garlic mashed potatoes, polenta (which was out of this world) and fried bananas which you can never go wrong with. Now the Brazilian steak Rodizio experience. Some quirks of the meal. At your seat they give you a red and green coaster which red means "no more meat" and green "bring on the meat". Might have just been where I was sitting at the table but I was sitting at the far end of the table. My coaster was unable to be seen. So the meat cutters walking around would only see a portion of the table and pass by and not check the whole group. Multiple times people at the far end of the table were missed. To the meat my favorite of the filet, top sirloin, bottom sirloin and lamb was definitely the bottom sirloin the flavor was out of this world. The side dishes  but the best of the sides was the polenta. Keep in mind they are complimentary and if you just ask they will bring more, but they did forget a few times when asked. Now to dessert we decided on a pineapple with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream which was out of this world and a to die forCREME BRULEE. Overall some plus and minuses to this meal, but definitely worth trying if in the area or other locations across the country.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried bananas and polenta
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Part of salad bar options
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Finished Sangria and Crème Brûlée

Kqwjst_6blf4de1r6iL97A.text: Took my hubby for his bday dinner. Service was grand. Food was awesome. Can't beat it if you are a carnivore and their salad bar has ingredients you don't see elsewhere. Will go back. Better than the one we visited in Las Vegas.

xahfYSqMxOspP5q1YDIsqQ.text: Best restaurant ever!  We love the food and the most excellent service.  We love that we get the churrasco prepared as we like it.  I like my meat well done and the rest of my family more the traditional medium rare.  We love the pao de queijo!! Food and service are consistently outstanding!  It is the best steakhouse value!

cEOaxHfZWYZDO-IDbQc0-g.text: The best steakhouse in town. Great atmosphere. The food was excellent, steaks were especially good, cooked the way we like them and the service was great. One of the best dining experiences we have had in Arizona.

DLtnuWery4QCkbJQMzcvOg.text: Hubby and I celebrate our birthdays kind of close to each other and Fogo de Chao is one of my favorites birthday places. Sign up for their email list, read the fine print on the birthday offer they send and you will see. We got $25 off for lunch or dinner churrasco experience, plus birthday dessert. Vanessa was our server this time and she was amazing, Brian assisted her too. I did not get names for our gauchos but pretty much everyone was awesome this time around.  Our favorite always are the beef ribs, which I do not think they bring regularly to the tables, we always ask for them (even more than once).  The salad bar was a little different but it had solid options, we also noticed the meats had different offerings but did not pinpoint all the changes. My best advice for this place is to be very conservative with the salad bar, and start with super small portions of all the meats the gauchos bring to your table, and I mean tiny. Then once you try a few (or all of them) you can ask for little bigger portions of your favorites. Enjoy!  PS The only down side for me here is that they do not offer the grilled pineapple like some other churrasco places do. : (

LIs6Wy18OU0Per4x4aolYQ.text: Food is amazing and they keep it coming till you say uncle. Amazing salad bar, I have often heard of vegetarians going there just for the salad bar. The only bad part is that this place is pretty pricey. A dinner for two with cocktails was almost 150 with gratuity. Better for lunch if you aren't trying to hurt your wallet.

ssYjsR9vtFVXETRlu-pDTQ.text: I took my girlfriend here for her birthday, we were both blown away about how delicious the food was. The salad bar was amazing as well. Everything packed a different and interesting flavor. Totally worth the money.   Also, the staff was on top of their game. Anyone and everyone their was willing to make sure you had the best experience.   Amazing.

-XBN_wzzqzb1eWtvrO4bzA.text: I've been wanting to try Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse for a long time. I took advantage of AZ restaurant week, made the reservations on Open Table at 7p.m. Saturday night. Plenty of parking, there was no need to use the valet. We were greeted right away when we arrived on time for our reservation. We were then handed a buzzer and told when our table was ready it will buzz and it wouldn't be long. We waited about 15 minutes.  As we walked to our table, we took note of a lot of large family parties, dates and small groups of tables. The restaurant was filled and loud. My only negative feel was that it felt like a land cruise ship dining room (food for the masses). We were seated at a perfect table for 2 against the wall. It was perfect because there weren't servers and people walking all around us to get to the Market Table (Salad Bar). Our waiter came over right away, explained how the variety of meats are served, Market Table and Sides included. Then he took our cocktail orders.   Now let the games begin! We had the Top Sirloin, Lamb Chops, Pork Ribs, Filet Mignon wrapped in Bacon, Pork Sausage, Sirloin, all requested at medium rare and we got it perfectly done. The Market Table and sides of Mash Potatoes, Cheesy Bread, Fried Plantain and Fried Polenta w/Parmesan Cheese all included and tasted very good. Dessert (I chose the Cheesecake) was part of the restaurant week deal, very OK.  Service was excellent! Cocktails excellent. Meats that we tried were excellent. Market Table and Sides were all very good. Dessert very OK and Atmosphere OK. Worth going for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Market Table (salad bar)
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheesy Bread
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheese Cake

EE0s-uq0hbiAtD4XZFagNA.text: One of the best Brazilian places ive ever ate at. Love the dine in set up with the salad bar. The cheese biscuits are amazing.. the customer service i experienced was amazing. Its a buffet style with great selection to choose from.

ium5xdD7h_hcgDxCQqNAvA.text: The only thing better than the food is the service! The gentlemen bringing the meats were courteous- wonderfully attentive. Our waitress, Ana Laura, was stupendous. Always checking on us and making the best recommendations. Going to come back on my birthday!

PkoMXVaQI1pO58r3RyFo3A.text: First and last time going. We should not have to ask for the rib eye and filet when it's included in the 55 dollars per person. And when it finally came out it was damn near raw. The only positive was the bartender in the bar was a cool guy. I feel robbed and irritated about this joint. Spend your money at Capital grille or Eddie V's. Oh yeah and the men's bathroom was filthy...

SaJExTFFCJi8nBqfOg-REg.text: Total disappointment for first timer. We came for dinner to celebrate an anniversary. I'll start with the cons. 1. 5-7 different servers. This means you have no personal attention or customer service. 2. At times you there's no meats being served. At one point I was waiting 15 minutes before I had something to eat(the salad bar was boring). 3. The salad bar was boring, for the price I would expect more items with actual flavor. 4. Came for anniversary, just ignored by the servers and managers while all around us people were getting desserts for their birthdays. Hmmmmm... 5. Meats where way over cooked, filet mignon was more like pulled beef, awful. 6. Never saw sausage, beef ribs or good filet mignon. Pros: 1. To me the sirloin was the best cut of meat. 2. The soup in the salad bar. Lol  Was it worth the $120? Not at all!!! Ruined such a special day, I guess we were looking at this place being the highlight but left us disappointed that we spent that much. A high end restaurant would have been better and probably cheaper.

qadtfQqBvLhB5OZcqvKO5w.text: We love Brazilian restaurants and we are very excited to go to this place for the untraditional Thanksgiving dinner because for us it was all about having not turkey on this day.  It was packed.  We fortunately made reservations a week in advance and it turned out that was a great idea.  The salad bar was good but they did run out of a few things, I guess that it was hard to keep up.  We only had a choice of four meat that kept coming around.  I did finally have to ask for the other meat selection.  We also had to ask at least four times to three different people to get extra sides we wanted.  All in all I WOULD probably go back but I do think I've to better Brazilian steakhouses.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4ajWtSF_u0Mfmmmprr3jpg.text: Oh man.... I think I ate myself silly here. This is not a good restaurant for people who lack great self control. There are so many food items being thrown your way, it's hard to say no. The salad bar is extensive and very fresh. The meats were generally tasty...there were a few that were better than others, of course, but nothing bad. The restaurant provided a free dessert (it was my anniversary) which was very nice and unnecessary. The price is high (about 60$ pp at dinner), especially if you can't eat a lot. I personally prefer a restaurant where I just order one perfectly prepared steak versus this scenario in which I get an abundance of pretty good meat, but if you're a buffet fan and can eat a lot, this is the place for you!

QpmwHrak9Q14akUDxk9B1g.text: My family and I enjoyed dinner on a Friday night at Fogo de Chao. Karina was our waitress and Norma was the manager on the floor. Karina was attentive and visited our table frequently. Our drinks were always filled. Norma spent time with us chatting after dinner. She was personable, and ensured that our service was up to standard.The salad bar was fresh with a variety of choices. The meet was excellent. It was cooked appropriately and seasoned well. The staff was exceptional and attentive. We've enjoyed all of our visits to this location. My family and I will return.

kv_5vZxtgXImcCo46PflPQ.text: Delicious food! David Amador makes the best caiprinhas everrrrr and is also the best rep

9di8CuC_gQTyBBX-IHztpg.text: Went here last night for dinner for my birthday. The decor of the place was beautiful but most of the meats were bland or mediocre for the price. We did the full experience and it felt like the meat options were limited from what the menu offered. Felt like that was misinformation and they should edit the kinds of meats they actually have.   The salad bar was wonderful. Definitely loved the smoked salmon and quinoa salad. The pork belly was moist and cooked well and the side dishes on the table were fine enough.   I'm putting my review to three stars. Knocked off two because of the service. We were left waiting around for the meats to come by and when we asked for a dessert menu and coffee, waited THIRTY minutes just to have someone come by to check on us. We ended up passing on dessert and asked for the check.   Check out is digital and you can swipe your card right then and there. Two of us had cash on hand-so we waited ANOTHER TEN-FIFTEEN minutes just to have someone check on us again so we can get cash.   For the price of what we were paying at this restaurant, I was expecting nothing less than stellar customer service. I was very much wrong. I'll probably come back if there's an occasion that warrants it or someone wants to go, but not any time soon.

zdDdjDbM8S_V_tT1BbKviA.text: This was my first time eating at this type of restaurant. I would say it's like a buffet style. I went here on a Saturday night and it was pretty busy. Fresh meat on a stick is brought to you to the table. You can choose to get that type of meat and how big you want the piece. I felt like the servers were always on top of things. They always made sure if we had enough water, if we needed more sides, and etc. The guys who served the meat were very nice too. I enjoyed the all you can eat salad bar. There was many choices to pick from with different kinds of salads and sauces. We also ordered the shrimp and lobster appetizer was amazing because they tasted so fresh. Lastly, we ordered the molten chocolate cake which was really good. I definitely would come back and I had a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp and lobster appetizer with meat and chicken plate
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Molten chocolate cake with ice cream, strawberries, and whip cream - $9.25
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mashed potatoes, sweet baked potatoes, and fried banana

4WG0-U-IJ2pw1XY3aKcbNQ.text: I checked out Fogo for the first time at a work outing. Being a meat lover, I was beyond excited for this experience! Here's the details:  Pros:  *Fully stocked salad bar makes it friendly for any crowd.  *Selection of various meats you are able to sample and try is unparalleled from any other experience. *Staff is responsive and friendly. You can select when you want to participate or sit out of a round of meat comes through.   Cons: *Pace was borderline frantic, and almost too fast. Creates an atmosphere of FOMO, so you keep saying yes and then your plate piles up.  *Meats were tailored to the masses and more conservative vs. what I'd normally order with most "well done". Even when they'd ask, they'd cut you off a similar piece for medium rare as the guy that asked for well done. The ribs were WAY over cooked, and it was like chewing on a dog bone. Definitely speaks to "quantity over quality".  *More on that note- I think I would rather have 1 perfectly cooked cut of meat vs. having multiple sub par presentations. Results in stimulation overload, and at the end of the day, you feel bloated and like you overdid it.   Overall, would probably pass on an opportunity to come back. I'm glad I got to experience this, but once is definitely enough!

MRbkEIUkP3v1TDUjdE_xvQ.text: This place is no longer worth going to. The manager was extremely loud going from table to table. The meats were fatty and low quality. You feel rushed because a million different servers come to your table asking the same things. Yet none of them bring the sides In a timely fashion. The salad bar is nice but not worth coming back to. The polenta was hard as a rock. This was not a relaxing dinner experience. After all of this, they drop a pen and a card to try to get you to sign up for there e-club. No thank you.

GxjVQ4MO8EDQnKyk0d-fdQ.text: Excellent authentic and fresh. Last time I went 4 years ago it was pretty bad. This time it was what I expected - great.

NVa0uH8AfXMGuJFz0Nj9jQ.text: Went there on 7/21 for my wife and best friends birthday with our families and the service was horrible. We went 30 minutes without having the wait staff come to our table. 15 minutes and not one piece of meat made it out of the kitchen. You can't make good on your poor service and not bringing out food with trying to give free dessert to go. You ruined the entire experience and will not be returning.

z4mdlFxzB2rDOTKvgiWpuw.text: My first visit. The food was decent. I particularly like the roast pork. Sides & mashed potatoes good. Lots of free parking, which is awesome. Not forced to valet (I hate that). It's easy to forget your card when trying to eat. Particularly with a group. I would have given 4 stars if not for the bathroom. Every woman knows it's an important & integral part of the dining out experience. But for the prices, they should be embarrassed. clean the restrooms. The toilets were dirty with broken toilet seats & a chair that was tore up. No

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dirty &amp; broken seat
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dirty
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. What&#39;s with the chair?

zvSHd_NpKb9hOY4YAvuZRw.text: One of my favorite places to go for really good meats. My favorite is the house special and the top sirloin. My husband loves the parmesan pork. The market table is also amazing with a wide variety of meats, cheeses, and salads. I always get dessert when I'm here, the flan and creme brulee are both amazing. They also include these little breads that are really good and mashed potatoes, polenta, and sauted bananas at every table. Definitely recommend for a special occasion or night out.

KREIemjaqLs6uAKchAGELA.text: The people were wonderful...but...if you are not a really huge eater and want more of a personalized dining experience this is not for you. Lots of hustle and bustle with staff hitting the back of my chair all dinner long left me feeling more like I was at a cafeteria than a fine eatery. The meats that came out were ok though nothing exceptional and the pork ribs (my favorite and looking forward to) were literally burnt and cold. The three stars here is justified due to the warm and wonderful staff, otherwise I would have rated lower. Sorry but I think they can do better.

Zca9P88b4iNEB3iOg8-HgQ.text: Ana Laura was an amazing server, our party quickly switched from 12 to 16 and she made sure we were sat quickly and all taken care of. She was sweet and made sure our experience (which for some of us, our first) was memorable!!

MGc7i6PhnZqHR1cZuLz8GA.text: We come here for a lot of occasions and is always great, Corrina was our server and she was excellent, we went for our daughters Birthday and she went out of her way to make her day special, everyone was on point and the food and experience was awesome, will definitely be back

d370TJ-mgV6RAxL3ofuTHw.text: What a great meal!  We have eaten at several different ones but the attention to detail here was great!  Thanks for great service Matt and Christopher!

yBoNS_7OcweL7XTW9UcFeA.text: Definitely the best restauramt we have been to out here! First let me say this is an experience. If you haven't been to a Brazilian restaurant, they bring around various beautiful cuts of meat cooked to perfection. You signal the waitstaff when you want more by flipping a coaster: green is go and red is no. Not only is the meat exceptional, but there is also an unlimited salad bar that is a destiny in itself. We chose this place for my Dad's 80th birthday and they treated us like royalty. Our waitstaff consisted of three, yes a team, of servers that were very attentive. Destinee, Lilly, and Favi were a class act. Cocktails are marvelous too. Certainly not going to wait for a special occasion to go back!

bYP7t1eoHEO5v1VQFWUlPw.text: Disappointed. If I could give zero stars - I would.  Does not deserve even one star.  We were sat by a window in a corner. We had to beg anyone who walked our way to send food over. It never came. Don't waste your good hard earned money on this place. You shouldn't have to beg to get food when you are paying them to serve you dinner.  **Go to Cuisine and Wine Bistro in Gilbert. They have top notch food, wine, beer, and amazing service!

L4eUV3zgss3FE8Vq5KYxdw.text: Went here to celebrate a friends birthday & since I don't eat meat, I was very please that they sold fish. The fish was cooked so well & tasted amazing! The drinks on the other hand, weren't that really good

7ahe0WLnCFHrSOKMDewbyQ.text: I love,love,love this place!!! Not one bad word and service is amazing and staff is super courteous.  Come with an appetite for sure!!!

hSWVWn7wUeehOsBubwIYxQ.text: This is the worst Brazilian style steakhouse I have ever been to. Food was terrible. Everything was over cooked, even when asked for medium rare. All the meats were dry and bland. The "fresh" seafood was clearly frozen. Also, talk about a boring choice of meats, there was nothing special about this place. How can you not serve buffalo or venison at a Brazilian steakhouse? This is a poor excuse of a restaurant. Wouldn't recommend to anybody. Very disappointing

ABDFCStQDgSxSrgpaHwbcg.text: Awesome food and awesome service at this place. Especially If you are a meat lover.  The constant flow and variety of meats available is well worth the money.   I've been to some so called all you can eat. places that tend to slow down the flow of food they bring after your first round. But at this place it just keeps on coming.  Also, the salad bar is amazing. Great quality and variety.  If you're in Scottdale and hungry, this place is a must.

M5qbgocaF6rBo5T0goIp_w.text: Fogo = No Go. Food quality is down.  Service is very rushed.  Had to ask for additional meats after being served a few on repeat.  Not worth the money.

AyuFQX0WPRVZnfgeBf7KJA.text: This place gave me totally mixed feelings. Mostly I have good things to say. The food was good but the lack of a fifth star is mostly because it wasn't worth the price. I spend a lot of money on food and I don't feel like I'm being cheap here. Everything was cooked well, you can eat your fill. Lots of variety of meats. But when I pay a check for 170.00 I feel like I should have an experience and not just be full. I have eaten at similar Brazilian style Bbq places and the prices were simply better. I'll give it this . The atmosphere was better. Very classy place. Staff was courteous and attentive and the food did taste pretty good. Then again it is Scottsdale. Overall it was a good experience.

PXkIriSaKVo4VZffkIfXow.text: I was treated to a birthday dinner at Fogo and it exceeded all of my expectations. The food is delicious and any meat lover will be extremely happy to eat here! The service was excellent and the servers were attentive without being overbearing. I was given a free dessert for my birthday that was the perfect sweet compliment to all the savory flavors.

wpsmUVOvmm7ffc7HYkk9gg.text: My fiancee, son and I went here for dinner on Christmas Day. The food was good and the meat a little overdone, but well-seared and served hot. The servers were outstanding! but the atmosphere is lacking. The place was too brightly lit and the tables and chairs placed so close togather it reminded me of a big cafeteria. My adult son had been ill and only ate a fraction of what he normally would. He had quite a bit of food left on his plates, especially the meat, and could not finish. I knew it would get thrown in the garbage, so I explained his situation and requested if there was some way they could take it in the back and package it so he could enjoy it when he was feeling better. I realize that was probably against the rules, however, I was hoping for a little professional courtesy. At $53 each, the fact that his leftover food was going to be thrown out was upsetting. (He only ate a couple bites of meat and a small amount of the food on his "sides" plate~the least they could've done was offer to charge him the Market price, at $23 less.) Also, the price of a 6-oz. bottle of Coke was $3.50 and he had two before we thought to ask and were told no free refills on soft drinks. So the total for his meager meal without tax/tip was $60! Also, no one explained there was rice, mashed potatoes, bean soup, and other hot food on the back bar behind the salads/cold items. They did bring a dish of mashed potatoes to the table which I thought came from the kitchen, and we didn't discover the hot sides until we were leaving. Should we return again, I would just do the Market Place area. It had a decent selection of cold gourmet foods and I especially loved the cheeses, however, I would have liked to try the hot food also. Although other good buffets at the same price ($30) would also include all of the entrees, meats and desserts. If anyone could even handle dessert after trying to eat all the food that is offered, it is not included in the full meal price.

svMKG5LZK8cejAa-EGeJyA.text: Always love coming here and gorging myself on amazing meats. If you've never been, be prepared so spend quite a bit of money and feel incredibly stuffed afterwards. Always come on an empty stomach to get the most out of it. Also, 21+ if you've never had a caipirinha, it's like a sugary mojito and very addicting!

diJo23DR9rEHPOOL_iDefA.text: The service here is beyond amazing! I don't think I've ever been to any restaurant that has service this great. The salads are fresh and delicious and the Brazilian cheese bread they give you is addicting and delicious! I like my meat medium so everything was cooked to perfection. My husband however will only eat it well done so it took a few tries for them to get it right, which is fine because they were more than willing to accommodate and make some just for him. Love this place!

7DnNWqAZ1uHqohRX3lW4KQ.text: The staff was friendly along with the manager. Beautiful restaurant. $50/per person.   The meats were not quality pieces of meat and were overcooked/and or tough. The meats weren't very hot and were cool to lukewarm. The meats were not flavored well either and the bread was slightly warm.  Not sure why the lady at the front desk said they were fully booked when at least half of the restaurant was empty?

TdVsfvhUxgs7sOzS_t8u-Q.text: The food was out of this world.  Expensive, but well worth it.  The one thing I couldn't get past was the service.  It was extremely sub-par, especially for how the establishment attempts to present themselves (professional.)  I can't even count the number of times that our party of 6 had to be told repeatedly (i.e. at least 3 times on each occasion,) that the specific item we were asking for would be "right out"...or "it was cooking, should be here any minute"...or any other excuse they could deliver us at the time.  Not just the meat/entree's - no...we had to wait over 30 minutes just for BREAD.  There was no flow to our meal, it was haphazard at best.  I don't expect 100% organization in any establishment - especially one where there a a myriad of servers/specialties running around.  But my experience went far beyond reasonable in the opposite direction of organized chaos.  This was a complete service failure.  Not to be outdone in failures - it took almost 20 minutes (not an exaggeration,) JUST to get our check.  Since it was my first time at Fogo de Chao, I don't know if this was just a fluke or their are staffing issues (new) at the establishment, or both!  But for the expense and time involved in an outing to Fogo - I can't see myself being willing to risk it in the future.  Now, if you have all the time in the world (our meal went 3 hours and 20 minutes!) - then by all means, go enjoy the most awesome food you could ask for.  Just be ready to work for it.

xXJiSeHFUM-laxk0pann0Q.text: We came here last here for thanksgiving and it was great! They served turkey that we enjoyed so we made a reservation this year at 7:30. When we got there, there was no turkey.  I asked about it and he said he thought they ran out but would check for me. Then, that specific person never came back.  For the first 30 min, we were only offered 2 kinds of meat.   They seemed unprepared for the holiday because there weren't enough people walking around and when they did, they completely skipped our table.  We talked to our server a few times about it and finally more meat came out.     I did enjoy the salad bar, but because We were so disappointed in the service, we won't be returning.

mychI8ADDmiQ5ZgeoDTQ7w.text: Amazing cuts of meat! Great atmosphere, fun experience what's not to love?! The fillet mignon is superb. Even the salad bar has unique options . Perfect for groups or a date night .

3944qUt-prxXrULiR8vnVQ.text: This place is magnificent! My family and I were first timers for my daughters 1st birthday tomorrow and we are very pleased with the service and the food. The steaks are delicious but the chicken (which I normally don't care for) was by far my favorite.   Now on to the important portion of my review... The customer service was AMAZING!! Our waitress was nice, and (I forget what the term is) the mean cutting guys were all pleasant and helpful but Lou the customer service manager was just the best! I read about him on other reviews so out of all the staff helping us I had to ask him his name because I just KNEW he was the Lou everyone was raving about. He waits, serves, takes orders, busses, he does everything!   ALL of the staff was amazing. Especially with our fussy 1 year old. They rinsed her bottle for us and filled it with warm water so we could make another bottle and not to mention waived all the drink fees (just 1 Coke and 1 mojito but still a nice surprise). We will definitely be back :)

9rMBiERerxWsgiQFDtgH1A.text: Found another place gor our family nights out. My boys were very opened minded and tried all the meats. Everything was delicious. Diffiently going to be returning back for another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tummys were full

J6lPnsaDKmIntbI9iN65Ig.text: If you like to eat different kinds of steaks and meat, this place is for you! The ambience in this restaurant was beautiful, and lighting was great as well.  The food is overall is great. I will definitely be coming back with my family. The only think is its a little more pricey than other Brazilian steak spots, but definitely one of our go to spots when we have a bit more money :)

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LnSP4mpMVdPfIWG38JoR1g.text: We ate here on Saturday and the food was fantastic. The reason for the three star is because I used the restroom before eating, which was a huge mistake. I had to try Not to think about the bathroom while eating to get through my night. The bathroom needs to be blown up and renovated, or maybe just cleaned. It was so very disgusting and it was only 445 pm!

OLvUwDBfEq2du93OtF3Wvw.text: This was my first time experiencing Brazilian steakhouse! Service was above exceptional! Christopher was awesome and knowledgeable. We will be back soon.

aNLi_SK5uVMPIl2oBUQy4g.text: I went for my birthday on a friend recommendation. Unique deal here $52.95 per person includes sides and unlimited meat and a large salad bar. This includes perfectly cooked sirloin, lamb chops, leg of lamb, rib eye, filet, tenderloin and chicken. The beef tends to blend in as pretty similar but great and they bring however you like it ... Rare medium rare medium ... Don't know if they serve ruined. They just keep coming with meat until you say done. I overdosed. Definitely recommend for meat lovers and a fun time. Servers and managers all were friendly prompt and efficient.

xjWtvpT5Czn2pSEEoK2QCw.text: If you like to eat this is the spot for you, very high end (about 50.00 per person) but it's basically all you can eat, and about the highest quality you can get. Huge salad bar and about any meat you'd want to try. The cool thing is they bring it out too the table and cut it off the skewers and onto your plate, until you can't eat anymore. But save room and time for desert too. Must try!

Yx9fSKXH5CXPlYoWHhFHfA.text: Three stars was for the service that was received. Also a small deduction for the food when compared to others I have visited.  They mostly kept up with delivering the meat when the cards were flipped to green but occasionally they slacked and we were kept waiting a few minutes with empty plates. Many times we also had empty glasses in need of filling that took waaaaaayyyyyy too long. I have ate at three Fogo restaurants and an off brand Brazilian steakhouse and this was by far my least favorite.  The meat selections were just not as good and well prepared as other locations I have visited. I will not say it was bad though, some of the selections were good, just kinda hit and miss. The salad bar here was also lacking when compared to others, a lot less selections and options....not a big deal with me as the salad offerings are not what I come for.  Still a decent option to visit in Phoenix but try the Houston or Sao Paulo Brazil locations.... will blow your socks off.

2k5OzefrloPCJ4z9AerFSg.text: This is a place that after you eat here; you put your craving to meat on hold for sometime. It has really nice selection if meat, I am a big fan of lamb and I got plenty :) Pros: lots of meat, salad, ambiance Cons: the meat is extremely salty, I thought I will get an hearth attack :) 2 people with 2 martinis we paid roughly 120$ so a bit pricey :)

d9OHKR7EQu4JKyFGz3iJ7g.text: We went for the first time to try this restaurant since it was restaurant week and it did not disappoint. The only thing different during restaurant wek is the discounted price. When we arrived we were immediately seated and the experience began. You can go to the salad bar and to get the protein started you simply flip the coaster to green.   The picanha steak was to die for and I had several helpings. Servers are very attentive and the food just keeps coming. We would now add this restaurant to our list of go to. I cannot think of a thing that could have been better which was amazing since it was so busy when we were there.

Pb-ZmthYffEQq_Zyqx1Kbg.text: I like Fogo. I've been to a few across the country. This one is a bit inconsistent.  The other night our cheese bread was old and hard, the salad bar seemed a bit tired and the hostess who seated us was rude.  This is the 2nd time I've eaten here in a couple of months and my first time here was much better.  The meats were all good, the shrimp cocktail was great.  4 people in my party got cheesecake and they were all different sizes and totally different amounts of strawberry topping.  3 of us for the tres leches cake and they were all different sizes and one was almost soupy? Coffee was brought out without cream and spoons.  Just not typical for a Fogo dinning experience.  We came in late (830pm)  so maybe that's why we got the subpar experience.  Hard to say if I'm going to pay this kind of $$ again for another dinner I'm hosting.

eIYgVwYoVORlnjtzxUicqw.text: I was blown away by this place after my meal I sat there trying to find something negative about this place and honestly I couldn't think of anything. The food was spectacular, the meats were cooked perfectly, salad bar was full of great choices as well as quality products. The wait staff was professional and attentative before my glass would become empty a waiter was on his way with a refill and same with the meats. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

zpY4cMdwaGjCWz0n0hlNyg.text: We are trying new restaurants lately..trying to broaden our horizons. Went here because we were passing by. The only reason I put two stars is because the customer service is very good. The food was so mediocre. If I am spending 50 dollars per person, plus drinks i expect real mashed potatoes with my food. I do not want potato spuds. It was a waste of money. I would rather go to a small restaurant with excellent food than a large overrated one. 100 percent equivalent to a las Vegas buffet. The meat was fatty, drinks were not good. I don't understand why there are so many good reviews on all of these different places, I feel like it is my duty to be truthful on here! I was not expecting a steakhouse quality meal for the price, but left feeling jipped. Bill for two came out to $165.00. I guess it's a quantity over quality type business. They give so much food, but none of it is delicious. Will not be back.

PzrS9j_xrhnc58TKK695mQ.text: This is by far the best churasscaria I have ever tried. Brazilian bbq at its best! Everything is perfectly seasoned, but my personal favorite is the top sirloin.   The sides that come with the meal are great too.. there is cheese bread, fried plantains, and these two other things..... very delicious.  The salad bar has plenty to choose from, try a little bit of everything. Great selection. The service is ok/good, but occasionally we had to flag our waiter down. Reservations are highly recommended because this place gets packed.   The night my boyfriend and I went, we saw two players from the Golden State Warriors, and we saw Muhammed Ali. Apparently famous people come in all the time.
