xxLIUtf4OE-odZ_QGmQ6Tg.text: Worth the per plate price! Outstanding quality meats and salad bar, great service.

IwcVjJslIluGFWxc-edpXQ.text: Always an absolute delight coming here. The garlic steak and bacon wrapped filet is a must have. Glad they got back the Guarana an absolute must try. And something about the bacon at the salad bar is just so good.  Wanna give a shout out to Lou and Christopher for being awesome waiters really made the experience that much better.

cgagB1g1tkZfeYxwhzvACQ.text: Admittedly, I'm not a huge meat eater. At Brazilian Steakhouses, I gorge on the cheesy bread things, mashed potatoes and plantains (and, in Vegas, a pitcher of sangria). This the only Fogo de Chao location I've visited. I'm thrilled that they are open for lunch. I sometimes meet my hubby there (now, he IS a carnivore and makes up for me not eating much meat). It's not crowded, service and food selection are still great, and it's cheaper. Also, kids 5 and under are free. Unfortunately for them, my four year old eats everything. She's in heaven here.  I still think I prefer Texas de Brazil b/c their plantains and potatoes are better. But, Fogo de Chao has palenta. The salad bar area and meats are about equal.   I did notice that the meats are cooked more than some of the other Brazilian steakhouses. More medium-well. The bacon-wrapped filet was great!

L5CDj4nD78sbIoLVF4ICLQ.text: Good food. Unfortunately (or fortunately for us), we sniffed out a scam. Check your bills. They overcharged us by +\~ $100. After we alerted the cashier to the mistake, we were offered a shoddy explanation that would leave even the most trusting soul saying "hmmmmm". I surmise there is a rotten apple amongst the staff. Overall, good food. Nice people. ...But something smells funny.

aJk8Z348jMUGd3gsnjxwrg.text: The salad bar..... Who needs the meat!! Unless it's the garlic beef. Or the cheesy bread knots. Now, I usually dont visit chain restaurants... especially after coming to this place from the San Diego location. I thought the food was just to DIE for, so I decided to take my friend who was visiting here (especially since I had a two people eat foooo FREE coupon). Now, I must say... I like this restaurant over the San Diego location. The tables are spaced out, and are definitely more accessible, you arent side-stepping between customers/servers trying to venture to the salad  bar or to your own table.  They have a drink service constantly going around? Something I'm definitely not used to. That was so incredibly convenient. The service was superb and the servers very friendly.  I would come here just for the garlic knots.  I seriously want to sneak in with ziplocs next time just to load up before I leave.... totally kidding. kinda. (IM FROM THE BAY AREA, we get ratchet).  Anyways A++++++.

5_5WlNoibDcxk4akObW7FQ.text: Norma is the best server in history. She provided the best service and performed above and beyond the call of duty. So, it was my birthday and we requested that she smash all the desserts together in one plate and came through like a champ. So, come visit her because she rocks!!!

WBDIHHCeP4BYoa6ZEGc96A.text: From a comparison point of view, this restaurant is not in the same league as the Fogo in Las Vegas. The quality of the food was True to Fago's high standards but the service was over-the-top-annoying. There was way too much "is everything ok?" to the point of interrupting our meal and conversation. I had to tell them that we would let them know if everything wasn't okay and to allow us to enjoy our meal. Seriously, at one point I was asked "how is everything?" twice while chewing the same piece of meat!  In my world, along with food quality, dining service is equally important, if not more-so. This Fago must define it good service differently.

W8IpXTIYd6k_Q8bmhvYBWg.text: Recently moved from Houston to Arizona. So happy they have Fogo here. We visited for lunch one afternoon and while the service was not the standard we expect from Fogo, Victor Lou N. came by our table and when we told him about lack of attentiveness of staff (never had anyone bring more side dishes and had to ask for more tea) he assured us this is not how they operate.   He told us come in for dinner again one night and give them another chance. He made our visit very worth while and when we get another chance, we will be there again.  If some of the wait staff know you by name, does that mean you eat there too much? :-)

CHn39fREtH91XXJ_uMDWBw.text: Fogo de Chao is our favorite restaurant in the valley. Every time we go there, our dining experience is amazing. The food is delicious, (most of the food is Gluten Free), the steaks are perfect, and the sides are always a treat. We do not have an issue of trying to decide what we want to eat on the menu, we want to sample it all!! What a special event eating at Foco de Chao is each time we go there. We are ecstatic to have this restaurant in Scottsdale. Bettie Sue Riddle

EBWE4vHD5Ekk2_TnKrIhvA.text: I almost gave this place one star, but decided to give it two so people didn't think I was just going off on a rant.  My wife and I decided to go celebrate a special occasion at Fogo de Chao to celebrate her passing the CPA exam.  We were both excited to go and try it out based on the reviews we had read.  I'm not really sure if we ended up hitting an off night but disappointing for a $150 dollar meal...  Let me say, first off, it wasn't all bad.  The interior is great, and staff, very professional.  The salad bar was very good, but ended up being the highlight of the evening. The fresh bread that they brought out and drinks were very good, however, when we flipped our cards over and began receiving meat, our disappointment began.  I love medium rare, not rare, and not well done meat. Every time I asked for a streak, I would ask for medium rare, and would ALWAYS get medium well to well.  I don't believe there was ever any pink in any of my steaks.  The chicken was overcooked and at times had to scrape the chard skin flakes off  before eating. Even the lamb came out slightly overdone, but edible.  unfortunately I am not a huge fan of lamb, I came for the steaks and expected more.  We tried every piece of meat on the menu in an attempt to find something worth the 50 dollars a plate we were paying, After about an hour, we discovered that the filet (not the bacon wrapped) while request medium rare, was closer to medium instead of burnt. Finally something besides salad and the sides worth eating.  Would I recommend this place to anyone?  For the price, absolutely not.  I could have gotten a much better meal for the price I paid at Ruth Chris, or any other steak house for that matter,  In addition, if any steakhouse had served me a well done steak instead of my requested medium rare, I would have simply sent it back to the kitchen.  My only option in this case was disappointment as I sampled all the available choices.  Overall, the only way I would ever come back to this place would be for a free.  I really hope I just hit an off night or something based on the reviews or people are diluting themselves. You'd have to be crazy to drop this type of money here with all the great places to eat around Fogo de Chao.

tfE_ow2Q3UhggtcqEAhm5Q.text: Excellent service, quality of food and selection. Lunch between 11:30 and 2 during the week matches the service quality and food of their dinner experience. If you've never experienced Brazilian barbecue Fogo will not disappoint. Bring friends and make it an experience! Save room for dessert, this dog is a fan of the flan.

wHzSUEyGR6-kfsMIXPTCVg.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant to go to when I am willing to pay a little extra for a meal. The customer service here is the best you will come across at any restaurant. You dont have just one waiter, no. You have like 6. And thats just for your drinks. The chefs come out with different meats constantly so you never have an empty plate. The food here is to die for. We come here for birthdays and holidays and are never disappointed. You pay a flat rate for your meals here and get more than your moneys worth. Lunch is about $15 cheaper and there is no difference between it and dinner. I recommend this place constantly to friends and co workers. Everyone should experience this place at least once in their lifetime.

86JoanBn7qUrUugI1wDUSQ.text: Massively overpriced cheapy buffet. This place had good reviews and it's all you can eat steak, what is not to love right? WRONG! Their salad bar is definitely the worst  salad bar I have ever tried. Bland, gross, cheap. The meat was gross too. I tried nearly  all of them and was Super disappointed. Dry, chewy, lacked flavor. For $50 a plate I expected at least slightly better than average food. No joke, I would have had a better meal at a $19.99 vegas buffet. Next time I want to spend $50 on one plate I will head over to Flemmings. Never a bad meal there!

i-oBwnokaEHM4cc7hLks4Q.text: I absolutely loved this place, ate so much I felt sick the next day and didn't need to eat until the next evening.  We came near the end of the evening, about 8ish. Some of the meats they didn't bring around, but if you requested them they cooked a skewer to get it for you. The lamb t-bones were unbelievable, each bite was a small orgasm in the mouth. The filet Mignon varied, the first skewer was excellent the second one they brought around was still good and tender but not as good as the first. The bacon wrapped filet was delicious as well each time they brought it around.  Definitely an experience worth repeating!

_7oypY8DV0Zcy_LNRTzpnA.text: Wow. What a unique and wonderful dining experience. The salad bar VERY well done. The meat - unreal. My stomach - exploded. Service excellent, concept fun, atmosphere celebratory. I have nothing but good things to say about this experience. Well, with maybe one exception. Seven people, dinner, drinks and dessert = $650. Ultimately worth it, but be prepared to sell a kidney.

c_BE8E6wBKBbMgsNonp4dw.text: Lu took great care of us! Phenomenal food! Will recommend to everyone that I know! Delicious lamb chops. Dessert was to die for.

Z-HFFYrU7OmIw2TRCs1G8A.text: Great service and great food! Thank you Lou, Marcos and Christopher for your friendly hello and attention to our needs. Everyone did super at making our meal all we could experience! We would ask for a meat selection and they would get it sent our way immediately!  Absolute loved the house special and filet mignon, along with polenta and cheese rolls! We brought our 4 teenagers for the first time and they were in awe, tried so many new things and loved it! It was a great business and Mother's Day celebration!

1ENJ_vAopA3NC_YuyBC7-A.text: Fogo!  How I love you!  Your meats and cheeses make my meats and cheeses happy.  Well, almost.  I've been a staunch fan of Fogo de Chao in Beverly Hills for so long.  The foods are 110% perfect.  Nothing wrong either in service or food.  Never.  Then I came to Scottsdale.  It was good.  But that's about all I can say.  The salad bar was actually better than the meats, which were amazing also.  Delicious pastas and vegetables laid out in a wide variety.  The gauchos who came to our table, along with the waiter/waitress staff, were great.  Very helpful, friendly and courteous.  The meats, however, just didn't match up with Beverly Hills.  Again, that's not saying something was wrong, they just weren't as good.  The Picanha (house special awesomeness meat) was good, but was lacking whatever magic put it on the map.    I'm not disappointed, but for $150 for 2 people, I was actually hoping for better.  In fact, I was actually turned off from enjoying their famous Creme Brulee.  Le Sigh.

FKeAxVax4muvyo-2V6J8NQ.text: Great place! I went with a group of people here last week and the experience was great! Food was good. Service was good. Environment was warm and welcoming. Will continue going back in the future.

P64dgiupVqty4ADNGhIe9Q.text: Wasn't impressed with their salad bar, the meat wasn't all that..... They need to take notes from Texas de Brazil restaurant!

0xEf0SOxvn5R3KZ6DvTjDg.text: Fogo is a chain, but unlike many chain restaurants Fogo's is usually fabulous.  There can be variability between specific locations.  In general, though, FDC's is awesome, whether lunch buffet or dinner service, though always a little pricey (that's how how you know I'm not in the 1 percent club, 'cause money still means something to me!) it's a safe bet if you want to treat your parents or loved ones or friends to a sure-bet nice meal, or have a nice night out with your significant other!

JZv-X4i4FcGC1OlFKROO6A.text: Having been to Churrasco in Brazil, I already know that I am a fan of Brazilian Steakhouses in general.  But the Fogo de Chao in Scottsdale, is probably the best one I've been to, and here's why -   The cleanliness and decor are top notch.  Not that other Fogo's are not, but this one is the nicest of the ones I've been to.  The service at this one is excellent!  And they really appreciate my few Portuguese phrases!  Muito Obrigado goes a long way here...  Finally, as I have come to expect from Fogo de Chao, the food is excellent.  Of course, if you don't like mouthwatering, perfectly cooked meat right off the skewer, then this place probably isn't for you.  Oh, and if you are somehow able to flip your card over to red when someone keeps coming by to ask if you want another piece of filet mignon or picanha, their dessert is excellent as well.  Enjoy...

b3433MtFnbYkXpXUiCJMnA.text: Drove up from Tucson to have a birthday dinner for my brother in law.  The food was excellent, although I was disappointed they didn't offer grilled pineapple.  We arrived before the rest of our party so we sat at the bar and the awesome bartender made us their signature drink, the Caipirinha, which was delicious and potent!  The drink was expensive out of Happy Hour, so if you plan to enjoy a few, happy Hour is your best time.

0JnC2-itK0y5IXHKbZFXvQ.text: Never ever ever ever EVER come to this place when you're not starving. Seriously your stomach better be growling like a beast, your feet must be tapping on the ground anxiously, and you HAVE to be begging for meat-heaven when you come to this place.  Only then will you be able to make your money's worth.  That being said, this restaurant is very fancy and very expensive. But it's worth it for the meat and for the sheer satisfaction of it all. Each meat is cooked to perfection making sure each bite is flavorful and distinct- different from the other ones. My favorite would have to be the Special and the Chicken.. something.  I never really caught the names of the meat since I was too busy drooling as the waitress brings them to my table. Sorry.  Now, the salad bar must not be left behind either. The apple salad is just amazingly scrumptious and crunchy and the rest of the vegetables is fresh. Definitely stock up on the vegetables because it prevents you from getting sick off of meat-overload.  I had the Brazilian Lemonade to drink and it was the best lemonade EVER. It was sweet, tangry, smooth, and juicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!

JrviMz8zjh9M6BFNO6LeBg.text: Alright... I have been to a number of these restaurants across the nation, and all pretty good. Here is our experience.... have you ever been to a place where the waiters almost annoy you too much?? This is the place. We could not go without having someone either ask to take our plate, ask us if we are done, ask us if we want a certain meat (that did not help at all by the way), ask us if we want potatoes etc... every minute. very annoying.. and they must have had like 15 waiters working.... the other issue was with the meat. Most of these places I have gone to have a good selection... but they seemed to bring the cheapest meat (top sirloin, sausage, and very dry chicken) about 80% of the time. If you are lucky enough to see something different it was normally gone by the time they came to our table. The eventually brought the beed rib and lamb to our table, but it did take a while. For the price you pay, I would never go back. If you are the manager and you are reading this, just tell the waiters to take a chill pill and relax.

6SVWjkYQrSi4zqxDLZe-YA.text: This is the first Brazilian steak restaurant I ever went to. I've wanted to go back for years but never did. We decided to go here today to start the new years off right. What an amazing experience! The food really is perfect.

I9xaSYQYHIImV_pOxBhzAw.text: I will start this review by stating that buffet, mass feeding type restaurants are not really my scene. If they were I would have given this a better star rating. By no means did I not enjoy myself, just not my type of place.   We were greeted with a very friendly host which can sometimes be challenging at Scottsdale establishments. We were seated very promptly at a table alongside the wall. I noticed that the windows are very high so you can't look outside unless you are taller. Not a deal breaker just interesting style of architecture with the builder.  The gentleman that came and explained the process of putting the green and red cards to start/stop the meat being brought around seemed rushed in his explanation and I had a hard time understanding exactly what he was saying because he spoke so quickly.   My best friend and I got up and survey and take in the salad bar. Nothing spectacular. I did find the potato salad was very good, and had some ingredient that made it pop a little more than your regular potato salad. The apple salad was very good too. I enjoyed a little bit of the cheese. The artichoke heart was very salty and not really my bag.   If I knew that sides were going to be brought to the table as soon as we turned our cards to green I would have not even hit the salad bar. The little round rolls they brought to the table reminded me of a favorite South American roll my stepmother always makes when I visit. These were much lighter though, almost cream puff texture. They were addictive!   The cuts of meat were all very good. I personally don't really eat meat so my stomach became quite full very quickly. I did notice that they came around very efficiently making sure we had plenty of meat. Our sides were replenished a few times when there was still quite a bit left. I thought this was a bit on the wasteful side as the food is thrown out, but that's just me.   I think this would be a great place to take a large group because it's fun and interactive. For dinner with just my friend and I it felt a little gimmicky but all of the servers and everyone working was very nice.

F2taBbokWG2g4XFVNORQLA.text: Love the place! Expensive but Good food! Drinks are expensive and all full of ice! Service was great.

amkaSYNi_eSC-J_YWBZzvw.text: Celebrated our 21st Anniversary with a wonderful dining experience.  We've experienced Brazilian food before but this place was much nicer than the previous place.  Our waiter explained everything in detail regarding the market selections and the sides that would be brought out.  The gauchos were on point and made several rotations.  When we mentioned a particular likening to the Hawaiian Pork they immediately brought out a fresh skewer.  They happened to be running a summer special so we got desserts for free!!! Absolutely delicious. Would definitely recommend.

brEi5SmP2EbAkR8fZcGRTA.text: I tried Fogo de Chao for the first time while in Atlanta a few years ago, and always wanted to come back. When I found out that there was one in Scottsdale, I got really excited and decided to go there for dinner. It was just as delicious as I remembered, in fact, I enjoyed the experience even more this time around. I love the all-you-can-drink Limeades! The attentiveness of the staff can't be beat: they constantly checked on us to make sure our drinks were refilled and that we have enough food. The assorted grilled meats were all very tasty and the salad bar with all the different sides was yummy too. We inhaled the Tres Leches we ordered for dessert. Overall, this was a perfect, satisfying meal: great food, awesome customer service.

3JeBcPexz1Qx56RDfctTow.text: Went to Fogo De Chao for the first time today for my Birthday! Loved everything about this place! The food was delicious and the servers did great! Lou the customer service representative went out of his way to make sure everything was extra special for my birthday including giving me a complementary dessert!  My new favorite restaurant!!

z8qhydpeKPE4KFaEA-tlYg.text: Simply put this place is ONE OF A KIND!! The service is impeccable, the food is exceptional and it is consistent from restaurant to restaurant. Kudos to Victor Lou Di Nolfi and Brent  for the great experience !! They made Fathers Day 2015, great!

LWkoYps1FEebSDFXIFDXDg.text: Today, I am giving Fogo de Chao the honor of being my 100th Yelp Elite review.  I ate here on Aug 31, 2017 for the very first time, for summer price of $45 instead of the $52, including prime cuts: lamb chops, filet mignon, ribeye, and beef ribs.  We were a group of 9 Wild Dining MeetUp Foodies.  The moment I put in my mouth, the lamb chops, ribeye, and filet mignon, my eyes rolled back into my head, in that "to die for" moment, that I KNEW WAS EXPERIENCING THE SAME "HEAVEN" THAT OTHER YELPERS DESCRIBED.  The meats were cooked very very RED, which is very hard for other restaurants to GET RIGHT(for ME) when I order "rare or medium rare" at other restaurants.  But here at Fogo, I can look at the color and pick where I want him to cut.  They KNOW how to cook these prime cuts, to me, savored only when very red/rare for most of the inside of their red meats.  To cook such premium meats medium and well-done is to me "the poor cow gave us his life only to be vulcanized".    ONLY here can I have all three expensive cuts of lamb chops, ribeye, filet mignon ALL on the SAME plate, at the same time!  How cool is that?    Yet, some of the other meats such as bacon-wrapped beef cubes, pork ribs, were as some disappointed Yelpers described, dry and over-cooked, leaving parts even unedible cos it is too hard (like plastic) to eat.   But not necessarily every time, maybe next time they come to the table with same item, that batch may not be not cooked as dry.  I only tasted 4-5 items at the Market Table salad bar, as I came for the premium meats.  But the marinated mushrooms, green beans (sweet and tender with no strings), hearts of palm, and smoked salmon with capers were ALL SOOO GOOD.  However I only ate those at the end of my dinner and I was alone, after everyone at my table.    When I got home, I realized I do not recall tasting the beef ribs, which employee Danielle, said was her favorite Fogo meat.  Next day I called the restaurant and was told by the manager, that you have to ASK for the beef ribs.  They do not bring the ribs to each table like the other meats, because they make very few, maybe only 15 ribs, because it takes 5 hours and they take up too much room on the grill, so other meats cannot be prepared.    The service was mostly wonderful.  Fogo seems to have picked the most upbeat and enthusiastic employees, like Danielle and Kaylee.  I do have one complaint about the service that makes me almost want to give 4 stars to this Yelp review.  Nine of us sat at a long table at the far rear of the restaurant, meaning 4 of us had our backs to the wall with enough space for someone to walk behind us.  ALL of us had our discs turned up to green, the entire time we dined there because our host said if we didn't, they would not even approach our table.  But SEVERAL of the meat servers only asked the people sitting across from me with their backs to the center of the dining room, what they wanted and cut for them.  But they did not ask the 4 of us with our backs to the wall, instead they quickly went away as if we did not exist before I could say "Hey how about US?"  It was almost as if "they RAN away".  Yet there was room for them to come behind us and ask each of us who had our backs to the back wall.  After a few times of them "running away" after serving the 5 across the table from me, I said to my neighbor, "Hey they didn't even ask US and ran away."  She said, "I am noticing the same behavior".    So the next day, when the manager told me about why I did not see the beef ribs, I told him about them "running away".    He said that next time I come in, he would put us at a "better table, more toward the center".  I also said I was not the host at this dinner, another person was, and he waited for me and others at the front door, and showed us where our table was, and I have no knowledge how that table was "assigned to us".  I said that it shouldn't matter where the table is in the dining room, that all diners should be given the same service wherever they sit.  Also people at the same table who had their backs to the center, were served the meat, but people who had their backs to the rear wall, were not.  At least they could ASK us, like they ASKED the people sitting across from US.   He agreed and said that he would address this issue with the servers, and thanked me many times for my "feedback".    As I am typing, the "getting it right with the ribeye, lamp chops, and filet mignon and enough of the other "heavenly" foods I ate here and the good service of the other employees, still outweighs this "running away" behavior, so I still feel good enough about giving Fogo 5 stars for my 100th review.  Why even the paper towels in the ladies room were "gourmet", having seen this type towel only at one other upscale place, the Phoenician Hotel.  I hope that I will not have the "running away" in my future visits, where I plan to come for full menu and EAT THE BEEF RIBS for weekday lunch for $35, in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet mignon front, ribeye behind, lamb chops right, hearts of palm below, pork rib far left, .  Never had ALL ON same plate.

Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Picahna, the prime part of Top Sirloin, Fogo&#39;s signature churrasco steak.  I love it rare like this!!!  I love the fat, too.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Black beans and rice, delicious, lamb chops, and hearts of palm

0IbI6kbR6ih_Dp9TmUR3Jg.text: I have always wanted to check this place out as I frequented a similar place in New Mexico and loved it. My wife and I went on Thanksgiving day around 4:30 and found the place packed. We were seated after a 15 minute wait. The service was outstanding and the staff very friendly and attentive.  The wide variety of meat was tasty and well prepared.  The salad deck was running short on some items. Approximately 30 minutes into our dinner in walks an old bag with her dog and is seated in our general vicinity.  After a bit she began to feed the dog off her plate. I noticed a couple that asked to be seated elsewhere and once reseated she complained about the dog to the staff. I found it highly offensive to allow an animal that was not a service animal into the establishment.  My wife and I dropped $245 there for dinner and drinks. I will not return.

5nmTr-CK0c6_hWc9cd7GDg.text: I absolutely love Fogo. My coworker and I talked about eating here for a good 3 months. When we finally had time to grab lunch together, this was the first place to come to mind! The salad and cheese bar is always great. Everything is gresh. But the best part about fogo is definitely their churrascaria experience! You get a flip card, one side is green and The other side is red. You flip to the green side when you're ready & flip it to red when you have enough meat on your plate or need a break!  The meat is always seasoned perfectly. There's workers who walk around with meat on a stick that come fresh off the grill. They ask how well you like your meat cooked & they slice is right off for you tableside. They also bring you sides which include mashed potatoes, fried polenta & fried bananas. Also, their bread is to die for. It's nice and crispy on the outside and nice and chewy, soft, cheesy & buttery on the inside. They literally just melt in your mouth. Very addicting!   They also offer a few other dishes if you're not big on the red meats or don't want the full churrascaria experience. You can also just dine here for the salad bar alone as well.   During their lunch service, it is slightly cheaper than dinner & they serve a most of the same cut of meat during lunch that they serve during dinner. Service was very quick here in the beginning as we sat down. After about 15 minutes, service started to slow down. Which was weird because the restaurant was only about 20% full at the time.

TdYl7Z7-alonA8imy9f5yw.text: We have been to several Brazilian steakhouses. This was our first time to this location. THE Fdc was in downtown Chicago and it was amazing. . The second best was Indianapolis.          The service was very good here ... the polenta sticks and cheese rolls were good. Unfortunately the meat was the worst of the 4 Fogo de chaos. Kept asking for medium and getting rare ... alot was fatty or tough. Very disappointed for the cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

D1NMGMWDJmY3L2EnoQeaTQ.text: Food is okay. 1 Star for service, it was the slowest and most frustrating service I've ever experienced. They were good about refilling drinks but it went downhill from there. The salad bar never was full of all the items. All the meats we requested were never delivered and additional sides were never brought. We got our rolls 3/4 of the way through the meal. We waited AN HOUR (if not more) to pay the check, other tables around us were waiting as well.

-zi6W_Jx1qtQjjFsGW2EDQ.text: Great spot with exceptional service. We went for lunch and were not disappointed. We had several servers wait on us constantly and we felt that we were very well looked after. Take it easy on the salad bar it is very good but the meat they bring is even better.

1jyYg8ervffPH5i1obwS0A.text: Food is super good   Service is way better  Over the top   I must say this has the best service out of all restaurants I ever ate at in Arizona by far  Staff and management 5 stars alone   Choices of meats are very good at this location also

Il0yQf2Z-rq613hiF6gMbQ.text: I have been 4 times in this location for lunch.   Loved everything but the Chicken. Chicken always tastes old.   My favorite is Garlic beef.

4CF4VHl4KDi77m3KHg409w.text: Great meat, plenty of options at the salad bar, but not enough side choices. Service was very spotty, you either had 5 men surrounding you with meat on sticks or you couldn't even get water because no one is around. I don't even know who our waiter was because they never came back after getting our drink orders. Meat is cooked to preference which is amazing! I'll come back just for the experience, not the service.

X4AmoDWNa3nuUFX1TUVAfw.text: We had a reservation and still had to wait 20 mins. The food was ok. Chicken was dry. Most of the meats were ok. Service was good.

LVdllc0EEiANTJbcTzl1yQ.text: To start, definitely a nice restaurant. All the staff work together here to make sure your you have all your needs meet. The food is simply amazing. I had about 4 Filets. All very good. Be prepared to spend over $100 on your bill, but well worth the amount of food you get.

EsA5Tx-cCSChixjx5wEb8A.text: Where to I begin, small things that could be forgiven just added up.  Not to mention the MALE employee in the woman's restroom, not OK.  He clearly knew he shouldn't be there and when I told the hostess she didn't care.  I was so annoyed with everything else I just left.  As for the rest, restaurant wasn't ready at opening, it happens.  then waiter rushes us, took our menus before we touched them.  I get the concept but I wanted to look at selections, prices, drinks!  Nope!  The food I had was good but didn't get to try many of the options.  Then at the end we sat there with cleared plates forever, no server, no check.  Finally a server came back, no check in hand to leave again and take even longer to bring it back.  that is when I left and had the bathroom incident while my husband stayed to pay (we met and took two cars)  I stopped at a pharmacy with a line and still beat him home by about 20 minutes and that was just to pay, not counting the other waits for this check.  Overall not worth the price, rather go to a good steakhouse pay a little more and get good service and no males in the bathroom.  If it was coed then that is fine but it wasn't and he clearly knew he shouldn't be in there, just odd.    Never again.

PzNNKOzGBlJqcYMtwZGx3Q.text: The staff is very friendly, the salad bar is great.  The meat is terrible.  Everything we got was overcooked except for the lamb chops which were raw.  We were talked out of the restaurant week menu because it did not include "their best cuts like rib-eye".  Those were also incinerated.  Very pricey for excessive quantities of bad meat.

1qEUKi3MqnJj4lGbtIFg7w.text: Very elegant, clean & sharp- looking restaurant with a wide selection of meet and salad bar. Very nice food, very! The only thing that i don't like about this place is that is so cold! Enjoy the meal, but don't forget the sweater! Lol!

j9fiE0CS2RXVd4Bnh2JnZg.text: Such a disappointment to the chain.  We came here expecting the same atmosphere, food and service as the Portland, OR location, and boy were we wrong!  The only redeeming factor at this location is the food, the food alone is great, it's just a shame it was served in this location... by these people...  Largely ignored by all staff and constantly had to flag people down, which becomes fairly annoying when the whole thing is that people are supposed to come to your table with food. We were basically paying for the privilege for begging passer-by's for food.

gLvc8ceqLGFjfcBCPd0IXQ.text: The food here is really good. I would recommend going here but make sure you go with a group and try to arrive early if you want to go during lunch or dinner services.

E4ZbpWYl_9w2zpYEdseMzg.text: took my wife and daughter her during spring training. both their first time being here. If you love meats you will love this place. make sure to come with a coupon. you will need it. We dont eat any of the salad bar, dont want to fill up on that crap. wait for the meat. sometimes you have to request the good meats or sometimes those come out last.. be patient.  not all the servers are the friendliest.

R2suP4hVywfkCyd3pmCtHw.text: My hubby and I were celebrating our anniversary so we decided to try this place. The only time we will ever try it. I was disappointed in their selection of meat. Wait they didn't have a great selection. I was upset they didn't have the grilled pineapple. The restaurant give u no space to walk to the cold bar. I think I hit someone's chair every time. The staff was friendly and that's probably the only reason for the 2 stars. Sorry Fogo de Chao it's gonna end up being Rodizio Grill for the win!

AwdQucasq-BBg2EprfM1Pw.text: Dropped off friends for an anniversary dinner and their take was the service was good, dinner was fair albeit overpriced. Management needs to get a handle on the (empty) "limo" drivers blocking the portico entrance. After my friends got out, I realized I couldn't drive past to exit the lot. Big guy driver comes to my car and says I can leave the way I came in I.E. in reverse. Friends wound up calling for a Lyft ride home and had to walk into the parking lot to meet her.

QoSgNKOjvQp5S45pqt3ioQ.text: This probably goes without saying but you had better come here hungry, because you are not going to be able to eat as much as you'd like. It's all you can eat but not like some cheap buffet, they are bringing you prime cuts of meat faster than you can eat it. They also have a salad bar that is the Tom Brady of salad bars with prosciutto, bacon, asparagus and more. It's not cheap but definitely an experience worth checking out. You should probably also take an Uber, not because you will be drunk, but because you are going to eat so much that driving properly will be difficult...

AE5i3rMa1aakzr7Rph6OXw.text: We came in for lunch on a Saturday around noon and got to experience the brunch churrasco. There were a few additions to the market table area for brunch: waffles, bacon, breakfast potatoes, and what looked like an omelette station.   They have an extensive drink menu with many wines available should you be interested. Once we were seated the service was spot on; we had several servers check in on us throughout the meal to bring us drinks, switch out our plates, and deliver hot sides.  For those that may be new to the experience, you can make unlimited trips to the market table which has a large variety of veggies, fruit, cheese, smoked salmon, potato salad, apple salad, etc. You can also order unlimited hot sides which were mashed potatoes, caramelized banana, cheese bread and polenta. Then, various cuts of meat are walked around and if your indicator is on green, you can choose to indulge in some. You can flip your indicator to red when you want to take a break from meat.   Overall we really enjoyed our meal. While it is a little pricey, it's a fun experience for a special occasion and you definitely walk out stuffed! Some of our favorites were the signature cut, the filet, and the bacon wrapped steak. They definitely will have more cuts for the dinner crowd but we were still happy with the selection we saw during our lunch.

asbk4224EI6mAD7DMKeHlQ.text: This was one of the best lunches I can remember! We opted for the Market Table only. Do not regret it. Started with the usual greens, asparagus, beautiful olives, cheeses. Next came the hot side table. Cup of delicious ginger and squash soup. Very refreshing. Then a bowl of rice with the Brazilian stew on top, and a few slices of outrageous crispy Sweet bacon. For desert, helped myself to some fresh papaya slices, pineapple, bits of cheeses, fig jam and prosciutto. The really nice servers kept us supplied with fried polenta and bananas. The floor mgr David checked on us, they really gave first class treatment for a couple of old dudes from Chandler! A truly wonderful meal for $ 25 tax and tip inc. We might be back next week!

scqVVeaYrOpl7bquK_--3w.text: If you are hungry and you are a meat eater then this is the spot for you. I normally wouldn't go to something like this because I'm much more of a steak connoisseur but I have to say I was pretty impressed with the service and the stake and the other various cuts of meat were surprisingly good.   I went along with a group of friends who had never been to this place and the service was excellent from start to finish. We had so many different cuts of meat that it was making my head spin or maybe it was just the wine. In either case I had a great time and will be coming back whenever I get the chance.

7Da3_wKQmTP7msVNicAzcA.text: Had a pretty bomb ass beef rib at fogo last night! Then we ordered another! Tricks of the trade sitting at the bar is so worth it. The entire bar staff were awesome and really made the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7Dw1gg-13OxnNVjBZCQhdQ.text: I have this place another shot since it was my birthday and my husband and I were craving some steak and yummy bites, it was a hit! We had to make a reservation since it was Friday night and jam packed once we got there.. everything was soo good!! The steak was so tender and juicy! I'm very happy that I've chosen to come back(:

jgCjhChn81NXeWeQK67cbQ.text: Brought my brother here for his birthday and had my first lunch experience! I am an all-out meatatarian so Fogo is my all time favorite restaurant. Food/meat was absolutely fantastic, cooked to perfection and of course the buzzing staff were always asking if there was anything particular we desired. I have to preface that I'm from MN so was a little taken back at the salad bar at this location -- they didn't have the apple salad that I love but it could be a regional thing. Just like how this location offered grilled pineapple which isn't a thing in our Minneapolis location so that was neat. Only sad part keeping me from five stars is the selection of meats wasn't as broad and they kept bringing out the same 4 things but that may have been cause it was lunch but I expected the same full menu as that's what was presented and paid for.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EahKVJCw-H5aYKnyo2w-hQ.text: I have been to this place 3 times now. First time was 10 yrs ago, 4-5 years ago, then last week. I have noticed the quality has gone down tremendously. It is $55 per person. I made the decision to rec' my aunt to go here instead of Mastro since it is a unique experience and she has never tried it before. I warned her in advance the steak quality is not anywhere close to Mastro.  Anyway, the steak was so chewy. It was like eating rubber. I am in school so I got steak from Wal-mart before, and this steak was worse than Wal-mart steak. The chicken was like eating straight up salt. The papaya ice cream had very little papaya flavor. The sausage was so dry. Overall, it was  not worth the $55. We wish we should have gone to Mastro instead.

XWowVIch5WHkeLLMIikRWQ.text: Met one of my gal pals here for lunch the other day armed with a gift card that said it was for "one lunch."   I showed the gift card to Ken, who happened to be the first server for our table.   I asked him what all I could order off the lunch menu since I didn't want to be surprised by ordering something and then finding out later, when the bill arrived, that whatever I ordered was not covered with said card.   He assured me that everything on the lunch menu was covered.   (more about that later!)   With that pronouncement in mind, I waited for my friend to arrive.     Unless one orders from the "market table," the lunch menu is rather expensive.  I perused the menu.   I was not in the mood for beef so decided on the chilean sea bass lunch ($28 before tax and tip) and thought I'd like to have the jumbo shrimp cocktail, which comes with six shrimp ($21.50 sans tax and tip.)    She decided on the "market table."   It has the various greens for a salad plus an assortment of cheese and cold cuts.    I definitely was not in the mood for that either.  The sea bass was superb!  That is all I can say about that.   Cooked and flavored to absolute perfection.   The accompanying relish tasted like apricot and was perfect.  I was not impressed with the accompanying potatoes.   I believe they were fried sweet potato sticks and some other sort of potato.  The potato sticks were hard and I didn't like whatever the other potato was.  I forgot to mention cute little rolls are put on the table to eat as one deliberates what to order.   They were soft and buttery.  I am accompanying this review with a photo of what my friend got from the wagon.  Back to the use of the gift card.   Ken came back and apologized that the gift card was no good on what I ordered.   None of it.  WHAT???!!!   I reminded him that he told me it was.  I could tell that my friend was starting to feel uncomfortable.   Not wanting to make a scene, I paid the bill, and we left.   I decided I'd take care of this little problem later.  Later that day I called and asked to talk to the manager.   Rodrigo came on the line and I explained what had happened.   I returned that evening and he credited me for the fish, but said the shrimp didn't count as lunch, even though it is not under a section labeled "appetizer."   I figured what the heck and went with it.  I am glad this little mishap was taken care of.   I do like the restaurant, and have been here a number of times.  Even when I returned that evening, Spencer, the bartender, called out to me to say "HI!" and said he had not seen me for a while.   True, I said, but that I would be back.  I would be remiss to not mention all of the wait staff are friendly and professional.

2r3-I6PdqASUTi9srSavLQ.text: We love this place. We have visited here several times. I love the pineapple martini. Sooo good.   The salad bar has every single item you could possibly want and more. The drinks and options for wine are always amazing.   However, for the main event, the endless options of Brazilian style bbq. Yessss!!  They will bring it to your table until you flip that green card to red letting them know you are done for. LoL   I don't think there was one item that we didn't like. Then again, I wouldn't be able to try everything either. So much food.   You have to try it and come on a very very yummy.

Ghec2hN9gzyh9Y9JOEs1QQ.text: My buddy suggested Fogo de Chao for restaurant week a couple of years ago.  I had never been and found it to be a fun dining experience for a reasonable price.  When I saw they had the same deal for restaurant week this year, I decided to pay it forward and mentioned to another buddy who I know has never been to Fogo de Chao.    Once seated,our server mentioned RW and then said but you don't get the premium meats.  For only $10 more you can have rack of lamb, and filet mignon just to name a few.  The card on the table identified you as getting the special cuts.  When I mentioned that last time I came for RW it wasn't that way the server said "cutbacks".    So of course we pay the $10 and flipped our cards to green.  Turns out we got the same food as everyone else.  They didn't bring out any lamb or filet.  When we inquired they "rushed" out some lamb.  That took over 30 minutes.  Then we asked for filet.  More than 30 minutes passed until we asked again.   In no time, some barely cooked filet made it to our table.    I think if I would have just stuck with the regular RW deal I would have probably enjoyed it more but knowing I paid extra for the same meal was a bit of a rip off - even if 2 lamb chops and a small piece of filet finally made it to my table.

cO6_ulZ1h352IfwV5tBbig.text: I give this restaurant zero stars. This was my first time going there. When seated out sever spoke so softly that I couldn't understand her. She automatically assumed we wanted everything among that she pushed for us to do bottles of water and wine. When going there I heard it was great. Not the case we got treated as if we shouldn't be there. No one checked on us to see if we need anything nor did they ask my boyfriend if he would Like another cocktail. They had a promotional deal going but they didn't even speak of it to us they just automatically top seller as if nothing else we could do. Overwhelmed and treated poorly. I will NEVER go back nor will I recommend this to anyone!!!

OFGJ8ZF4cabbDdfLDDIR_A.text: This is the worst anniversary dinner I've ever had! It was so disappointing because last night was supposed to be special and it wasn't.   My bf made a dinner reservation for our anniversary at 7:30 pm Friday evening January 4th. I was so excited because we love fogo de chao. We go here every year for our anniversary.   Well last night didn't go so well. We were seated in a small table by the wall. I asked if we can have a better table since it was small and cluttered around other people. There was no room for us to move around and enjoy dinner if we stayed there. So we were seated at another spot but this time it was around 2 big party groups. I gave up and just said okay that's fine whatever.  We sat down and I ordered a glass of wine. Ate and waited for people to give me different type of steaks, meats, etc. Server checked on us about four times only the whole time we were there. I asked for the fried bananas like three times and they never came through until our original server who gave me wine finally gave me some.   To end the night we waited 15 minutes for them to come to our table and ask for the check since we were done eating. I was angry and annoyed. I told my bf this is the worst anniversary dinner ever. Service is just horrible. I couldn't enjoy my dinner or evening because of it.  Finally a different server asked if we were celebrating tonight for a special occasion. I said yes its our anniversary . He said he would bring a cake out on them. I thought it would be cake like we had previous years which was the cheesecake that said happy anniversary and it always looks presentable. Well this year he gave us a cake that looked like the last piece that no one wanted. It was tres leches and ugh! I did not enjoy that.    If I knew the service would be bad last night, I would not have bothered coming back here. I don't know what happened but, usually they have great service every year we come by. Time to move on and look for another place to celebrate my anniversary. I hate crappy service!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My anniversary cake last year 2018
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My anniversary cake last night 2019. Disappointing.

Q2XT9ZigoRDHRngdWay59A.text: Experience a superior selection of Brazilian meat brought straight to your table when you wish, you only need turn over your Red and Green marker when hungry... then sit back and be crowded by a selection of meat brought over to you by their Leather loin cladded servers.    Fogo has fast become a favourite of ours as we can always find a huge selection of food that can easily accommodate our dietary needs and by no means be considered settling.   Their salad bar experience is a wonderland of everything from plain roasted vegetables, smoked salmon with huge caper-berries, prosciutto straight off the bone, kale salads, cheese board, meat selection and fruit.  The market bar alone is just worth coming for.   On one of our recent visits we were expertly taking care of by Christopher who was able to navigate around both our dietary restrictions, he was really attentive to us and made the experience extra special.    We will be back as soon as we have room!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GMqrNfc5AwzLz6xoXZp5FA.text: We came earlier this week for my son's birthday. Service was excellent all the way through, although the staff didn't communicate well with each other properly identifying which person's birthday it was. Not a big deal though. The salad/Cold bar was well stocked and everything was delicious. The meats were also well seasoned and they did a good job ensuring that we never had to wait for more cuts when desired. My only knock, and a minor one at that, was how long it took for them to clear are used plates. Overall, it was a good value for what we paid.

s_95hpQxQtMXRJ2zWsr7nQ.text: The steak here was really good. They had a wide variety of meats. The salad bar was nothing spectacular. Price was much higher than other Brazilian steakhouse

rvVByWftmNTbSP6X2BK9Tg.text: Saturday night. Made reservation. my granddaughter and fiance took me there to celebrate their birthdays.  My first time their second. Omg what a pleasant fun experience!  Dress code was down to shorts and sandals to dress up. No one out of place. ALL staff was friendly helpful and the place was packed. The meats came around by at least 10 Brazilian waiters who sliced off meats of all varieties just the way you like it. Out server Gabriel was exceptional. Special Thank you Gabriel and staff for the superb dining experience. It was one of the most impressive experiences I've had while dining and I mean dining not eating. Have to give a special shout out to David Amador for his complete customer service hospitality along with the tres leches bday cakes.  Thank you what a wonderful staff all of them.  Good luck with your studies Gabriel. See you soo.  The Salsa Lady of San Tan Valley

f_O7rLkLe36ZYwJjzvWzyA.text: Best place family enjoys the variety and the drinks service is amazing.  Clean, valet parking

DxG96aqLB3ywYZE3Pm6V1Q.text: I just have to say awesome experience I've ever had! Place is amazing and the food to die for ! Tried as many different cuts of meat and ever single piece of meat was delicious. But my eyes were bigger than my stomach.  I would really recommend this place to friends and family!!! Thank you for the experience!

nX1Gmsh2Uf98lWW89ibhMA.text: In the event that you have been to any Fogo de Chao previously, you can safely anticipate the same from any of these chains. I adore the idea and the eatery chain.   I will put together my review with respect to the other Fogo De Chaos encounters I had. I am deducting one star for service and absence of food choices. It took everlastingly to get a refill. The server wasn't attentive in any way. We were just offered five sorts of meats consistently with no other options.

NaSGKwoCLcIQg2hbdYQAkQ.text: Compliments to Ana and to customer service leader Norma for absolutely exceptional customer service. 5 stars for attention to detail and care for customers!  Food was superb.

YwPV7J2fFrRLrmvWjwx5yw.text: Food was great, except for the desert.  We shared the tres leches and didn't care for it.  Bacon wrapped filet and chicken were great, sausage is awesome as well.

HXk8zVOtpnV8v6YJv6eWkA.text: Tending not to like overly meaty flavor, I often try to avoid Brazilian restaurants. For some reason, I end up at one roughly once a year.   I have to say, this one was better than the others I've been to. the meat, in many instances, was far more tender than I am used to having. The linguica was much less greasy than I've had elsewhere as well. They also knew how to cook a chicken breast and didn't dry it out like all the rest. They also take requests if you want something you haven't seen come by recently.  Their salad bar was also quite good.   They also make a very good caipirinha. If you happen to go and want to try it, just mention it as the Brazilian drink with the name you can't pronounce. They'll know.   The service was also ridiculously efficient and nice. The only drawback is we kept sending the fried banana away and noticing this, someone else would bring over more banana. The mashed potato side was a nice idea, but the mash was really runny.   The only real drawback is the price is really steep. At least it won't feel like a waste, however.

xC6ZroNkJtU9jz1iK6jHZg.text: This has to be one of the most fun eating experiences I have had in a while.  If you have not gone, you must try it.  Definetly different then regular dining experiences.  I am just happy I didin't feel like the ladies in the movie Bridesmaid afterward.

JIip6jPbMCiGMa7gVJg0lg.text: This is the mecca of meat lovers, my husband's "happy place", and the only place he will NEVER turn down even when he's beefed out!  With about 12 different meat options and a salad bar you better come hungry and take your time enjoying all the options before you fall quickly into a food trance. Sure its a bit pricey at $50 per person, but considering the quality of the meat is top notch and the huge all you can eat selection it's well worth it every once in a while! They have everything from filet mignon, to top and bottom sirloin, and my favorite, the lamb chops. Finger licking good! The salad bar is rather small compared to others I'm accustomed to, but the chicken and apple salad is memorable, as is the asparagus (which are BIG). Your meal is accompanied by mashed potatoes, plantains and polenta. These aren't anything to brag about, but who comes here to load up on carbs when you have all the meat to chose from. They also have a big wine room with a great selection.  I love that this is a Brazilian churrascaria that aims to look and serve authentic. The servers actually dress in authentic gaucho attire and most actually speak Portuguese! Last churrascaria I went to had caucasian servers who didn't speak a word of Portuguese or Spanish. Big points to Fogo de Chao! Like Sarah M. mentioned, the servers are always accessible but not overbearing. They give you a small discs at the start of the meal - green lets servers know to bring on the meat and red lets them know to move onto the next table. So you can always enjoy your meal at your own pace without feeling overwhelmed.  I love it!

-6wmv_a0wyzP0yN8cANhhw.text: Holy moly.  I had lunch there today.  I'm still full.  Guys dressed as gauchos come around with skewers of beef chicken and sausage... Oh and lamb.   It's a carnivorous delight. Basically all you can eat for 26 dollars so if you go, go hungry and plan to pace yourself and stay awhile. Atmosphere and service were good, dark woods, tall ceilings, crisp white linens.  Friendly and inviting staff works as a team in the table service. The gaucho outfits gave me a chuckle but to each their own the beef is good the lamb was superb and there is a salad bar ( that is also all you can handle at lunch) which was well stocked and included three different types of cheese.   No draft beer, but I did try the Brazilian black beer and it was tasty. Enjoy.   If you are a carnivore or omnivore and you like yourself... Eat here once before you shrug off this mortal coil... Or however Shakespeare said that.  ( always was better at math than English)

87VavPHkcZNm_W4egzyBdw.text: The whole Fogo de Chao experience is really unique, fun, and delicious. They have a fresh and tasty buffet style salad bar with items such as, pasta salads, asparagus, fresh bread, fruit, and all sorts of side items. The variety of meat is phenomenal with chicken, filet mignons, rib eyes, etc. Wow! Is this place good. I highly recommend for small groups,  big parties, whoever!

VYjeBJ2xVwGu4zPeGKZbNw.text: Went here for Mother's Day...meal was fantastic...a beef lovers dream come True!  the salad bar was nice, too.  Bartender was exceptional...everything was going great until we went for a trip to the salad bar and  almost tripped over someone with his BARE feet out in the aisle.  disgusting!  told the manager who did go over and tell the person to put his shoes on.  My complaint was with the manager's nonchalant attitude about it...as if everyone does that...no big deal.  I would give the restaurant another two stars but had to knock them down for the mgr's demeanor.

cK8LT9-_yvA2DNm1WAYp0A.text: Great Salad Bar, and never mind the nonsense about not eating from it to save room for the meat... Fogo's salad bar is a 9 out 10.

3DrdtC_aStT0vYS-bGflMQ.text: Service was friendly, food was good but arrived really late. I would still recommend this place because I loved the food.

muKsgqFtvICLFrbWNhJv5Q.text: New Years Eve at Fogo was great! This place is worth every penny! Its a bit expensive but its an event. You leave eating every animal on the farm (organic, sustainable) made to perfection.

94UO6dscV6iNwQ9zbAgu-Q.text: For a local Brazilian Steakhouse, it isnt bad.. Its definitely not Texas de Brasil, but its a nice place to go eat. The decor is great, staff was nice.

lZYVfuZZyLnt_UanEp1Xeg.text: I am giving this place a 5 stat rating because it is the best brazilian food restaurant I've been to in Arizona. First off they treat you like family and accommodate you in anyway. The atmosphere is for all types of people, either you are on a date or out for a family outing. I know the price is a little high but its all worth it because your table is never empty and your drinks are always full. The meat is cooked to perfection, the cheese breads are freshly baked, the sides are just as delightful. Now the desert is mouth watering  delicious, I had the creme bruelle and new york cheesecake with my husband. I would definitely go back and send others there. Enjoy I know I did.

MHV1cmEg_N_Oeq33sWIomA.text: I love Brazilian barbeque and this place did not disappoint. I've only been to one that I would consider better than this and the rest that I've been to were no where close to this. The quality of all of the different types of meat were amazing. The salad bar was also great. It's not a cheap meal, nor is it expensive in my opinion because of the quality of the meal. Definitely worth the money!

iR6UdapHVZqpBdTCSA-_fQ.text: yes, carnivores galore. sometimes compromising the lives of tasty animals is necessary.  here i consumed and exceeded my recommended caloric intake, and felt robust thanks be to incredible meat feast. fried, crispy polenta paired well with the succulent meats carved to your liking-- how do you like yours? in my case, medium rare please, or perhaps something that is still pumping blood onto the plate, delightful! fat marbling where it should be, juices trickling out of meat fibers, and the most enjoyable sensation of meat disintegrating in your mouth. YEAH, pretty great. everything receives a thumbs up, with the minor exception of birthday cake surprise dessert, which was...forgettable.   anyway... iron deficiency? no more! i was quite the satiated and proud meat-eater, despite that afterwards the animals took the rest of the week to become completely digested and absorbed.

HHFxrC-JtUFmkn46E2riyw.text: For the price and reputation, Scottsdale location can do a little better, service-wise

bv9QB742GwFD4-58YWT8gQ.text: I've been to Fogo many times in Phoenix and most of the time our experience has been really great. The food is amazing and the service is also nice. Don't forget to try the desert wine cart where you can get one of the best deals on sauternes in the Valley.  My only complaint comes from our experience on Valentine's Day where we did indeed have reservations and they were running more than 2 hours behind. Overall, i'd say a great bet for a meal in Phoenix - and certainly your best bet for any annoying friends that are still playing the Atkins diet card.

z45RUSPe2lFgP-W3JbSWvg.text: At Fogo de Chao you will get excellent meat, excellent salad options, and even some tasty side dishes if you so desire.  The wait service is prompt and excellent.  It is not every day that one needs to fill up on several pounds of succulent meat, but when you do, Fogo de Chao is the place to go.

OXlYLj8eEPf3r9h51y-Ivw.text: My wife and I dined here on 7/19.  What an excellent dining experience.  Started off with the salad bar which was very impressive on it's own.  I had to keep reminding myself not to indulge too much on all the salad bar offerings so that I could try as many meat selections as I could handle.  Once the green light was given, the meat started coming.  All the meat offerings that I tried were excellent except for one, which is the only reason Fogo didn't get five stars from me.  The chicken breast was very dry, although I am sure that this was the exception and not the rule.  The rest of the meal was delicious which more than made up for the chicken breast.  The sides were also excellent and didn't stop coming either.  The service was friendly and attentive but not overwhelming.  We were never left wanting for anything.  And price?  More than fair.  For two dinners, three mixed drinks, a desert and a Bailys coffee it was about $175 with 18% gratuity.  I'm looking forward to my next visit.

AtEYIkOr0wZaGcTCUsec4g.text: This place is amazing! If you live gourmet and love meats this is the place to be. They have waiters who come around and serve you different types of meats from pork, chicken, filet mignon...its all u can eat! Including sides and salad bar. They also have this desert you can eat that breaks down the meats. Awesome place and totally worth it! Just be sure to come hungry!

2vm5oDZcAb-OVLmQiBpyNg.text: This was my first trip to Fogo de Chao, and it met my expectations. I was a little nervous because the main idea behind the restaurant is basically "all the meat you can eat", and I don't typically eat very much meat. I also knew going in that it would be pretty spendy, and Fogo met that expectation as well. Don't expect a menu; you won't get one. Instead, you get a "guide" to the meat that will be delivered to your table via gaucho-wearing servers in blue embroidered button-downs (interesting combo, but hey- how else will you combine the traditional Brazilian concept with Scottsdale professionalism?). And the meat just keeps coming! Flip your coaster from red to green to signal the gauchos that you need meat. Need a break to breathe, stretch, unbutton? No problem! Flip the ol' coaster back to red and they leave you alone for a bit. The salad bar is a nice addition to a seriously protein-heavy (non?) menu. That definitely helped me, since I don't eat red meat on a regular basis; I was able to pace myself a little better by starting with the salad (fyi: mix the ranch dressing with the basil sauce. Amazing.). The restaurant space is HUGE and loud. It's very difficult to have a conversation, and when you have your green coaster showing, the gauchos are constantly visiting your table. We made a reservation because Fogo was crazy busy with spring training crowds in town. We arrived early, sat in the bar for almost an hour, and when I checked with the hostess, apparently they 'tried' to buzz us on the little flashy-thingy, but it didn't work, so they gave our table away! We did get seated almost immediately following that, and our drinks were comped, so it was taken care of very well. I'll be going back here, but probably in a year or so; it's really expensive and it's a TON of meat, but it was amazing food. Selections to try: the bacon-wrapped filet mignon was so moist and flavorful! Make sure you get some of the cheeses and prosciutto from the salad bar, and definitely mix the ranch and basil dressings- to die for!

5RF7HrR98UpN9UiPqizuZQ.text: We eat here pretty often and really enjoy it. Great for diners that are gluten free. Service & food is five star; see my "gluten free options" section for reason for the three star review.   For lunch you can do the market table (extensive salad bar w/ different meats, cheeses, fruits, veggies, etc.) for $15; you can add 8-10oz of various cuts of meat for $8-9 or so the whole experience for $32. So lots of options and great for everyone.   Service: Service is always great... one time a server did a mini wine tasting with three different Malbec wines for us to try before deciding on a glass. If you want a certain type of meat, don't be afraid to ask for it.   Food: The "market table" salad bar has a little bit of everything for everyone... lots of meats, cheeses, fruits, veggies of all sorts. The sides that come with the meats are excellent (my favorite is the Pao de quiejo --- naturally gluten free cheesy bread made with yuca flour!!) And, of course, there are the meats -- not much to say except they're all delicious. Rare lamb chops are my FAVORITE. If you're not big on really salty foods, I would suggest letting someone else take a piece of meat before you do so you don't get the brine... I never can eat an "outside piece" because it's much too salty for my taste but most people love that part the most.   Drinks: Good wine selection. Can't speak for anything else.   Gluten free options: all meats, all salad bar items that are actually on the salad bar EXCEPT SALAD DRESSING... not sure about the items that are on the second small table. I do just want to comment that although most servers are knowledgeable about the gluten free options, my server today was new and not sure so asked someone else and came back to tell us that "everything except the bread is gluten free"... I just wanted to double check and nope, the dressings are NOT... I remember reading something about it online so I looked and then asked another server just to see if something had changed since the post online and she came back and said that the dressings are not GF. This is the only reason that I am giving three stars because I eat GF due to a wheat allergy, not Celiac, so I could have had a minor reaction, however for somebody with Celiacs, this could have caused them to become severely ill. I understand that some places may not educate servers on the exact ingredients of things but if your menu says to ask about gluten free options, the servers should be well informed!! Before today, this would have been a five star review.

DR2QGZDgw3p9emkWZNCb3A.text: Great food and atmosphere. The meat never stopped coming.   Our waiter was having a bad day though. He wasn't the most attentive.  He kept forgetting things we've asked for. Aside from that, great place to go every now and them.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green means more meat, Red means I&#39;ve done!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xObEzDPE7Kqacc7j9F30Vg.text: I have been going to Fogo for more than 10 years and have always enjoyed my meal, until recently. The last 2 visits at the Scottsdale location have been sub-par. The salad bar is still good, however too many times they either did not have or ran out of smoked salmon. My last visit was on Christmas day. The web site said regular dinner prices, however, once at the restaurant they were charging more. The disappointment comes with the meat. Most selections were tough and dry. They did not have the baby lamb chops as usual and the overall quality of the meats has gone down. The service has also gone down. I never had to ask for the sides that automatically come with the meal. I've had to ask the last few times and they did not refill either the bread or bananas. I ended the meal with coffee and my coffee was not refilled. I had to wait and ask for a refill. I don't mind spending over a hundred dollars for a meal if it's good, but Fogo no longer fits that bill.

xGsiQnQD38duiPODw6T2Bg.text: Go here hungry. I got filled up so quick. I wanna go back to savor each meat they bring out. Definitely worth the money. Great experience.

yJ8ymSECVvW-Vuc5mXeRPQ.text: I went here on the basis of yelp recommendations.  Well, now I question the validity of yelp reviews!! seriously, $59.50 per person for your entre - do you know what that buys you at other fine dining establishments? my goodness and then to be herded in and out.... sorry but not for me. At 39.50, sure there is some value here.  1. They purposely do not bring the filet out to the end - why bring expensive meat when they can fill you up on sirloin or beans/rice? why do you think they serve you beans and rice? 2. The salad bar is awesome - but again the sole purpose is to fill you up so you skip the meat  this is nothing more than a eyeball experience, (yes, you have never seen this before) and  you cannot believe the number of possible meats (and by the way, if you know beef, you will clearly recognize the cuts and the order they bring them to your table).  Go order a nice M/R filet somewhere with a  glass of wine and enjoy. Easy to skip FDC unless you are in it for the eyeball experience. you will easy spend $100 per person for average food, compared  for an excellent meal somewhere else

pBT6mvzsyUOGG8eqMC7QRQ.text: I cannot begin to explain how amazing the food is here. I've been to places like this before, but always felt the supplemental bar lacks, but not here. Prime meats and cheese, olives, different salads, and the best zucchini I've had...and butternut squash soup is heavenly. The meats that comes around is a little too well done for my liking, but the did go back and get me some medium lamb chops on my request. I do think the apps and the drinks are overpriced, as they don't add much to the experience. Definitely recommend

NSIxQFeLmoSJkeriaeUQBw.text: There was no doubt where I was going to take J for his Father's Day dinner/lunch.  FOGO it was going to be!  I did however have a little hesitation on taking Baby C along with us.  Would they have high chairs?  Never saw any babies/toddlers there in our visits there.  Baby C can be a pretty messy eater, with a good portion of his food ending up on the floor.  And, while Baby C is pretty well behaved, he is now known to start testing his vocal cords out - chattering very loudly and screaming with excitement.  I was reassured when I made my reservations, that they did in fact have highchairs (30 in fact), not to worry about any mess Baby C would make, that there would be plenty of kids there, and it would be pretty loud.    Mother's Day and Father's Day - who leaves their kids with a babysitter anyway?!  I tell you what, I am glad I made a reservation for us and indicated we would need a high chair, because there was apparently a wait - On High Chairs!!    Our service was kinda so-so, but I attribute that to the fact that there were a TON of families there (we had a 2:30 reservation).  So many people in fact that I believe they ran out of meat, as we were waiting for quite a bit for a gaucho to come by wielding his sword of meat.   My favorite - The Lamb..hands down.  Baby C's favorite too!!

b9pBxo8DejSVfunFLYDvPw.text: Great service everytime! Food is great! Very accommodating even when i was still 1 hr late to my reservations!

gkh95KXDRyFyMubBzQsKPg.text: Why do I keep coming here? I never pass up an opportunity to eat at Fogo and it's usually dinner I eat here a couple times a month so I know the ins and outs of this place.  Today happens to be a lunch at Fogo day and as with other lunch times I've had here the service/food sucks. I swear it's annoying because they try to "hide" the tastiest (and prob most expensive) cuts like the beef ribs and the filet mignon. Like today, I asked for the beef ribs and not only did it take them 30 minutes to bring them, but they tasted like they were reheated hastily. The server didn't seem like he wanted to give me any of the good stuff, just the burnt inedible parts. Fail. I know my stuff here and asked another server to bring them back and he gave me better stuff, but that's beyond the point which is if you don't want people to get certain cuts, then just don't offer them! Part of the filet they gave me was burnt and inedible, the other part was good, but not the best. The atmosphere during lunch feels much different than during dinner, perhaps it's because dinner is busier, or perhaps because they've got fresh cuts at night and during lunch you get the left over crap. In any case, I'm going to stop referring this place altogether if they don't get their shit straight. Excuse my French but this gets annoying when you hype up the place to friends, then you take them and the experience sucks.

IR25NgtdF2ZIN_yC7slhiw.text: Obviously the unlimited meats are the draw, but for us tonight, the service was spot on.  Gilbert explained all of the options and the need to pace.  Once we were 'done', he went through the entire inventory to ensure we didn't miss anything.  He took the time to go and get us the bacon wrapped filets and bone in ribeye...quick, knowledgeable and friendly!  Thanks for the best steak and service in town.

dzzGLwSkHGP1JhIxM5YyfA.text: BE AWARE! HONOR MISTAKES ??????????  We visited Fogo De Chao in Scottsdale AZ on August 6, 2016. We had 3 adults, 1 kid and 3 drinks which is about a $218.00 dollars charge (total bill's around $180 plus tip). On August 9, 2016, I checked my bank statement and my credit card got charges $418.00 dollars. They overcharged me $200.00 dollars.  I called the manager attention to the overcharge and instead of apologizing, he told me how it had never happened that before. Then, it was said that the tip mistake.     Is it really a mistake?

Jh59oT1TdLzO_XPcfHzeRQ.text: Basically, unlimited steak. If you like steak, you will like this place.  One of the guys also took the time to show us around the wine room. It was pretty cool.

UMNd0U5exYKtItL_li_-Xg.text: Everyone I know recommended this restaurant for my birthday. First time there so I made reservations and I did let them know it was for a birthday.  I have to say the food was excellent but the service was very subpar. Ran out of water several times, had a waiter ask if this was our first time there, I explained yes and that he would return and explain everything and never did, but the worst part was my girlfriend was using crutches, we were ending our night, I went to the restroom and not one employee offered to open the door for her.  For the money charged for this restaurant, I do expect a gold star experience.

PqGDXop4Ca_iFBC5ddY8_Q.text: I'm so glad we came here for our romantic date night while in Arizona. The food was yummy and just got some one on one time with my guy.

cFD0A38Tajc1csKHUeGdfw.text: We went here Saturday night for dinner, it was very awful service and food.   The meat was disgusting, either too dry or too rare... Our server was wiping his forehead with tons of sweat everywhere. The veggies were practically frozen.   It was nasty, I would never recommend this place! I wish it would have been better for the price we paid!

_3GPeCg819ppaulNNsJaJg.text: The meats were delicious, the price was high, and the servers were not all that friendly. The taste of the cuts earned the place a 4 at least. But when your servers aren't happy to be there, or warm with the customers, I have to mark you down.   If you've never been to a brazillian steakhouse (churrascaria), they cook various meats Portugese BBQ style, and serve them to you tableside on huge skewers, with big knives! You use little tongs to grab the meat as they cut it, and away they go to the next table. You use an object, sometimes a wooden dowell, or here you use a table coaster to turn it to the green side when you'd like them to keep serving you meat, turn it to red when you want to take a break.   I enjoyed the sirloin, the lamb, the chicken legs, and the sausage. The salad bar is amazing, and the sides they bring you include cheese bread, friend plantains,whipped potatoes, and these little polenta sticks dusted with parmesean. I had a beer with dinner, and the molten lava cake for dessert.  About $75.00 for everything, and it was just me.

urH9z2Ac79ScpEgn-Ar_pA.text: Good Food.  Overpriced and lacking the service to justify the price. We went with a group for a surprise bday party in the back room.  The hostesses were clueless as to the previously arranged plan for the group to be seated by a certain time.  Even after explaining the situation to them; they could'n't make it happen.  Ultimately, the guest of honor walked in while the group was milling around in the bar area.  Sat at a table in the bar as we were waiting.  no wait person ever acknowledged us.  Went to the bar and ordered a beer and mixed drink.  The bar tender put the drinks down w/out cocktail napkins or  inquiring about   rather I would like the beer in a glass or wanted water, etc. At $16.00 per cocktail; they need to do better.  The salad bar was fresh and with several unique options.   Ultimately, once seated the food came.  the grilled meats were very good; but it was all delivered so fast (6 + different meats in 10 mins) it was a little hard to appreciate and savor any one meat. If all you can eat meat at significant expense is what you're looking for; this place will do. For me; overpriced food for the service.  I doubt I'll be back.

Z0DndZnIyjQg8XN-t2s4FA.text: Its a good place, overall i thought it was entirely too big compare to the one in Orlando, i felt you didnt get the romantic setting there because of the capacity of a lot of people in there, food was on point and valet service was great, I would stongly recommend if you are looking for that romantic setting, this isnt the place, Just way to big and i guess the only one in Arizona can have that effect..
