i4u3QPd07qnTqWdU9ZwlDg.text: The best food you can get in Scottsdale! It's amazing awesome food! It's worth the money, I understand it's a bit pricey but it is worth every penny. The best meat I've ever had in my life

sxD9Bww44f7htozq5c_tfg.text: I write this review with the disclaimer that I'm barely a carnivore.  I'm super picky about the meat I consume (mostly that it does not qualify as "weird") and am not very flesh-venturous.    The restaurant is beautifully appointed.  While we did not sit at the bar, it looks like a great place to enjoy a happy hour.  The dining area is large and open.  As we weaved our way around the tables to the "salad" bar, it had the feel of a large wedding venue.  The salad bar was extremely varied and nice deviation from the near constant processional of meat.  There was a small salad section but many other choices - fresh mozzarella, potato salad, olives and a number of other goodies.  The yucca bread and polenta fries were fabulous.      The drinks were tasty (they make a mean caipirinha) albeit overpriced (which is to say, Scottsdale-priced).    Desserts ranged from tasty to average.  The flan and tres leches cake were well received.  The cheesecake was tasty but could have come from Costco.    I noticed they had a location in Sao Paulo, Brazil so I mentioned to a friend that we had gone there.  He had been to the Brazil location and said it was the best churrascaria he'd ever had.    So, Fogo is definitely the real deal in terms of Brazilian steakhouses.  My gentle constitution protested the next day from about 3 weeks worth of meat consumption in a few mere hours, but as I said, I'm barely a carnivore.

PtiokCK3RVQ4lZy-WzLFuA.text: I've been coming to Fogo for several years and it's always a great experience especially when Norma is walking the floor checking up on things. She is always so attentive and is the epitome of excellent customer service. She is a sweetheart and always with smile. She always makes our experience that much better. Thank you Norma!!!

fchNdDzjfND7mlWWGZYk9Q.text: Wow!  That's all I can say.  Not sure what happened in the six months since our last visit, but the experience took a huge nosedive in terms of service and quality.  Granted, there was a 30-person private party in the back room, but there were also 40+ of us in the main dining room and we were absolutely starving.  Normally we are in and out in 1 hour.  This visit took 2.5 hours because the staff simply did not bring us food.   The food we did receive was either undercooked, or burnt to a crisp.  This was our first attendance at the new Saturday morning brunch, and it will definitely be our last!   To be honest, the quality and service has declined so much that we may never return to this location again!  PS:  when we returned home we became gravely ill and spent the next two days in misery.  Take that for what it is worth....

SzMSLls0SsCDFuRb-3hoBw.text: Fogo de BLAH!  What the heck happened to this place? Admittedly, I have never been a huge fan of this Fogo de Chao.  Since I am not a huge meat eater....I am the person this type of restaurant makes their money from.  However....in the past, at least the food and service were good.  Not so much tonight.  :-(  Our waiter was friendly enough ...but we had to ask repeatedly for menus, drink menus, side dishes (rice and beans), table service, etc.  When we inquired re: the possibility of taking home some scraps for our dog - the waiter sent the manager for a lengthy and unnecessary explanation about the potential abuse.  A simple "no" would have been adequate.  I get the concern - but, hey...how about this as a solution....let the waiter put your scraps in a bag for Fido.  No concern about heaping piles of meat being taken home, and less waste.  When we were leaving...we looked around for the super yummy mints in the lobby area. Hm...our favorite part of the night....not to be found??  We asked the gal at the front, who grudgingly (GRUDGINGLY!!) pulled out a plastic tray and gave us a couple mints.  When another member of our party asked for a mint or two, she said "oh, I thought you were with them."   WFT? For the cost of a couple of mints, this restaurant will mint-shame a party of four?  Wow, perhaps a course in customer service might be helpful.  Are a couple of mints really worth alienating a group that just dropped $400 for a few slices of meat?  Rumor has it Fugo de Chao may he having some financial difficulties.  Granted, the restaurant options in Scottsdale are galore.  SUGGESTION - poor customer survice is NOT the way to solve this problem.  I'm just glad I now have a legitimate reason to never give my money to this restaurant again.  For the same price, I can and eat a delicious steak at Mastro's, AND be treated as a valued customer.   After tonight, FDC has successfully alienated the members of my group who have championed this restaurant in the past.   Good riddance Fogo, you won't be missed.

QTbUp8-bwIE6cDn0yW0ELg.text: Been here in Houston, DC, and now Scottsdale. Good. Every. Time.  First, the pao de queijo is so good. Warm, soft, fluffy, slightly cheesy but not to heavy, I could eat them all night if I didn't have a lot of meat to devour later.  The sides, the bananas, fried polenta, mashed potatoes. I only ate the fried polenta, which is crispy deliciousness and not too salty, but my friends had the bananas and potatoes and liked those a lot.  Meat. Well, there's a lot. If it's your first time, I suggest you try A LITTLE BIT of everything to find out what you like, then just get those items. Considering it's more than 50$ a person, It's pretty much what you have to do to make it worthwhile. Since I've already done that, my go-tos are the lamb chops, leg of lamb, bacon wrapped filet mignon (probably only get 1-2, bacon, while delicious, tends to get heavy), and filet mignon. My husband really likes bottom sirloin too, which I'll also get if I'm in the mood.  The salad bar is also super awesome!! Which I would suggest eating at the end of your meal to make the most of your stomach space for the meat. There's this heart of something (forgot what it was) that looks kinda like a bamboo shoot (same color, shape) but it's not hollow. It's got a light sour taste to it (like artichoke hearts) and the outside texture is kinda like artichoke hearts, but the middle is almost creamy. If you like that flavor and texture, def try it. I have no idea what it is but I like it! Other than that, fruit's pretty good, they had prepared orange and grapefruit slices which is a huge plus if you've ever eating a grapefruit.  They also have a salad bar only option if you have vegetarian friends/family. I think that's about 30$ or so? Still a bit selection.  Service is good too! The meat handlers may feel a bit pushy, but don't hesitate to say no if you don't want what they're offering. There are also floor managers making sure that if there's ever a lull in your meat service that they get you what you want.  If you haven't been and have money, goooooo!!!!!

wTUslY3du9sogLPfKAt-UA.text: What better way to learn the anatomy of a cow than through eating it...rodizio style!  I've now been to 4 of the 19 US locations and I would say this one is right on par with the rest of them i've been to.  What do I love about Fogo de Chao?  The quality of meat is excellent compared to many of the other chains.  I consider Texas de Brazil the only competition when it comes to meat quality and flavor.  The service is always impeccable and you never have to wait long for gauchos to make their rounds.  I've also had multiple occasions where the gaucho serving the filet mignon gives generous portions, which quite frankly pays for the meal in itself!  The salad bar could be much improved in my opinion, but I hardly waste any time there so I won't waste my time complaining about it.  The scalloped potatoes are delicious, though...but carbs are AYCE killers!  Every table is served fried polenta, garlic mashed potatoes, caramelized bananas, and the famous cheese balls.  The cheese balls are doughnut hole sized pillows of cheesy doughy goodness, but again...carbs!    My dad and I love to save the bananas for our dessert.  Seriously though, give me one plate of those bananas, a scoop of Haagen Dazs vanilla ice cream,  and a bed to nap in after I enter my food coma and that's what heaven must be like!  My favorite cuts: -Filet Mignon...duh -Picanha, the house specialty -Ribeye -Top sirloin -Leg of lamb

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. If that&#39;s not heaven I don&#39;t know what is

fbivV8qkRJYqse8Ie9wMdw.text: okay, let me tell you about Fogo De Chao, this Brazilian Stakehouse is the best piece of meat I ever put in my mouth. OMG this place is beyond delicious. Me and my friends ate here for lunch on Monday 1/18 for my birthday. We were all amazed on how delicious the food was, they also have a great salad bar.  I dont know about everyone else, but i will defiantly be back to eat here at Fogo De Chao.  FYI: The host and staff were great and friendly.  also keep in mind they charge per bottle for coke products, my friend found that out when he got his bill for drinking 4 cokes lol....   Note*  1st time eating here, try out the lunch hour because it is decently price for about $30 a person, dinner goes about $50 a person, but it is worth ever dime for unlimited choices of meats that came around our table during the entire time we were there..  :-)

EzeFebkPsKVd1l2BYqrI7A.text: To celebrate my brothers recent promotion at work we decided to take him out for a nice dinner. Fogo was the first place my husband recommended. What man doesn't love steak!? This was my second time, my brothers and sister in laws first, and we couldn't have asked for a better experience.   The market bar was so tasty and the steak/sides were endless. The entire experience I would describe as pleasantly indulgent. My brother was impressed and grateful.   At Fogo everyone is your waiter. If you haven't been there before be sure to let them know so they may explain how it works. While the entire staff was great we cannot say enough about the exceptional service Steven provided. He typically works at the bar but stepped out to assist and we were lucky enough to get him!   Thank you Fogo and Steven for making the dinner so special!   My only regret - not taking any food pics! I guess I was just too mesmerized by the delicious food. ; )

UVKW2fXxkNWrPosKZ5aG7A.text: Took my boyfriend in for his first time, my third, and the staff and food never cease to amaze me! The staff took very good care of us, especially Rico. He told us it was his day off, but he was in for the shift. We never wanted for anything. Their food is mouthwatering and their drink selections are worldly. We will be faithful guests as long as they stay open.

TB7BsmMVREyDx6DqURNUyg.text: very much wanted to like this spot but it was underwhelming to say the least. first off the salad bar is nothing special, other Brazilian steakhouses I've been to really wow you with the salad bar. the selections were very plain and unexciting. Our waiter was good, checked in often and kept up up to date on drinks. We were excited for the selections of meat to come around but they were few and far between here is y breakdown  though.  garlic beef, small pieces that were significantly overcooked and very tough. the lamb was delicious. Filet was bland and rather tough. Prime sirloin ( house special) was fantastic, great flavor and very tender although it was doled out in really thin slices. Flank steak, they called bottom sirloin was very inconsistent ranged from charred and flavorless to , just ok.  The Ribeye was again unimpressive and mostly flavorless. The biggest criticism i have is the waiting for food. Unlike other BSHs I've been to you had to wait and often times ask for someone to come around with the cuts and much to my surprise several of the servers had no idea what rare vs medium was. All in all,  not really worth the time or money in my opinion

jk5raG34sZDeb-WvjY6UXw.text: I went here today for lunch. I have heard great things about fogo, for a Long time. The salad bar/buffet was really nice. Didn't eat much from there. But what I had was good. The coaster thing was different, kinda cool. Several of there meats where good...but not great. (I grill at home...ALOT) so I was a little disappointed. My favorite was the rib eye was my #1, then #2 was bacon wrapped filet, #3 was the chicken wings. I tried the lamb, beef rib, top sirloin, sausage. I am a meat lover, so... The ambiance was nice, I would go again. Oh yeah the Crum Brielle was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crim Brielle, very good.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tres leche, nice...
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Get the meat a little at a time, that way it will be hot.

qBoRrt_wLJSGWjTjtkSkow.text: Happiest place on earth. The food was out of this world, the stuff was very attentive and professional!

X5HjRho2Y9A-lmhoYn4hEQ.text: South Brazilian BBQ. Meat was perfectly cooked and the farmers market table was delicious.  Will definitely be back. Wine selection was good but a little overpriced.

Kh7LDed4Lb3mcbabtI0_iw.text: Our server was amazing, I think we could of been his only table (which some servers screw up not wanting to crowd but just end up not being around.)    The gauchos werent very friendly, but I guess theyre not supposed to be personable.   I was disappointed in the salad bar, not much there, everything is cold.  When your card is green and you just sit down its a bit overwelming... then it dies off and youre looking around, asking for specific things, I never did see the filet minion again.  Mashed potatoes were so boring. Bananas were good, but nothing special. Out of all the meats my favorite was the parm crusted pork (usually dont care for pork and am a huge steak eater) the steaks just didnt have any flavor. Some were really salty. Some things were dried out.   Overall, fun idea, fun with friends, great if your husband can eat a lot, get your moneys worth. But for me, it wasnt worth that amount for that quality. Id pay $50 for an amazing 5oz filet over this any day.

GQZcI4w9eOpwMJ1iEZlkoQ.text: Love this place! If you are a carnivore, then this place is for you. Julio was the best meat carver! He was extremely attentive, super friendly and goes above and beyond. . The server himself, the one serving the drinks, not so much. Our server was never around, always had to ask a meat carver to send him out. We went 10+ minutes a couple of times without a drink in front of us.  I would give this restaurant 5 stars if the server was better with checking in on us.  Oh and the cocktail prices are comparable to drinking in Manhattan.. Good drinks but be prepared for high prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ohh you know, gettin our unlimited filet and ribeye on

F83HShvQDLYAFDc8I_GrDA.text: So i went here with 4 friends from college- we sat at a round table and had a great time.   The service was excellent- the waiter gave us an option between restaurant week or normal selection and explained the difference and walked us through the whole process.   The salad bar has anything you could want- even trendy kale- but dont spend too much time there because you want to save it for the real stuff.   The meat kept rolling in every minute once we had our card flipped green- it was like heaven on earth.   The one complaint I have is that the filet was over cooked and slightly burnt- other than that it was a great time with friends   Id definitely recommend this place. 50 bucks gets you enough food for a week

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yes please

7ZpAHRB-kZ134_R1V00iJA.text: Wonderful experience all the way around.  The food was great and the service was unbelievable.  Every meat we tried was spectacular.  Don't miss this location.  The whole party had a blast.

5rcOT4_y7yAvTJ4jOCbMOQ.text: This was the best Fogo De Chao experience I have had. They were all terrific, but the team here really stood out. They were over the top accommodating and the food was beyond excellent!

2vbKoMbfJnvMoYpTGMgKYQ.text: Love it!!! Excellent steak, very good Bloody Mary drink, and really good some kind of  Brazilian lemonade.  Nice salad bar, can't wait to go back!!!

QhwSpM3KC3_Cu0SEhkHs8g.text: We had my sister's graduation dinner here and if you like meat, a top notch salad bar, and now even a stellar fish dish. Fogo de Chao won't disappoint. We had a huge party of people and they did a stellar job serving us. It's a place where it's all you can eat and you simply keep getting served until you flip over your card to red or pop from eating so much. The salad bar is one of the best ones I've seen. They had kale salad, pickled tomatoes, a couple good cheeses, and the whole assortment. A vegetarian will not have any issues with finding something to eat even if it is a Brazilian steakhouse.  They also have good desserts and beverages as well as a good dessert drink menu. If you're there to eat meat, only eat a small bit of salad or none at all. They serve a delicious bread before and during, as well a few sides that come out with the meat. Mashed potatoes, fried corn bread type things, and fried plantains. We had a great experience, the servers were attentive and took care of us well.

i05JnTHnwKUhWDwFis7GZQ.text: Best food around! Not to mention the service!!! Norma was legit, the best waitress that's served me. Being from out of town, I highly recommend this to anyone in the area wanting to try something new!!! Make sure you give yourself a solid hour to spend here, trust me, you'll need it!!!

RIqceg3aMuAO8QDmo23-cQ.text: My experience here was great ! We had a reservation for 7pm and as soon as we sat down ,our server (one of many ) explained how it works. I loved the turn around cards .This is within minutes of getting there . The price is pricey but for the convenience of not waiting 45 mins to longer  to wait for your food like in a regular restaurant and amazing flavor in food . Well priced I'd say . I will return very soon again . I love the variety of meats and restaurants was beautiful inside and out.

l2JXi4chznoDCv5QEHJ7KA.text: They are lucky to get 2 stars from me.  Not sure why this place has such stellar reviews. I'll keep it simple.  1. No refills on drinks the entire dinner. 2. Only beef was good. Chicken, pork, riblets, and lamb were all dry as a bone. 3. The salad bar left a lot to be desired in my opinion. They had some good, unique choices and displays, but they should also offer traditional salad options.   We spent $50 each, had a reservation at 6pm and left at 645pm. That says something. You are much better off going to a real steakhouse like Mastro's City Hall or Ruth's Chris. At least their meats are worth the price.

ygH67KRiJaiahbah7ARKPQ.text: The staff here is excellent.    If there is anything you want you just have to ask.  Drew is awesome!!  He went way above and beyond to take care of us.

MW57BH9ZPHqwmfGrqFSNjA.text: Ok. It all started when the person I spoke with said that reservations are not needed up until 8 pm. I said okay. My wife and I are the only ones coming. Granted we have been here 10 plus times. We arrive at 630. The hostess says there's a 45 wait. I explain our previous conversation. With hesitation she agrees to seat us right away. So my wife and I are seated in the far back corner where no one can really see us and meet our dining needs. When it's time for the meats to go around we were not offered some of the meats that are on the menu. So we make a request to our server Gilbert, who by the way was okay., We continued to wait for upwards of 20 minutes to get the pincane cut. I mentioned it to three different waiters. Then after it was all said and done the cut that was brought out was dry. Remember we have been here ten plus times.  Then came the check. I had to ask to pay. Then the server took my card and disappeared for about 20 more minutes. I was close to coming up to the hostess booth to get my card.  Every new years eve we bring about 20 people with us. If you don't want my business or my money please say so. Tonight's meal wasn't worth the $114.00 I spent. The service was terrible ..food good..service not so much. Please contact me with a solution as soon as possible. Thank you.

__-41beDon1eK4tOeJQ4RQ.text: I only went because I had a gift certificate. The restaurant was so bright that I felt like I was in a high school cafeteria. Service was good. Food was ok. Drinks were outrageous. $17 for a cocktail? Where are we, Vegas? Basically, I felt like I was at a theme park restaurant on the Vegas strip. Won't ever be going back.

7eAWgHfp8XLI43Nc9V5zSQ.text: I've been to Fogo De Chao probably 5 or 6 times now, and this experience was probably the worst.  You know what they say...you usually don't write good reviews all the time, but when you experience a bad one, you'll surely write one.  This is the case last night.  The times we do go, its usually on a Friday or Saturday night, but this time we went on a Thursday night.  The food was great as usual, but the service was god awful.  It was extremely slow.  So everyone knows their concept, you drop 60 bucks for all you can eat meat and their salad bar.  They have guy walking around with meats and they stop by your table, well on this night it seemed our table was completely invisible  to them.  So we arrived in a pretty big group, there were about 15 of us.  We arrived at 6:00 PM and started eating at 6:15.  From 6:15 to 6:45 only one "guacho" came to our table.  We addressed it with our waiter who was extremely friendly and helpful, but she really couldn't do much.  When she finally did tell them, they would come to our table and offer meat to couple of people, then walk away.  We were to the point where we were trying to flag people down!  The gaucho's with chicken and pork stopped by out table frequently, but I didn't pay 60.00 bucks for chicken, I wanted the red meat!  Overall, extremely disappointing experience for sure.  It got to the point where, I wasn't even full or satisfied, but just gave up on flagging those jokers down and flipped the card to red.  Matay.  I give up.  Maybe it was just a weekend, understaff or whatever, but it was truly a disappointing night and the service was pathetic.

RQFXj6XtkgYbDBo9yyYpLQ.text: This was a ruined anniversary for us. The positive : servers were all great, salads were diverse, and tasty. Sides were adequate.  The negative: in a place where the star was supposed to be the meat it was mostly inedible. The garlic beef was mostly fat and gristle, chicken dry, bacon wrapped beef tough, never saw any lamb, ribs or filet.  I have NEVER complained about a restaurant while still there but today I could not contain my disappointment as this meal spoiled our special day.  Norma and Marco apologized profusely but it was too late to make up for the poor food served. We were not charged for the dinner and we were given a piece of cheese cake, but the damage was done. We will not return. It would be ridiculous to return and ruin another night out. I don't not get the great reviews!

TV9N13Kv3MAXmdy_-X_xJw.text: First I have to say the food is still amazing. My rating is due to extremely bad service we received tonight. It all started great, but once we turned our round things to green it went downhill. First I had to flag down a waiter to ask for sides. Apparently none of them thought to bring sides for the people with steak on their plates.  Once they started bringing different meats around one thing became very apparent- it was all sirloin and pork. So we had some and it was good, but we were looking forward to having some ribeye and filet mignon, so we said no to about 15 offers of more sirloin. At that point a waiter asked us if we were looking for a particular cut, yes, we said. He told us he would send some our way and we never saw him again. No ribeye or filet mignon either. The situation repeated 2 more times, none of them came back to check on us. Trust me, I would have been perfectly happy if they at least told us it will be a few minutes or they are out of it. But nothing.... untill maybe 20-30 min later someone offered us the cuts.  I ate the plantains we had as one of the side dishes and were not offered any more ( they used to always refill them).  And the last straw was that the waitstaff was obvoisly avoiding eye contact and it took us a while to even get our check I have been to different locations of Fogo de Chao multiple times and always was extremely pleased with service as well as food. Me and my boyfriend were very excited about going to my favorite restaurant but left very disappointed. What happened? New ownership? Trying to save money and first offer cheaper cuts of meat? Why was the service so bad? Would love to hear from the restaurant representative please

N5FexssVef5Xt9FvgucnnQ.text: Fogo is always good in any of its nation wide locations. This time I was at Austin and took a client to lunch. Extremely awesome service, meat cooked to perfection. Not. I have can go wrong here.

mhNd6zJltAQZT3jhyvJndQ.text: I don't know how to write this review, because after all, I did ask my boyfriend if we could just move into this restaurant. So obviously, I liked it. Most meats were on the well done side, and I felt rushed picking out a glass of wine. Service was impeccable, and the food we were offered that was actually cooked well and warm was delicious. I understand it's gotta be tough to temp something everyone would like. Lighting was off, in my opinion. Felt more like a cafeteria than and upscale(ish) restaurant.   I begged and begged to come here because I have been to similar restaurants that blew me away, and while I enjoyed myself, I don't see me going out of the way to come here again.

CpjlbyT1cDS7krIkgESlWw.text: I've been waiting for years to go to this place that I have heard such great things about, because I'm a carnivore like no other. The Decour was nice, the salad bar was OK, but the meat was beyond subpar. The meat was not only over cooked but what they claim to be filet mignon tasted like it had the texture of round steak. The lamb chops were OK, but they were overcooked as well. Not a hint of pink was to be seen. I was greatly disappointed and would recommend Ruth Chris and spend a few extra bucks. The only reason why I'm giving this place more than one star is because the service was better than average.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PgxklxPW81AwTJh9LQVedw.text: Restaurant week so a little forgiving. Major slippage. First we were asked 4 times what we wanted to drink. Took over 20 minutes to come. Second drink took 25 after calling manager over. Even though we asked did not come over w filet or rib eye. Never brought dessert.  Salad bar terrific Bill was all screwed up. Upon sitting asked to be divided by two couples never saw that waitress again.  After corrected, bill had 4 drinks not 2 again corrected Place good for lunch.  In need of managerial organization

bEC3XPixt90gAQ2KyTo2Tw.text: Amazing service as usual. Though they were extremely busy with it being Restaurant Week and slashed dinner prices, everybody was attentive and created the Fogo Experience that can't be matched.

5XYolrYDfX6RpcnvMcMmCQ.text: Food was very good. Great salad bar. Overall good experience. Like open table reservation.. Three stars for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mold chocolate cake
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tres leches cake was amazing.

UytqXxkpNSN-g5bAAbbz1A.text: I was going to sit here and write a detailed review touching on a little of everything, but to sum it up...it's amazing and you're missing out if you haven't ever been.   Service is seriously unmatched..everyone in the building has a job and they are on it! You will wait on nothing, but meat to be sliced off on your plate. Before you can finish one slice another is surely on it's way....  If you've never been to a Brazilian steakhouse expect it to be busy and I assure you, you will return. It's an experience good for any occasion.  I appreciate that I can come in my t-shirt and jeans and not feel out of place eating an upscale meal. You can dress up if you'd like but you don't HAVE to and I appreciate that!   It's great for parties, families and business... I loveeee this place...but be advised your gonna spend some $$ here. Don't worry it's worth every penny..come hungry..verrry hungry!!!!

TdQBFRZRsjfwPGXeDW_I-g.text: A staple popular steakhouse from what I know.  This chain is more than popular everywhere you go.    They definitely have it down when it comes to serving up "Meat" of all sorts.  My favorite was the bottom sirloin and the second runner up was the rib eye.  Most of the meats were cooked to perfection and juicy while some were over cooked.  The chicken was definitely over cooked and dry.    They have a nice salad bar cause truthfully after a while you want some greens in your diet so much appreciated.  They had everything from kale to apple salads to freshen up your palate.    Overall, a nice sit down dining experience and afterwards I hope some of you are like me.  I felt like running it off! -Enjoy!

kzsqFu19sGSoDjSKYYSMng.text: Went this weekend with a party of 6. Valentine's day weekend so I expected a crowd. It was very hard to get the waiters to come by with meat. Probably had 3 different types of beef, the rest were chicken breasts, legs, lamb, and sausages. We paid $50 a person for meat not fillers. Never saw filet mignon or the other better cuts of beef. Definitely left disappointed. Also took 3 tries to get the check right. Last year we got a GC to come back, this time nothing was offered.

-ynOSYMCJY6X2S5v4kbALA.text: This is my favorite steakhouse. The food is outstanding and the service is wonderful. I look for any excuse to go there. Norma is amazing we met her our first time there and every time since, she always has a smile and so helpful. What a great staff! What a great place!

PPDgXFphy-Si4J_KfuB6xQ.text: I love everything about Fogo de Chao! An evening at a Brazilian steakhouse is an event. The atmosphere is relaxed, the decor is luxe, and the service is superb. Every part of the restaurant staff seems dedicated to your enjoyment.  Now for the food. I would come here for the salad bar and side dishes alone. Fresh, crisp greens; garden vegetables beautifully presented, an ever changing selection of cheeses and deli meats, olives. I could go on! The garlic mashed potatoes, fried bananas and polenta are delicious and served in the perfect amount.   What can I say about the meat? Cuts of beef familiar and novel, pork roast, lamb chops, pork and beef ribs all expertly cooked on swords around an open flame. Chicken and sausages roasted to perfection. I loved the top and bottom sirloin and the filet. I always have at least a piece of chicken and a sausage. I was too stuffed to try the lamb or beef ribs.  The dessert was just right. We had the flan, the creme brulee and the chocolate mousse cake.   Finally, the cocktails were perfect. I will always go to a Fogo de Chao when I can. If you've never been there, you owe to to yourself.

serwpjIaCHjOUvhGjyXi0w.text: This place was awe inspiring! My son and a group of friends went last night for a birthday celebration and we stopped by. The food was incredible! Nonstop meats kept coming to our table for the entire evening. Each one more delicious than the last. The decor was great, and so was the service. The best!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

t6QKkpKhE-Yb6Wi0n-faGA.text: The actual experience was better than expected.  And I expected a lot what with all the stories of endless meat.  The little rolls made of Yucca flour and cheese (I don't know what they are called) were incredibly tasty.  They are light yet somehow very satisfying.  There were too many cuts of meat to count, all of which were prepared very well in different temperatures so you can have your preference.  One of my favorites was the garlic beef.  Service and atmosphere were both excellent.  All the servers and "meat-men" were extremely friendly and well-polished.

ajncemfPoh8C2NY5V0J79A.text: We were there yesterday for dinner and let's just say it was an ok restaurant. Let me start with the salad bar, there was a small collection unlike the Brazilian restaurant we visited in Chicago (Texas de Brazil), as for the meat, the service were fast but the meat collection was small as well and test wise it was ok. For $50 meal I would prefer to go to a different restaurant with better quality and that what we are going to do next time.

ICxZLgXRpgSWfAkx5a26cA.text: Definitely a place for special occasions for most of us considering dinner costs close to $60 per person. This place is heaven. Highly suggest this place to impress a first date or to celebrate a birthday for that special someone. They serve countless delicious meats, and each and every employee stops to ask how you're doing. They also have a great selection at the salad and cold meats bar. I've been here 4 times and each time has been just as good as the last. Make sure to call in for a reservation, and dress nicely. I swear it looks like some diners here are athletes and models.

KOY45l88sh2FcfPu9LvEzQ.text: We celebrated our friend's birthday here tonight. Food was delicious as always and our waiter Jr., was excellent and kept the amazing bread coming. Norma was also very kind and sweet to us. We will be dining here again for sure.

OX-9yxa9yeWU399zQSs-yQ.text: So delicious.   Service is awesome and unique.   If you've never been to a Brazilian steakhouse, you're missing out.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wmczKN_H6lZhEqFsvvyzIA.text: This place is awesome - the service is always great, the food delicious, and the prices are very reasonable for upscale dining. I'm impressed every time I go and I always leave full. Favorite restaurant in the valley!

wUuAGQiBy1YWY8J6GYi_1Q.text: Food is awesome, Staff is friendly they start right away with the meat selections. Marco the assistant manager is the best. 10 stars

1-EmfhmIDCgosI1_h-pcmw.text: What a fun experience! We have been to the location in Portland OR and thought it would be fun to take the family we were visiting in AZ to a nice dinner here. It did not disappoint, great wine selections, and the food was delicious! Only comment was that there were several times that our coasters were on green and we weren't being served for long stretches. But that was minor, and we had a great time!

2wk7Bekotk6gSmxWopLPXQ.text: So we took an overnight to Phoenix we decided to try this place out Tuscanos is way better!  The salad bar was not that great service was super slow.  We asked 4 times for a milk for our little one.  And of course it was way overpriced and most of the meat was chewy or lacked little flavor.  Never again even if it were free

McsfTG15PKYbOqGXV8KGvg.text: Food was excellent, at least what was offered to us. What makes this only a 2 star review was the service. My husband, son, BFF & I went last night to celebrate my birthday. We were there from 6pm until 8pm and we only saw lamb chops once, half of the table was at the salad bar and never had a chance to have any. We never saw beef ribs, ribeye, or chicken breast. Beef filet made its was over one time, and we each were given a tiny sliver. The real disappointment was that since we were there celebrating my birthday, we indicated that on the reservation. My husband and my friend told 2 of the servers it was my birthday, and my 11 year old son went over and told the person at the host  stand also, and no one ever offered a birthday dessert until after the bill came and my friend made a stink about it. If you are coming here to celebrate something, don't. You can get a nicer meal and better service for a lot less. We were there for 2 hours, spent over $300 and were only offered half the items they tout on their website. Pretty disappointing. We won't be back.

pwHGl-MCtRCDVp6q1C_jXA.text: Pass on the salad bar even though it is amazing the meat is out of this world. Can't believe it took me this long (15yrs) to find this place. Can't wait to go back. Meats are tender and so many I could eat for days if I didn't get full ;).

vJlbXI5NNVnJ7ff-tiOX0A.text: The best meat I've ever ate! This place is full of delicious meats! The food itself is worthy of 5 stars! I give it 4 because the staff is 2 stars. We waited with no food on our plates for over 20 minutes. The waiters are walking around looking like they don't know where to go or who to serve. I was so disappointed because I was ready to eat and had little to eat during the day so we could tear it up. Yes, I will go there again and again because it really is mouth watering delicious, but hopefully, the staff gets their stuff together.

Bf_x8xnnNWkRbY843B0zJg.text: This is nothing like any other Fogo I have ever been to. Limited menu, unfortunate salad bar, service is the farthest thing from Brazilian... this place should be in Tempe or Chandler, not Scottsdale.

_7XLz1uKDIMbgVI8xZt2hg.text: We come here every nye and have a blast! It's a bit pricy but if you plan on eating until you can't move - this is the place to go! They serve great meat and provide an excellent salad/hot bar! The fried bananas are AMAZING!!! Plus the service is always on top of their game!

thG4obYvsCQ47WNirTPgGA.text: Be prepared to be stuffed! If your on a diet beware! Lol its alot of good food you cant deny! Alot of meat to choose from.

kzZlTvaWnvc2bLNA07jtiQ.text: I went here for my friends birthday dinner and I don't know if people hyped this place up to much but it wasn't as great as I thought it was going to be.   The restaurant is in a nice area and very easy to find. Its an upscale place so people were dressed up but I also saw people who were dressed very casual too. We were with a large party so we were seated in the back room the restaurant. It was obviously our first time here and nobody explained or came around to our table for a good 20 min. Finally we had to wave a waiter down to get our dinner started.  The dinner comes in two phases. First the salad bar and then the meat. They give you a two sided red/green coaster which you use to control to pace of how much meat you get. The salad bar is amazing and had a lot of variety. I recommend you take it easy your first round so you can have room for the meat. When your ready the meat carvers come around and cut the meat for you. I really enjoyed the lamb, filet mignon and the bacon wrapped chicken. I recommend you take your time eating the meat and not get everything all at once. The meat doesn't taste very good when it's cold so before trying a different meat finish the meat on your plate.  Overall the restaurant was nice, the food was good and we got free dessert because it was our friends birthday. My friends got to pick any dessert from the menu and the rest of our party got to pick either a cheesecake, chocolate moose and something else ( I can't remember lol).  They loose a star because it was our first time and nobody came around to our table to explain how everything works until we flagged someone down. It also took them a while for the meat to come around to our table.

e4-u38DCYyQ3XmcSOoKwHQ.text: I came here with high expectations after visiting other Brazilian steak houses in different cities.  First time visiting one in Scottsdale.  The salad bar was disappointing, they have a poor selection compare to other Brazilian steak houses I have visit.  The meat was average, was not as flavor as I would expect.  The service was slow, but they were very busy the night we came.  Not sure if we will be back.

MSMIT8JyHL3PSx52K-oWYA.text: Marvelous. Unique. Filling and accommodating. Would go here so so often if I could, or if I could eat this much all the time!   Fair warning- places like this are usually a flat $50 + alcohol, so if you are on a date plan to spend at least $150.   If you haven't experienced Brazilian steakhouse before, you are missing out on a terrific culinary experience.   The salad bar is terrific, and gives you an opportunity to load up with the greens, the fruits and the starches. It is a top notch salad bar.   Then when you sit down, you are treated to a cavalcade of delicious meats being served to you, one at a time, to accompany your meal. You can have as many as you want, and as much as you want. The quality of the cuts and their preparation is of the calibre you would expect at the nicest steakhouse- but this is all you can eat.   Truly a great place for celebration, I'll be returning!

kLVdzgiE1Fk77quR11G4Qg.text: I can't believe it took me so long to go! The food was fantastic and well worth the price. I'm fairly certain I ate 50 dollars in filet alone. Considering the fact that I have spent more money on a single steak without sides at a traditional steakhouse, you definitely get bang for your buck with Fogo!   My only complaints are based on the service. There were numerous occasions where my date and I were ready for more meat (with our cards flipped up on the "ready" side) and the servers would come to the table next to us, with their backs turned to us and walk away when done.  They never bothered to check if our table or any others behind us were also wanting any. In addition, our main server definitely could have used some wine training as he was not able to tell us anything about the wines we asked about.  Despite some poor service situations, all in all, I was very impressed and will be back soon.

wUzTlG_lbzY90M9KKfTuoQ.text: I've been here many times & every time is a great experience. If you love meat then this is your place. The different cuts of meat all seasoned well & all cooked right. The beef ribs are my favorite, they are seasoned only with salt & cooked to fork tender. I also love the salad bar, filled with fresh imported options. They had white rice with freijoda (black bean stew with pork meats), this side dish was a perfect complement with the rich meats. One thing that I really appreciate is the service, the service here is top notch & classy. The servers are always helpful & willing to give suggestions. This last time I went they suggested the limeade which is so fresh you can see the froth when they serve it to you. I LOVE this place & you have to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Took my brother here for his birthday,  lunch included complimentary dessert. Thanks Fogo de chao!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tri tip, sirloin, beef rib, &amp; pork sausage. SO DELICIOUS!!!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. First course before the sea of meats come your way. Freijoada, grilled zucchini, cucumber salad &amp; mozzarella cheese.

0NTGiMqMyNRhXVhWqElhvA.text: I love this place! You know when its good when even Brazilians go to this place to eat. If you are a big meat lover, this is your spot. Its pricey but well worth it!

d_s7WKuVVZkIMNiCyFJ5kw.text: Lets start off good and work downward shall we.............. I loved the salad bar THE BEST APPLE AND CHICKEN SALAD I ever had.  Mozzarella Boccochinis, the best asparagus  I have had ever. Not crazy about the Prosciutto (no taste, very blah) but the smoked salmon superbly sliced and Fabulous. Let me not forget what ever was on the table in the pop over bread thing. OMG that was a highlight for me. Now I like to see my wait staff work hard as I tip off that idea. These Guys were on their game, quickly as if they were riding a horse. they came to the table with swords of meat and sliced accordingly to my desired cook level. After sampling every meat  (or most of them) I dawned on me that somehow they all tasted alike.   The saturation on herbs and the distinct flavor of lemon smothered each meat.   Now I like lemon of lamb and pork but not everything.  I did PIG out and I was sorry that I could not afford the 14.50 for a glass of wine nor the 8.50 for a cup of coffee.  I love meat and meat loves me, but I just can't be that glutenous.   Sorry I could not be more support of.

BHUlqsDONC-rwL9zaIEKbA.text: On Valentine's Day went to Fogo De Chao for the first time. This was also my first Brazilian steakhouse experience. I am going back next month for more! It was very busy the night we went but we had reservations which I would suggest. We had great service from the team styled staff. The salad bar was good but I filled up on all the meat! I also loved the sides of mashed potatoes, fried bananas. My favorite meats were the Lombo (pork loin encrusted in parmesan) and the filet mignon.

_oMZ1dJY4zxJDwSUBWsTHw.text: Despite the high price of admission, Fogo is our favorite restaurant and we look for occasions or excuses to splurge. We first experienced Fogo in Philadelphia, but this location is even better, mostly from a service perspective (since their menus are the same). At this location, it is not hard to sample all the meat, even the more expensive tenderloin and ribeye.   You start your meal at the salad bar (which could be a meal in itself if you have vegetarian friends), which has great selections including fresh mozzarella, smoked salmon, prosciutto, and the best apple salad I've had anywhere. And then, onto the main course, an all-you-can-eat meat extravaganza. You control the pace of your meal by indicating when the servers should come by and carve your selection table-side off of large skewers. It's like getting dinner and a show as the gauchos dart through the dining room with sizzling hot selections. Our favorite is the house special, Picanha, and of course the bacon-wrapped filet mignon. While chowing down you are also given unlimited side dishes, including airy, irresistible cheese bread, crispy fried polenta, garlic mashed potatoes, and carmelized bananas. And, if you save room for dessert, their creme brulee is second to none. I wouldn't recommend their cakes though.

CrjUPmEKw_Pghd0sAF9lSw.text: This place is awesome.  Best meat I had in long time.  I went in during lunch time and price was reasonable for all you can eat quality meat.  I would give this place 5 star but can't afford to go here for dinner.  Awesome dining experience.

EpXqCgpAkSHspWoO6X1V5w.text: I have been to a Brazilian steakhouse before and this one was just as good as the one I went to in DC. The service was outstanding. The food was unbelievable. All the meats were good but my favorite was the filet mignon. It just melted in your mouth! I am drooling just thinking about it. We ordered a bottle of red that was so good. It went perfectly with all of the meat we were eating. How we had room for dessert is beyond me but the hot molten cake and the tres leches, wow!  The cheese knots were addictive and my waiter even snuck me a little box full of them at the end of the night. I will definitely be going back again.

pg1IjH2w7e-Nq21kmxnutA.text: Seriously? Hands down, THE BEST STEAK PLACE EVER!  They have every type of steak a meat lover could want. They also offer chicken and pork, ribs... etc. Their salad bar is decent but don't waste your time. It'll fill you quick, and in my experiences there, wait out for the meat. Its a nice place too, so dress up. It ruins the experience of the ambiance. Its a quick eat, we got in and out of there under an hour. I was very impressed. You can start eating as soon as you sit down. And another plus.... you can eat all you want! It's a bit pricey, at like $50 a person starting off, but well worth it, for the experience alone. Its a perfect fun date place too. They have a nice bar area, too.

dsPbhbmIRtbSOERELzCRYQ.text: Definitely an adventure in dining and the food was very good, although some of the meat was inconsistent - one piece good, another of the same type not as good. The service, however, was spotty. Took forever to come back for our wine order, then brought the wrong bottle and we had to ask 3 times for a beer we'd ordered at the same time. It does seem to be a spot for baseball players to hang out during spring training, so you might spot someone and our waiter was helpful in pointing out who was there last night. But, you have to eat a LOT of beef to get your $55 worth here, so not sure I'd go back.

I2xLX7JA_a-CdadQ2WB0lg.text: I went here recently with a medium sized group for a bachelor party dinner.  We arrived right at 6 pm for our reservations and were seated immediately.  We were given the rundown on how everything works, and then were unleashed.    My first stop was the salad.  I came in with a plan, go easy on the salad part to leave room for the good stuff (meat) and get some salad fixin's to at least make it seem like it is a somewhat balanced meal.  Overall, I have to say I was pretty disappointed with the salad bar.  The only things that I were really impressed with was the fresh cheeses (fresh mozzarella balls especially).  I guess the pesto salad dressing was nice but most of it was just average for me.    Finished the salad plate, and flipped the red/green card to go.  (Note:  I'm not sure how efficient this system was, there were times when I was green and the gaucho's passed me by, and times where I was red when they asked how I liked my cut).   All of the sudden it was a whirlwind of skewer toting gaucho's, asking if you'd like some of their meat (hmm...that sounds more like a description for a bachelorette party?).  I tried countless different cuts of meats, top sirloin, filet, chicken leg, lamb, etc.  My least favorites were the lamb (did not like the flavor, I usually really like lamb) and garlic meat (can't remember the cut offhand) which was a little overpowering with the garlic (and I like garlic).  The best were the filet mignon and the rib eye.  The other meats I had were also very good.  We were also served some cheesy bread rolls and a trio of sides, garlic mashed potatoes, fried polenta and fried plaintains.  I did not try the plantains, but the garlic mashed were uninspired at best (and opposite of the meat had little to no garlic flavor) but the polenta was fantastic.  I had at least three of those suckers.    Service was mostly good.  One problem with the meat service is that you get hit with 5-7 different meats in rapid succession, then you don't see another server for a bit.  Kind of feast of famine...  Also, we had one person order an after dinner coffee that wasn't deliver and an error on the check.  I additionally thought that the layout of the restaurant wasn't great, when it was crowded when we left it was pretty hard making it through all the tables when they were full and you had tons of employees running around.  I liked it.  I would definitely go back to a brazilian style steakhouse again, though if I went to Fogo, I might go for lunch (starting Oct 1) and save about $20 bucks.

3R2yMfpavzyHknAP2kVAOg.text: If you are reading this today is your lucky day! Truly. I am an on again off again food snob. Maybe reformed. But no.  Fifth time there, time to review. I'ts a simple format. Eat Meat! The dinig room at night is like a dance floor of waiters holding there meatsticks and offering it up to our hungry mouths. Ok, that looks like a porn intro.... but it's True. So for now call me Brandon St. Randy cause I want the meat they got. First off skip the salad bar please. This is a place to get your protein, nothing else. The slad bar has all kinds of frou frou hearts of palm, and aged romano. Sissy shit. Here at Fogo it's meat only. The house specialty here is the "picahna" and it is so good. It's like the best part of bacon fat on top of juicy sirloin. Make sure you get good slices wth a good amount of fat cap. Skip the chicken legs.....boring. All other cuts of meat are delicious. Do not pass on the Brazilian Limeonade!!! DO NOT! It is bottomless and so damn tasty, just needs a good rum in it.   Inexpensive for what you get. Make sure to turn your service card to OFF or there will be a dancing meat stick waiter on one of your elbow's.  They offer excellent sides. Caramlized Bananas, Grilled Polenta and you can ask your waiter for spicy dipping sauce, it is not on the menu or offered you need to ask. The varietes of meat include Top and Bottom Sirloin, Tenderloin, Pork and Beef Ribs, Chicken Drums, Lamb Chops and Chicken wrapped in Bacon. For me, it's only the Red's....Meat that is!

RvzrUfk9iwPHJ5ECPl596w.text: Was just here for a birthday party with about 9 others. I had been to Fogo de Chao before in another city and it took me a good amount of time to go back. I remember being fuller than I've ever been and for whatever reason kept me away from there for a while. Overall the food was good, but not great.  The salad bar was pretty tasty and had some good selections. I didn't have one meat offering that I was blown away by.  The service was average and it didn't help that one of the meat carvers spilled meat juice on the back of my shirt (was never mentioned, but noticed by my wife). I made the hostess aware of this and they gave me a wipe to try and clean it.  You would have thought that they would have thrown in a free dessert or something on the house, but just a "sorry about that". They also offered to pay for the cleaning if it didn't come out.  If you haven't been to a Brazilian steakhouse before, it's probably worth checking out, but to me seems a little gimmicky and probably will be a while before I'm back.

WBMgleqhjEwtUekcjUlj5g.text: Excellent food and lots of it.  Pretty pricey, but worth every penny of it.  They keep bringing the food and will cook it to your liking if you don't see it the way you want.  One of the few places that can cook a rare piece of meat without it tasting horrible and no complaints while doing it.  The salad bar is great, but who eats salad at a place like this.

0jJKPPz7DQsU_NnTCxVCTw.text: talk about full... this place allows you to eat many different styles of Brazilian meats made to order.  I was a fan of most, although it seemed as though there was a little too much salt on all of the meats.  It was a wide array of choices.  My least favorite was the pork ribs which were very dry.  It would not be a suggestion of mine as a place to go on a date, it is $45 per person to eat and I feel to get the full value you have to eat a lot!!  Overall it was a good filling experience, the staff was there all the time and I was never in need of anything, very on top of water refills and fresh plates.

dRbzsDKqcNp50H2TBE14Dw.text: if u can afford this food than you know why most people have given this place five stars i also went to the one in Austin Texas OMG!! sooo good i will and have already returned to this place many times

ZQkpmEFpV8k3Lj1FuqKX3Q.text: My first impression of this place was good, you open that huge door and walk into the place and it just feels like quality. It's high end and well styled. I had a few drinks in the bar with colleagues. The bar was small but nice. Service was very good. We then went back to a private room with two huge wooden sliding doors. This room was rectangular and very classy. We were given the low down on how the place works. Go and hit the salad bar first, be conservative and then come back to your table for an all out meat on a sword fest.  The salad bar was good. Everything was super fresh and high quality. So was the unlimited meat. It was all tasty. Salty from the seasonings and cooking preparation, but delicious. The house special sirloin is not to be missed, along with the filet and the leg of lamb. The sausages are forgettable, the bacon wrapped filet is so so. 90% of what I ate was delicious and I could have as much of it as I wanted. The other 10% was fair and I could stop after one bite and move on without feeling like I made a mistake.

8JRReewBRN-xV6LXDwgb4w.text: If you like steaks and you like salads, then this place is for you!! I just love their salad bar, it's so tasty and satisfying that I find myself wanting to go for seconds and thirds :) But I would rate their salad higher than their steak...They are a bit pricy but I think worth it for a wonderful and different dining experience.

aidVC9K-X8wr5kfreL3PIw.text: This was simply an amazing dining experience. My boyfriend and I have eaten in several Brazilian  steakhouses, including one excellent but more casual one in Guadalajara, and this one in Scottsdale shames the others. SHAMES THEM!  The service was spot on, the meats more flavorful than other Brazilian places we've been. Amazing wine list. And am I crazy or were all or most of the wait staff actually Brazilian??! The boyfriend has known several Brazilians and spotted the accent. How much more authentic can you get?  I adore the salad bar at these places, but holy moly i wasn't prepared for the cheese bread. When you read the words "cheese bread" you're mind might go immediately to Red Lobster type places. Or at least mine does. Yak. But these are little pillowy soft bread rolls with a cheesy consistency. Not heavy at all. How do they get the flour and cheese to play nice like that??  I have to disagree with people's comments about waiting longer for well-done cuts. I dont eat anything that isn't brown brown done. And they happily offered up the perfect cuts.  how can you no to bacon wrapped sirloin. Dear god!

L1EJffmbmvIt11CzziBGhw.text: Pricey but good. It's like the meat-scapades. All the food is good, but I definitely prefer the filet mignon... some of the chicken and pork gets a bit dry. Fantastic salad bar. Wear stretchy pants. Dress stretchy pants.

ILqY4BoGC93okkDVna186g.text: Took my hubby this weekend for his B-day...he LOVED it! Def have great service and TONS of food so come hungry! We had a light breakfast and didn't eat for the rest of the day in preperation. I like that even though they bring it around for everyone I was still able to get my steak Medium, rare. THe filet and the p-something (half moon shaped) are by far the best. The salad bar was very interesting with everything from fresh mozzerealla to asparagus. My husband could barely breath due to overeating but def worth while for a special occasion and like I said the servce was amazing

3EtRf4cck1T3y4Bxfbs_KQ.text: Sadly, I must rate my recent experience at this location as one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant and considering how much I previously loved this place, it really is unfortunate.  Our group had a 2:00 PM reservation which we later found out that they close at 2:00 PM to set up for dinner service. Please note this was for our office celebration for a year of working our tails off NOT something that we do often -- We were so excited that we had a timer count down in the office until we headed out to a place that "WE ALL LOVED".    WE WERE RUSHED from start to finish!!! - it was so uncomfortable having the staff eye us as if we were going to rob the place.   Drink service took 30 mins - Literally! - ABSOLUTELY unacceptable for such a highly rated place!  We received the incorrect bottles of wine, were told they did not have a bartender - very confusing for paying guests.       The servers bombarded our table with meats -  We couldn't enjoy a single bite without the next offering and repeated offering was being offered again -- the object of the on/off is for the servers to take note - they truly just wanted us out of there.  Our team is in the industry and tried to rush as fast as we could to be nice, but it really was not enjoyable.    On this same note of service:  A piece of very rare meat was being cut where blood splatter all over the white linen and a piece of meat flew into my water -- the server saw it and simply moved on to the next guest at our table and let me sit with the meaty water -- needless to say, I was a little repulsed.    During our white elephant gift exchange, we were announcing annual awards for our sales team and the server came over to shout out drinks to figure out what check belonged to each person at the table (please note split checks stink, I get it, but this was for drinks only and there were several of the (14) guests - that were not drinking) It was so inappropriate that the server interrupted our announcements. AGAIN super rushed.    Honestly, the list goes on and on and to say the very least, I as a guest that frequents this location often was extremely disappointed.  This experience was so displeasing that I will not return.  Moral of the story do not book a reservation at 2:00 PM, save yourself the awful experience!

Y6lo5av1cqx87L1Fi6kSYg.text: I've been here several times in the past, but my last visit was beyond disappointing. Both the service & the food has fallen off to a point of me & my family maybe not returning. The service was slow even though they weren't busy...at all. The meats were flavorless, tough & some cold. We preferred the rolls & plantain over the meats...really sad. I use to know some of the managers that have been there for years, but we didn't see any of them. Whatever changes were made, need to be returned back to the way it was.

Kqf6QXSXlD_x9Eneck2Pvw.text: I must say that the entrance to this place reminds me of Church doors. It must be the way the doors are designed that gives off that vibe. The place is decent the staff are dressed well and it seemed fancy but at the same time it's not? I guess it only seems fancy  by how everything is laid out on the table and how much your meal will cost.   If you go during lunch the price is about $30 and dinner it's about $55 for the Churrasco Experience (unlimited meat/salad bar).   They have a salad bar where you can get as many items of fresh salads and other side dishes  as many times as you want but limited on the selections they offer.   At the table, there's circular cards given to you. Green if you're ready for the servers to bring you an assorted types of meat. Flip it to Red if you want the servers to stop. Servers will also serve you different sides like fries, mashed potatoes, wings etc.   You get a selection of Pork, Chicken, Beef, etc. but after a while they all start to taste the same. It's great that you're given a chance to try unlimited meat but you get sick after a while. Your palette of flavor is limited.   We tried the full experience for dinner, it wasn't too bad but I wouldn't say we'll be excited to come back. However, the staff are very friendly and informative. They definitely explain well as to how everything works. I don't think a specific server is assigned to your table because they all work as a team and you can flag anyone down if you needed anything. Any servers would gladly assist you as to what you need. I think that it's great that they're all working together to satisfy customers needs. Although sometime's it takes them a while to get back to you.   We had a decent experience I wouldn't say it was bad but in my honest opinion I wouldn't be too crazy to want to come back any time soon. For me, I think everything seems a bit over priced.   Feel free to at least try the place out though. You might or might not like it. I guess it just depends on your preference.

3BVnNsbmNtiiZHG-rpc4iw.text: As a first timer here, I gotta say I was very satisfied with the food, the choices of meats and they were all so so delicious. I'd definitely go here again. It's a great atmosphere and area. I dined with my family and ordered almost every meat but the lamb. The skirt steak and the Parm crusted pork is really great too. the bread is amazing. One of the best bread I'd ever had. The chimichurri is amazing!!. I would've given this review 5 stars but near the end the service it began to slow down. We asked for our bill and it was a 20-30 minute wait just to get the bill! A neighboring table that came after us got their bill before us after we requested it for 10 minutes. Aside from that, I'd let it slide and I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

J9KZuPp_iyabkiI_MGIoLA.text: I love this place. Every time I'm in Arizona I go here for dinner. The customer service is great as you typically don't need reservations even in the customer weekends. The salad bar is also really good.

1DydfLZthyOfbCok6Sc1Hg.text: Stay away from the salad bar. I know it's tempting and there's lots of pretty stuff there but don't do it! You sit there and you wait for the meat and you eat all the meat you can because if you don't and you eat that salad you're going to tell your self why?! Why did I fill up on salad and not eat all the meat possible

LeVXQggre4RYSLAjcqW5jg.text: I thought that I was going to like Fogo de Chao a lot more then I did. The idea of the restaurant is obviously very cool and unique. Unlimited amounts of meat and a full salad bar. However, the majority of the steaks all tasted the same and I thought that the majority of the meats were either over seasoned or too salty. The sides that came with the meal were pretty good. We loved the fried bananas and the polenta fries. Mashed potatoes were just okay in my opinion. Salad bar was good. They had a good amount of options. The cheesy bread that is served with the meal was good when it was warm, but when it got cold it wasn't very appetizing. I honestly just think its a little overpriced. If I'm paying 53 bucks then I want to be eating some of the most flavorful meat I've ever had, and this wasn't the case. Service was great though. All of the staff was very friendly.

WEnv6QvRXqIyvbIvwSQWnw.text: Lunch is $34.95 and dinner $52.95 for the full experience. To me, hitting the lunch hrs is the best bang for the buck! They do have a small bar that serves some exclusive drinks, but most of my time the two times i've been here have spent devouring blue cut, and rare steak, slice after slice.   It's very salty, very addictive, and makes you want to just push through your said human bodily limits, arbitrarily demolishing everything they toss your way. I dont stop them from bringing out the tasty morsels, until I truly need a break from the carnivorous cravings.   I tried some salad,  some desserts which I'm pretty sure cost extra if I remember correctly. I felt pretty-kewl flipping my table medallion back to on after I was mentally prepared for yet another aggressive assault by the staff of the various select choices of lamb and beef.   Check the special of the day, sometimes they offer 2 for 1 wine bottles!  out of 5, go check it out for yourself if you're in the Scottsdale area.

sb8rR13K9SUke6GagwTeMg.text: Thought my experience in LA and LV was better. This location blows. The quality of the meats and the service suck!!! We were promised by 2 servers that our lamb was on the way but 30 to 45 mins later... they made it up though. Kinda late.

ds6sMtYlplrZNZaF6zF1cQ.text: Over the years this Fogo de Chao has changed in a few ways, including correcting the problem that caused me to downgrade them previously.  The servers are no longer acting harassed and no longer communicating a "hurry up, get out of here" vibe to customers.  It's still expensive but now you leave feeling that it was worth it - for a celebration.  For more frequent visits, well, it's still expensive and not a great value.

7RTBrHJkeFWpY73FF101Gg.text: The food was delicious, good to have so many options. The service was good, but the employees are often trying to get each other's attention above the noise, so it can feel a little loud. The caramelized pineapple was a terrific dessert choice.

7n74L4VUMpqryQ_SielxgA.text: For my 100th review, I decided to choose a place that I truly enjoyed, and will make sure to make it a yearly event. I will break this down by several different factors, and hope this review is helpful in deciding whether to go or not.  Decor: As you walk into FDC, it feels very upscale, with a nice bar on the left near the waiting area. The restaurant looks like you should be dressed up a little more than just casual, and technically you should, but some have gone in shorts and a tank top. There is a ton of seating, and the staff are all dressed for the Brazilian theme.  Food: OK THE FOOD IS AMAZING. I wish that could be all that is needed to state, but I will make sure to kinda explain what is really good. All the steak is perfectly seasoned, and is almost like butter melting in your mouth. The sausage is pretty good as well, and I sadly am not the biggest fan of the chicken here. I think it can be overcooked at times, but luckily you can ask the staff for a less cooked option. They also have an amazing cold food bar with fruit, salads, and other options.  Service: The servers are all amazing people. They ensure you have a wonderful time during your visit, and constantly ensure you get anything you need. You don't have to worry about waiting to flag down your server, they all work together, and the staff seems very happy.  Overall: I want to thank the staff at FDC, they have a lifelong customer as long as I can come down there. The food, service, and drinks will always have me coming back. If you want an amazing experience, with food to match, then please come enjoy yourself. Just please make sure you wear the appropriate attire for this place.

5KOrYrNoOfNwQRJcC5EwvQ.text: I had high expectations for this place from my initial experience at a Fogo de Chao in Chicago so I recommended this place to my boyfriend. Suffice it to say that our experience at this particular location in Scottsdale was less than satisfactory.  There were a lot of little things that happened that all added up to a frustrating experience. First of all, we weren't sure who our waiter was from the get go. We had a male server who introduced himself at first, but then a female waiter who came by later. This made it confusing when we were trying (with little success) to track either waiter down when we needed something.  Secondly, we asked the female waitress for a bread refill (after several minutes of sitting there wondering when someone would walk by) which never arrived. So again, waiting another SEVERAL minutes, we finally waved down the male waiter and asked for bread and water, since we still had not been offered a water refill. The male waiter then decided to walk around filling every other table's glasses before arriving at our table with more water but, again, no bread. He finally brought the bread several minutes later. And mind you the female waiter never asked us or apologized for not bringing bread the first time.   On top of this , we also wanted more soup and there were no bowls available at the soup section. We went back twice to check and still no bowls. My boyfriend also alerted an employee about there being no bowls and we never saw anyone come around to put out more.   Then someone cleared our table without asking us, utensils, napkins and all. When I came back from the salad bar and found I had no utensils we once again had to track down the waitress to ask for more utensils.  Finally, when we got our checks we were charged two full Brazilian dinners even though I had only gotten the Market option. When we alerted the waiitress she said she would go change it but we never received one word of apology from her.  The food was altogether decent, but nothing spectacular and my boyfriend said it wasnt worth the price. I was hoping he'd be more impressed by the experience of it all but it was altogether a pretty frustrating experience. We would have been happier customers if we'd at the very least received an apology or a discount on our checks.  Not coming back here again.

p6yQ5slXnchx7M0p5hAxKg.text: On 03/04/2018, a Sunday, we took our son out to your Scottsdale restaurant for his birthday. I made a reservation (party of 3) for noon and marked the box advising the celebration was for a birthday.    My wife was using a leg cart, and we were seated in the middle of the dining room. She had to weave in and out of tables and had difficulty doing so. The hostes that sat us, waited at the table and watched her struggle between other guests. Rather, she should have thought about the placement of the customer and the difficulty she was having. She dined only from the market place, which was also a struggle to get to and from due to where we were seated. She returned to the market for quiche and a beef dish. To her surprise, ALL three hot dishes were EMPTY.   I stepped away from the table for a moment, my wife and son still there. When I returned, all of the plates and silverware were removed.  One server overheard me commenting to my son, and she asked what the problem was. She brought new plates and silverware back to us, so we could finish our meal.  Never a mention of the birthday. I mentioned it when we received the check, unfortunately spoiling the surprise. My son, detecting my dissatisfaction, declined the now, late offer of a free desert.   The check did not reflect the market place for my wife and we were charged for the Brazilian brunch.  I had the server correct this.  I am EXTREMELY dissatisfied and disappointed in the lack of attention by the employees. Other Fogo de Chao's I have dined in, ran like well oiled machines. The food was always prepared and ready for the customer, and they were attentive.  Scottsdale Fogo fell COMPLETELY flat.    I posted this on their customer site and have not yet (as of 03/14/18) received a response. Here again, this shows me, and hopefully YOU, that they are not concerned with a customers dissatisfaction. I do not recommend going to this restaurant. Truly a disappointment.

pFU4kest896nKsE8LcLE4Q.text: Dining room was incredibly bright and that killed any shot at ambiance. Restaurant is very tired and needs a refresh.  Definitely not up to the standard we expect in Scottsdale--I am a local.  Our table top had large areas of material missing which was visible through the tablecloth.   The food was ok, much if it was over-seasoned with way too much salt.  The meats tended to be very high fat and not well trimmed.  The salad bar had some odd items and lacked some of the basic items you would expect... cheeses, various seeds, croutons.  I've been to other locations and had a better experience.

Qj9HtAfXG4CUDW9cYn1_Rw.text: Food was good not great. Mediocre biscuits and potatoes with tasty meats. I'd try another fancy place.... there's lots in this town. Christopher customer relations manager stopped myself and a guest while leaving and accused us of dining and dashing. We had paid and closed the tab with our server Tyler. They should do a better job with more than one person handling tables and make sure before making scenes.

83PjvUEHUEkn9eKijbGrAg.text: I was a little disappointed when we went at lunch. Now the disappointment stems from the Brazilian steak houses I've been to in Texas. The salad veggie area is much bigger at others and the meat was okay but I was expecting a little bit more. Maybe I was spoiled with how amazing things were in Texas.

fIjX1OCC2G1By2Dpq5CH_w.text: Decided to celebrate Valentines at Fogo de Chao and very disappointed. Greeted to a group of very rude hostesses but the waiter that first attended to us was very nice and thought it would turn around the experience. After he brought out the sides we never saw him again, were only checked on when they were getting us to sign up for their rewards club and then I finally got a refill on my drink and fresh plates. For the price I felt let down as they were bringing around the cheap meat until we requested steak. After that we didn't see anyone for like twenty minutes so we finally got the check which did not include the promo gift card they were advertising we had to ask for the manager to get that. Can't say I will go back to use it though, for the money I felt it would have been a better experience to go to Fleming's or Ruth's Chris.

Zya-icB-ImdTl50MiP60WQ.text: This is definitely an experience worth trying. My sweetheart took me here for Valentine's day dinner. We are both on a low carb diet and from our research, this looked like a perfect fit.   The restaurant was table cloth and most of the people were dressed for the occasion. We were seated in the side room in the corner. This had the advantage of being quiet and privet, but had the disadvantage of being super far from the fancy salad bar. We made one trip out to it. It was a low carb candy bowl of cheeses, meats, and veggies. I grabbed a little of everything.   At the table,  the servers brought the meats. You tell them your preferred doneness and they slice it off the main shank for you. I had some nice fatty cuts and some very tender rare cuts of steak. They also brought some other sides to eat but they were bread, so sadly we couldn't eat them.   Everything tasted so wonderful that we got caught up in the moment. Having server after server stop by. Before we knew it, we had a nice line up of meats. We quickly made it through all the tasty cuts.   One thing I regret is that we got full eating too quickly. We should have slowed down. It's a pricy bill, but nice quality at all you can eat. Basically a Vegas buffet. Also the tables were really close together which made it hard to walk through. I don't know if this was for the holiday or if that's the normal layout.  Great for special occasions.

YjuAPyJSppnwecSL9DXHow.text: My family (my wife is Brazilian) and I visited restaurant Saturday evening and were so disappointed with the quality of the food (salad bar) and the churrascaria. The feijoada was terrible! The chef must have just opened a couple of cans of black beans, added a few pieces of old, over cooked pork, heated it up, and called it a day. The beans were then to be served over a bed of bland, over cooked rice.   Our waiter never offered a menu to order from as an alternative to the salad bar. White tablecloths and extremely high menu prices does not make this a classy restaurant. Our bill for four was $260.! Will not recommend restaurant to anyone nor will we return. Gave restaurant two stars by accident.

wAE8-c4zbNVtlRFgvF0Unw.text: Our waitress Norma was awesome! Beyond awesome! No joke, ask for Norma. If your waitress isn't Norma, then your experience won't be 5 stars. Oh, and the food wasn't bad. I feel like some of the meats need a condiment as they tend to be a little dry. If it wasn't for Norma I would not have given this place 5 stars.

4H3p9cPChi1NAYcGicMDPw.text: This is an amazing steakhouse. The experience was unforgettable. The service was outstanding. The food beyond perfect. Drinks were so delicious. I had the white sangria. I'm not a wine drinker and I couldn't get enough. Again absolutely delicious. I can not wait for my next experience at Fogo de Chao. If you have not been here yet. You are missing out.

a3AGkXnHWUOmuxbbSGnoEw.text: Never fails! Awesome food, amazing service...Lou was amazing at checking on us and making sure we were doing well....we were literally the last in the restaurant and he never made us feel rushed.....Food is delicious as always and Thank you Lou, for another fabulous experience!!!!
