CMl6egorz4OeXfRbLJgYzw.text: More like Fogo de " Holy Cow!" Guys running around with long metal rods wrapped in meats??? Hell yes! Is this some type of meat-lover's porno shoot I happily stumbled upon?  I can't really add anything that hasn't already been said, so I will just say that you MUST go here if you consider yourself a meat-lover like me.  My personal favorites: Everything wrapped in bacon, and the Parmesan crusted...YUMMMMM!  "WOW, that's a lot of meat!"

-sxjw9j-MiwHXRBDt5fwhA.text: Two friends and I were there for lunch today and we were disappointed.  We had to wait for servers to come to the table. We also had to wait sometimes as long as ten minutes for items we requested like beef and pork ribs, rib eye steak, and lamb chops. The pork ribs were over cooked and when I told the server he said that this is how they are prepared in Brazil. I told him not True since I have been to Brazil two times and had very juicy, tender ribs.  I have been to this restaurant a few times, and this is the first time I feel like I was ripped off.  I will go back with the hope that it will be up to par. Maybe today was a bad day for them.

Rt2NElCzjIjCZx810hKBdQ.text: Definitely make sure you are hungry when you visit this restaurant. The service was decent. The vegetable bar was good. The meat selections were not as vast as I expected. There were no seafood or fish passes for meat. (Red meat galore though!) the drinks were a little disappointing as well as the dessert. Not my favorite by any means.

KUfFbC_qzZMdTRC9-F5eVA.text: Just went again for lunch and it was as good as I remembered. I will just not go on a holiday/special day in the future.

lTVN_oPHOrMh4qywppykLw.text: Of course this restaurant is going to be pricey, because it's a Brazilian steakhouse. But, because it is more of an upscale restaurant, I feel like we had better service. Salad and side bar is amazing. The gauchos are friendly and never made us wait for the meat to be brought around.   We had a large party, and the whole restaurant was very accommodating. My older son is picky and didn't eat any meat, and ate minimally from the salad bar, so our server didn't even charge us for his meal, even though he is 14.   Will definitely return the next time we travel to AZ.  Oh, and an added bonus are the soft towels in the restroom. I know, it sounds weird, but when you're paying $50 per meal, the restrooms had better not have "paper" towels.

QLW_2xh9GbFm2kPBnxW_QQ.text: First time here. Very clean and the aroma of the prepared meat was amazing when you walked in. The Brazilian Steakhouse was new to me but I really enjoyed the experience of them coming around and cutting the meat right at the table.  It wouldn't be fair for me to not mention the service. It was great, we were regularly checked on but not to the point it was annoying.   Would recommend, especially if you've never experienced the Brazilian steakhouse experience.  Probably would have given 5 stars but my opinion was that it was pretty pricey.

AzafCwp7VWAJTT-4pfFzvQ.text: What wonderful experience, and not just the food which was exceptional. From the time we were seated at our table to the time we left the restaurant....FANTASTIC ! Can't wait to go back...Fogo de chao helped make this one of the most memorable Father's Day. Thank you.

QulcP4d-SGRRUt_gnOxezw.text: Its hard for me to say much more then all the other review that this place has. This was the 3rd time coming here from the far west side of phoenix (over 40 miles away) and it is a meat lovers paradise. Servers are very attentive with all the various meats they serve.     our visits this time was to take out of town family member, who loves meat and has never been to a brazilin style steakhouse.   I would probably visit Fogo more often but it is just so far from our house.

LE2tlYnQvPWTzb5KnSsMJQ.text: I really thought it was just OK. I read lots of reviews and heard, you must go, but it's lots of yummy beef, some lamb that I really don't eat, and a salad bar. I don't like serving my own salad. I like to be served when I go out. It's cool for maybe a sweet 16 or for a one time thing. I did like the service. I had a nice glass of wine. The potatoes (mashed and sort of au gratin) were just awful, out of a box or something. The salads were fresh and good. I was stuffed and did not eat that much, but we tried a roll, bit of plantain, and a bit of polenta. It fills you up to eat salad and starchy stuff. We brought home a piece of pie and I hope it's good....key lime.......for breakfast tomorrow!  Not sure what the hype is Fogo.....will probably not be back.

IUcHOHvDKBAEuRatHkvIug.text: This is my second time coming here in 2 years and the experience was just as how I remember it. While it was a bit crowded because of Valentines Day; the service and steaks were still amazing.  The never ending steak passing by as soon as you sit down just adds to the experience.

jDWb5DOm0bEYgiZhKnJUhg.text: I have been to a few different Brazilian steak houses before, but this was my first time here.  We went to celebrate a couple birthdays with a group of 8 people.  The service and atmosphere is what earned both stars. The only complaint in this department was when I went to the rest room, a service tray was leaning against the wall less than a foot from the urinal. Pretty gross for a crappy diner let alone a nice evening out.  The food was not worth the cost at all. All meats, except the sirloin, were way over cooked. The carver would ask how you would like the meat cooked, and we quickly learned your response did not matter. Dry and well done was what you got. My wife is pregnant so only soda for her, and one glass of wine for me. $148 total including a 20%tip. Not worth it at all. I will not return, and recommend looking elsewhere for a good Brazilian steakhouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is a service tray right next to the urinal. Gross!!

Pnjjs50wePMGZDzmpOSZhQ.text: Filet, Sirloin, and Ribeye, oh my!  This was my first Fogo De Chao experience, and it exceeded my expectations!  I've been to other Brazilian steakhouses in the past, but Fogo was fabulous!  Sure, I could've made a meal on the sensational thirty item salad bar on it's own, but I took a breather and then went for the meat.  Green light on!  I also enjoyed the crispy hot polenta and caramelized banana side dishes. Yum!  Rolando was the waiter I had the most contact with and he was remarkable.  Evan, the GM, was friendly as well... this was such a treat to be a part of, and of course, even more fun because I was surrounded by some of my favorite yelpers!  Thanks Fogo folks - once I digest my 2 - 3 lbs of meat, I'll be back to see you again!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

V912O3Gb60coy66_dL_V7g.text: A fantastic dining experience, fabulous atmosphere, family oriented, or could be a romantic dining experience for 2... Food absolutely delicious ... variety, prepared to your liking, quality and quantity under one roof.  The staff was over the top in the area of customer service, they seem to be enjoying their job equally as much as I was enjoying the Dining Experience!!!                                                                                                                                   T.C.

Te2aCkkrPkfLg4JmsG7wMw.text: Can't complain about anything...woo hoo rare meat! Service was great. Watermelon on the salad bar. Good company, plus we had a gift card. We'll be back

ayjlrF-A7RUTJZ_yqgNiYw.text: Wow!!! Was very impressed. It is an expensive meal but not something I'm just going to because it's Tuesday. The servers were very down to earth and joking around. We went as a party and the food was delicious. It is all it's cut out to be. Lamb, ribeye, chicken, pork, all of it. Just delicious. I've been to several steak houses and this is a very unique steak house that you will surely remember. It is a very cool change of things with the green card (feed me) and the red card (Stop feeding me). The one knock was the seafood tower. For the price have had much better sea food towers. The overall experience and quality of food is too good for them to get anything under a 5 star!!!! The salad bar is really cool with some unique cheeses, fresh salads, and some cool sides. If you want to change it up and enjoy yourself go here!!!!

mDVru4aXX0Os01moBguWNw.text: We took the family for Thanksgiving.     The service was so terrible it was embarrassing. From the host at the front door, to the people bussing the tables. Couldn't even get the drinks correct, and we only ordered SODA!!!!!    Nobody knew what they were doing, it was SO chaotic and disorganized  it was almost like the employees never worked in the restaurant industry before.  I will NEVER EVER go, or recommend this restaurant to anyone, The price was most definately not worth the lack of service, we would have been better off going to McDonald's.  WORST experience ever!!!!!

FwymxN06ixO4v4siNRezwA.text: Went to this restaurant for our anniversary. If you are looking for all you can eat and love beef. This is the place. The place was clean and busy. The staff was very friendly and the food was good. A little pricey but was good.

3X2Kpu56gTuO036PaPUs8g.text: This place is a meat heaven!! If you are a steak person, this is place to be indeed. I had a great experience here, the staff and food top notch. Be back soon!!!

Asrp5Zzk_TPmtbF5IMxEtA.text: I have come here many times I and it has always been good. The last time we went at lunch and I was the best trip we have had here. There was not many people in the restaurant and servers were looking for things to do. The food came around faster then it could be eaten and they brought our anything we asked for. The price is also less for the lunch so it is a win win.

7XLG0qAXycALBIVPbSewNQ.text: We are out visiting from Orange county Ca and decided to to dine here for our sisters birthday. The service was perfect, the staff was on point, and the food was Amazing!!! I will definitely be coming back to this location not to mention the locations at home. Thank you for making our night special.

2EAvxSXN7JfsSOlKrwYjkw.text: Great food and nice service. I really like it that I can eat different kind of meat and just only a piece. Roundabout great experience, nice drinks and atmosphere.

2sJgTQi1LD7afnpYjs8Edw.text: Over all great experience. We made reservations months ago for 7 people. We arrived about 20 minutes early and were seated immediately. John our waiter was on top of everything. Food was great. Maybe could of had a little better selection at the salad bar, but let's not kid ourselves, who goes here for the salad bar??  My daughters first experience at this type of restaurant And she loved it.  Bring a fat wallet, you will need it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bring your wallet or a rich uncle.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome shrimp cocktail, but pricey.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. She had a blast

kN6VcKqXCDuzLPUukgJwCQ.text: If you are looking for a royal, "Last Supper" experience, this is definitely the place to go. Hands down, this is my favorite restaurant when I am craving carnage. LOL This restaurant has the most elaborate salad bar in Arizona! They really do a great job of providing dishes with top quality ingredients. There are perhaps 30 different salad/cold side-dish options. This is just a bonus to the main meal. Beyond The coveted salad bar, the concept of exotic meats freshly made and carved straight to your plate... Just genius. Although spendy, the price is definitely fair for the product and service which is provided.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad bar plate

ZTfokRr16Y0pJYh6X6qEgA.text: We came here for a celebration and reserved a private room for a party of 12. The restaurant is very well decorated and our private room was extremely elegant, clean and welcoming. We started out our meal with all you can eat salad bar, followed by unlimited choices of meats that came around our table during the entire dinner. We all finished up our meal with delicious dessert that we all shared. All of our guests left this place extremely satisfied and happy at the end of the night. Since majority of our guests did not go to the salad bar, they even removed some costs (we did not ask for it by the way) and did not add the 20% gratuity on our final bill. Due to the excellent customer service and how happy we were with this place, we ended up tipping them 30% instead.   If you have a huge get together and most of your guests are meat lovers, I highly recommend this place. They do require your credit card number and fill out two pages form for a large party reservation. However, they will not charge you unless there is a no show. Adults are approximately $55 per person and children are half price.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spanish cake
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate moose cake

vkSRggAZyPP0Lx2cZ6AFOw.text: Great experience and wonderful food! Not your typical salad bar, wonderful choices. Amazing meat choices as well!

a_FSbFIuaPnLcKdjaho7Sw.text: Arrived here for the first time yesterday, came back the following day for lunch. I'll probably have to come back tomorrow and again and again, then eventually file for bankruptcy within a few weeks because I'm addicted to this place. By the way, Karina rules as the greatest server ever.

accKRWzVjCx6V_2u4yr_5Q.text: Meat lovers paradise.  Staff are incredibly friendly.  All the meats served were cooked to perfection.  Yummy, yummy    One last thought, the Brazilian Limeade.....delish.

PqcQbM1_nWla4EV75_OQJw.text: This place was perfect for a nice date night, great food and even better service. We had Norma as our server and she was absolutely fantastic. I don't not usually write reviews but seeing as how the restaurant does a tip pool for servers I thought Norma deserves a shout out. Thank you for the great service. We will be back.

fnZ-UZllkn7JCVWmFhjMQQ.text: Awesome workers awesome food.  Found out that there workers some of them where new and I had no clue!!!  Shout-out to those who served!

XEo1JlptR2_20mYR0KoYyg.text: I've been to this joint probably four times... and the only thing holding it back from a five star rating is the price.  I get it - you're offering unlimited prime meats - but that doesn't mean you should charge $16 for a 10 ounce cocktail.  Was it good? Yeah... but for that price it should be twice the freaking size.  C'mon.  The salad bar is spectacular... offering an array of Brazilian appetizers.  They bring fried bananas and pao de quiejo to the table as often as you'd like (tiny rolls baked with cheese in 'em that are just incredible.  The lunch offering, while not as plentiful as the dinner (in regards to the variety of meats they bring around) is half the price ($30'ish vs. $60'ish) and the only way to go in my opinion.  My favorite (even when I lived in Brazil) is the picanha - perfectly seasoned and medium rare, the way meat should be eaten.  Yesterday the pork and chicken wrapped in bacon weren't as tender or juicy as they've been in the past, but all the beef offerings were out of this world good.   The rice / bans / farofa remind me of the time I spent in Brazil and you must get a can of guarana for nostaligia's sake (their most popular soda - kind of tastes like cherry ginger ale).  The service is always solid and a few of the meat servers were actually from Brazil so I also got to practice my Portuguese too.  I'll be back, but only on rare occasions to celebrate something... word on the street is Rodizio is opening somewhere in the east valley and with their cheaper prices they'll certainly compete in this underrated foodie arena.

YYVkaZq1NkjHm9OnvT7xvQ.text: 100% worth every penny! Just took my large family (11 people) for a birthday lunch. The service was astronomical and the food was delicious!! This was our second visit and we went 40 minutes past a similar restaurant to eat at Fogo! Highly recommended and will definitely return.

S-nOvwy4_rMyIl7KGZONxw.text: This is one of our favorite Brazilian steakhouses jn the US. We have been to a few and this is by far the best. The meat is fresh and perfect and wow that salad bar is the best. They also give you 5 star customer service. Great place to celebrate or have a great night out of something fun. Prices are reasonable for what's provided, also great parking and good drinks at the bar. Will always come back, fun to bring out out of state friends over to this place.

MJp3BfSjR0vu_ZxQmKhLjQ.text: I went here for valentine's day and the food was amazing as well as the drinks. It's a very romantic atmosphere. The service was excellent and our server took really good care of us! I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends and family because you will not be disappointed. It's a little pricey but it's very well worth it, this is the place to go so prepare to be amazed!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cappuccino at its finest
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing dessert

aFISJFAM5S-1yZmvZQLtww.text: Incredible as always! The salad bar is great, but who comes here for salad... unless you come with your girlfriend who is a vegetarian like myself. You have to pick and choose your meats because they aren't all incredible, but a lot are. If you are on their birthday list, you get $25 off of your meal and a free dessert. Also, if you would like filet mignon, put a request into your waiter and he can help request it to come out for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

J3sDlBlsP3kOSyaejEF0ug.text: Always is very enjoyable to have diner at Fogo De Chao. Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Gustavo took care of my family much better than any luxurious cruise with his first class attention to every detail. Great place.

gVJd4-7o6WdqdYqy-t_u5Q.text: Pricey, but well worth it! The meats are so delicious and perfectly cooked to your likings. Don't touch the salad bar until you try all the meats because there are about 8 different types and they're all scrumptious. The cooked bananas are also really good along with the mashed potatoes and polenta sides to clean your palate between meats. Also request a side of the chimichurri sauce, it goes great with every steak! Overall, I'd say the filet minion and lamb were my personal favorites. The service was also very good, the second you flip your card over they are there at your table with different meats. Definitely a unique experience that I would do over and over.

W1qmJmS9z_2tiTHgus33IA.text: All of the staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and clearly understand quality service. They will not stop offering you large portion of what ever they are serving so long as your chip is green. If you want three lamb chops and they only have two on them they will give you the two they have and bring you a third very quickly. If they are offering bottom round but you want leg of lamb, just say no thank you but please bring leg of lamb and next thing you know they will be at your table with it. They brought our table bottom round but we wanted sausage and leg of lamb, next thing I know three servers are at our table with sausage, leg of lamb, and lamb chops. The food is amazing and the verity is nice. Most places that offer an all you can eat buffet style have a few good things and the rest is sub par, that is simply not the case here. Every thing they had to offer was high quality and delicious. The price makes it a place where most people would treat it as a special occasion, but you will get your money's worth and leave happy. Happy and VERY FULL.

wfqwejM6fHbob7YcC3Rvcg.text: They know how to do meats.  I can't think of a single thing that wasn't great about this meal.  The only negative I can possibly think of is that nagging feeling in the back of my mind that it is just . . . too. . . . much. Just too much of everything. The whole experience constitutes a sort of embarrassment of riches.  But that's what celebrations are about, and thus this is a great place for a celebration.

hHWpEQ54Eklowb4nVIXyVA.text: my sister and I went there over the labor day weekend, the good thing was the restaurant week, the bad thing was restaurant week. we did the special offer. and yes it was really good. the place was packed but our table was waiting for us. the salad bar was awesome. I think you can go and just do the salad bar and it would be good in and of itself. The meat did come and come and come. all great, the only reason I didn't stuff myself was that I wanted that super new York cheesecake for desert. I am soooooooooo glad I did.  when your in the area this is a must stop.

QY_uNhZ8_sHTD9YDkPhT0Q.text: This place was excellent. We came here for my birthday and it did not disappoint. We prepared ourselves by abstaining from food all day so by night time, we were ravenous. When we first arrived we were seated quickly since we had made reservations, thank god we did since it was pretty busy when we got there. Our waiter went through the spiel with us about how the whole process worked since it was our first time there, he seemed extremely busy but he was always kind and there when we needed him, +1 star there. I decided to visit the salad bar and ended up with some smoked salmon and asparagus. The salmon was delicious and the asparagus was abnormally large but also great nonetheless. Abnormal veggies, +1 star. Right when I sat down, the filet mignon came by so basically, it was meant to be. It was cooked perfectly and extremely tender. It was a melt in your mouth kind of good that could bring a grown man to their knees. Yum. +1 star. Then right after the filet the lamb chops came. I'm pretty sure this is the part I died and went to heaven. Cooked to perfection and the spice on the lamb chop was tasteful and not overwhelming. +1 star. Other meats then showed up which were good but let's be real, the filet and lamb chops held a place in my heart already. I do have to say though, the chicken and bacon wrapped filet were a bit dry. Other than that, there were no complaints. Since I'm the type of person that always has room for desert, we charged on and ordered the molten lava cake. If I didn't die before, I definitely did now. It was a melt in your mouth warmth and heaven of chocolate, if chocolate was a drug then I'd happily OD on this everyday. When we pierced the outer shell of the cake the chocolate on the inside flowed like a baby chocolate river, it doesn't get any better than that. So basically, +5000 stars. My first time experience was off the charts and I cannot wait for another excuse to go again!

uiFmIgaxmZdLTaqdLOHxOA.text: My husband and I went here last night and it was absolutely disgusting. To the point he literally had to spit his food out it was so fatty. Half of my plate was the scrappings of fat I had to trim off my pieces of meat. The salad bar had nothing to choose from other then cold veggies and hard rice. I was at Texas de Brazil in Chicago last week and for the exact same price you had triple the salad/ buffet bar, great meat vs this disgusting cheap cuts of meat offered here and even though everyone here was very nice, it took forever to get drinks, refills, and we had to ask for someone to clear our plates after an hour of being there. I will never be back and its a shame because theses places are normally wonderful.

EtrVqc7b2CbF8ZjNVIN75A.text: Love Fogo De Chao! Go here every 6 months to stuff my face with the best meats on the planet. Big alcohol selection if you can afford it and the cheese/salad buffet is a nice side compliment to the meat. This is a place to take your wifey or sister visiting in town. 6 stars if I could!

iD8CtxGXYoKPw0wXlxxaWQ.text: I ate here for a late birthday lunch with my sister (plus her bf) and the food and service was top notch. For lunch you get the same food for a cheaper price but even the dinner price is well worth it. It was a buffet style restaurant, where you pay one price and get all the food you can eat (except dessert+drinks). We started at the salad bar but there were so many good food that my plate was full with no space for the meat so I had to get a second plate. They give you this card where you flip over when you want to be served with the freshly cooked meat. They have their servers walking around with the meats looking for people to be served.  We tried every type of meat on the menu and I loved it all. They even had bacon wrapped meats which were amazing (who doesn't love bacon?). Did I already mention the service was excellent? Well, they have a friendly staff who are all very efficient. When we asked for a particular meat we were craving, they would bring it right away. When we asked a question about the restaurant, they gave us an informative answer. Lou who seemed to be the customer service manager, came to our table asked how everything was and had a good sense of humor. All-in-all I was blown away with the Brazilian Steakhouse experience. Definitely coming back soon!

i0I4EO3qnHFnd012caFQ5w.text: Salad bar is amazing, meat is so so. They have a great selection but for the price not sure if it is worth it. Maybe once in a while for a special event...

NWnV_t4okQVtjmjqIyBQtw.text: Do you remember as I do, playing The Oregon Trail video game on your apple IIe in elementary school? The part I always loved(besides naming people cool names), was the hunting feature.  You would shoot a huge buffalo and could never carry back your entire compliment of meat.  Well, old school video games beware, Fogo De Chao has figured out a way to carry back the entire tomb of meat and place it right on your plate.  No joke, I have never seen more protein in a confined space.  You have around fourteen  options of different meat and by the second round, the types really starts to blur together.  There is filet, strip, chicken, sausage, etc...  The theme, is that comes hot and in mass quantities.  At first look the price tag looks pretty reasonable, but do not expect a  couple to get out of here for below $130 with tip. Yep campers, its around fifty a person for this all you can eat meat extravaganza and "salad bar."    The salad bar is a collection of eclectic items that really do not seem at all like they belong on a salad bar.  That being said, it doesn't matter, because the meat coma you are entering does not allow for further eating, other than the meat.    Now that I have been here once, I imagine I will go back someday, but not in the near future, my stomach is going to need at least another month to digest it all.  Good service, absolutely advertised as what you get for the meal, have to give Fogo a solid rating.

c5bsS5ifphSGdiWTRFovtg.text: I had a wonderfull great time dinning with friends and family.  Junior the Philippines server, he was awesome all night one of the best help. It's a plus on my behalf....love the lamb.

SqOOzl1fpkqmczpRZ5su4g.text: Loved the food it was all amazing! I would recommend to anyone. Great place for a date, the meat was to die for! I enjoyed my date there and I cant wait to go back. Also the service was outstanding.

UlrREULWRECY7AxEFzsSFA.text: We came for valentines day and it's crazy busy all the time!!! Great food but we waited 20 min for our check so the server brought us two free dinner gift cards!!!! Amazing way to over make right what's been done wrong... Slow service at the end to get our check was more than compensated for and we will for sure come back again

HRQx-LxXB07o3-pb19L4tQ.text: I can't believe what happen to my sister on her birthday here!! First, of all yes this place is located in Scottsdale and sometimes I expect rudeness BUT OH MY GOODNESS this was worst than a night in Mississippi on Klan night!!! My sister had reservations for get birthday party to be held there and we were told by the hostess as long as half of the party showed up we will be seated! Well, it's half of us and she turns around with major attitude saying that her manager said that it has to be the whole party here! When,  everyone showed up on time they still made us wait, seated other people before us never apologize, never updated us when we will be seated... Basically just left is in the wind! The manager never spoke to us, he just kissed ass of some surgeons I actually work with!! Don't judge book by its cover!! This place is done discriminatory is disgusting!!!  Save you money go some where else if you want your business valued!!!!!!

Y4CD5eZfJBKJNtBkVMVfUw.text: I procrastinated on making Easter reservations and wound up coming here with the bf. Inside it looks like you are at someones wedding reception at a nice catering hall- nice, but unoriginal.  All of the staff were very kind and helpful and we soon got down to business. The salad bar was my garden of Eden! Mushrooms, beets, humongous asparagus spears (genetically altered, perhaps?;) ) the basil dressing? Amazing. I loved it, and even my veggie-shy man enjoyed some of it's offerings (bread and butter!).   Time to get meaty! I have never had so much hot meat in front of me at one time! We quickly learned what we liked (filet and ny strip for me) and what we didn't (bottom sirloin still visits me in bad dreams). I tried two pieces of chicken that were both hard as rocks and a pork sasuage  that was ggggross! I had more uneaten meat on my plate than i had consumed, so after about 20 minutes I cut off the meat flow and went back for seconds at the salad garden.  Before leaving, we finally saw the lamb chops coming around. I love them and had to try them. My first bite was pretty decent. But each subsequent one was fattier than the next. Blech! Enough for me.   I will mention the sides, although they were truthfully unmentionable. The "crispy polenta" was overcooked and greasy, the plantains looked nasty but tasted ok. The potatoes were the best of the worst, and we actually ate them. But overall, the sides aren't worth the room in your belly. We had none left, and therefore passed on dessert.  I'd go back for the salad bar, it alone costs $20, but I think it's worth it. Everything else, meh.

gEei1UFRV0yLWy4FvTtR7g.text: I was a first timer here at Fogos, the food was great but the service was poor and the waiters are rude.. My father in law overheard one of them saying that we probably had minimum wage jobs.. Our family owns a business, we are a modest and humble Hispanic family and have never experienced rudeness at that level. I won't be back.

w0sB6GT8OkyG8J9SDxJUsg.text: If you know what you want and you're prepared, Fogo de Chao is 5 stars. Practically starved myself all day so I could indulge. Father-in-law and I were greeted warmly by the hostess. Stopped in the bar for a drink and had a nice glass of wine, server was friendly & helpful. Server explained the concept to my FIL, who had never been to a churrascaria. Salad bar was nice, just icked up a few nibbles (olives, prosciutto, roasted peppers...) to complement the upcoming meatfest.   It's all about knowing what you like.  Best of the meats: the two top sirloin selections are spectacular, as was the lamb chop and lamb t-bone. Juicy & flavorful/ Ribeye was super tasty.   Worst - leg of lamb was overmarinated, the pork ribs were cooked fine but needed some sort of rub/seasoning, the bottom sirloin had great texture but was kind of bland.  Passed on the chicken, sausages and filet mignon.  Service was prompt, attentive and polite without being overbearing.  A great meal, and a fun/different experience.

8BnIbCx41OKJIdaTKD1MzA.text: Over all the place was ok. The fillet mignon was the best piece of meat there. Everything else was ok. The beef ribs were over seasoned with salt and the pork ribs were dry. One cut of the fogo house special was very tough and inedible. The salad bar was ok. Not a whole lot to choose from but I was there for the meat anyways. The sides they brought to the table were good. The fried Polenta sticks were addicting. And, they had my favorite cake on the desert menu! Tres leches! So over all for the price ($50 a person) I think they could have done a better job on the food. The meat especially. Oh the staff was really nice and helpful. One of the waiters even offered to take my sons bottle in the back and wash it for him after he dropped it.  Lol on a side note the people sitting next to us who looked at us all night like we didn't belong there were stealing food and putting it in their purses lol I thought it was funny.

kAk7TOZEwiwPK1_oPopUAg.text: If you love meat, I cannot possibly fathom why you wouldn't love this place.  When you feel like being the big fatty you always knew you were, go here and indulge.   There's nothing I can say that hasn't already been said, so just to confirm:  -- The interior is beautiful and their wine selection is very impressive. -- The salad bar contains all that is good.  TRY not to spend too much time there, but I must confess that I loaded up on the cheese (parmigiano reggiano FTW) and smoked salmon. -- All of the side dishes (which are also endless) are winners. -- The meats are all very very good, but some are more impressive than others.  Their Alcatra is amazing, especially if you get an outer, crispy slice.  It's basically beef bacon.  Also, their lamb is superb -- seasoned just enough to expose the flavor of the meat.  Their chicken unfortunately falls short compared to everything else. -- Go for lunch.  It's the exact same experience for ~$15 less per person.    It's a bit pricey, (~$30 lunch, ~$45 dinner) but it costs about as much as the high end buffets in Las Vegas or a high end steakhouse, and it arguably surpasses the former in quality while easily beating the latter in quantity.    Bottom-line: Save up on both your cash and your calorie intake and then indulge like the glutton you are.

dnurwArVjbiWhrFfqoiR-A.text: Ive been wanting to try this place for years. This year was my 40th birthday and what a better place to try than Fogo.    My girlfriend and I made reservations with her brother and wife.  What I loved is when we showed up, we were seated immediately.  I've been to places with a reservation and they would say "Oh it'll be just a moment" and 10 min later...  Right as we sit down, one of our many wait staff comes over to us to take our drink orders and lets us know that we can begin our meal.  They have a huge salad bar, but I was told by a friend "Do NOT eat it if you want to fill up on meat!"   So my girlfriend got the salad bar and I ate some of the cheese. It was delicious!  We guys flipped over our card to green and it was on.  We must have seen 10 different guys come by with different meats.  My favorites were their house special, sirloin and filet wrapped in bacon.  We ate like kings!    To top it off we even had room for cheesecake.  I highly recommend this place. It was pure heaven.  It is a bit pricey though.  ABout $50 a head.  But soooo worth it!

3fNBWsRCv9yUuWP6gvBvCA.text: This is the fourth Fogo I have been to and it held up to the usual standard.  The service was excellent as usual.    The meat was great as always.  First round of ribs were great, the second and third were ok.  The lamb was a tad salty but good  The pork was ok.  The chicken and sausage was decent but those are never really that great at any of the locations.

ePQ_JxCx_87Yu0bTPl5-hA.text: We came here as a party of 13 for Thanksgiving, we come to Fogo quite often. We love the gourmet salad bar and the experience of a Brazilian steakhouse. It's super fun to try all the different meats and not get full on just one. Service was spotty on Thanksgiving, they were very busy, I get that but we could barely get water and ice tea refills. At one point, my husband walked over to the bussing station and grabbed the water pitchers and ice tea pitchers and filled our drinks. (This was after waiting a good 15 mins with no one coming back) And it was difficult to get meat! It seemed as if they didn't want to come over to our big party! A manager did come towards the end and ask us what we wanted and he was able to get the guys to bring the pork ribs and ribeye. Towards the end a server named Eric came and started taking care of our table and he WAS AWESOME! I was thankful he took over . On a day other than a holiday, service is great , the food and experience are awesome and the managers are attentive as well. The holiday was just too busy for them.

ZYKnaDDbYfggio3Fw0_phw.text: Our service was impeccable everything was great.  The food is so good and tasted great . CHRISTOPHER was so friendly.   All the staff was great .  New guy Steve kept checking in on us. Great guy . My only complaint would be that it was so damn bright in the room dim the lights maybe even toss a small candle on the table and save a few bucks on your energy bill it would really help out.

GZqziffrBhUYuromQlepcw.text: So, I really, really love Fogo de Chao, but I was disappointed with this location.  I've gone to Fogo in Dallas and Kansas City for years, and each time, the food is amazing, the service is impeccable, and the restaurant is beautiful. We always have a wonderful experience and feel that it's well worth the money.  The Scottsdale location... no. It's large, and the restaurant is nice, but the service is not good. The gauchos regularly came to our table and were attentive, but our dirty plates were not cleared until as asked, our sides of fried polenta, mashed potatoes, and fried bananas became cold/empty and were not replaced until we asked, and our cheese bread also ran out and was not replaced until we asked.  Usually, sides and bread are replaced quickly, whether they're cold or empty, and several people will ask how we're doing and if we need anything. That didn't happen here. After we were done eating, we sat for a good 10+ minutes waiting for the table to be cleared so we could get dessert despite several servers walking by.  I just wasn't impressed. It was not the good experience I've come to love. I will happily go to other Fogo locations but I think I'm done with Scottsdale.

-wZ8UvddsBdSR2rnq4a_Bw.text: I've been to a few Brazilian steakhouses and in my opinion it wasn't my favorite but it's not bad whatsoever.   Meat selection- they had around 10 different beef/pork/lamb options but no seafood like other Brazilian steak houses.   Salad bar- great selection but no sushi, or really anything interesting. Didn't see soup either  Sides- mashed potatoes were garlicky but yummy, then there was some sort of potato, and sweet plantains.    Price- Compared to other Brazilian steakhouses this place was pricey because of their lack of options.

gbNCvOifTbe3wc7gsAYOHw.text: The only downside to this place,  is the fact there are no beds next to the table to be able to take a nap before the long drive home.  I definitely highly recommend !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qqh68t39X3Qh3mbWZtu7jA.text: "....they need more meats on a stick..." - Ben Stiller as Ted in There's Something About Mary.  I think he meant they need more gauchos running around in a restaurant slicing it up for me to indulge in.    I brought a friend here for dinner.  He had never had the churrascaria experience so I thought I would help him improve his dining experience exponentially.  The first great thing, apart from the food, was the parking set up.  There's complimentary valet parking OR your friend can park a 100 yds away from the front door so he can laugh at you while you negotiate beds of tiny rocks in your stilettos.  Anyway, this location is soooo much better than the Beverly Hills one that has super atrocious parking.  To the good stuff....I made my friend order a caipirinah and I ordered a Mondavi Pinot Noir to start.  We hit the salad bar and my friend was like what is all this weird stuff.  Who cares, just dump ranch on it!  They had a really yummy apple salad that I had never tried before, but I like to load up on the hearts of palm, artichokes, and buffalo mozzarella.  Along with never having had the Brazilian experience, my friend had never had filet mignon....smh...you poor sheltered thing.  He tried the bacon wrapped filet & chicken first.  I watched him de-virginize his mouth with filet mignon.  It was pornographic.  Then we tried MY personal fave, lamb chops medium rare.  I also had the bottom sirloin which was a little too skirty for my liking.  Oh, this kid also tried his first bite of polenta....christ almighty...and he liked.  We finished off dinner with the papaya cream dessert, which was papaya blended w/ vanilla ice cream topped w/ creme de cassis, and 2 snifters of B & B.  Oh, you've never had B & B?  Kiss the enamel on your teeth goodbye, but it tastes absolutely delish!  We had phenomenal service at a great price.  I got more bang for my buck here at this location.  What I spent here on the AYCA, dessert, & booze was equal to the cost of the AYCE only price at the BH locale.  (What's the exchange rate of the Cali $ to the AZ $....3 to 1?  I love it!)  For a casual yet buzzing dining experience, bring your self-proclaimed sheltered friends here for a meaty, treaty taste fest, flip to green and it's on!

j7rYI2Da_90z-SEsSEkH1g.text: Great restaurant great all you can eat meat! I would definitely come back! And our servers Marco and Norma were the best!

yNSqp1nlCUmrPKhSVwvKpg.text: Marco, Norma and Brandon were the best. Had a great time. Will come visit again just for the experience

WIUmMmMsF74mePqYV_7www.text: I am Brazilian and grew up there, I am talking about.  Compared to their other locations this one was a little weak. First off no Pineapple and Chicken hearts. Rice and black beans were below average. That is not cool even if you have delicious lamb chops. Step it up.

lJEncTq-63m6tA2Q90SP7A.text: This place...If you like being treated like royalty this is the place to be. Every place you look there are carnivorous delights that can only be obtained here. Everything is tender and juicy and well worth the 50 dollars it cost.(33 on sundays before 2). Some body please give lou a promotion! That man is the heart and soul of this place, and constantly makes sure you dont have to lift a finger. Cant wait to be there TODAY!

UowTqDnLQ35gqT5YETL9aQ.text: Heard nothing but great things about this place. Walking the "buffet" I found one mozzarella ball worthy of making my plate. Most of the meats that made the table were edible.  I thought Brazilian bull was lowest end churasco, Fogo takes the winner! If you're near a Tucanos and looking for this style meal. Check them out, they do it right!

XvAySrl3gT1yNnj_KllCGg.text: It had been several years since we went here. We were craving the salad bar.  Once our waiter learned we were just having the salad bar, we never saw him again. We hardly saw any servers after we ordered. Guess they figured the tip would be small.  The salad bar choices have changed over the years with less choices & not as good of quality. The price was $25 a piece. Too high for what we got. We were ignored & had poor service. We couldn't wait to leave & won't be going back.

ZzhldOa9P9QkBUs4letslQ.text: Fogo de Chao is a place for the vaguely gluttonous meat-eater who enjoys watching the fine-tuned ballet of service whirl around the room with roasted meats and downward-pointing carving knives. We went for restaurant week ($44 a person with an unexpected dessert included) on a Saturday night and the giant space was PACKED. The service was completely stellar though with a host of waiters, meat presenters, clean-up crew, and managers checking in with us for the whole experience. Our waiter guided us through the experience as I had not been to this particular Brazilian steakhouse before, suggesting sauces, pointing out special items on the More-Than-A-Salad-Bar farm table, bring the side dishes of mashed potatoes, plantains and fried polenta, and making sure out favorite meats made it to our table. The salad-bar cold options table is great with items like marinated mushrooms, roasted vegetables, imported cheeses and cured meats, pear and endive salads, hearts of palm, and much more. If I was a vegetarian, this would go on my list of lunch places just for the salad bar options alone as they are much more exciting than a selection of spring mix. The meat selection was a bit more standard American fare than other Brazilian steakhouses to which I have been, but everything was cooked so perfectly it was amazing. My favorites were the beef tenderloin (for which I waited a couple times for the perfect medium rare slice), bacon wrapped filet mignon, parmesan crusted pork, and the roast lamb, that had a lovely seasoning on the outside yet was perfectly cooked and juicy in the interior. (Special kudos for Dan, one of the managers, for being so friendly, checking in with us several times, and orchestrating the return of the beef tenderloin when I missed it the first time.) Drinks are pricey by general Arizona standards, yet pretty expected by Scottsdale/city rules - I particularly loved the passionfruit caipirinha. Overall, we had a wonderful time as the food was great, service was amazing, and just watching the whole experience in the general dining room was entertainment in itself.

Lo8tB0oMBWRVhZj6UZlWkw.text: Ferrari's + Fashion + Filet = Fogo de Chao   Maybe it's just me, but I felt out of place here. Well, I am getting up there in age and no longer feel a part of the "in crowd." As we parked our car (yes, we parked our own car and didn't use the valet), we saw Ferraris, Mercedes, Escalades, BMWs and they were everywhere. My husband and I drive a Lexus, so we're not exactly chopped liver, but the car display here was over-the-top.   Then, there's the "eye candy." Granted it was "AZ Restaurant Week," so the restaurant was bustling with high energy. There were so many gorgeous young girls in stilettos and spandex dresses that were two sizes too small; I'm not sure how my husband was able to concentrate on his food.   As for the food, it was good. The salad bar is huge with exotic and high end offerings including: tender fresh asparagus stalks, apple salad, hard salami and prosciutto, shaved authentic Parmigiana Reggiano, sun-dried tomatoes, and freshly made buffalo mozzarella.   Here's how the all-you-can-eat carnivorous feast works. After you've had your fill of the salad bar, use your special coaster to let the waiters know you're ready. Flip the coaster to green to signal food service or red to take a break. Each waiter carries dramatic skewers with different meats. There are at least a dozen different varieties of beef, chicken, lamb, sausage, pork. Once we flipped our coasters to green, those waiters swarmed on us like flies to honey. Truth be told, it was overwhelming, almost scary. So we quickly flipped our coasters back to red so we could enjoy our feast. I was surprised that many of the meat selections were dry. Maybe they could set some flavorful dipping sauces on the table to provide moisture and a variety of flavors. But perhaps that would defeat the purpose of showcasing the meat?   At any rate, I can see how many people enjoy Fogo de Chao. But for me, I'm not a fan.

hdwP1IFq4qut_GJbPmgRNw.text: Second time I have been.  The first time was Valentines Day, it was packed, the service was terrible so I just thought maybe it was a bad day. Second time we planned a family dinner with our daughter and her husband and our son.  Service was TERRIBLE.   First thing we get seated, and the hostess stands their holding our menus for about 5 minutes and says nothing to us, after a few minutes we are all sitting there like what is going on.... She finally speaks and says she is waiting for our server, finally our server gets there and the hostess gives the menus to our server for our server to hand them to us.   We order our drinks, 4 of us order drinks my daughter just wanted water, 4 of us got our drinks fast, the water took about 15 minutes longer to be served wtf? Meanwhile another server at another table drops a bowl of mashed potatoes all over the floor, some other person comes and tries to sweep them up, I nearly died laughing.  So the food is good.... The meat is excellent. It's all you can eat, they didn't come take our dishes when we were finished, I stacked a few in the empty spot and they sat there pretty much the whole meal. We order desert, we order desert all 5 of us.  They bring the desert out which is also delicious, but they put candles in 2 of the three birthday deserts sit them in front of us, we have no silverware for about 5 minutes, we figured they were going to come back and light the candles?!? We sat and waited purposely to see how long it took for people to even notice, we finally flagged someone down to bring us silverware. Anyhow the food is good, our bill was $348...if I'm going to spend that kind of money I expect excellent service.  We won't go back for a 3rd time.

aB15M6kO_WR_g5qkC_gx6g.text: They don't hold reservations even when you make one.  I made a reservation here and was told we have have a few parties ahead of you and ended waiting an hour to be seated.

PzdQyF0V8K6glcgnBhePUg.text: After knowing about, but never having lived near a Fogo de Chao, I was very excited for my first visit. I visited on  Thursday night with a group of about 50. Service was dismal. I had to flag down a waiter after sitting without a drink for over 10 minutes. It took that long to get the drink & the waiter stood in the middle of the room with no idea who to give it to. We asked repeatedly for hot rolls, only to get a basket of 5 cold rolls for our table of 10. The meat was rarely brought back to the room. They would go to the large table first, ran out of meat, and never return. If we asked for rare, they would promise to return, never to come back. When the waiter came to ask what we wanted for dessert, I told him I had only had 3 pieces of meat and would like more. We finally got tired of waiting for food and, after most of our party of 50 had departed, we gave up & left too. In total I had a lamb chop, a small cut of filet, a tiny sausage, and 2 chicken wings. Not worth $50. I would have had more than one glass of wine if the waiter had ever come around and asked. I also would have appreciated not having to ask repeatedly for everything, down to a glass of water (hot rolls, hot potatoes, more bananas since 4 pieces isn't enough for a table of 10). Everyone at the table was complaining to each other that they were still hungry. I would not recommend this place for large groups. Small parties may work, but they are far too disorganized and unwilling to serve. I would not ever expect to have left hungry, but I did.

ij3Jw3wsQ5uSZ_jgSBbDPw.text: Amazing food , Amazing service! Highly encourage everybody to experience this place at least once!

iq3i8jKrum7vNeDRxVyK0A.text: Carnivores Dream or overpriced buffet?  I had eaten at Fogo De Chao about 6 years before this visit and I had fond memories, perhaps because I was celebrating my 24th wedding anniversary. This visit was an ok experience but not what I expected. When you enter the restaurant, you're greeted with warm, rich tones and textures that lend themselves to setting expectations of a fine dining experience. When you're seated, you see servers with beautiful skewers of different types of meat that look good enough to immediately get your mouth watering. That was actually my favorite part of the dining experience; the expectation of what was to come. Unfortunately, it was downhill from there.  When you're handed the menu, you'll notice there are only a few options that basically amount to meat and/or  "The Fresh Market" (aka the buffet), the new Sea Bass and the buffet or just the buffet. There were also some dessert options and some drink options. You'll also notice there are no prices listed, so you have to ask (sometimes repeatedly) to get a full understanding of what to expect price-wise based on the combination of options you choose.  When you get your drinks you might be surprised to find what you were using for a coaster, really isn't a coaster. Our server explained how to summon the meat carvers to you by turning up your round paper coaster size circle on the table from red to green. That meant that a few of us first had to take our glasses off of the "coasters", lol! I think at the other Fogo De Chao, they used plastic poker chip styled discs to call your meat server.  Since I'm not a big meat eater but was joining a group of family for a meet-up, I decided before I made my choices; I'd check out the buffet. I recall from my prior visit in another city, Orlando, there were great items on the buffet.  I was disappointed to find the selection not even up to the expectation of a good Sunday Brunch buffet at a hotel. Sure, there was salmon; thinly sliced like what one might have with lox and bagels; and there were capers and onions for good measure. However that may have been the most extravagant item on the buffet. Other than that there was your standard fare veggies, salad and potato salad. (When is the last time you went to a nice restaurant and had potato salad?! I personally don't know of any). I will give them credit for having a quinoa salad option. There were also many items without a label that I had to guess at what they actually were.   So, unless you are going for the meat, I wouldn't recommend it because at about $32 for the buffet and a drink, there are better ways to spend your money.

QrnvmxIk81Oq_eFcP_k07w.text: Now, this review is in regards to my visit on 06/11/2017. I've been too busy to write out what I wanted to say but I figure now is as good a time as any.   This was my second time at this location and I was severely disappointed. First off, I waited at the entrance for a couple of minutes in full view of staff walking by before my presence was even acknowledged. It wasn't busy or anything so I was a little confused. As soon as I called out to someone, I was met with an extremely apologetic greeting which made me feel a lot better. At least I knew it was only a matter of someone not seeing my party and myself walk in. No big deal.   The food looked amazing and it smelled great. My family sat down and made our drink orders. For anyone who has never been here, it's a little pricey so don't expect to be paying any less than $6 for a cute little bottle of beer. But it's a gorgeous restaurant and the service is usually impeccable.   I perused the salad bar and gathered what I needed to make my own smoked salmon bruschetta. The smoked salmon didn't really taste like anything. It usually has a delicate flavor that's very noticeable. This salmon tasted as though it was soaked in water for a while. Some areas of the fish were darker than others so I didn't wind up eating it.   In addition to the salmon, I opted for the chicken salad which actually tasted delicious. But I couldn't finish eating it because I bit down on a chicken bone. I was so sad! After that, I didn't trust the salad so I just pushed it aside. I didn't know what could be done about it but I did let the server know and he immediately informed who I imagine was their supervisor. Someone came to my table to make sure the bone didn't cause any oral injuries which I thought was very nice. It's not the worst thing I've found in my food so it wasn't a big deal. Besides, I was really there for the meat.   Now, on to the meat. Every single piece of meat that came out was incredibly bland. This was a stark contrast to my first visit which was phenomenal. With every piece of meat I tried, I hoped the next one would be a little more flavorful. It wasn't and that was so disappointing. I had raved about this place to my family and it left so much to be desired.   We stayed for maybe thirty minutes - just long enough to try everything. None of the meat had any real flavor so we got up, paid our bill, and made a trip to Rodizio's in Mesa because darnit, we were determined to have unlimited meats! Fortunately, the meal was redeemed in Mesa. They don't have the variety that Fogo has but what they do have is amazing and so delicious - and it's almost half the cost of Fogo. In fact, Rodizio's left such an impression that I'm reluctant to try Fogo de Chao again. Reluctant but not unwilling. My first time there was pretty amazing and that smoked salmon was spectacular.   I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.

TiHQmswPqt6VLTSh9JZSww.text: Okay...now I know I said I wouldn't go back, but my twice a year visit to Scottsdale got me here as one of the people I traveled with really want to go.  This Tim they get all my stars.   First, all the meats were excellent.  I wanted rare and I got rare.   Funny enough the person I was with wanted well done ( go figure ) and sometimes they had to wait for the next round.  Service was five star.   It appears the servers were very on top of it asking if there was something special I wanted.   Sometimes I was actually taking a break and they would ask if I wanted something special.  There appeared to be some new items circulating like pork chops and chicken breast.     But as always the beef ribs and the rib eye were my favorites.  Thanks guys for turning it around!

57ZHODnQBTGXuZ8Xs3zDNQ.text: Bring your appetite. Don't be a fool a fill up on the bomb salad bar though. Make sure you ask for the filet minon, sometimes it can take awhile to find your table.

wpgV89KKLlB7HVe7nnfFDQ.text: Favorite steakhouse ever! Luv their bread and lemonade..Servers are friendly and fast

dw-8bKB_jropL90OxbuogQ.text: Top class service. They probably don't have the best food in the area (I know it's pretty dumb to compare their steaks to Houston, Ruths Chris or Paul Martin because they are cooked differently but the info may be useful for some people), but their service is absolutely the best. The restaurant was full when we were here but there's nothing for us to complain about their services. The waiters replaced our dirty dishes every 10 minutes. They even refilled my water like 4 times when my water drop to 1/2. Unlike other restaurants where there's only 1 waiter responsible for your table, in Fogo, you can ask anyone anytime for your requests. When we asked to take our wine bottle home because we couldn't finish it. They put it in a bag for us and then seal it. VERY PROFESSIONAL.

SGITDro-vOxgSnv5_1i8Qg.text: I am a vegetarian but my family and friends are carnivores. What can I say about a restaurant that feeds you delicious, incredibly delicious food and when your plates are empty, brings you more. There is something for everyone. I am a vegetarian who enjoyed the large array of foods from the salad bar which included papaya, pineapple, vegetables of all sorts and potatoes. The servers made us feel like we were part of the family as they let us know what was good and steered us in the right direction. They reminded us to go easy on the salad bar and start with papaya to cleanse the palette and that was just the ticket. Thank you, thank you for a wonderful experience.

J-_8rQsX3uwUifhq_9R_Sw.text: The food was fine, and what you would expect from this chain. Nothing spectacular but good and what you want when you go to a place like this.  My review is a *WARNING* when you dine here.....someone in the staff is skimming credit card numbers and stealing. Two people out of three had our credit cards compromised and fraudulent charges day of our meal and day after our meal. It isn't rocket surgery to figure this out, we are from out of town and got into Scottsdale on Sunday. The first and only use of our credit cards at the same place was Fogo. Within four hours of dinner one card was compromised and the second was compromised hours later. The first fraud was a credit test at a Tempe gas station.  These are the reasons we know it originated at Fogo.  Food was fine, but maybe not at the risk of your credit and all it takes to correct.  Bring cash if you want to risk it.  Shame on you Fogo staff...

79Qd_1cBEjlMUTDvuILigg.text: We've eaten here several times and it's very good and Leo our server today was excellent.

j0QuUD-n4Dj-FzYkn9MOSg.text: First time at this restaurant. The food was very tasty The Market (salad) bar beautiful and fresh. Wait staff was very attentive.   Our primary waiter Eric however spoke SO fast and not loud enough over even the light lunch time din of the dining room that his initial spiel about ALL the food and beverages not only lasted what seemed like 10 min (way too long even for first timers!) but we were exhausted from straining to understand him.   I still have no clue about 90% of what he said.

TzuwqRhEONnuVWonmEtQxw.text: I wasn't impressed. I've been to similar restaurants and had much better experiences. Our initial server never took our drink order, never offered us bread, and didn't ask if we'd like extras. Luckily the table next to us had someone attentive initially help them.. she saw us sitting there and took our drink orders and offered bread (you share servers). Honestly, the servers were the only part of the evening enjoyable. Very attentive. The chairs are too tall for the tables (mind you I'm 5'4") making the seating uncomfortable. Some of the tables aren't located in the best spots, so by the time the passadores arrive to our table, most of what's left on the skewer is extremely bloody meat. I'm a fan of medium rare, but I'd prefer to not have a bloody lump of meat on my plate. I could've brought the meat home and threw it on the grill and it would've been better. Very disappointing. The buffet was scarce as well. I just don't feel that this particular restaurant lives up to the True style of Churrascaria that I'm familiar with. My husband and I left feeling unsatisfied and sad that we spent so much money. We won't be returning-as the area has so many amazing places to eat wonderful food and this restaurant in my opinion isn't one of them.

HDwLl1lHzTt5OmfOeoR4dg.text: We had great time celebrating my 40th birthday at Fogo de Chao. They allowed us to bring our own birthday cake that they kept in the kitchen until we were ready for it to be served. The staff was awesome and the service was great. We had an awesome time. In all we spent about three hours eating drinking and enjoying our celebration.

jRV-6MpPkbSTyFhXi4o-Ig.text: One of the best places to celebrate w family -The food is Fantastic & Service is too !  We have had several family outings here & everyone always says it is sooo delicious - & now BRUNCH !

HAeQJFem6An7TGiUsj-LOA.text: I love this place. MY only problem is, i keep the card on the green side and i get more meat on my plate than i can handle. lol But the customer service is great. If you haven't saw a certain meat you like in a while. They will ask you what would you like and they will bring out that meat for you. I love this place.

z-U0KImxdpb9H5AB8U_7vA.text: First time at Fogo de Chao. Heard from our kids that it was good.  I researched what Yelpers were saying about it and you were all right!  Our reservations were ready on time on a busy Saturday night. The place was packed. We each ordered a drink ($11 each) and settled into our table. Our waiter did a good job explaining how it all works.   We found the salad bar to be full of delights: fresh greens and various chopped salads, meats and cheeses, toppings galore and a few nice surprises, like Hearts of Palm.   We didn't overfill since we knew of the meat bonanza to come. I can pack away a hefty meal but my wife is petite and I knew I would 'lose money' on her with this place.   During the entree portion, we sampled the top sirloin, bottom sirloin, pork sausage and chicken. The other varieties came around after we were full.  We both enjoyed the top sirloin the best and the chicken the least (overcooked). The fried bananas were excellent but the garlic potatoes lacked imagination.   The service was great, if a bit slow at the end. The food was good but a bit overcooked for a guy like me who likes medium-rare red meat.

VevhaNK278sX0z47CkLgFA.text: This is probably the worst of the worst place I have ever visit. It is a combination of poor quality of food with very bad service. Literally we wait for 15-20 min to have some meat. I will never go there again.  Deserve negative stars

BxVjh7N8qy05-3cAsPbx6A.text: We had such an amazing experience both times we have been here. We had a party of 9 the most recent and we were taken care of very well by Vinh. Ask for him when you come.

I98aPu2NXavB7dPi1nYxNQ.text: Who woulda thunk it....a Brazilian steak house that is vegetarian friendly! A fellow veg head suggested it, recommended weekday lunch for the price....off we went. They have a very very nice "salad" bar. Not like put a bunch of lettuce on your plate, but just nicer. There are several pre made salads...kale and citrus, quinoa, a watermelon salad, pear and endive salad, fancy potato salads, etc. What sets it apart though is the variety of other items....kalamata olives, artichoke hearts, capers, fine cheeses, roasted vegetables, even smoked salmon.  There are so many delicious items, including soup. And they also bring a few small hot plates to your table....plantains, polenta fries, and garlic mashed potatoes.  A pleasant and delicious surprise. About 15 bucks per person. And perfect to take your carnivorous family and not have them say "you can't eat here can you?"

USuFIZr2Vv45KyXxozjvBA.text: Sooo great!! First visit to this location. Exceptional food, awesome service, my love made a classic first visitor mistake. He loaded up on the incredible market table. As usual the meats were incredible.!!

7MM6Hw5yABBFC7OhCNnwDw.text: Always a good spot for date night or client entertaining....  Foga De Chao is a pretty solid bet for your nicer dining needs. Whether you are in Chicago or Scottsdale you always get the same quality of food and service.   Brazilian steakhouses are

Fajw7UNVHkJpKhLGvLptFg.text: So went back this time for my brothers bday dinner! We were a large group of 22 and I have to say I was happy that the restaurant was able to accommodate us! I am a vegetarian so I was drawn to the salad bar/ I say 35$ it's not worth it! I wasn't blow away/the choices were very very minimal I have to say that if we are paying that much I think that they would have a better array especially fruits. My family was pleased with the meat selection but they said that they didn't get a lot of great choices till the end when they were completely full up. Drinks are expensive! The thing is would I go back- it's a 50/50 unless they improve on selection!  Ambiance was great!!

LBF4-VcdPi40-R7_mkWreQ.text: Food was awesome and our server Analaura was even better. It was super busy and we were lucky to have made reservations. They also have great wine and a great salad bar.

ORp1SLOgoS2nr0USSUJRAw.text: Love this place! I've come here 3 times this month and enjoy it so much. The servers are great and so is the food. I recommend this place to anyone. Eric and Fabi are the best servers we've encounter out of the 10+ times we come here!
