mITKnE00gfJWZ-TvtrpJiw.text: We have been to this location frequently but this visit was very disappointing. The meat was bland. First time I ever needed to use a salt shaker there. It was tough and took a long time for meat to come around. The salad bar was good. The best part of the meal was the polenta and Fried plantains.   The Manager told one of the waiters he could go home because they were slow. This was a Friday night. Definitely wasn't worth the money. Huge disappointment. Come on Fogo you can do better!

n22s0uJFiuEFs-rhgd0Q5Q.text: Went there fathers day weekend and was not impressed. First, we made a reservation but still had to wait like 15 minutes to be seated. They know how to take the reservation but not hold it--Seinfeld style.   Ordered fries for my kids that came out like 20 minutes later. Salad bar came complete with dead flys as protein; manager didn't even have the courtesy to come out apologize for the dead insects in our food. They gave us four options of meat that rotated every 20 minutes, and when they did stop, they gave us chunks of fat, or a slice of meat so thin my toilet paper was thicker. Paid the $100 bill and left a zero tip. I never do that, but the waiter looked like a deer in the headlights when we showed him our food. An apology would have been nice for giving us poor cuts of meat. I wish i spent the money at Longhorns or Yardhouse. You won't catch me dead in this place again. I'm upset I even have to write this. I hate writing.

K8Hkn6FHf8iWabt1onqgvw.text: I created a Yelp account just to let everyone know how amazing our server was. Ana-Laura was an outstanding young lady with a big smile who made date night perfect! The food was amazing as always.

OhCx5pgtGmZuWUccvIdyzg.text: My husband and I were so excited to try this restaurant. We decided to celebrate our anniversary there tonight.  I am so disappointed.  First, the table was in a corner and very small. The noise level was high and the pace or vibe in the restaurant seemed very rushed or frantic.  We remained hopeful that the food might be worth it.  Unfortunately, the salad bar was decent but every piece of meat was dry and tasted the same.  Even though I noted it was a special occasion when I made the reservation, not one person said a thing or even asked. If you are considering this place, skip it.  It's not worth the hype at all.

gTUHVTYOfvRWUrh5S6Pgbg.text: Wow!! Deceitful and unethical behavior.  My husband and I had been wanting to check this restaurant out for over a year now and were very excited about going. We get there, tell our waiter it's our first time and it starts out great. The salad bar is amazing and the meats start coming. That is when the manager, guys in button downs, come by asking if we want any kind of meats or sending different cuts our way. The food is great! But then this man comes to the table and tells us they just started a new dry rub steak and we have to try it and asks us how we would want it cooked. We were super happy with the meal, everything was delicious, the rolls everyone raved about were fantastic! Then the bill comes... We see that the steak was $75! We were never told there was an additional charge for this steak! I bring it to the attention of my waiter that this is a considerable amount of money for no one to mention prior. He apologized and agreed that it was a large sum not to be told about, but proceeded to bill us the full amount and think nothing of it. Then on the way out we saw the man that had told us to get the steak. He said he had told all the tables that night and we were the only ones that had a problem with the additional cost and we obviously didn't understand what he was saying. We told him again that he did not tell us the steak was extra and again he acted like it wasn't his fault and there was nothing for us to do. I am so shocked!! This is robbery! Insane that they would sell addons at the table without them knowing the additional cost until they get the bill! What if we didn't have the $75 extra to pay for it? This was a special occasion and I am not rich by any means but even if I was, I would still want to know when I am ordering something that is not a part of the regular dinner. I will not be coming back and will definitely be warning others! This is so deceitful and unethical that this restaurant is treating their patrons this way. I was a server for years and could never image doing such a thing.

X8RNHsq0IeLm49kuvZT4Gw.text: Make sure that you save some room for dessert! As good as the main course is, the desserts are excellent. My favorite is the Key Lime Pie. The presentation is top grade and the taste is a slice of Florida heaven!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Key Lime Pie

PgUWdbtsgy6eHH81sqz0TQ.text: 7:20: "I'm checking in for my 7:30pm reservation under Samantha." (Hostess gets last name, too, to confirm reservation).   Hostess: "Ok, I'm just waiting for one of my hosts to come back."  *stands to side of host stand for a few minutes then moves to waiting area with seats*  7:35: "hey, just checking on the eta for our reservation."  Hostess: "who are you?"  Samantha.   I don't see your reservation.   But we just checked in with you.    No you didn't. Last name?   *gives last name and phone number*  Oh I see it now. We can seat you now.    The food and service AFTER being seated was excellent. Host usually gives off first impression of an establishment, though, so that was lackluster. 5 stars for food and rest of service, 0 stars for hostess.

xaG3cYK_k9OubTs4WxXctw.text: We made a reservation days ago and it was still going to be a long wait.  In fact there were dozens of people waiting with the same issue.  What's the point of a reservation if the restaurant overseats and doesn't honor it?  I don't care how good the food is (and I may never know) because I won't dine someplace that treats its customers that way.  Thanks for ruining father's day!

nyz2r_OzZXn3zeu0xOpSvw.text: First, we may have reserved for a little more people than we asked, the employees took that so well and set up another table very quickly. Second, our server, Ana Laura, was amazing, cheerful and very knowledgeable about where she worked. Overall, GREAT first experience and definitely will be back. Thank you Fogo de Chao!

fhDNYD2olirK8yPn6GtYHQ.text: This is an experience! A fun treat every once in a while. I was a little surprised when we got our bill. They charged us $6.95 for spring water. Which didnt taste any different than tap water. There was no warning that we were getting charged for water! BEWARE of hidden charges (my reason for 4 stars)! We started out with the salad bar, which included in the dinner price of $59.95. Then came the meats...we had parmesan pork, house special sirloin, garlic steak, sausage, chicken legs, top sirloin, bacon wrapped sirloin...there was probably more that we didnt try. All of the meat was tender and cooked perfect...melt in your mouth good. You can buy wine by the glass or bottle. They have a large selection of beer, wine and mixed drinks. We of course had to end our meal with dessert. Hubs and I shared a strawberry cheesecake. It was as big as my head! So delicate and yummy. We would go back, but most likely on a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The huge strawberry cheesecake!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We got these delicious rolls. I thought it looks like a mouse. Lol
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The shrimp cocktail...you get 6 jumbo shrimp.

v-HXC5CgVzJrRbKM9TuH_Q.text: My experience at Fogo De Chao was exceptional. The staff was great and the concept of the restaurant was unique and fun. The drink selection was also good consisting of classic drinks with their own special twist. Definitively going back!

8U-u1fOieOlelEAmlyYF1w.text: Just had dinner here, served by Anna Laura she was amazing and added the sprinkles on top of the carnivorous experience...

gHTxWfuOTXnVnaOlcwf4iw.text: I went with a group of 6 for lunch last weekend for a very special occasion.  We had a great meal and experience overall.  The entire staff was EXCEPTIONAL.  The manager, Clair Napier, was extremely accommodating and made everything more than great for our dining experience.    In addition, Chris Rachford, went above and beyond by making a dessert which is no longer on the menu that was a favorite of the guest of honor (a little girl) at our lunch.  Other members of the FdC staff were equally great! Angelica was very attentive and came by our table regularly to make sure everyone was enjoying their meal. And Kate, the hostess, helped us setup and personalize an "end of lunch surprise" for the little girl.  David was great as well.  We will be back!

Zht3nbKU22p0xQMCECnRJw.text: Wow, what an experience!  I went to Fogo fifteen years ago and loved it.  Surely it wouldn't be as good as last time, since the restaurant is grown up and has become a chain.  Yeah right.  This place is just as good as last time.  Everything.  Top quality across the board.  Food, service, ambience.  Top notch.  It was literally the highlight of my trip to Scottsdale.  I talked to the owner John and told him I'd be coming back again soon.  If you haven't been to Fogo recently, give it another try.  You will be very pleasantly surprised.

vxJaN0W6hD_I3HnnV-fffw.text: The food is great! The meat just keeps coming and coming and coming. They have all types of options for meat including beef, chicken, pork, and lamb so there is a little something for everyone. My tip for first time goers is to pace yourself while eating. They are going to constantly be coming with more meat but you don't have to eat as fast as they come. That's how you not get full ten minutes into the meal. Also save room for dessert because the  cheesecake is HUGE and amazing!

Ti2z4I-ORdOOC-rPI2nB8A.text: So over priced it was ridiculous. The food was nothing special. So maybe people went for the atmosphere? Because that wasn't great either. We paid for the whole experience,  which included the "salad bar" My husband waited 20 minutes before they finally filled up the Salad.  The beef, honestly was not even good. Tough! We were even charged for a refill of coke.  Give me a break. Spent over $140. NEVER EVER GOING BACK

-_Yf0AYyTDBXQ54ah-TAvg.text: Full disclosure I am a vegetarian. However, I'm not one of those walk in the room and declare to everyone I'm vegetarian. Instead I'm the quiet kind that surprises my coworkers by asking to join them for lunch. I happen to know steakhouses often have amazing sides to compliment the meat so when the opportunity presented itself I was definitely in.   Fogo did not disappoint. The salad bar had lots of delicious veggie friendly options. Everything was well prepared and fresh.   What made me really enjoy this place was while it was upscale it was never stuffy and the service was impeccable. If you are eating meat you have a little card you place red side up when you want to be passed over and green when you want the server to come over. When my coworkers cards were green I don't think they ever waited more than a minute for someone to cut off a piece of meat. This was one of my coworkers first visits and he said everything was delicious but his favorite was the Parmesan pork.

U-3KTWnFR-7Ao1hTAswmFA.text: We went on Easter Sunday. They sat us in a back room, which was not a problem. The problem was that the meats never made it to the back room. We had to tell the waitress,  then she had someone bring us beef. We asked for ribs and other meats but I guess by the time they got to back they were all gone. We got the same sirloin meat, once chicken and once lamb. I asked for ribs 3 times. The waitress brought me a small plate with two small sliver of ribs. Their was 6 of us. The salad bar was great!

KX3O4u3gN7SrM1UAuOxZqA.text: Come to this place with an empty stomach and a hearty appetite! Even vegetarians will leave full after serving themselves from the awesome salad bar. The Fogo waiters descend on your table offering you selections of various beef, pork, chicken, and even lamb selections. Like your meat rare? Medium? We'll done? There's a selection for you. Even on a day when the restaurant had 200 reservations, my party of 13 experienced great service. Even though it's pricey (lunch is over $40 after you factor in tax and tip), it's worth every penny!

vnikpqiciHBoH2mLpZ9fjw.text: Our second time here was for a birthday and the service was not great. We had a reservation with it being a Saturday night and still took 30 minutes to be seated. When we did get seated the food took a while to start coming around and trying to get a drink refill was not happening. We had asked our waitress twice, the person refilling water once and finally a manager came by to ask how our meal was going -that's when we got our refills. Our reservation had stated we were celebrating a birthday, yet nothing was said/given though plenty of other tables had desserts with Happy Birthday written on them. Was a completely different experience than our first time and very disappointed.

VlB9QpqJUxfiaCp2kWYPAw.text: Well folks if you like meat this is the place to be!   Brought my brother here for his birthday to celebrate. I did reserve a spot to make sure we have room.   So they bring you bread and oh it's delicious! Also they bring you mash potatoes on the table & refill it whenever you need it. Also there's a buffet style so you can get what ever you like. There is soup, salad, salami, cheese, rice & etc. they give you a card and you flip it over when you want me and when you don't want anymore you flip it again. If your card is not flipped to receive meat they will not ask you. They do have a lot of choices. They also have chicken, sausage, & etc.  they don't cook the meat well done which I like. Also later after 5:30 they bring other meat like chicken wrapped in bacon & other unique options.

6WOpv9rCaIaf3ZiLfFzGFA.text: Here come the meat sweats, people. Like most traditional Brazilian churrascarias, Fogo de Chao offers an all-you-can eat experience, starting with a buffet-style salad bar, which puts most salad bars to shame.  They go beyond the boring mixed greens and put out a huge spread of cheeses, fruit, rice, soups, veggies, potatoes, toppings, etc, etc, etc, etc, etc etc, ETC. Then there's the Brazilian cheese bread, served table-side (my favorite), along with fried sweet bananas (my second favorite) and oh---I almost forgot the multitude of servers walking around the dining room with skewers of freshly grilled meats ready to fatten you up. At the tables, each diner has a two-sided card at their place setting that lets the wandering meat guys know whether or not to stop by and offer you whatever it is they're slicing up. You just flip the card to let them know how you're feeling. One on side, it basically says "BRING ME THE MEAT", and on the other is something like, "LEAVE ME THE EFF ALONE"... I don't remember exactly what is says since I didn't flip it to that side all that much.    The variety of meats is pretty impressive. Lamb, pork, steak, sausages, chicken and even different cuts of meat.  If you have little self control, you may get into a lot of trouble.  As for the quality of meat, it's pretty standard...so, don't expect prime or the best product--it's all-you-can eat, after all.  Servers aren't assigned particular tables (it's pooled) so anyone can help you.  I wish we were told that initially, so we wouldn't have spent 20 minutes trying to find the first random waiter that took our drink order to get another one. I was pleasantly surprised at how big and busy/boisterous the restaurant as a whole was.  Our two, loud-mouth, chatty, tornado toddlers blended in just fine.  Oh, and the best part?  They eat for free.  Kid-friendly ALL THE WAY, baby.  It definitely makes the $50-something price per person (for adults) so worth it. Romantic and intimate?  Not so much. But it sure has that somewhat upscale, modern and sleek look that makes it feel like you're about to have a fancy date.  Then it's pretty much like the DMV but without terrible attitudes from the staff and the lines here actually move (I'm from CA and don't remember what the equivalent is in AZ is and am clearly too lazy to google it at this hour).  Overall, we had a really good first experience.  We'll definitely be back, wearing stretchy pants (and no shame), and eat our weight in grilled meats and cheese bread. So, I suggest you do the same!

xSighc1SrTDCg9vKIcKYdQ.text: Everything was DELICIOUS. From the market table to the waiters coming around with every different kind of meat you could think of, It was worth every penny.

jujSjyWoWmW6ymBy0NIieg.text: Thank you, Analaura! What a great dinner and service we had!  Everything was delicious!  That filet mignon was the best!

8v9WzBN9xWXqrrmMhpr7Ug.text: This WAS my go to resteraunt when I had a special event. Went there 1/3 for my birthday. What a disappointment. Food was great as usual, but when you spend $100+ for lunch it is not only  about the food!  To start with the restaurant was FREEZING. It was my birthday, and stated so on the reservation. Every other time I go for a special day, the hostess acknowledges it. Not this time. I asked that the stuff they put on the table not be there as my wife and I do not eat it. It just goes to waste. They put it on the table anyway. The staff is usually friendly and attentive. Not this time.   I wanted the NY strip and was told by my server they do not have is. I told her they do. She came back 5 minutes later and said I was right, and said it was on the way. 10 minutes later, still not there. The manager stopped by. I told him I was waiting on the strip, the place was freezing, and the service was bad. He said it was 50 degrees outside and he would check on the steak. Never came back.  I gave up and asked for the check. She asked if we wanted dessert. I said it was my birthday. They give dessert on birthdays.....usually. Not this time!  Better service at Golden Corral. What a waste of $100.

5avsiWeYb7Q5GiQVjTy8sw.text: Meh....  Way expensive.   They want me to write more but I think I captured my feelings exactly.

f5qQ-QHOhl-37XNXoa_HPQ.text: I went her for my birthday.  We went all in with the Fogo de Chao Experience.  I was very satisfied. The meat options included garlic sirloin, bacon wrapped sirloin/chicken, ribs, filet mignon, and more.  They were all delicious, tender and had authentic flavor.  The salad bar did not disappoint either.  The options were exotic, and typical, but all was fresh and flavorful and paired well with the meats offered.  At then end they provided complimentary cake which was so moist and delicious as well.   We ordered a bottle of wine and this was my only complaint.  The bottle I chose was one of my favs and I normally get it for $12 at the store.  They charged $46. I feel like this is overpriced.  I don't want to pay 400% over retail for anything.    Overall, the experience was everything I could have imagined: food quality above expected, service was amazing, drinks below expectations, and I would definitely go again.

7jNlPGD3Z4B4dY3ObqRy7A.text: Great selection of meats, highly recommend the Parmesan Pork. Nicholas had great recommendations. Will be back vey soon

yeivjsimLH8CyjAlptmhGA.text: Definitely A class service.  Though everyone was great Samantha was our main server and was fabulous!! She frequently checked in to ensure everything was on the up and up, cleared our tables promptly, and was just a joy to have as a server.  Thanks Fogo

dF7zeci9_lN9KkBhM_thWw.text: My husband and I went here for the first time for our wedding anniversary (lunch) and wow, we were so impressed! First of, THE BREAD IS AMAZING! It was soooo delicious, I've never had anything like it before! The plantain was also good but the steak is the star of the show. The rib eye is my favorite, so tasty and juicy. The beef cuts are very good. Stay away from the pork, it's tough and not as flavorful (rib and sausage). They have a great selection of veggies and fruits. The staff is amazing and friendly. They always checked on us and we even got a free anniversary dessert. Definitely an amazing experience! 5 out of 5 and we will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iZJWCAphu59wSX-ieMKTgQ.text: Been wanting to go for a long while. I was impressed with everything that I ate. All meats were cooked perfectly with the star of the show being the lamb. Both cuts I had were outrageously good. I really loved the sausage also and really wish I could find somewhere to get that around AZ.   The brazilian sides were a really great accomplishment to the meats. I stayed away mostly from the market-table as I was there mostly for meats. Though everything looked good.   The service was outstanding. I have never gotten service that good before. They constantly went above and beyond during my whole meal. I literally was able to get everything that I wanted because I didn't even need to ask someone they came around to insure that I had everything I needed.   I will absolutely go back without hesitation. I look forward to it.

VlqO_TAu6w8RHJG2YecQbg.text: My husband and I are eating low carb, and we thought this place would be perfect for Valentine's Day. We made reservations, parking was pretty easy, and we were seated exactly at the time we reserved for.   It may have been because it was Valentine's Day, but the place was just so chaotic. It took about 10 minutes before someone finally brought our drinks. The tables are also super close so you can pretty much hear everyone's conversations around you. The restaurant itself is very nice, but it's a bit awkward walking to the salad bar when you're just inches away from someone else as you're trying to navigate through. It kind of reminded me of one of those more formal dinners you have on a cruise. We also heard someone arguing with one of the waiters about already giving another waiter their card for their bill, so be sure to keep your eye on who you give your card to! That was probably just a random and unusual situation though.  The salad bar was pretty great. They have cheeses, salami, bacon, and other salad toppings. The actual meat serving was neat too. You're given a card that you can flip up when you want someone to bring meat to you. They have different types of steak, chicken, and pork. If you make the amateur move that we made, you might eat a bit too quickly and be done with the whole experience within 30 minutes.   The prices are on the higher end. It's about $55 for the churrasco experience (unlimited meat/salad bar) for dinner, but drops to about $30 if you go during lunch. There's also an option for just the salad bar experience which is about $25 at dinner, but I don't think that's really worth it.   The place was a fun experience, but I probably won't be back.

gZ3KSyDJGh6jtt4_bctRvA.text: Food quality is awful, over priced, and just a rip off for what you get. I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody, I've been twice and both times it sucked.  The was rough and over cooked both times I went, the atmosphere sucks also, you might as well go to an actual steak house.

92jQPKtia4_kMq2Y1fb-qg.text: Food was yummy but service was a bit slow. Had to wait for about 10 mins just to receive my hot tea. Servers were also slow on taking used plates off of our table.

BhzJDba-K2Iwf9ekVTMaMg.text: We were so excited for this experience, but it fell flat. The service was sketchy, giving them a pass as any place can have an off night. Food was delicious. I could have just eaten that roasted pineapple all night. Then the service got really weird. One of our servers offered gratis dessert because of the weirdness that happened while getting seated. When another waiter noticed my husband looking like he was not enjoying his experience (we weren't), suddenly we had more meats table side and pleasentries then we could handle. My husband asked for rib eye and they all disappeared again. It finally arrived after asking 2 different staff and the original server coming back to ask if he had his rib eye yet. Clearly he had not, but it had been long enough to where he could have already had it served and consumed. I asked the 1st server for the desert menu when we had finished with the delicious main dishes, she brought it, explained the options and then poof, again. Finally the other server came over and asked if he could bring us anything else, it was so disjointed, we were not sure if one knew what the other was doing, we were pretty sure not so much. Husband asked for the check, when it came he said they gratis my husband's iced tea for the wait at the beginning. Really weird. Most people seem to be having a special occasion (birthday, special event) and seem to be really enjoying themselves but we were just there for  Saturday date night dinner and to experience the service of the meat and it just did not seem special, so in that regard it's really not worth the price of admission unless you're experiencing a special occasion which we may do again because we really did enjoy the healthy options at the buffet sides bar, the roasted pineapple (a keto no-no but I threw caution to the wind) and the sauteed onions and mushrooms accented the meats perfectly. Pretty sure we will try again, it was that tasty.

FbG3Z30x9ImZ8pn13XpAyg.text: Not impressed at all.  To begin, the girls at the front desk yell out people's name for tables right in your ear.  The dress code...there is none.  Wear your best pair of ripped Jean's and Van's shoes and you will fit right in.  There is zero ambiance.   They do not have menus.   They have guys walking around with community meat to your table.  The place looks like a banquet hall with a big salad bar that made me feel like I was at Olive garden.   We couldn't even stay to eat because we were so turned off by this place.  Heading over to Dominic's or Fleming's for a real steak house.

kw4s4hPkKzUzGV0XXYaY7g.text: Our family's favorite Brazilian bbq in AZ!   The service is always AMAZING and food is always sooooo good! It's hard to find a good restaurant with amazing service. A busy establishment like this one at that! We've seen even the General Manager wait on tables not on just one occasion but a few!

4kbitSRDOUQJsqUt3_1iNA.text: Wow.. didn't expect that! So disappointing. We ate at some of these restaurants in the past and very enjoyed but this time it was just not good. The meat was very dry and tasteless. It felt like we were sitting in a cheap diner and not a fancy restaurant. We will never go back to this restaurant and I certainly do not recommend for meat lovers.

rbm5uRmyTwM3Gh00Cs2Xjg.text: Absolutely LOVE this place!!!  A family favorite and go to place to celebrate.  The food, staff and atmosphere is perfect for all occasions.

Z68XEiLfTMtvuMslNgHe0A.text: Great food and awesome customer service from Vicente!! Thanks  for the fabulous meal.

AAizlzDaRj2HutySsoGylg.text: Oh. my. gosh.  Terrible experience.  Neither my husband nor I could cut any of the cuts of beef - and when we finally after several minutes did cut a piece it was not chewable.  We tried every type of beef offered and even mentioned it to the waitress - but they could only say, "Sorry to hear that."  They could see our plates.  We both kept saying, "We will try again."  But it was not chewable and filled with so much stringing unbreakable gristle and fat.  Both parties on either side of us were saying the same things.  I think we were all surprised that it was that bad.  My husband and I did eat the chicken and pork which were edible but not very tasty.  I have never given a poor review on Yelp. But Fogo seriously needs a new chef there.

oDsqh1nXsFUNbMeg_3JTJQ.text: This is a different twist to a regular steakhouse. The staff was very good and extremely fast and organized. The atmosphere was great. They carve meats right onto your plate from large metal skewers. Awesome flavor from the different meats. The salad bar was unique and different with cheeses and meats and a rather large selection. It's pricey but over all worth the money. Enjoy!

Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oHS17LOA134lqort01FgLQ.text: This is my second time I have eaten at this place and I can honestly say I will never go back. I seen the real last night 3/27/19. I took my friend for his bday and lets just say is was horrible and we spent $263.47 for the most gross meat I have ever eaten in my whole life. The meat smelled like they were killing the animals in the back and putting them on the grill to serve to us. We never received a server so the whole night who ever passed by is who we had to flag down just to get those boxed mashed potatoes and that nasty looking dessert. I'm not sure why every piece of meat they serve smells the same but that's gross. When i woke up the next morning my husband poop was so strong I almost ran completely out of our house. It's 10 hours later and my stomach is so swollen I'm considering going to the emergency. I wouldn't recommend this place to my enemy. Complete disappointment for the price. I will never go there again!!! Also I did not leave a tip cause I had no server to leave a tip with.

F51N5RmagtLyeUJFVh1WkA.text: Good place with great food. But everytime we have gone the service is horrible. There are too many waiters to keep track of that serve you. With Our last experience they bring around side dishes like mashed potatoes for your meal. After a while we had gotten some but then we never got anymore. The manager came over to talk to our table and asked if we wanted more potatoes. We said yes. Still never came. Another waiter came over to check on us we asked for more potatoes and again still never came. In the end we never got more potatoes to accompany our meats. Then they were asking if we wanted to try a sample of a red wine infused drink. I got one. Then our bill came and that little sample drink was $12!! Probably should mention that it's not a sample!!! Then also when we got our bill they tried charging us for a whole bottle of wine when I only got 1 glass. Then on top of it we had to wait over 20 mins and ask 2 different people for our check. Like I said good food and fun experience but service sucks!! I would expect better service with how high priced the place is.

Dc2BWy04gUUibz7e1oHICg.text: Found myself here for a second time due to a work dinner.  We had the opportunity to work with their banquet staff due to our large party in their private dining room.  First of all, if you need to make special arrangements due to coming here with a large party, this place has the best deal.  We got 2 drinks included with the meal (not limited to only wine and beer) and a wide choice of desserts were also offered within the cost per person.    Overall, a pretty good range of good quality meats where you need to come hungry and be ready for protein night.  My favorites, filet mignon, rib eye and lamb chops.  You get the best bang for your buck when sticking to steaks and lamb verses filling up on chicken and sausages.  But chowing down on their cheese bread is a must since it's incredibly delicious!  Service was outstanding when handling our large party and we got top notch attention throughout the night.  Carvers make sure to ask what meat temperatures you like and remind you to get your tongs ready to grasp your meat when they cut!    Perhaps there could be some improvement in the salad bar (ceasar salad gets pretty soggy quickly when sitting for awhile) but overall, Fogo de Chao does a really nice job all the way around.

y7pUn4K-UsATQcMlzvaNSA.text: Came here to celebrate our anniversary,  first of all they have a complementary valet which well it's awesome !, pwe made reservations therefore we basically just had to arrive and they gave us our table super fast!!! Once we were seated the server came to us offered drinks then we went off to the salad bar which I mean had everything and anything from veggies to cheeses to cold meats and salmon, so much stuff to choose from!!! They also had other hot sides I believe I saw rice and black beans but tbh I did t try any of that so can't tell you about it, anyway we had everything and anything I mean from the lamb to chicken and steak it was all just perfectly cooked super juicy and well seasoned, we even got free dessert for our anniversary and I ordered the cream Brule which was just freaking amazing! I seriously fell in love with this place, my drink never went below half empty, servers always up to what we were needing the (manager) or Someone came out to ask how everything was and honestly it was such an amazing experience! Will be back !!!
