v6feP4q2DPZmPHqHlmmKig.text: We absolutely LOVE the food here and have been in multiple times but I have to say,  last night was extremely disappointing from the moment we walked in until we left.  I had my newborn with me and requested a sling.  The gentlemen set it down and watched me put the baby into it securely then mentions that it might not be a good place to have the baby in because it would be in the way of the employees slicing the meat. So then why would you put it there to begin with and then wait until after I put the baby in it to mention that??!!  Second, a waiter comes up to the table numerous times while we were waiting for our guests being very aggressive and trying to up sell us things we were not interested in. We were there for the delicious Brazilian meats not seabass.  He was very rude and arrogant in the process. We had to ask multiple times for items that were missed or never brought out at all.  However,  given that it is a team effort where you get multiple servers that come up to the table I can see how things might be  miscommunicated. That leaves me to the final and the most disappointing part of the evening.   My father in law drove up last year  from out of town for his birthday and liked it so much he drove into town again requesting to come back to this restaurant again for his birthday. Last year I spoke to our server as well as a manager explaining that we would like to surprise him with a molten chocolate cake for his birthday. It never came out.  They offered him the desert menu,  he chose the molten chocolate cake,  they brought it out with no candle or birthday at all.  I approached the manager asking what happened.  They apologized,  came up to the table and told him they were going to surprise him with a desert.  Ummmm, when you tell someone about the surprise is not really a surprise plus we already had the one that was supposed to be a birtday. So they basically ruined the entire moment.   Last night I arrived early having a conversation with THREE people including another manager explaining what happened last year and basically begged for it to not happen this time.  Unfortunately that was too much to ask because for the second year in a row the same thing happened!!!!   The best part was apparently they were closing,  the servers were circling our table like sharks impatiently waiting for us to leave.  Meanwhile, I was still waiting for them to surprise the guest of honor with the deserts we preselected and spoke about. Our main server said no one mentioned it to him but after speaking to 3 different people I can't understand how this happened,  AGAIN!!

gOzIqcAE-lAxzH58T2ob1w.text: Awful. Awful. Awful. If I could give this place 0 STARS I absolutely would. First, we were celebrating our anniversary we walked in and the hostess was being absolutely rude to a patron. We were sat and the floor beneath the table was dirty, the table itself was dirty and we were sat in a corner. Second, the waitress knew nothing about the wine. She kept trying to get us to purchase a bottle of Malbec which we weren't interested in. Third, the salad bar was measly at best. It was so weak, and there was hardly any "salad" in the salad bar. It was an awful experience we will NEVER go back. Needless to say we left before eating anything. Save your money, go somewhere nice, and spend it on QUALITY food, great service, and a clean restaurant.

HMHW_-opjZm8RgEcrWhAmA.text: Disappointing experience for a birthday... service was terrible, we were passed over for food service and after 3 reminders about my son's birthday, they forgot!  For the expense, definitely not worth it!  I will never go back again.

6wkjVfPI9nxNYl-5y9F1sA.text: Absolutely remarkable. Being a certified carnivore hungry for all sorts of exotic animal flesh, Fogo de Chao delivered an array of finely cooked meats that allowed me to indulge my primal desires. Those meats were paired with healthy servings of mashed potatoes, fried plantains, and a salad bar filled with all sorts of green foliage I merely looked at. I cannot recommend this restaurant or the experience it offers enough.

na3PlSusyRH2A2cBD_w47w.text: This was definitely an experience. I have never had Brazilian before so I didn't know what to expect. The restaurant was very accommodating as our party size increased from 10 to 12 right before our reservation was booked. They switched tables for us and we were seated about a half hour later than our original time.  When we sat down to eat, I was slightly overwhelmed by all the meat brought around. Everything tasted good- but nothing was so amazing it stood out more than the others. The fried bananas were good as well. I'm happy I had this experience but I dont think it is worth the price.

ZGO_bnKq4DTAT73XgsUX_A.text: Fogos presentation for their food never disappoints. The staff are always very friendly.

vwN_X9MekOWjbGdIZeM4yA.text: Loved the experience! Went there for my graduation and everything went great!! I loved the way I was treated and the complementary dessert, Thank you!!! Will be returning pretty soon!!!

IrgzKSrnDWaisuaYOYESfQ.text: Great restaurant. Wonderful ambiance and the food was amazing. Took my hard to please husband there for Father's Day and he was very happy! We all enjoyed it! Pricey but worth it!

lkc14FGCDE8q_bkR8WE6bw.text: Was at the Scottsdale location and what a great experience. I never do reviews but I had to for this place. The atmosphere was beautiful and so was our server Angelica.  Her attention to detail and her friendly conversation made the experience perfect! Thank you Angelica. Michelle from Texas see you next trip.

yApvF7jV-Gwg5P5lZ2U2Kg.text: The service was amazing!! The food was not my cup of tea. But kudos to the service and management staff.

KW6MjCTa9_Tn66jLwPlz4w.text: I recently had the worst experience here. I had a large amount of family flying into town to celebrate my uncle receiving an honorary doctorate at his Alma Mater. The culmination of the weekend was a surprise dinner for him at Fogo. As a professional event planner, I emailed the private dining salesperson (who was lovely) and together, we made the decision that sitting in the main dining room would be a better option for my group because we didn't want to be married to a minimum spending amount since my lovely 85 year old grandmother was treating. Although we did not get the private room, we were informed we could come early to set some menus and decor on the tables.  When I arrived to the restaurant at my reservation time, I was informed that my table wasn't available. What? I had made a reservation and my entire family was on the way. I peered into the private room and it was not occupied. So, a lovely hostess found the "manager" and asked him if we could use the private room. He gave me some schpeel about we can't because of a myriad of different bogus reasons and stalling and then my husband and I finally sorted through his BS to hear that another group would be coming in.   Okay, no worries- that makes sense. BUT Then, the "manager" proceeds to tell me he was actually lying and that there was no group in there tonight but he didn't want to give us the room because we are not "his" customers and had previously contacted the group sales manager (as one would). He said "his" customers can get the private room at any time with no minimum or anything. I said "Great! We would love to be your customers, we are here now and will definitely have a bill of over $2,500. He said no once again because we aren't "his" customers.  What? Isn't everyone in the restaurant "his" customers? His pompous attitude and aggressive demeanor COMPLETELY ruined our night, had me fuming and my husband minutes away from going off on this pretentious snob. He continuously talked over me, insulted me and never once apologized. Congratulations Fogo on ruining a once in a lifetime event for my family and uncle.

3DbzcZD_hE1hScxLYgLXSw.text: Bring an appetite.   High end dining. Quite expensive but you won't find many places like this.   Love Love Love  Grilled meat  Grilled pineapple  More grilled meat  Delicious.

Sohv1BHUGfRpeMcroChm8A.text: I've tried various churrascaria restaurants throughout the our-- Las Vegas, Miami, Colorado Springs etc., so I am comparing FDC to them. The staff was friendly and outgoing, and  I felt welcomed. The food on the other hand, was okay. Sadly, It did not knock my socks off. I hoped for well flavored meat, and the meet served did not meet my expectations(left me looking for steak sauce). The buffet was well organized and offered great choices of sides. Moreover, the mash potatoes were tasty and helped the meat taste a little bit better. Dessert was pretty impressive, I had the cheesecake--it was rich and very flavorful--it had drizzled strawberry sauce, which complimented it well. This restaurant is okay, but way overpriced when compared to other Brazilian steakhouses.

ybCu8sa1px65rgZYkSLcMQ.text: Excellent food, the salad bar, while very good, was not what I was expecting. Reading the reviews made it sound like a HUGE offering of everything you can think of, which is not True. I will say it was good, but I stuck with just taking tomato slices and some of the hard cheeses. The meat that came around that blew my mind was the lamb, not the bone on lamb, but the lamb meat skewer thingy. So good, seriously, I am not a fan of lamb, and this lamb was so good I kept asking for more (which they kindly oblige). So the salad bar options aren't huge, but damn, the meat is crazy good. You will enjoy this place if you eat the carne good stuff!

FVHufu2NpowMsgfTD13LSQ.text: I felt like a King...but at a king's price.  I had the meal, one mixed drink, and coffee and tip....$78  By the end of the meal, my head was spinning and I was dizzy with the excessive hospiality, the over abundance of great food, great service and good coffee.

QAedRyonVERK_Cm6o_4SQQ.text: Service mediocre for how many staff was present. Salad bar was eclectic and not necessarily in a good way. Meat was likely good for those who don't mind medium rare to rare. Molten cake appeared to be purchased elsewhere, like a Sara Lee cake. The atmosphere is like a Vegas buffet. The price does not equate to the experience or the quality of food.

dP6I24DfMoCM6xc6_vQfQw.text: Subpar experience: Two things were clear during a visit to this restaurant for dinner on March 11th (1) if you don't make a reservation you're met with a very lousy/snotty hostess attitude (2) after a long wait, you're place in the furthest backroom - very uncomfortable seating arrangements with poor service.    I was in a group of 7 and the table placement was poorly done with constant interruptions from people trying to squeeze through between table chairs, given the very close proximately with other tables.  Our main server's attitude was decent but slow at best.  Actual meat service was almost none existent, in fact when the meat service would enter this backroom area, they didn't have enough left on the skewers to even make it to our table (except for less popular items like pork sausage).  Only once, did the crown jewel "filet" make it to our table - with very little left to just serve a couple of us and a broken promise of returning with more.  It was clear, this section of the restaurant was treated as an afterthought.  Multiple times we complained about this fact with only slight improvements being seen.   The food itself was good but I'm completely floored with the per person price tag a better customer experience wasn't made a priority.

vjdZyHW-XjQ24vPUI0XjMQ.text: Authentic and Delicious.  I tried not eating all day in preparation and still could not come close to tasting all the meat.  Salad bar is great, drinks fantastic, and amazing service.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JkKV_r5q56Z8e6IDJOki1w.text: Great restaurant. Both food and service was amazing. I expected more from the salad bar but I was there for the meat anyways so it wasn't a deal breaker. It's pricey so this place is good for special occasions. We will definitely go back. Go hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meat meat and more meat

BF8r1v18JL1mi7aww3yMug.text: Food was excellent. But most impressed with the customer service manager Lou. Lou went above and beyond.  Very nice to have somebody care that much about his job and customers.

y680DxKw6LHHD8g7Hi_wmA.text: This place was completely mediocre. Maybe I'm a buzz kill but the meat wasn't even good. Most of the meat wasn't marbled well, and was rather sinewy. My girlfriend has been to another location in San Antonio which supposedly was better. There was one thing that was really pleasant about this place, the bartender, he was a former army guy (17 Delta I think).

OK8S0REeSwHgvoLL5sTe2g.text: The buffet items were fresh and flavorful, all the meats were excellent-juicy and flavorful, cocktails perfect-not shorting customers on alcohol pours, the service was outstanding-always present and assisting, even management made themselves constantly visible and asking if we needed anything... an excellent dining experience!!

RjcjI4nCcYveI48id_Hh3w.text: This place is very expensive, but you get your moneys worth.  I was actually taken here as a guest of my aunt and her husband and I felt very guilty because even though I do eat meat, I feel like I did not eat enough to make it worth it to bring me.    The salad bar is amazing.  Its top of the line food including mozzarella balls as big as a child's fist. The thing is, if you are there to eat meat, then don't fill up here as the big show is next.    You get coasters that on one side are red, the other side is green.  Think of a stop light, red is stop, green is go.  Men with spits of meat will walk around and ask you if you would like a cut of what they are serving.  There is beef, pork, lamb, chicken, and sauages walking around.  As long as you are flipped to green, they will keep coming.    When you are finally done with all that meat and you somehow amazingly have more room, then totally go for the desserts.  They are out of this world.  I got the tres leche cake.  So amazing.  Along with the pinot noir we got, this was a very decadent meal.

8Humd0RfNVmRvvg66j-1TA.text: Hubby & I took the parents and two other couples here because Durants was booked (Saturday night). So, everyone was in the mood for meat- and I believe Fogo delivered. It took awhile to get the waiter to come around and explain the process to the 'newbies'-Drinks with the pao de queijo (warm cheese bread) was a delicious start.Salad bar was fine, but seemed the attendants were a bit slow to get the items refilled/replaced. After that, though- everyone was thrilled with the array of meats that flew off the skewers when the Gauchos came around- all the meat was fabulously done.  Some of our party ordered desert- but I favored the caramelized bananas . Everyone really enjoyed the experience, no doubt, we will all return.

qmaVeeRrNDUkKgHrd3dT8w.text: The food is good. One little problem: the check suggest 3 options for tips, 18%, 20% and 22%, That is fine, the problem is the tip is calculated after Taxes... which increase the check by 10% or so. Why should one tip on taxes? Not cool.

-wJEZn-HTgl1UxjmEsmsag.text: "Where do you want to go for your birthday?" "That place with meat on swords!" ... Said the manly carnivore that I call my boyfriend.  Fogo totally lived up to the hype and was for sure a unique dinner.   The salad bar is epic in proportions. It's the size of my living room and family room together in length, multiplied by 2 because there's food on both sides. There were at least 10 things that I had no idea what they even were, but they were delicious vegetables or cheeses of some sort. There is a freaking barrel of parmesan cheese that you saw off a hunk yourself, for God's sake. It's amazing. I could have been happy with just the salad bar.  Then the meat. Yes, it really comes around on huge sword-like knives, and they cut you off a hunk of at your chosen temperature. I only sampled the top sirloin, rib eye and filet mignon (sad, I know), but Carnivore McGee got through 13/16 meats and by my calculations, ate over a pound and a half of meat. It was all delicious by his standards. Ladies, if you want to entertain yourself at dinner, bring your man to Fogo and watch him go from blissful looks to saying "Must... eat... just one more piece!" and struggling to force himself to wave away the servers.  The service was great too; we had no problems as some others did. There are a couple waiters who are actual waiters and manage drinks and checks and such, and there was always one of them within eyesight. The meat never stopped coming either, it was continuous throughout the hour we spent on that course. One of the meat servers (he's got thick wavy black hair and an accent) was a total sweetheart and chatted to me about how I liked my cocktail (one of their Brazilian sugar cane liquor ones) and educated my boyfriend on the 3 different cuts of lamb, and even ran back to the kitchen specifically to get him a sword of one of them. THAT was wonderful service.  Oh, and to take the mystery out of the prices (they don't list them... anywhere... "If you have to ask, you can't afford it"), here you all go:  $29.95/person at lunch, $49.95/person at dinner.  Tip: Be careful with the Caipirhinia cocktails; they are extremely strong, and they are $13.50 a pop. Some sticker shock ensued with that one when I got the bill!

KB9UW3Lce5l8r7f6E8L7pA.text: I wish 0 stars was an option. Very, very disappointing. Maybe it's because I'm used to the Brazilian spots back in Chicago. I seriously had to ask for everything. Can you bring us more bananas? Can you refill our water? Our bread basket is empty. Jeez. I can't even use the excuse of them being busy because there were so many empty tables! The cuts of meat were horrible. They all tasted bland. The prices are high,  even for lunch and although I understand why Brazilian restaurants charge what they do, this place in particular is not deserving. I'm never going back and am spreading the word.

jKH8E3bGMwS4qJ1gbeXIAg.text: Amazing experience. Great food, awesome service. Try all the meats, request anything they have. Anytime you have an issue just ask anyone and its solved.

Q4ap3JmQy8otbruqLbWYZQ.text: I wouldn't go here on a date night, and it's not a place to take someone out for business, but if you have a family of hungry teenaged boys then it's the perfect spot for a birthday dinner.    The interior design is just okay, a couple steps up from a cafeteria.  But that's not the reason you are there.  The reason you are there is the all-you-can-eat meats.  And if you have sons, they will eat your money's worth.   I've read some reviews, and yes the steak is not the same as Mastro's.  Who's expecting that?  The steak and other meats are decent, and given how fast my kids were eating, I am not sure whether they tasted anything anyway.  And while some reviews cite poor service, ours was really good.  The restaurant operates under a team concept, so you have multiple servers.  A couple servers were especially good.  If you are sick of Benihana, and you're looking for a more upscale all-you-can-eat buffet for teens, this is your place.

nbCvQbMdLSAA_hVPROr21Q.text: An orgy of red meat and excess followed by two weeks of cleansing and fasting.  Try to not think of the starving children in Africa as you go through this debaucherous exercise.  I feel like I need to go to 'confession' every time I eat here.  Savor the Picanha.  Addendum:  It's an hour later and I feel horrible.

dnx0CklJ0vPMr9IF7sg58w.text: Consistent offerings of service, food, atmosphere and drinks is what makes this franchise successful.   No matter whether I'm at Fogo in DC, Baltimore or here in Scottsdale, I get the same gut-busting food and well-made drinks in a place where I could either wear a suit and tie or jeans and a t-shirt.  A specific note on this particular location- there were a lot of families with small children on this particular Friday night. No judging, but I've never seen that at any other Fogo. Fogo back east is really "date night" or the kind of place to pre-game for a bachelor party or a business dinner, but not to bring infants and toddlers. Possibly a by-product of its location on Scottsdale Road in a strip mall near a few hotels. IMHO, this is not the place to bring kids, but I respect the rights of anyone to do so. If I was traveling w/ kids in tow and I didn't have a Fogo in my city, it'd be hard to pass up. In any regard, it did not bother me in the least. I was too wrapped up in my company and the food and those drinks.   You will easily spend over $75 per person here including tip, so prepare to camp out, eat slowly, enjoy your meal and be treated like royalty.  The house special sirloin will make you rethink how to prepare sirloin at home, it's that good. Don't fill up on salad at the salad bar- you can do that at Olive Garden- but do enjoy the cheeses, mushrooms, vegetables and cold cuts which raise the salad bar. Did you see what I just did there?  Nice wine selections here. Ask for a Brazilian red to enjoy with your meal if you have the coin.

78MZ5Zp0PK8-LxihCgDzUg.text: Even if your not a meat-eating machine this place has an A-M-A-Z-I-N-G salad bar with top notch ingredients and cheeses and everything your little heart could desire. The important thing to remember when you go is to make sure you go hungry because it can be a little pricey so you want to get your moneys worth of food.  I had been wanting to go here and my work held a business dinner there which allowed me to make it happen. We had a private room in the back which was really nice - made it feel like we were in our own restaurant almost. The staff was so attentive and I love the green means go and red means stop cards you get to show if you want more meat or not. I would forget to turn mine over to red and before I knew it I had every type of meat on my plate.   They were delicious, but I feel like you always end up overeating at this place.

oGwl1u4P7RjScWRxPgvdLg.text: Meat meat meat!  This place is perfect for a fatty like me.  All I do is sit there, flip the card to green, and my plate just fills up with MEAT!    The food here is delicious,  the last time I was here,  I was pregnant and I didn't feel right leaving a review because everything I ate had to be burned.  This time around,  I asked for medium rare everything and it was DELICIOUS.  I had expected the meat to be salty, but it wasn't salty at all.    The meat sliced through so easily,  the flavor was awesome,  and I LOVE LOVE LOVE the garlic beef!  I also got a little bit of their basil salad dressing and dipped a few pieces of meat into it, and oh man, it was heaven.  Speaking of salad dressing, their salad bar is one of the best I've had.   I love their tomatoes, their cheeses, their salmon, their salads, and the basil salad dressing is a must have.  Don't eat the chicken, it's dry, and that is all :)  I would definitely recommend this place.

gFxQrCndcTWrQV3MoxzlBw.text: I've been to other locations many times and te service was a lot better. This location took a while and while going to dinner by myself, they ignored me a bit. Not impressed but still good food.

poedcaMUF1XQvaY2IclJbA.text: I went to Fogo de Chao last week during AZ Restaurant week with a couple of friends. Unfortunately, this place didn't really rise much past mediocre (read on)  Fogo de Chao is a typical, although nicely done-up Brazilian steakhouse establishment. The building is grand and colored in nice deep earth tones. It was a Saturday so it was packed, but nonetheless, we had reservations and were seated quickly once the whole party arrived. Brazilian steakhouses aren't really my thing, but I've striven to be impartial on this review.   First, the salad bar. There is a nice selection of things here including fresh vegetables, prosciutto and a giant parmesan that people hack into. So, on to the first two major demerits:  There was smoked salmon on offer, but the particular slab on offer here was frozen. At these prices ($19.50 just for the privilege to graze the salad bar, but comes with the normally $46.50 free-for-all per person price), this is a screw-up that is not even close to being acceptable for a simple salad bar setup, and of course the price compounds the level of disappointed that I reach. I know that Americans are into big, but the parmesan was puzzling given that this is a block of cheese that is either shaven or grated, or enjoyed in deliciously rich chunks. It was impossible to get a nice shaving out of this thing as there were no decent implements to get into the parmesan well.   Second, the meat service. There was a nice meat selection, and overall the meats were of good quality and quite tasty. However, I did notice that the cheaper cuts of meat were much more plentiful and forthcoming. Our table actually had to actively ask for them to send over the lamb, pork tenderloin, and beef ribs. We were also told that some of the cuts were unavailable. The complimentary sides were delicious. The cheese bread, polenta and bananas were lovely.   Dessert was just uninspiring, boring, pre-fabricated crap. It was free so I can't complain too much, but in normal circumstances they're probably charging in the high $9 to mid $10 range for a thin, crappy piece of what I think is anything but homemade cheesecake with an uninspiring combination of HFCS, sugar, red food coloring, and a couple of strawberry seeds that was the sauce. My friend had the chocolate mousse cake which was equally uninspiring and crappy. I'm not expecting a superstar dessert, but at least make an honest attempt at quality.   The booze is WAY overpriced. $12.25 for a "Premium Caipirinha" ... are you kidding? And, to boot, one of the things that pisses me off to no end (and results in major loss of critique points) at high end restaurants ... BILL ERRORS. We had a total of two cocktails and were billed for four. Simply, unacceptable. We weren't even brought a revised check before we handed over our credit cards for payment, and what's worse, not even an apology from the server regarding this $25 whoops on the bill. The only saving grace of that incident is that we were charged correctly in the end.  So,   Overall:  C to C+                Fogo de Chao has a lot of potential to be a great Churrascaria                as it bills itself to be. On this particular occasion it didn't really                rise much past mediocre given some borderline egregious                 failures in service and food quality. Some plus points for                great interior design though.   Food:     B-      (Big plus points for great meat. Minus points for the                           piss poor attempt [if I can call it that] at dessert, and                           frozen smoked salmon on the salad bar)   Booze:  C-      ($12.25 for a Caipirinha? Give me a break!)  Service: C     (Service was overall good. Near failure in service for                        the bill error. The only saving grace was their                        responsiveness when we asked for something specific)

rE9flIjobHxIU9Cc-sfmJQ.text: Food is amazing! Salad bar is alwts well kept and clean. The servers are friendly and very attentive. The Gaucho chefs always ask how you would like the steaks cooked and if they didn't have it they returned quickly. Great atmosphere! Go here to eat

CIh4XqbZBZ3w6aJDkonTmA.text: WOW is it good here. Love the decor, the location and the food. Excellent service at all times. You really get what you pay for.  100% recommended.

6b9FpkDMge1pw6l8ntjVSw.text: Have always loved this place, but the last visit could have been a lot better. The meat was over cooked and the service below par. The tres leches was to die for though!

YQ_0egnboy8Q1hDRuBus2Q.text: We took company from CA here because they are big meat eaters - we are not - but heard about the great salad bar and were not disappointed there - it was wonderful.  Our CA company loved the fun of it and the food and the experience.  We would take company again although it is too much for hubby and me - we are not meat eaters - we did try the chicken wit our salad bar and enjoyed that - tasty - we are normally fish eaters.   I do suggest a try if you want something different.  The service was good - somebody at the table all the time - the side dished okay but not memorable to me.  The salad bar I will remember - thank you. We did think it was odd they did not come by and ask us if we wanted dessert or coffee at the end of the meal - we almost always have a coffee - maybe the four of us would have split a dessert to celebrate a little but we were handed the bill and her hubby paid before I realized what happened - that seemed rushed - with no menu and no one else appearing to have dessert or coffee that may be the way it is.   Thanks for an overall fun experience - our company was happy.

w49lMPQXk3BQgk4cvO4A_w.text: Underwhelming and over-priced.    Mrs. Wanderer became a fan of churrasco, Brazilian barbecue after eating at the outstanding Via Brasil in Vegas last year so we popped in Fogo de Chao to see how they compared.  Answer: not favorably.  The best thing about this place is the physical appearance of the restaurant but it's all downhill from there. Two star food, one star service and a four star price.    The salad bar was just okay but really nothing to get excited about. We were much more interested in the meat courses than messing around so after a perfunctory pass at the antipasti we had the waiter clear our plates and waited for the meat to begin.  And waited. And waited some more.  Waiter after waiter walked by us, huge spear of meat in hand, head down, studiously ignoring us.  We finally managed to flag one down by literally, yelling.  We didn't know what else to do since we'd been waiting at least ten minutes for somebody to serve us and we were hungry.  We finally got some meat and it was fine but then the same thing happened on the next course.  For the next hour we played this game where the waiters would walk by us doing their best to avoid eye contact and we'd try to intercept them.  It's very hard to avoid concluding that they are really not that keen on giving you meat here which kind of negates the point of being a churrascaria.   The three sides were all mediocre and unmemorable: soggy microwaved bananas, mashed potatos and fried polenta wedges.    For this kind of money, I'd much rather eat at Ruth's Chris or Morton's.

w2E_HZW52V9IxyHqJwyhBg.text: Flesh Fest!! If you love meat, you'll enjoy Fogo De Chao.   Our fist encounter with Fogo De Chao was in Houston a couple of years back. We were both impressed with the service and the food. Since then we have visited Fogo De Chao in Scottsdale and have loved every minute of each experience.   My husband and I came here for our first year anniversary. We made the mistake of eating a huge breakfast at Bill Johnsons Big Apple. One shouldn't do that if you plan on going to Fogo De Chao.   For New Years Eve we again visited Fogo De Chao with some friends. Service has been impeccable all three times we went (both in Houston and in Scottsdale). Our wine and water glasses were never empty and our table was always clean. The wait staff were kind and always remembered our favorite cuts of meat. The Lamb Chops are my favorite. The Bacon Wrapped Fillet Mignon is to die for!  I am a definate fan of Fogo De Chao!

T-2pNoqZF5lMT-lW8ONBtw.text: I'm not a big meat eater, but my god, if this was my last meal on earth, I'd die a happy (and uber stuffed) woman. My friend was visiting and she's from Argentina so this was kind of similar to the way the meats are prepared over there. We decided it would be wise to basically starve ourselves (with the exception of water) before our dinner at 7. We also decided to skip out on the salad bar and went straight to the meats to ensure that we could get maximal stuffage in our bellies. They also give you an unlimited ammount of yummy sides (mashed potatoes, sauteed bananas, polenta cakes and this awesome cheesy bread that was so moist and fluffy). Since there are over 15 choices of meats, I'll only name the ones I really liked and ones you might want to skip.   Good meats: top sirloin, filet mignon, filet mignon wrapped in bacon, flank steak, sausage, and lamb chops (I am not a lamb fan, but boy was this good)  Skips: chicken wrapped in bacon, lamb shank, and pork tenderloin (only because ours happened to be dry)  The guy that seated us gave us helpful tips and pointed out this place is similar to other Brazilian buffets but with better looking servers. Agreed =)  One of our servers told us the reigning champion is a 115lb woman who ate 12 lbs of meat on her birthday (with 2 plates of salad, and a plate of desserts). Gross. Steve Nash apparently can only eat 5-6lbs.

9ejaUoxOgMtV1wmMLarkYw.text: so this is what its like to be treated like a king. from the moment we took our seats til the last bite of the "chocolate molten cake" (which im going to say is a definite must), we were in awe of not only the setting, atmosphere, and delicious meats/treats.   before our wonderful dining experience (or might i say carnivore adventure), i had no idea what to expect... but, between the delectible sun-dried tomatoes (or you could pronounce it,, sun dried tom-ah-toes) and the filet mignon there was an outstanding staff ready to serve.   what i recommend:::::: besides all of it..... -sundried tomatoes -potato salad -cucumbers -filet -top sirloin -pic-kanye??? -and a must.. pitcher of sangria amazing way to end an amazing night... happy 3 year babe ;)

xYmk_XrE-bNLf3dMprBFSg.text: Simply like no other place. The service, the food, and entire place are awesome. The lamb chops, oh my God, do delicious.

4csvywUZ4QeRpnbGB4XEYA.text: Great service!!!! Customer Service manager Ryan was awesome! Will defiantly bring a group back : )

qZrhsrz6QQr9SAbOpn_rww.text: I went here for a celebratory dinner, and it worked out beautifully. I only eat chicken so I decided to forgo the meats portion and just get the salad bar... I was glad, because after 1 1/2 passes at the salad bar I was filled to bursting! The other people in my party went nuts over the meats though! The waiters were incredibly friendly, and fellow patrons as well- when our neighbors at the next table found out we were celebrating they sent over a bottle of Moet :) Would definitely come back with more meat-eaters for special occasions.  Oh and P.S., I got the Superfruit Lemonade cocktail (I think that is what it was called), and it was delicious!

ywG971_YGgV8l_L3wXkIYw.text: This place always amazes, salad bar offers fresh unique and tasty choices. The meats are definitely the star here, all of them are tasty and perfectly cooked. If you want rare, you can get dark red and bloody, if you like well done it's just a slice away. Deserts are perfectly acceptable and usually compliment your dinner perfectly. The only downside is, soda is served in 10az cans that come to 2.50ish each. I racked up just about $10.00 worth of diet coke, but I didn't come for the coke and the meat was so tasty that it really didn't bother me, maybe it should have. This is a great place to go for those celebration type outings, guys will probaby appreciate it more than the ladies, who probably won't eat their monies worth. Bottom line: if you haven't been, you have to try it at least once, and probably twice, and maaaybe three times if your pockets go that deep.

b2SdoegilQi_tDwPPbJ_Lw.text: Meat-astic! As an uber-carnivor, Fogo is one of my all-time favorite dining destinations!

UqzQcABzZBmN73fhrnk9UA.text: Wow, this place rocks! Great atmosphere, fun and fantastic food. The salad bar is unlike anything I've ever seen. Surprisingly, the never-ending parade of perfectly prepared meats is as entertaining as it is tasty.

X9sQDcdnGbHTAIUKst6xGw.text: Holy meat in your mouth Bat Man! Where else but a Brazilian style buffet can you have an orchestrated meat orgasm. Brought to you all at the flip of what should never be confused as a drink coaster. With the flip of the red/green"coaster" we were immediately assaulted by six meat wielding servers. Everything from fillet, to lamb, to the most incredible chicken wrapped in bacon. Yes my friends bacon! This place is the closest I have come to man vs food.  Not to be forgotten is the salad bar. The salad bar is a vegetarian delight in a carnivores lair. Decidant cheeses, fresh vegetables, pastas, and starchy concoctions to satisfy your inner vegan.  The service was outstanding, even with the $50 a plate cost. I have several meat-a-terian friends I will be sharing Fogo with. After two hours, a salad bar, and fifteen meats later we all left in what felt like the third trimester of a well deserved "Food Baby".

_ahYS0OoeUBje_14p4qX_A.text: Meat, meat, meat, meat, meat! Did I mention meat? This place is a meat lover's paradise! However, I am not a huge meat person, but my bf is... so I knew that I had to take him here. He absolutely loved it. They bring the meat by the table on huge skewers and side it right onto your plate - the ultimate meat indulgence!   My only complaint was that all of the things I really wanted to try like the filet minion for example, barely came by our table. While other types of meat like the top sirloin and bottom sirloin were constantly being offered to us. I felt like I was just waiting and waiting to try certain menu items! Fogo needs to work on varying up the choices that pass by the tables. Other than that, no complaints. The buffet was awesome, drinks were superb and when the filet minion finally arrived at our table it was perfectly seasoned, juicy and tender... yum!!

YzZnBrh4wjpKrHBosPSXUQ.text: Service was phenomenal and food was so great what a wonderful experience  Melissa  Christoph,Norma, Dulce, James, Antonio, Tiffany, Tyler,& Brian was over the top. It was so awesome to know people and not just get served from the kitchen with a waiter or waitress, we got served from people, it's a nice pace for a different place for the Redmond's. Dope, Dope place.

px2G7EVL4afzVLCNhNoOkA.text: My husband and I had previously dined at the Fogo de Chao at the Denver location with our family.  Once we had booked our anniversary get away I was pleasantly surprised to see that there was a location at our chosen vacation spot.  I made a reservation a few weeks before our visit and when we arrived on a Saturday evening we were seated within 10 minutes of our reserved time.  We were seated and served promptly and made our way to the salad bar.  Excellent array of choices from lox to fresh fruit, definitely a highlight of the meal.  The endless amount of meats that are offered were amazing.  Unfortunately our night ended abruptly due to an unexpected reaction that I had.  Marco (the Manager) and his entire staff were more than accommodating to our situation and took excellent care of us both.  We will definitely be be back to this amazing establishment our next visit up to Scottsdale.  Thank you Marco for being so understanding and wonderful to my husband and I!!

mqjPK7MUi39KUzj_8zVNFw.text: Just had dinner here and it was such a great experience. The staff was so quick to serve and entertain every question we had. Thason was so nice and attentive. I've never had better service than this. We had a very good time.

6-tQJoVCe4RPsdqZYnpYMw.text: Our experience was great! The service was fantastic and very attentive even with the wait. Food was amazing, but Norma our server was great she went above and beyond for us and for myself and my gluten allergy!!!

Uq1Ow9QETR1ViLUVGKByeQ.text: I'm not an all you can eat steak kind of person, but for Valentine's Day I decided to try it out for my husband. Walking in the decor is beautiful. The servers are all dressed as if they're about to hang out with some bulls in Brazil. I love character dressing, so it impressed me. They sat us down immediately. One of the servers in our area explained how it all works. He said that we could start at the salad bar first or turn over the card to the color green to start the all you can eat meat "buffet". We decided to try out the salad bar. The salad bar itself is incredible. It has this amazing caesar salad, olives, roasted red peppers, charcutterie, cheeses, and the most amazing potato salad I have ever had in my life. Honestly, I would just eat there, but at last - I had to try the meat.   We flipped our cards to green and immediately someone came by serving us pieces of meat. It was delicious. We had parmesan Pork Chops, Filet Mignon, Top Sirloin, Lamb Chops, and some type of sausages. Besides, the parmesan Pork Chops, it was all really delicious. After the amazement died down, we both realized they kept coming around with the same type of meat/poultry. You're allowed to ask for what you want, but even then it took a WHILE for that to come by. You would think that most of these meats would have a medium rare option, but most of the time it was well done. And who eats steak well done? It's just too chewy at that point. Other times, it would be on more of the rare side. I understand that you can't always cook meat perfectly, but still. There really should never be a well done option.   Of all the Brazilian steakhouses I've been to, this by far the better one. Next time, I would come when they weren't as busy and spend more time at the salad bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green for meat!

8nfRHslLElrbBjU3ViJSOQ.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. Can't say I was enthused, but I tried a lot of the food anyway.  I'd have to agree with a lot of the reviews regarding the service. We waited a long time to ask for the bill, to receive the bill and to essentially get our cards back.  For the food -- it was okay. I have a few pieces that were inedible and found that there were only a few cuts of meat that were good (in my opinion anyway). We had the (I'm assuming) manager directing the guys who cut the meat to tables who complained about attentiveness to their demands including us, but once he intervened, the service picked up.  Okay experience and not worth the money. But my boyfriend enjoyed it, so it was good on that part.

kV2grc_CBBClrK_JpjmRLQ.text: Alejandro was the best meat server there was! He kept bringing around filet mignon because he knew I enjoyed it and was very pleasant to the whole table. Thank you for the great service !

NM0qVpjcjl1b2URVWz8xMA.text: Do you like meat? Do you love a great atmosphere? Are you human? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, you need to go to Fogo de Chao immediately. Seriously, like right now. Stop reading this review and go.  Ok, welcome back. I'm sure you're as stuffed and immovable as I am right now. I weep that I am not Shakespeare, for I cannot put together the necessary words to adequately describe how amazing the food was and how awesome our customer server Lou, was.   Firstly, the food is phenomenal. I was expecting merely adequate meat with the whole gimmick being that the food is never ending and that they cut it at your table. I could not have been more wrong. The meat, the seasoning, the lingering, smokey flavor was simply the best I ever had. It took all of my willpower not to ask the server to take the slice of meat for himself and to leave the skewer. Tonight, while I am in the midst of a meat coma, I will be dreaming of their top sirloin and filet. (Sorry Kaley Cuoco, Fogo gets top billing tonight).  One aspect that guarantees that I will be coming back, too often for my bank account to recuperate, I'm sure, is the customer service. Derek, our waiter, did a great job of explaining the protocols to my wife and I as this was our first time there. But it was the Customer Server Lou, that really stood out and made the night memorable. I have experienced a lot of restaurant employees who checked on you simply because it was their job to do so, but Lou really cared, this was evident from his first introduction. He treated us like close family and ensured that we were cared for and well fed. I was celebrating a promotion, but Lou definitely stole the show. I can't say enough nice things about how great he was and how relaxed he made us feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A welcome surprise

3BZL9tsa1fw74Nzwt_7L1g.text: Wonderful and classy environment. Went for my birthday and got a free dessert! Didn't get a whole lot of options for main course though which was disappointing, but still good for what we did get.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

J0HMgPEoOTJEZAv-pmarjA.text: Update review. Came here for Restaurant Week, the only time you really get any discount here.   Gone is the whole wheel of parmigiano. New addition of feijoada with farofa. It was fine, not spectacular.   Complimentary dessert during Restaurant Week. Got a tres leches cake which was pretty good. Overall meal, good value, meat was good as usual. Still the best churrascaria out there.   Like I wrote before, always get the picanha. And keep it on green.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Picanha, always picanha.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Feijoada, not bad.

45rM9l-faQPgO2B8yszQlA.text: The team at Fogo De Chao is so accommodating! We bring a large group here several time a year and everyone is so easy to work with. Danielle Heywood is their event coordinator and she couldn't be more pleasant to work with., and the rest of the team is equally as flexible and fantastic. We will continue to bring our groups here and I would recommend this location to anyone  who needs private dining for a small or large group. Thanks for being awesome team Fogo!

00TE7cDKbyuqblolaat2bw.text: Brazilian Steakhouse - what does that mean, great food with a multitude of flavors. It also means that they bring out their meats on skewers and carve to your liking.  There is a salad bar available, my suggestion is to get the salad and sides because when you start the meat portion you will need to mix it up a little.   Turn your card to the green position and let the meat induced coma begin, my personal favorite is the bacon wrapped filet and garlic sirloin. The lamb chops are also a keeper. Keep track of what you get because it will start to look the same.  Would suggest on the first visit to try all the meats to see which one you enjoy. Don't eat everything but conserve your appetite so you can try as many things as you can.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Going Green!

aXsIDNlXs6PZ56FMpgyU4Q.text: NO I DON'T WANT ANY SIRLOIN! Please give me the money meats, and not offer sirloin 10 times first. I regret not sitting in the dining room. Big mistake. The meat jockeys just go to the main dining hall, then give you whatever is picked over. Great food though..

P0ytAT-bS51trdaF1JzY7Q.text: Perfect.  I was unsure about this place because it seemed to "out there". But I went with a group of friends and it was excellent.  They have a small but very well made salad bar.  Their appetizer are pretty good too.    They main draw here is the meat, you flip these little coasters over from red to green and they start bringing you lots of meat.   I mean a LOT!  and it always good, always.    The service was also amazing, at one point we had a waitress just standing there waiting for ask to "need" something.  I wanted to sample a drink and they gave me the drink for free! :D  I had a great experience and will come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Super good salad bar!!!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice place!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meat cooked in front of you!

f75gx0BwW_Qxc3wLT3tlgQ.text: Excellent food. Service is immediate and the attention paid to food quality, preparation, and service is amazing.  Mango Ginger Martini is fantastic.

Os4BALhV0AH2du6jm2xdVA.text: This is THE BEST MEAT YOU WILL EVER EAT!!!!! When my husband or friends want to go for an extra special outing this is our go to. There is not a single thing I can say bad about this place. Yes it is on the expensive side, HOWEVER you get 100% what you pay for. All you can eat wonderful beef, pork, lamb, and chicken, unlimited sides, salad bar that includes items like smoked salmon, totally a luxury indulgence.  Best advice, go for lunch Monday-Thursday. They take off $20 from the all you can eat.

Z8Kz-p8_WxnRpIr8HgHx7w.text: Service unbelievable meat yummy .,polenta,so-so, good friends, drinks amazing. Also just makes that special occasion more special

Qvh6Ur1QHJ8PcAhsPyicPQ.text: I like this place for the experience but it's been hit or miss. I've been to Fogo many times, three times in the past two months. One of those times is was fantastic, one was average and one was a disaster.   Good food if you can get it. Avoid this place on a weekend when it's packed. I saw one person serving meat in the entire restaurant on several occasions one Saturday night. They seem to care only about serving large parties and probably selling drinks more than anything. Then when someone asks what meat I would like to try, they don't come back. I brought two friends for the experience and left embarrassed.   On a good night everything is wonderful!  Salad bar is pretty incredible. Huge selection of fresh veggies, salads, meats, cheese, etc. I'm tempted to just get the salad bar if I go back.   Bottom line, if you haven't been there you should go. Like I said, maybe try it on a weekday when you get better service. It's a fun experience and be sure to come hungry!  Enjoy!

ebJAPeGqlNaqdTTqv_JtUw.text: I have Been to 3 Fogo locations and always have a good meal.  Of course some or more solid than others but all are pretty consistent.  This location had one of the most attentive staffs compared to Vegas, and KC.  Drinks were nice and cold and though it was a bit expensive I'd say it's worth every penny. Fresh free fresh meat!!!!   Pause!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The aftermath of my 3rd plate!!!

9BkQTe0BWL7dJvAIBis3UA.text: Dear Fogo, I love your food and the service has always been great, with the exception of today's experience. In the first hour I was there I had to ask several times to get anyone at the table. I get it, you're all busy and it is lunch time, but it shouldn't have to come to me calling the manager over to get service at the table. Maybe it's because it was lunch time and we were sat in the middle of the dining room. So, for future reference, don't go for lunch, because you'll be ignored. I'm so disappointed, I wish it was better, I don't know if I'll be back, even for dinner. The experience has left a rather poor taste.

ophWjvmP3gPG8C9KC3oGBg.text: Went there for the first time, was introduced to the Cuisine experience and amenities by Danielle Heywood (thank you to that talented lady). The fresh, healthy, gluten-free choices, delicious flavors and seasonings coupled with the incredibly friendly service from Juan... all the staff, made for an exceptional experience!  I will be back soon!

tEYuE_AvckIX6CJVEZgb1w.text: I've lived in Brazil for 2 1/2 years, worked at a Brazilian Steakhouse and been to many gatherings for Barbeque at Brazilian friends' home's over the years, and while this place is not perfect, it is very good.  Food quality: 4.5 Stars I can see. taste, smell the freshness and quality of every cut of meat and the salad bar.  Service quality: 4.5 Stars Front desk is average. Gauchos and Servers are great.  Price: 3 Stars If dinner was $30 or $35, we would probably go up to 10 times a year. As it is, I can only justify going 1-2 times per year, outside of when they send me a coupon.  WHY SO MANY POTATOES???? Scalloped, baked, potato salad, mashed, etc.  Trying to fill us up so we don't eat so much meat?  I thoroughly appreciate the salad bar, even though i only put a few things on my plate before i let the meat finish me off.  All of the meats are prepared with great attention and detail. I even was able to try the leg of lamb and lamb chops.   Picanha and the Filet Mignon were my absolute favorites, while the sausage was unique and tasty too.  Take your time and don't let them run you out before you are done. At times, I feel they are trying to just turn over my table. When i am footing a bill well over $100, i feel like i should feel the service saying "fica a vontade", which is not always the case.  I will likely return for my birthday...or any other time they send me a coupon.  Fogo, thanks for "matando saudades" of Brazil for me.  Obrigado.

1l3Excrgh1rssjcmmhxlzw.text: Tried this place last night, walked in with a reservation, the place was packed and so loud. Had to squeeze through tables to get to our table that was so close to the table next to us we could have joined in their conversation. My bad for not knowing that there is no menu. The meal consists of salad bar that's can't even compare with a Sweet Tomatoes, and then the second course is meat, and meat, and more meat. I guess if you want dry chicken wrapped in bacon that's okay, they also have sausages, flank steak, rib eye, pork and filet. But for the most part our table saw lots of chicken, flank steak, sirloin that had way too much salt on it. We did manage a thin sliver of rib eye, and when we had to ask for horseradish it took a long time to get it. The desert, they do offer several choices. We had key lime pie, not exceptional just okay.  Okay then the kicker, the bill came for four of us it was 389.00 without tip, I know what your thinking, and no, we only had one drink per person.  So I rate them just two stars, if you want to try it make sure you know how much it costs.

bCfNhgm39kGJIxETcMCTRA.text: We've been to a Brazilian steakhouse before and were really looking forward to it.  We went to celebrate a birthday and were so disappointed.  The service was incredibly slow and disorganized. Some of the types of meat never came around to our table. There were not many choices of meat and some of it was fatty and salty. The waitstaff was one step above "unfriendly" and they were out of some choices on the dessert menu. Very over priced. We won't be going back.

XOBQobPOl6mjjmeyu---Fg.text: Note to self: fancy place, not the greatest restaurant to take your 14 mo old on a whim and  you and your hubby are wearing casual wear.  With that said, even though we looked out of place, we still had a great time and the service was excellent!  We never get our money's worth in these type of churrasco restaurants because neither my husband nor I can pack it in.  However, the meats were delicious and their appetizer/salad spread was yummy, too!!  I love hearts of palm and mushrooms so this was right up my alley but they also had "normal" stuff too like potato salads and regular salads and the like.  Great place for a date, especially if you want to impress.  You can go in there in casual wear, too, as we did, but it is more of an upscale type establishment.  Enjoy!

IwW2-kLQpzeOrvVobrNmkQ.text: This was our first time and first experience at a brazillan steakhouse.  The food was flowing and they even provided a handy Thanks! and No Thanks! card for our eating enjoyment. The service was impeccable, with the entertaining and personable server John, who made our evening awesome. Thank you so much for making our night special, it was a pleasure.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FyD53PqkPWXOk478sXYRWw.text: Yeah it's a bit pricey.  $50 for dinner and $40 for a bottle of crappy white moscato.  You do have the opportunity to eat a lot of food.  I ate enough to hate myself and disgust my wife.  The service was fantastic.  We never waited for refills on drinks, for sides, or for the main entrees.  If our coaster was flipped, we almost always had a server at our table offering a beef, pork, chicken, or lamb entree.  It was fun with a group.  But, they couldn't quite figure out medium-rare filet mignon.  The meat was OK, not fantastic.  For the price, I would rather buy one very good steak elsewhere in the Valley.

MSXFZwxGunlwSN015Qy3Uw.text: Cannot say enough about how exceptional our experience was! My wife and I went for our anniversary, we had such variety of meat we couldn't keep up! I recommended the lamb and braised chicken, you will leave stuffed.  First thing is you need to come prepared, don't eat all day. Second you need to know its all about the meat. Fogo will bring cooked meat to your table and cut it right off the skewer. Full size salad bar with all the toppings, and the servers were more than accommodating. Nestled in an upscale Scottsdale Plaza it really fits the mark of High End Brazilian spa steakhouse . We will be coming again !  Recommended for Special nights out with your SO - 4.97 Stars

ovxzy4rvpcVYiXPoIA-9RA.text: I have only eaten at one other Brazilian Steakhouse (two if you count the one in Israel...but it was a standard steakhouse...not the Brazilian model where they bring the meat to your table) and this one FAR exceeded the quality of the other. Every thing about it was top notch. Atmosphere...upscale and nice. Salad or food bar (I can't call it a salad bar because it was so much more) was stocked with high quality foods. But, the thing that you go to a Brazilian Steakhouse for is the meat....and the beef could not have been any better. Every cut was flavorful and tender. I just wish I had been hungrier. I went for lunch during their summer special and only paid $25 so at that price the value was excellent.  Only complaint...don't order a soft drink. They come in VERY small bottles (10 oz I think) and they charge $3 each.

uoUrrljzO60p4pLsbhzGxg.text: Husband and I attended an investment seminar here tonight.  Salad bar was full of very different foods, three choices of hot foods. Carrot/ginger soup was delicious. As I don't eat red meat I opted for chicken..piece of breast..very dry,overcooked. Ditto on the leg,  i can't give opinion on the beef, husband did say it was good.  We both had cheesecake for desert. I think that is what gave us the food poisoning. Both of us got severe stomach cramps in the car..made it home just in time. First and last time we eat here. Glad the meal was free.

wFiLnejLN-rwPD0yiZSavA.text: This was my first time to Fogo and my expectations were met AND exceeded. Food was fantastic and service was on point. Thanks to the manager, Norma for helping make my first visit memorable. We encountered one hiccup with our meal, and she quickly made sure everything was fixed. I will be back!

ZhV1pZhxESOUQBdgKh9fbA.text: Love this place, the meats were spectacular!!!  Having lived in Brazil, I wish the salad bar was more complete with Brazilian foods, but one can't complain when the meat is perfect. I also wish they had the pineapple and chicken hearts like some other restaurants have... But I still loved my visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Some filet and ribeye here... The filet was to die for!!!

xPE6yOx0kQw0e9hSPLseyw.text: I have wanted to try this restaurant for over a year & tonight was the night. Great looking restaurant, nice bar, nice wine list.  Very attentive staff and meat was very good quality. I personally don't dine at buffets or all you can eat establishments so take this review in consideration.  I ate very little off the salad bar and definitely wouldn't come here for just that. It's great & all but why spend $30 at a salad bar? Make sure to eat the ribeye & filet. Don't waste your stomach space on chicken or pork or sirloin. IMHO. The little devilish bread biscuits you get are yum!   We were stuffed after this meal! Dessert was pretty good too.  I think one visit here is plenty. I prefer to spend my $ at a fine dining establishment with one steak versus 1o diff cuts per seating. Also, the sides could use some work.. No one really touched them.

PJOt33UZRp97Rl28YZG7bw.text: Horrible food at this location. The drinks were horrible.  I've been to other locations around the world but this one was the worst.

3zA8Lnu1Lf3OLDkcxYaWIg.text: Fogo De Chao was an amazing experience! It is basically an upscale buffet with the accompanying upscale price. There is an unlimited salad bar and all-you-can-eat bread, potatoes, and polenta. The same with the meat. It flowed non-stop! The chefs walked around with chunks of meat on a large skewer and cut off pieces for us at our table. We let them know if we wanted it well-done or medium-well and they obliged. We were done after several pieces, though. Think about it. How many steaks can you eat at once? What a profitable pricing scheme!  Beware of the soft drink prices, though! NO FREE REFILLS. I became suspicious when I did not see the prices listed. I used my phone to look it up online and there were several complaints from customers who were not told this in advance.  Would I return? Maybe once more to share the experience with someone going for the first time so that I may enjoy their reaction. Otherwise, once was enough for us.

6bijTxiQx-tccD13JOtGwg.text: I was here on Sunday with my boyfriend because one of our friends recommended this place.  It was our first time!  The decorations of the restaurant are terrific! Dimmed lights and low key.  Good place for a date!  Our servers were very attentive and the food was absolutely amazing!  Fresh meat, all kind of meats, the food came fast and was like one after another. I also loved the salad bar!  Everything looks and tasted so fresh!  The restaurant manager, Marco Moretti, even came and greeted us.  There was a little bit of discrepancy but he fixed the problem with smiles.  He was so nice!  It made our experience there very pleasant!    We would definitely be here again soon in the future and would recommend this place to our friends and family.

w49sAttp3T972hTYU23CYQ.text: In Scottsdale for a work trip and I brought my wife here for dinner. She loved all the of the cuts brought to the table and loved the service  and atmosphere. I have been eating a vegetarian diet for about six months and the salad bar was more than enough with a ton of fruit and veggie dishes so I didn't feel bad not eating any of the meat. Would love to come back next time we are in town.

Ouqn8w455Y4RX4LplZLntg.text: I celebrated two Valentine's Days there. It was an extremely busy place those days. Service was very good, servers were friendly, patient and attentive, but it took some time to get our drinks (about 10 minutes or even more). I still put 5 stars because I would recommend this place for any occasion or just lunch/dinner. The food there is delicious.

Cno90tYYrBAvk154vGlCdw.text: Base on my visiting to this place, 3 stars is the max. The service was just ok for me. Took a while to have someone come over to ask for food. We gotta eat slowly since we weren't sure how long it would take for them to come over even we all ready turned the card to " ready for new food " or whatever they called it. As it's said that there were different kinds of grilled meat but I only tried 3 bc as I mentioned earlier, took awhile for the server to come over with the meat plus there were just 3 or 4 servers with same meat come to serve. And yes, the place is fancy and nice but 100$ for both of us (50$ for each) with all of these experiences, I dun think it's worth.

XVMpTEvvnSXjg2xR53QkDw.text: 5 star service. The steaks are amazing! Servers come by and slice a fresh portion for you whenever you want. The salad bar is great as well. Took us about 45 minutes to be seated since we had no reservation but it was well worth it. Will be back.

bopQOeQ8dPoU9e4xgzco2A.text: What a great way to get introduced to Fogo De Chao  And I thought I would still be full this morning because of all the wonderful food I consumed last night.  (Sorry meal plan, but I had to break a couple rules last night...)  Food, service, atmosphere were all A+!!!!  The meat was cooked to perfection.  The salad bar is AMAZING!!!  And the tour of the kitchen and the private room was a great touch to end the evening.  Thank you Gabi for putting this together!  It was such an excellent treat!

W4PNTHSX-RhVvb35uqzzcQ.text: Great service and great food. We came for a birthday and were treated amazingly. everyone was super responsive. Lou and his entire staff were great. Amin stood out especially. He is definitely a stand out and treated us like family. Will definitely return!

JBQaSOjRmFom7pGFPLFvsQ.text: Great food, fun atmosphere, and the service is excellent! Great for a special occasion, just don't forget to come hungry.

in1CBl2LwIFkLzAr55jyLQ.text: What can I say?!?!? Fogo is a destination beyond belief... My head waiter Lou was fabulous. His attention to detail was as great as the food! Thanks for a wonderful time!!!

gKQIeJ-4DYpXoL7so_Bg5Q.text: Expensive but excellent food. It is worth every penny you spend there. The meat just needs the right amount of salt and pepper and let the meat shine for itself. Having said that, I was also never disappointed with the service either until my very  last visit. Despite reserving a party of 20 several days before-hand, we had to wait for more than 40 minutes for our table. Personally in this situation I usually cancel my reservation and go to another restaurant, but when you have 20 people with you, it is difficult to migrate to other places and feel obligated to wait.  I know for sure that next time I come here to not  bring large parties at this place. I gave 3 stars due to poor organization, but will give 5 stars for the food.

F6WNOFi-JUp0Qj4EFh_OVQ.text: A place Togo go to once just to try out.  Must be a red meat eater, I'm not but the salad bar was outstanding.

mMheQ0B4MoL2Mjj85bB2Jw.text: I have been to four such places in the Phoenix area and if you combine food and ambience this is the best by a mile.  The service was exceptional--we didn't have to wait for anything and people were coming by constantly not only to serve us a gajillion types of meat, but to check on our every need.  Refills?  Sauces?  A particular cut you'd like?  Anything and everything was available right away.  We got taken on a tour of the kitchen and it is huge and spotless.  There is also a private room which apparently is first-come-first-served and is no additional charge.  There is a salad bar with chilled asparagus, hearts of palm, and the most ridiculous artichoke hearts--literally just the very best part of the artichoke here.  There was a delicious chicken salad, potato salad, a bunch of cheeses, and cold cuts.  But of course, the main event was the meat--sausage, sirloin, leg of lamb, chicken legs, bacon wrapped chicken breast, bacon wrapped filet... and the best cut of filet mignon that I've had in a long time.  Tender, amazing, delightful.  This place also gets extra kudos for the fact that the servers ask as they are cutting the meat which doneness you want, which is nice.  I really enjoyed it.  Finally--the dessert was sublime.  Between the three of us, we shared the papaya-ice cream-black currant liqueur thingy, which wasn't too sweet but wonderfully subtle; the molten chocolate cake which would be the most perfect desert known to humanity if it had a few more fresh berries on there, and a wonderful creme brulee which capped off my birthday in the best possible way.  Gabi was evasive when I asked if it was her who ratted me out and scored me a free birthday dessert but I will go ahead and give her the credit since she's just so all-around exceptional.  Once again, an exceptional event--thanks to Yelp and most importantly, thanks so much to Fogo de Chao.

Pe5uQBUdrPR8ShAa8nRyDg.text: Ribeye was the clear winner here, seasoned tender and juicy medium rare. Have a shot of Veev(acai berry alcohol) and let it all digest! Yum

FPpJ7PKCHqgYXHrbSstfTw.text: My first experience with Fogo de Chao was several years ago at the location in Chicago but I was thrilled when one opened in Scottsdale (much closer to where I live).  If you love meat, this is the place for you.  I enjoy almost every cut of meat  and a few times I've ventured around the salad bar (it's beautiful, but as we know it's about the mean).   I've also sampled the various starches on the table (bananas, polenta) and I love them, but again it's really about the delicious cuts of meat coming around every time your card is on green.  If you go, go hungry and clear the rest of your schedule.  Even if you don't stay too long, you'll be in a lovely meat-induced sleepy state for the rest of the evening.  It is a bit on the expensive side, but when you think about what you get, both quality, quantity and selection it's really worth it.

zBLMmXeO_qL9sRJrUw7Mlg.text: Texas de Brazil is much better, from the bread and other appetizers to the soup and salad bar. We were somewhat disappointed bit it was on overall. They seemed to come around with their house steak constantly and only rarely with chicken.

X_dTAwmTw9iP678HSzas7A.text: Delicious food; worth every penny.  The service was amazing, too.  Kuddos to our amazing waiter Derek.  He was very pleasant and attentive.   I would definetely go back and request Derek as our waiter.

v9nNNSjFo8PHYH2Tqxdapg.text: Best dinner of your life. Pricey but worth it. The filet is like butter but the real winner is the ribeye! Must try!

FlYgl6FqeNs6CljgYp9dLg.text: Great food accompanied by a wonderful atmosphere! If you want to really experience what an exceptional Brazilian steakhouse is like, Fogo de chao will exceed your expectations!

frH8ygsSw6NaMQnRSZLqsQ.text: Great servicing and the meat is to die for!! Shot of cachaca with the meat is very good. Best dinner ever

yc-1ynPZTh5DdXNG02Gedw.text: I would seriously recommend not eating breakfast if you get the lunch special here. Its pretty affordable at $25. I love the steak and buffet styles sides.

ukBa2dK9XlPIg9LLMvelrA.text: Heard great feedback from friends, but didn't live up to expectations.  Salad bar was ok, out of multiple items both trips from the table.  Meat was average, excellent service.

cu16ipDb_PeDabpPJ6uSNw.text: Ok, so I am a big fan of this place because of the overall experience.  I am not a huge meat eater, and after eating here, I probably won't be able to eat a steak for a month or two.  Simply because I am not used to eating this much meat.  Let me start with the salad bar- I would go there just for this!  Too many things to list, but,l trust me, you could fill up on it alone.  Many items  are non-standard to salad bars.    Ok, so then they brought out the side dishes.  I am a carb-a-holic and I could have died and gone to heaven right them.  Fried polenta squares, Sauteed bananas, cheese bread, mashed potatoes, etc.   Liked everything but the mashed potatoes. Then the meat started coming.  And kept coming.    I turned over my coaster to red pretty quickly, but my fellow diners were braver than I.  They kept eating and eating.  The meat all tasted good, but it all started to blend in my mind.  The only True standout for me was the lamb which was really, really yummy.  My mom, who is a genuine carnivore, asked if she could have a beef rib, not the meat on it which is what they usually carve, but the actual rib.  They gave it to her and she is still going on about how good it was.  I can't believe it, but my table ordered dessert.  I am ashamed to say I cannot remember what it was!  But it was really good, even though I only had one bite.

gXV8E17LBKiYWKA4jKTJ0Q.text: Three words can pretty much sum up our visit, Delicious meat coma. The sides were pretty tasty too!

xpaXklVej8iU0hpCcOJ0ZQ.text: Go very hungry. There is a ton of food. The carvers can be a little snippy when you don't know what you're doing would be my only complaint. Overall great food, the desserts were really excellent.

187qKswfBQqp2qgVBTUdvg.text: I finally got to try this place out.  After years of knowing about it and not doing anything about that I got my day.  Meat!  Lots and lots of delicious meat!    The salad bar was great, but I knew that I didn't come here for that.  I tried my best to be brief at the bar, but I couldn't resist.  Wonderful selection of veggies and cheeses.  Smoked salmon as well.  The hearts of palm were crunchy, the artichoke hearts were wonderful.  I was in love, but I was ready for meat.  First they clear your plate and throw down some side dishes.  Truthfully none of the sides looked tempting.  It was a small portion, but I bet if we wanted more, we'd get it.    The second you flip that button to allow meat, they come running over.  Skewers upon skewers of meat.  All of them were wonderful but some were better than others.  Stay away from the bacon wrapped filet and Parmesan crusted pork.  Both were not that good.  I also noticed that I prefer the meat when it's straight out of the flame.  If it sits around more than 15 minutes, it's not as good.  What I really liked about the place was the service.  Top notch.  They let us know right away that they work as a team.  So if we didn't see the server that first waited on us, we could ask anyone.  That was True.  There were about 6 people helping us at all times.  What I didn't like about the place was I felt a little rushed.  The rest of my party was done eating and I was still trucking.  Not only did they clear the table while I was still eating, the waiter even presented the desserts.  Dessert was the last thing on my mind while they were still bringing me meat.    However the dessert (if you can make it) were spectacular.  We had the creme brule and the molten chocolate cake.  Both were fabulous.  Overall, I'd come back here again and again and again.  It was wonderful
